original: sgrib pa med cin zhes bya ba la sogs pa la nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa med pas go rims bzhin du sgrib pa med cing ma chags pa'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa med cin zhes bya ba la sogs pa la nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa med pas go rims bzhin du sgrib pa med cing ma chags pa'o //
translated: The phrase unobstructed and so on means that because there is no affliction and no knowledge obscuration, there is no obstruction and no attachment, respectively.

original: de yid kyis na thogs pa me dpa'o //🔽mnyam pa me dpas mi mnyam pa'i //
analyzed: de yid kyis na thogs pa me dpa'o // mnyam pa me dpas mi mnyam pa'i //
translated: The phrase unimpeded in mind means that there is no obstruction to the arising of any object of knowledge.

original: bdag nyid dang mi mnyam pa nyid dang mnam pas na mi mnyam pa nyid dang mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid dang mi mnyam pa nyid dang mnam pas na mi mnyam pa nyid dang mnyam pa'o //
translated: The phrase equal to the unequaled means that it is equal to the unequaled because it is equal to the self and unequal to the self.

original: dpe gzhan thams cad las 'das pas na dpe med pa'o //
analyzed: dpe gzhan thams cad las 'das pas na dpe med pa'o //
translated: The phrase without example means that it is beyond all other examples.

original: mtha' yas pa'i shes pas yongs su bcad par nus pa ma yin pa nyid kyis na dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: mtha' yas pa'i shes pas yongs su bcad par nus pa ma yin pa nyid kyis na dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: The phrase incalculable means that it is not able to be measured by infinite knowledge.

original: khyad par de dag gis khyad par du 'phags pa de su zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par de dag gis khyad par du 'phags pa de su zhig yin zhe na /
translated: If it is distinguished by those special qualities, who is distinguished by them?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yang dag pa ji lta ba'i ye shes kyi stobs gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yang dag pa ji lta ba'i ye shes kyi stobs gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The phrase the power of the Tathagata's wisdom that is just as it is is stated.

original: kun brjod pa la sogs pa'i cho 'phrul byed par nus pa nyid kyi ye shes ni thogs pa med pa yin pa'i phyir stobs su brjod pa'o //
analyzed: kun brjod pa la sogs pa'i cho 'phrul byed par nus pa nyid kyi ye shes ni thogs pa med pa yin pa'i phyir stobs su brjod pa'o //
translated: The knowledge that is able to perform miracles such as telling all is called a power because it is unobstructed.

original: stobs kyi nang na sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyi stobs gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: stobs kyi nang na sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyi stobs gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Among the powers, the power of the Buddha's knowledge...

original: stobs kyi nang na zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs nyid shin tu phul du byung ba yin no //
analyzed: stobs kyi nang na zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs nyid shin tu phul du byung ba yin no //
translated: Among the powers, the power of knowledge of the exhaustion of contaminants is the most excellent.

original: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes dang @141a * //🔽gzigs pa gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes dang @141a * // gzigs pa gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The Buddha's knowledge and vision...

original: ye shes ni bden pa mngon par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes ni bden pa mngon par rtogs pa'o //
translated: Knowledge is the realization of the truths.

original: gzigs pa ni mngon par shes pa lnga'o //
analyzed: gzigs pa ni mngon par shes pa lnga'o //
translated: Vision is the five higher perceptions.🔽The perfection of the ten powers...

original: stobs bcu'i pa rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs la sogs pa bcu'o //
analyzed: stobs bcu'i pa rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs la sogs pa bcu'o //
translated: The ten powers are the power of knowing what is possible and impossible, and so on.

original: mi 'jigs pa bzhi zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa bzhi zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The four forms of fearlessness...

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa dam 'cha' par mdzad pa la phyir rgol bar byed pa med pas mi 'jigs rten pa nyid rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa dam 'cha' par mdzad pa la phyir rgol bar byed pa med pas mi 'jigs rten pa nyid rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: The four kinds of fearlessness are: I am perfectly enlightened with respect to all things, and so on, which are not disputed by anyone.

original: mi 'jigs pa bzhi po de dag mchog tu legs par khong du chud pa gang yin pa ni kun rdzob tu'o //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa bzhi po de dag mchog tu legs par khong du chud pa gang yin pa ni kun rdzob tu'o //
translated: The four kinds of fearlessness are supremely well penetrated in a conventional sense.

original: de kho na nyid du gzhan yin no zhes chos thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de kho na nyid du gzhan yin no zhes chos thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: In reality, they are non-existent, as it is said, all things are non-existent.

original: don dam pa mngon par sgrub pas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: don dam pa mngon par sgrub pas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase by the realization of the ultimate means

original: sgyu ma lta bu nyid mngon du mdzad pas so //
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu nyid mngon du mdzad pas so //
translated: by the realization of illusoriness.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase the wheel of the Dharma means🔽the wheel of the Dharma of the three natures.

original: rang gi thugs su chud pa'i chos gsal bar mdzad pa shes rab kyi pha rol phyin pa ston pas 'khor lo dang 'dra bar yang dang yang du mngon sum du byed pa'i don gyis rab tu bskor zhing gdul ba rnams kyi rgyud la rab tu rgyas par mdzad🔽pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi thugs su chud pa'i chos gsal bar mdzad pa shes rab kyi pha rol phyin pa ston pas 'khor lo dang 'dra bar yang dang yang du mngon sum du byed pa'i don gyis rab tu bskor zhing gdul ba rnams kyi rgyud la rab tu rgyas par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is the one who turns the wheel of the Dharma, which is like a wheel because it is the perfection of wisdom, which is the clear manifestation of the Dharma that he has realized in his own mind. He turns it well because he causes it to be directly perceived again and again. He is the one who spreads it in the mindstreams of those to be trained.

original: de nyid mun pa sel bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir chos kyi sgron ma 'dzin pa zhes bya'o //🔽yang dag par sad par byed pa'i phyir chos kyi rnga brdung pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid mun pa sel bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir chos kyi sgron ma 'dzin pa zhes bya'o // yang dag par sad par byed pa'i phyir chos kyi rnga brdung pa'o //
translated: He is the one who holds the lamp of the Dharma because he dispels the darkness of ignorance.🔽He is the one who beats the drum of the Dharma because he awakens those who are asleep.

original: gdul bya'i yid 'gengs par byed pa'i phyir chos kyi dung 'bud pa'o //
analyzed: gdul bya'i yid 'gengs par byed pa'i phyir chos kyi dung 'bud pa'o //
translated: He is the one who blows the conch of the Dharma because he fills the minds of those to be trained.

original: rgyas par byed pas na chos kyi dung sgrogs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyas par byed pas na chos kyi dung sgrogs pa'o //
translated: He is the one who proclaims the Dharma because he spreads it.

original: sgrib pa brtan po thams cad 'joms pas na chos kyi ral gri 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa brtan po thams cad 'joms pas na chos kyi ral gri 'debs pa'o //
translated: He is the one who wields the sword of the Dharma because he destroys all the stable obscurations.

original: tshim par byed pas na chos kyi char 'bebs pa'o //
analyzed: tshim par byed pas na chos kyi char 'bebs pa'o //
translated: He is the one who sends down the rain of the Dharma because he satisfies.

original: rnam par gsal ba nyid du shes par bya bas na chos kyi mchod sbyin sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par gsal ba nyid du shes par bya bas na chos kyi mchod sbyin sbyin pa'o //
translated: The gift of the Dharma is the gift of the Dharma-sacrifice, since it is to be known as the most excellent of all sacrifices.

original: yid la 'thad pa nyid kyis na sems can thams cad tshim par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: yid la 'thad pa nyid kyis na sems can thams cad tshim par mdzad pa'o //
translated: It satisfies all beings, since it is pleasing to the mind.

original: mnyan par bya ba nyid kyis ji ltar bde bar mdzad pas na yang dag par stobs pa'o //
analyzed: mnyan par bya ba nyid kyis ji ltar bde bar mdzad pas na yang dag par stobs pa'o //
translated: It is the true gift, since it is given as one wishes, by listening to it as one wishes.

original: gang yang chos bstan pa de dag dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /🔽sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la 'dul bas na btul pa'o //
analyzed: gang yang chos bstan pa de dag dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la 'dul bas na btul pa'o //
translated: And that teaching of the Dharma, etc.🔽It is the taming, since it tames the disciples through the Buddha-dharmas.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi bslab pa la bslabs pas na bslabs pa'o //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi bslab pa la bslabs pas na bslabs pa'o //
translated: It is the training, since it trains in the training of the Pratyekabuddha-dharmas.

original: nyan thos kyi chos rnams la lhag par mos pas na mos pa'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi chos rnams la lhag par mos pas na mos pa'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: It is the inspiration, since it inspires through the Sravaka-dharmas.

original: rang @141b gi byang chub rtogs par bya ba'i phyir rigs nges pa thob pas na nges par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rang @141b gi byang chub rtogs par bya ba'i phyir rigs nges pa thob pas na nges par gyur pa'o //
translated: It is the certainty, since it is the attainment of the certainty of lineage for the realization of one’s own enlightenment.

original: de nyid ni rdzogs pa'i byang chub la gzhol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid ni rdzogs pa'i byang chub la gzhol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It is the progress to perfect enlightenment.

original: slob pa'i zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu dang po la zhugs pa la sogs pa dang 'brel ba rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: slob pa'i zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu dang po la zhugs pa la sogs pa dang 'brel ba rnams kyi'o //
translated: The term “learner” refers to those who are related to the first fruit, etc.

original: mi slob pa'i zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa nyid do//
analyzed: mi slob pa'i zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa nyid do//
translated: The term “nonlearner” refers to the state of an arhat.

original: de la dge slong ni brjod pa gsum la sogs pas bsnyen par rdzogs par byas pa'o //
analyzed: de la dge slong ni brjod pa gsum la sogs pas bsnyen par rdzogs par byas pa'o //
translated: A monk is one who has received full ordination through the threefold rite, etc.

original: dge slong ma yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: dge slong ma yang de bzhin no //
translated: A nun is similar.

original: dge bsnyen ni skyabs gsum yongs su 'dzin pa dang / bslab pa'i gzhi lnga yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: dge bsnyen ni skyabs gsum yongs su 'dzin pa dang / bslab pa'i gzhi lnga yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
translated: A male or female lay practitioner is one who accepts the three jewels and the five basic precepts.

original: dge bsnyen ma yang de bzhin yin pa'i phyir rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dge bsnyen ma yang de bzhin yin pa'i phyir rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The term “two” refers to the fact that there are two types of lay practitioners:

original: skyabs gsum 'dzin pa'i dge bsnyen du slob dpon gyis gzung du gsol zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du gsum la skyabs su song nas bslab pa'i gzhi lnga yongs su 'dzin pa'i dge bsnyen du slob dpon gyis gzung du gsol zhes 'dul ba las gnyis su smos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyabs gsum 'dzin pa'i dge bsnyen du slob dpon gyis gzung du gsol zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du gsum la skyabs su song nas bslab pa'i gzhi lnga yongs su 'dzin pa'i dge bsnyen du slob dpon gyis gzung du gsol zhes 'dul ba las gnyis su smos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: one who accepts the three refuges and one who accepts the three refuges and the five basic precepts.

original: yid kyis sgom pa'i zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yid kyis sgom pa'i zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The term “mental contemplation” refers to

original: gang zag gcig gam gnyis sam gsum la yid dang bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang zag gcig gam gnyis sam gsum la yid dang bar byed pa'o //
translated: It is the delight of one or two or three persons.

original: ma lus pa lus pa med par zhes bya ba ni go rims bzhin du rgyu mtha' yas pa las byung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / 'bras bu gzhal du med pa rab tu ster ba'i phyir ro zhes brjod par bya'o ;
analyzed: ma lus pa lus pa med par zhes bya ba ni go rims bzhin du rgyu mtha' yas pa las byung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / 'bras bu gzhal du med pa rab tu ster ba'i phyir ro zhes brjod par bya'o ;
translated: It is complete and without remainder, which means that it is the result of infinite causes and it bestows immeasurable results.

original: / gcig tu bsdus te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: / gcig tu bsdus te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: It is summarized in a single verse, and so on.

original: 'das pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang 'brel bas bstan pa'i phyir gcig tu ste /
analyzed: 'das pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang 'brel bas bstan pa'i phyir gcig tu ste /
translated: It is summarized in a single verse because it is related to the tathāgatas of the past.

original: rnam pa gcig tu mngon par bsdus shing lhag par sgro btags nas tshad med pa nyid la sogs pa'i tshul gyis bsdoms shing brtsis nas /🔽byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa nas dud 'gro'i skye gnas dang 'brel ba'i bar gyis gzhal zhing tshad du byas nas 'ongs nas 'chad pa'i rjes su yi rang ba mchog gis rjes su yi rang bar bya zhing /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu mngon par bsdus shing lhag par sgro btags nas tshad med pa nyid la sogs pa'i tshul gyis bsdoms shing brtsis nas /🔽byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa nas dud 'gro'i skye gnas dang 'brel ba'i bar gyis gzhal zhing tshad du byas nas 'ongs nas 'chad pa'i rjes su yi rang ba mchog gis rjes su yi rang bar bya zhing /
translated: It is summarized in a single verse by collecting it into a single verse and by adding it up by way of immeasurable and so on.🔽It is summarized in a single verse by collecting it into a single verse and by adding it up by way of immeasurable and so on.🔽It is summarized in a single verse by collecting it into a single verse and by adding it up by way of immeasurable and so on.

original: byed pa po'i bsam pa phul du byung ba'i dad pas shin tu dga' zhing bdag nyid kyis de dag thams cad rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bsam pa khyad par can gyis bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byed pa po'i bsam pa phul du byung ba'i dad pas shin tu dga' zhing bdag nyid kyis de dag thams cad rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bsam pa khyad par can gyis bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should do it with the special thought of a superior attitude, thinking, “I will complete all of these myself with the faith of a superior attitude.”

original: mchog gi don nyid bstan pa'i phyir mchog ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: mchog gi don nyid bstan pa'i phyir mchog ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: In order to teach the meaning of supreme, he says, “supreme” and so on.

original: 'di dag ni bshad zin te //
analyzed: 'di dag ni bshad zin te //
translated: These have already been explained.

original: ngag tu rjod par byed pa na zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams @142a * //
analyzed: ngag tu rjod par byed pa na zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams @142a * //
translated: When one utters the words, “all tathāgatas,”

original: cad kyi tshul khrims kyi phung po la sogs pa mi dmigs pa'i yid la byed pas rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i bsod nams sems can thams cad kyi don du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar bya'o
analyzed: cad kyi tshul khrims kyi phung po la sogs pa mi dmigs pa'i yid la byed pas rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i bsod nams sems can thams cad kyi don du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar bya'o
translated: one should say, “I rejoice with the merit of rejoicing with the thought of the non-apprehension of the aggregate of morality and so on of all tathāgatas, and I dedicate it to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment for the sake of all sentient beings.”

original: zhes brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: yongs su sgrub par gyur cig ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: yongs su sgrub par gyur cig ces bya ba ni /
translated: “May they be accomplished” means

original: skyed par byed pa ste /
analyzed: skyed par byed pa ste /
translated: The agent is the one who causes.

original: bdag dang sems can thams cad kyi zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: bdag dang sems can thams cad kyi zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: All sentient beings is the remainder.

original: mi dmigs pa'i yongs su bsngo ba'i yid la byed pa bstan nas /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i yongs su bsngo ba'i yid la byed pa bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the mental attention of the dedication without objective referent,

original: da ni de la rgol ba ngan pa la lan gdab pa'i phyir 'dri ba ni de la gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i gang zag dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: da ni de la rgol ba ngan pa la lan gdab pa'i phyir 'dri ba ni de la gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i gang zag dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: now, in order to respond to the bad objections, he asks, Therein, the persons of the Bodhisattva Vehicle, etc.

original: dngos po gang gis yongs su bsngo zhing zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid la sogs pa'i rigs kyi rgyu gang yin pa dag gis phul na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽glegs pa ma la la las rjes su yi rang zhing zhes smos te /
analyzed: dngos po gang gis yongs su bsngo zhing zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid la sogs pa'i rigs kyi rgyu gang yin pa dag gis phul na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // glegs pa ma la la las rjes su yi rang zhing zhes smos te /
translated: By what things does one dedicate? Those which are the causes of the lineage of Tathagatahood, etc. If one offers means if one gives.

original: der yang yongs su bsngo ba'i yid la byed pa'i gnas skabs yin pa'i phyir yongs su bsngo zhing zhes don gyis gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: der yang yongs su bsngo ba'i yid la byed pa'i gnas skabs yin pa'i phyir yongs su bsngo zhing zhes don gyis gzung bar bya'o //
translated: In some manuscripts, rejoicing is mentioned, but there also, since it is the occasion of the mental attention of dedication, dedicating should be understood by implication.

original: de ltar yang dngos po gang dag dang rnam pa gang dag gis sems gang zhig yongs su sdo par byed pa dang zhes de ma thag tu 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar yang dngos po gang dag dang rnam pa gang dag gis sems gang zhig yongs su sdo par byed pa dang zhes de ma thag tu 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, “by whatever things and in whatever ways one dedicates one’s mind” will be explained immediately below.

original: dmigs pa gang dag dang rnam pa gang gis zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dmigs pa gang dag dang rnam pa gang gis zhes bya ba la /
translated: “By whatever objective supports and in whatever ways” means

original: dmigs pa'i tshul khrims la sogs pa'i phung po dang chos thams cad do //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul khrims la sogs pa'i phung po dang chos thams cad do //
translated: the objective supports are the aggregates of morality, etc., and all dharmas.

original: de 'dzin pa'i rab tu dbye ba nyid ni rnam pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dzin pa'i rab tu dbye ba nyid ni rnam pa'o //
translated: The differentiation of their apprehension is the “ways.”

original: sems de zhes bya ba ni 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: sems de zhes bya ba ni 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: “That mind” refers to the conceptualization of the apprehending subject.

original: gcig ces bya ba'i sgra ni tshig gi phrad de ci zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don la 'jug go //
analyzed: gcig ces bya ba'i sgra ni tshig gi phrad de ci zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don la 'jug go //
translated: The word “only” is a verbal prefix that modifies the word “how.”

original: ji ltar mtshan mar byas pa de bzhin du dmigs sam zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ji ltar mtshan mar byas pa de bzhin du dmigs sam zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Just as one perceives them as signs” means

original: 'das pa nyid kyis dngos po la sogs pa ni mtshan mar ma byas par yongs su bsngo bar mi nus pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'das pa nyid kyis dngos po la sogs pa ni mtshan mar ma byas par yongs su bsngo bar mi nus pa nyid yin te /
translated: that one cannot dedicate things, etc., without perceiving them as signs, since they are past.

original: med pa'i phyir med bzhin du lhag par sgro btags nas brjod pa'i kun rdzob ji lta bar yul du byed dam /
analyzed: med pa'i phyir med bzhin du lhag par sgro btags nas brjod pa'i kun rdzob ji lta bar yul du byed dam /
translated: Because it does not exist, is it the conventional that is superimposed as existent that is taken as an object?

original: ci ste de kho na nyid la de bzhin du dmigs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ci ste de kho na nyid la de bzhin du dmigs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Or does it mean that one focuses on reality in that way?

original: gal te dmigs so zhes 'dod na de lta na ni //
analyzed: gal te dmigs so zhes 'dod na de lta na ni //
translated: If you accept that it is focused on,

original: tshad ma'i gnod pa yod pas na //
analyzed: tshad ma'i gnod pa yod pas na //
translated: then it is undermined by valid cognition.

original: dngos por dmigs pa yod na ni //🔽smig rgyu la sogs shes pa bzhin //
analyzed: dngos por dmigs pa yod na ni // smig rgyu la sogs shes pa bzhin //
translated: If there were an object of perception of things,🔽then it would be a mistaken conception,

original: phyin ci log par @142b yongs su rtog //🔽de phyir de'i mthus 'byung ba yi //
analyzed: phyin ci log par @142b yongs su rtog // de phyir de'i mthus 'byung ba yi //
translated: like the consciousness of a mirage and so on.🔽Therefore, all the acts of dedication

original: yongs su bsngo ba'i bya ba kun //🔽bdag dang bdag gir log pa las //
analyzed: yongs su bsngo ba'i bya ba kun // bdag dang bdag gir log pa las //
translated: that arise from its power🔽are weak,

original: byung ba bzhin du stobs chung ngo //🔽zhes 'dod do //
analyzed: byung ba bzhin du stobs chung ngo //🔽zhes 'dod do //
translated: like those that arise from the error of self and mine.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i yul ni sgro btags pas brdzun pa yin pa'i phyir dang / rkyen la rag las bas 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir rmi lam dang sgyu ma dang smig rgyu dang 'dra bar de kho na nyid du dmigs su med do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i yul ni sgro btags pas brdzun pa yin pa'i phyir dang / rkyen la rag las bas 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir rmi lam dang sgyu ma dang smig rgyu dang 'dra bar de kho na nyid du dmigs su med do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He said, “If those things do not exist, how can there be a dedication that is not inverted?”🔽He said, “If those things do not exist, how can there be a dedication that is not inverted?”🔽He said, “If those things do not exist, how can there be a dedication that is not inverted?”🔽He said, “If those things do not exist, how can there be a dedication that is not inverted?”🔽He said, “If those things do not exist, how can there be a dedication that is not inverted?”

original: btsun pa rab 'byor dngos po de dag dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so da lta na yang yongs su bsngo ba phyin ci log par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor dngos po de dag dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so da lta na yang yongs su bsngo ba phyin ci log par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He said, “If those things do not exist, how can there be a dedication that is not inverted?”🔽He said, “If those things do not exist, how can there be a dedication that is not inverted?”

original: gal te dngos po de med cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa yin te /🔽rang gi mtshan nyid yul du byed pas na dmigs par byed pa'o //🔽spyi'i tshul yongs su gcod pas na mtshan mar byed pa'o //

translated: He said, “If those things do not exist, how can there be a dedication that is not inverted?”🔽He said, “If those things do not exist, how can there be a dedication that is not inverted?”🔽He said, “If those things do not exist, how can there be a dedication that is not inverted?”🔽He said, “If those things do not exist, how can there be a dedication that is not inverted?”🔽He said, “If those things do not exist, how can there be a dedication that is not inverted?”🔽He said, “If those things do not exist, how can there be a dedication that is not inverted?”🔽He said, “If those things do not exist, how can there be a dedication that is not inverted?”🔽He said, “If those things do not exist, how can there be a dedication that is not inverted?”🔽He said, “If those things do not exist, how can there be a dedication that is not inverted?”🔽He said, “If those things do not exist, how can there be a dedication that is not inverted?”🔽He said, “If those

original: 'du shes phyin ci log pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid can gyi 'du shes ni rang gi yul med pas phyin ci log tu de ma yin la der 'dzin pas /
analyzed: 'du shes phyin ci log pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid can gyi 'du shes ni rang gi yul med pas phyin ci log tu de ma yin la der 'dzin pas /
translated: The phrase “perverted ideation” and so on means that ideation, which has the nature of grasping signs, is perverted because its object does not exist.

original: 'du shes phyin ci log pa yin no //🔽sems phyin ci log pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'du shes phyin ci log pa yin no // sems phyin ci log pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is perverted ideation because it grasps what is not that as that.

original: dmigs par 'dzin par byed pa'i rnam par shes pa'i sems de bzhin du phyin ci log pa yin no //🔽lta ba phyin ci log pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dmigs par 'dzin par byed pa'i rnam par shes pa'i sems de bzhin du phyin ci log pa yin no // lta ba phyin ci log pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase “perverted thought” means that thought, which is the consciousness that grasps the object, is perverted in the same way.

original: rnam pa yongs su gcod pa'i pa'i ngo bo'i rnam par dpyod pa'i bdag nyid can gyi shes rab kyi lta ba nyid snga ma bzhin du phyin ci log pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa yongs su gcod pa'i pa'i ngo bo'i rnam par dpyod pa'i bdag nyid can gyi shes rab kyi lta ba nyid snga ma bzhin du phyin ci log pa'o //
translated: The phrase “perverted view” means that view, which is the wisdom that has the nature of discriminating the essential nature of the object, is perverted in the same way.

original: mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni ji ltar na 'di'i snga ma dang 'brel ba'i phyir 'on kyang 'gyur ba nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni ji ltar na 'di'i snga ma dang 'brel ba'i phyir 'on kyang 'gyur ba nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase “it would not be” means that, because it is related to the preceding phrase, it would be perverted.

original: de lta na yang mi dmigs pa'i yongs su bsngo ba'i yid la byed pa ni 'du shes phyin ci log pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni lhag ma ste /
analyzed: de lta na yang mi dmigs pa'i yongs su bsngo ba'i yid la byed pa ni 'du shes phyin ci log pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni lhag ma ste /
translated: Still, the mental attention of the non-observation of the dedication is of the nature of the error of discrimination, etc. This is the remainder.

original: gang gi phyir gzhan du na 'du shes la sogs pa phyin ci log pa nyid du bstan pas dkyus ma'i don dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir cung zad kyang ma smras par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzhan du na 'du shes la sogs pa phyin ci log pa nyid du bstan pas dkyus ma'i don dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir cung zad kyang ma smras par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because, otherwise, since the error of discrimination, etc. is taught, one would not say anything at all that is not in conflict with the meaning of the root text.

original: gal te gzhan la rang gi yul med pas 'du shes la sogs pa phyin ci log tu gyur pa na //
analyzed: gal te gzhan la rang gi yul med pas 'du shes la sogs pa phyin ci log tu gyur pa na //
translated: If, because the other does not have its own object, discrimination, etc. becomes erroneous,🔽how could it be of the nature of the other, which is not its nature, of the nature of the error of discrimination, etc.?

original: de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa gzhan 'du shes phyin ci log la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du ji ltar 'gyur snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas brjod pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //🔽'dod @143a * //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa gzhan 'du shes phyin ci log la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du ji ltar 'gyur snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas brjod pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // 'dod @143a * //
translated: The doubt, “Why is that?” is addressed by “It is thus,” etc.

original: chags kyang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chags kyang zhes bya ba la /
translated: “Attachment,” etc.

original: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni zhe sdang la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni zhe sdang la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: The word “also” includes hatred and so on.

original: rnam par btags shing zhes bya ba ni sgro btags nas so //
analyzed: rnam par btags shing zhes bya ba ni sgro btags nas so //
translated: “ Imagined” means falsely imagined.

original: kun tu brtags nas zhes bya ba ni yang dang yang du dmigs nas so //
analyzed: kun tu brtags nas zhes bya ba ni yang dang yang du dmigs nas so //
translated: “ Fully imagined” means repeatedly imagined.

original: 'du shes phyin ci log pa la sogs pa las byung ba'i phyir 'dod chags kyang 'du shes phyin ci log pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'du shes phyin ci log pa la sogs pa las byung ba'i phyir 'dod chags kyang 'du shes phyin ci log pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs par sbyar ro //
translated: Because they arise from mistaken ideation and so on, attachment is also mistaken ideation, and so on.

original: 'di skad du gang gi phyir mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i dngos po la rtag pa la sogs pa yod pa ma yin pa sgro btags te de nyid la yang dang yang du dmigs nas 'dod chags la sogs pa 'du shes phyin ci
analyzed: 'di skad du gang gi phyir mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i dngos po la rtag pa la sogs pa yod pa ma yin pa sgro btags te de nyid la yang dang yang du dmigs nas 'dod chags la sogs pa 'du shes phyin ci
translated: This is what is meant: because the impermanent and so on are not present in things that possess the attributes of impermanence and so on, one falsely imagines that they are present, and then repeatedly imagines that they are present. Attachment and so on arise from this mistaken ideation.

original: log la sogs pa'i rgyu can du skye ba na 'du shes phyin ci log la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du skye ba yin pas de pas na mi dmigs par yongs su bsngo ba'i yid la byed pa yang de bzhin du skye bar 'gyur ro zhes brjod do //
analyzed: log la sogs pa'i rgyu can du skye ba na 'du shes phyin ci log la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du skye ba yin pas de pas na mi dmigs par yongs su bsngo ba'i yid la byed pa yang de bzhin du skye bar 'gyur ro zhes brjod do //
translated: When it is born with a cause such as error, it is born with the nature of a false perception, etc. Therefore, the attention of the dedication of the non-apprehension of all things is born in the same way.

original: phyogs gzhan bstan pa'i don du brjod pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs gzhan bstan pa'i don du brjod pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: In order to teach another aspect, he says, Moreover, just as the entity and the non-entity do not exist, just so, etc.

original: gzhan yang dngos po ji lta ba dang rnam pa med pa'i ji lta bar zhes ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang dngos po ji lta ba dang rnam pa med pa'i ji lta bar zhes ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: Moreover, just as the entity and the non-entity do not exist, just so, etc. is the remainder.

original: byang chub kyang de bzhin sems kyang de bzhin du med pa yin nam ci zhes khong nas phyung la /
analyzed: byang chub kyang de bzhin sems kyang de bzhin du med pa yin nam ci zhes khong nas phyung la /
translated: Is enlightenment like that? Is mind like that? Is it non-existent?

original: de lta'o zhes khas len par byed na /
analyzed: de lta'o zhes khas len par byed na /
translated: If you admit that it is so,

original: de lta na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de lta na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: then he says, If it is so, etc.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i chos thams cad dang / de'i bag chags kyi khams thams cad kyang med pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya bar 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i chos thams cad dang / de'i bag chags kyi khams thams cad kyang med pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya bar 'dod pa'o //
translated: It is accepted that all dharmas of grasped and grasper and all their elements of habit-energy are non-existent.

original: de ltar gyur na nyes pa ci zhig yod ce na gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de ltar gyur na nyes pa ci zhig yod ce na gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: What is the fault if it is like that? He says, “If, etc.”

original: 'di snyam du gal te de ltar dngos po la sogs pa med pa de bzhin du byang chub dang sems la sogs pa yang yin na de'i dngos po la sogs pa gang dag gis sems la sogs pa gang zhig byang chub gang du yongs su sngo bar byed
analyzed: 'di snyam du gal te de ltar dngos po la sogs pa med pa de bzhin du byang chub dang sems la sogs pa yang yin na de'i dngos po la sogs pa gang dag gis sems la sogs pa gang zhig byang chub gang du yongs su sngo bar byed
translated: If it is like that, i.e., if things, etc., do not exist, then enlightenment, mind, etc., also do not exist. In that case, by what things, etc., does one dedicate what mind, etc., to what enlightenment?

original: de / gang phyir gang gis kyang gang yang gang du yang yongs su sngo bar mi phyed do //
analyzed: de / gang phyir gang gis kyang gang yang gang du yang yongs su sngo bar mi phyed do //
translated: Because by nothing is anything dedicated anywhere.

original: des na rnam pa thams cad du yongs su bsngo ba mi 'thad na yongs su bsngo ba phyin ci log tu 'gyur ro zhes bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: des na rnam pa thams cad du yongs su bsngo ba mi 'thad na yongs su bsngo ba phyin ci log tu 'gyur ro zhes bsams pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, if dedication is not tenable in any way, dedication becomes erroneous.

original: de kho na nyid du phyin ci log yin yang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang 'dra bar brgyud nas yang dag pa'i don thob par byed pa na dngos po la @143b sogs pa kun rdzob tu yod pa nyid kyis na yongs su bsngo
analyzed: de kho na nyid du phyin ci log yin yang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang 'dra bar brgyud nas yang dag pa'i don thob par byed pa na dngos po la @143b sogs pa kun rdzob tu yod pa nyid kyis na yongs su bsngo
translated: But like the conceptions of impermanence and so on, they indirectly cause one to attain the perfect meaning.🔽🔽Since things and so on exist conventionally, they are dedicated.

original: ba'i yid la byed par 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: ba'i yid la byed par 'dod pa yin te /
translated: But just as conceptual thoughts of impermanence and so on are indirectly conducive to attaining the authentic meaning, so too is the mental attention of complete dedication, since things and so on exist superficially.

original: de pas na khyed kyis lhag ma ci yang ma smras so zhes bya ba'i bsam pas 'phags pa rab 'byor 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: de pas na khyed kyis lhag ma ci yang ma smras so zhes bya ba'i bsam pas 'phags pa rab 'byor 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: Therefore, with the thought that you have not said anything else, you say, “Subhūti, this is so, this is so!”

original: yang na dngos po dang dmigs pa la sogs pa de la don dam par mngon par zhen pa dang bral bas kun rdzob tu sgyu ma'i skyes bu bzhin du yongs su bsngo ba ni phyin ci log ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bsam pa dang ldan pas /
analyzed: yang na dngos po dang dmigs pa la sogs pa de la don dam par mngon par zhen pa dang bral bas kun rdzob tu sgyu ma'i skyes bu bzhin du yongs su bsngo ba ni phyin ci log ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bsam pa dang ldan pas /
translated: Or else, with the thought that complete dedication is not erroneous, since it is free from the ultimate attachment to things, objects, and so on, but is superficial, like an illusory person,

original: 'phags pa rab 'byor 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa rab 'byor 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa yin no //
translated: you say, “Subhūti, this is so, this is so!”

original: rigs pa dang ldan pa yin na yang ci'i phyir las dang po pa la brjod par mi bya snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas de la gang dad pa tsam dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: rigs pa dang ldan pa yin na yang ci'i phyir las dang po pa la brjod par mi bya snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas de la gang dad pa tsam dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The doubt is anticipated with the words “why is that?” and is resolved with the words “therein, faith alone…”

original: rtogs pa'i yid ches pa dang bral bas brtan pa ma yin pa nyid kyis na dad pa tsam mo //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i yid ches pa dang bral bas brtan pa ma yin pa nyid kyis na dad pa tsam mo //
translated: Faith alone is not firm because it is devoid of the conviction of realization.

original: de nyid du chung du dang 'bring dang chen po'i dbye bas dga' ba tsam zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs gsum gyis brjod do //
analyzed: de nyid du chung du dang 'bring dang chen po'i dbye bas dga' ba tsam zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs gsum gyis brjod do //
translated: The same is stated in three verses with the words “mere joy…”

original: yang na dad pa tsam nyid yod pa nyid dang / yon tan dang ldan pa nyid dang / nus pa nyid la go rims bzhin du mngon par yid ches pa dang / dang pa dang / mngon par 'dod pa ni de bzhin du dga' btsam la sogs pa rnam pa gsum bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na dad pa tsam nyid yod pa nyid dang / yon tan dang ldan pa nyid dang / nus pa nyid la go rims bzhin du mngon par yid ches pa dang / dang pa dang / mngon par 'dod pa ni de bzhin du dga' btsam la sogs pa rnam pa gsum bstan pa yin no //
translated: Alternatively, the mere existence of faith, the possession of good qualities, and the ability are respectively the conviction, the delight, and the desire for that, and thus the three types of joy, etc. are taught.

original: med par 'gyur du 'ong zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i dbye ba la mi mkhas pa'i phyir nub par 'gyur du 'ong zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: med par 'gyur du 'ong zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i dbye ba la mi mkhas pa'i phyir nub par 'gyur du 'ong zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: The phrase it would be as if it were nonexistent is because of not being skilled in the division of the conventional and the ultimate, and so it is thought that it would be as if it were to disappear.

original: de lta na yang smras bar mi bya ba nyid yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na yang smras bar mi bya ba nyid yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then it would be just as if nothing had been said.

original: 'phags pa rab 'byor phyir mi ldog pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'phags pa rab 'byor phyir mi ldog pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The phrase Ārya Subhūti, the irreversible bodhisattva great beings and so on is stated.

original: gang dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis nye bar bstan pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis nye bar bstan pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase who are taught by a spiritual friend means

original: so so'i skye bo yin du zin kyang yang dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis byin gyis brlabs kyi bden pa gnyis kyi rang gi ngo bo yongs su shes pas zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo yin du zin kyang yang dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis byin gyis brlabs kyi bden pa gnyis kyi rang gi ngo bo yongs su shes pas zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: that even if they are ordinary beings, they are blessed by a spiritual friend, and so it is thought that by knowing the nature of the two truths.

original: nye bar bsdu par bya ba'i phyir de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: nye bar bsdu par bya ba'i phyir de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to summarize, the text says thus and so on.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa las mi 'dang bas so //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa las mi 'dang bas so //
translated: The phrase thus means that because of not going beyond conventional truth,

original: gzhan yang kun rdzob kyi phyogs la brtan pa'i don bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang kun rdzob kyi phyogs la brtan pa'i don bstan pa ni /
translated: Furthermore, the teaching of the meaning of stability in the relative

original: byams pa sems gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa yin te /
analyzed: byams pa sems gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa yin te /
translated: is stated in the line “Maitreya, whatever mind…”

original: @144a * // gang zhes bya ba ni rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'o //
analyzed: @144a * // gang zhes bya ba ni rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'o //
translated: “Whatever” refers to the roots of virtue that are accompanied by rejoicing.

original: sems de yang zhes bya ba ni rjes su yi rang bar byed pa ni yongs su sdo bar byed pa'i dus su nye bar bsags pa rnams par 'jig pas 'gags par 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sems de yang zhes bya ba ni rjes su yi rang bar byed pa ni yongs su sdo bar byed pa'i dus su nye bar bsags pa rnams par 'jig pas 'gags par 'gyur pa'o //
translated: “That mind” refers to the mind that is rejoicing, which is stopped by the cessation of the accumulation of the roots of virtue at the time of the dedication.

original: rang bzhin gyi 'jig pas bral ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi 'jig pas bral ba'o //
translated: It is “separated” by the cessation of its intrinsic nature.

original: rnam par 'gyur pa'i 'jig pas rnam par 'gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par 'gyur pa'i 'jig pas rnam par 'gyur pa yin no //
translated: It is “transformed” by the cessation of its transformation.

original: des na zhes bya ba de'i phyir te /
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba de'i phyir te /
translated: “Therefore” means for that reason.

original: yongs su bsngo ba'i dus su yi rang ba'i sems gang gis yongs su sngo bar byed pa /
analyzed: yongs su bsngo ba'i dus su yi rang ba'i sems gang gis yongs su sngo bar byed pa /
translated: At the time of the dedication, whatever mind of rejoicing dedicates🔽is that mind that rejoices.

original: rjes su yi rang bar byed pa'i sems de gang yin te /
analyzed: rjes su yi rang bar byed pa'i sems de gang yin te /
translated: What is that?🔽It is nothing at all.

original: 'ga' zhig kyang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽'di snyam du /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig kyang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽'di snyam du /
translated: This is the meaning.

original: 'di ltar 'dir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rjes su yi rang bar byas nas rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tshig gis sngon dang phyi
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rjes su yi rang bar byas nas rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tshig gis sngon dang phyi
translated: Thus, by the words “Here a bodhisattva great being, having rejoiced, should dedicate the merit of rejoicing to omniscience,”

original: mar bstan pa'i phyir skad cig ma gcig la rjes su yi rang ba dang yongs su bsngo ba'i yid la byed pa gnyis mi 'byung par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mar bstan pa'i phyir skad cig ma gcig la rjes su yi rang ba dang yongs su bsngo ba'i yid la byed pa gnyis mi 'byung par bstan pa yin no //
translated: the two mental activities of rejoicing and dedication are shown to occur in a single moment, because the earlier and later are indicated.

original: de bas na byed pa po mtshungs pa la ta'i rkyen brjod pa'i phyir sems gcig kho nas sngar rjes su yi rang bar byas nas phyis yongs su sngo bar byed pa yin no zhes brjod par gyur na /
analyzed: de bas na byed pa po mtshungs pa la ta'i rkyen brjod pa'i phyir sems gcig kho nas sngar rjes su yi rang bar byas nas phyis yongs su sngo bar byed pa yin no zhes brjod par gyur na /
translated: Therefore, since the condition of the same agent is expressed, it is said that having rejoiced earlier with just one mind, later one dedicates.

original: de ni mi rigs te gang gi phyir rtag pa ni rim dang cig car dag gis don byed par 'gal ba'i phyir skad cig ma nyid yin pas rjes su yi rang bar byed pa'i sems ni yongs su bsngo pa'i skad cig ma'i tshe med pa de pas na
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te gang gi phyir rtag pa ni rim dang cig car dag gis don byed par 'gal ba'i phyir skad cig ma nyid yin pas rjes su yi rang bar byed pa'i sems ni yongs su bsngo pa'i skad cig ma'i tshe med pa de pas na
translated: Therefore, since the mind that rejoices does not exist at the time of the instant of the complete transformation,

original: des ji ltar yongs su sngo bar byed ces bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: des ji ltar yongs su sngo bar byed ces bsams pa yin no //
translated: how could it transform?

original: de ltar rjes su yi rang nas zhes bya ba'i tshig ma 'brel to zhes bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar rjes su yi rang nas zhes bya ba'i tshig ma 'brel to zhes bstan nas /
translated: Having demonstrated that the words “having thus rejoiced” are not connected,

original: da ni rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po zhes bya ba'i tshig de mi rigs par bstan par bya ba'i phyir rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa yin no //
analyzed: da ni rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po zhes bya ba'i tshig de mi rigs par bstan par bya ba'i phyir rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa yin no //
translated: now, in order to demonstrate that the words “the thing that is the merit possessing rejoicing” are illogical, he says, “If the mind that rejoices does not exist, how could it transform?”

original: 'di skad du gang gi phyir rjes su yi rang ba'i rnam par skyes bas rjes su yi rang bar byed pa'i sems nyid rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'di skad du gang gi phyir rjes su yi rang ba'i rnam par skyes bas rjes su yi rang bar byed pa'i sems nyid rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po zhes brjod do //
translated: It is said that the merit of rejoicing is the very mind that rejoices, because it arises in the aspect of rejoicing.

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de bas na rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po tha dad pa'i las su gyur @144b pa gang zhig rjes su yi rang bar byed pa'i sems byed pa bor gyur pas yongs su sngo bar
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de bas na rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po tha dad pa'i las su gyur @144b pa gang zhig rjes su yi rang bar byed pa'i sems byed pa bor gyur pas yongs su sngo bar
translated: Since that is so, what is the merit of rejoicing that is a different action from the mind that rejoices, which is the action of the mind that dedicates?

original: byed pa'i sems de gang zhig yin /
analyzed: byed pa'i sems de gang zhig yin /
translated: What is the mind that dedicates?

original: sems de nyid kyis sems de bsngo bar yang mi rigs te rang nyid la byed pa ni 'gal ba'i phyir zhes 'dod do //
analyzed: sems de nyid kyis sems de bsngo bar yang mi rigs te rang nyid la byed pa ni 'gal ba'i phyir zhes 'dod do //
translated: It is also illogical for that very mind to dedicate that mind, because it is contradictory for something to act on itself.

original: gal te rjes su yi rang ba'i sems kyi rjes thogs la sems kyi skad cig ma khyad par can skyes pa las rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po thob pa'i sems gang yin pa de phyis yongs su bsngo ba'i sems kyis
analyzed: gal te rjes su yi rang ba'i sems kyi rjes thogs la sems kyi skad cig ma khyad par can skyes pa las rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po thob pa'i sems gang yin pa de phyis yongs su bsngo ba'i sems kyis
translated: If you assert that the meaning of that statement is that the mind that obtains the merit of rejoicing that arises from a special mind-moment that arises immediately after the mind of rejoicing

original: bsngo bar bya'o zhes bya ba la 'di ni ngag de'i don yin par 'dod na /
analyzed: bsngo bar bya'o zhes bya ba la 'di ni ngag de'i don yin par 'dod na /
translated: is later dedicated by the mind of complete dedication,

original: de lta na yang yongs su bsngo bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tshig 'thad pa ma yin no zhes smras pa ni /
analyzed: de lta na yang yongs su bsngo bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tshig 'thad pa ma yin no zhes smras pa ni /
translated: then even so, you cannot say that it is dedicated.

original: gang gi tshe sems gnyis phrad pa med na sems kyi sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe sems gnyis phrad pa med na sems kyi sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: When two minds do not meet, how can the mind be the object of the mind?

original: gnag gi don 'di ltar sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: gnag gi don 'di ltar sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: This is the meaning of the passage.

original: skad cig ma dang po byung ba'i rnam par shes pa ni skad cig ma nyid yin pas skad cig gnyis pa'i tshan med la /
analyzed: skad cig ma dang po byung ba'i rnam par shes pa ni skad cig ma nyid yin pas skad cig gnyis pa'i tshan med la /
translated: The consciousness that arises in the first moment is momentary and does not exist in the second moment.

original: de bzhin du skad cig gnyis par byung ba yang rgyu ma tshang ba'i phyir ma skyes pas skad cig ma dang po'i tshe na med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du skad cig gnyis par byung ba yang rgyu ma tshang ba'i phyir ma skyes pas skad cig ma dang po'i tshe na med do //
translated: In the same way, that which occurs in the second moment is not arisen because its cause is incomplete, and so it does not exist at the time of the first moment.

original: de ltar na gang gi tshe bsngo bar bya ba dang sngo par byed pa skad cig dang po dang gnyis par byung ba'i sems de gnyis 'grogs pa med pa des na dus mnyam du 'byung ba med na skad cig ma gnyis par byung ba'i yongs su bsngo ba'i
analyzed: de ltar na gang gi tshe bsngo bar bya ba dang sngo par byed pa skad cig dang po dang gnyis par byung ba'i sems de gnyis 'grogs pa med pa des na dus mnyam du 'byung ba med na skad cig ma gnyis par byung ba'i yongs su bsngo ba'i
translated: Thus, when the mind that is the object of dedication and the mind that is the dedicator occur in the first and second moments, they are not simultaneous because they do not accompany each other.

original: sems kyis skad cig ma dang po byung ba'i rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po'i sems de yongs su bsngo bar ji ltar nus pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sems kyis skad cig ma dang po byung ba'i rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po'i sems de yongs su bsngo bar ji ltar nus pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If they do not occur simultaneously, how can the mind that is the dedication occurring in the second moment dedicate the mind that is the basis of the merit endowed with rejoicing that occurred in the first moment?

original: 'o na snga ma'i sems mi skye ba nyid de'i tshe yod pas yongs su bsngo'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na snga ma'i sems mi skye ba nyid de'i tshe yod pas yongs su bsngo'o zhe na /
translated: Well, if the former mind does not arise at that time, it exists and is dedicated.

original: sems kyi rang bzhin ni yongs su bsngo bar yang mi nus na zhes smos te /
analyzed: sems kyi rang bzhin ni yongs su bsngo bar yang mi nus na zhes smos te /
translated: But it is said that the nature of the mind cannot be dedicated.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //🔽bcom ldan 'das dang 'phags pa byams pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis brgya byin lan 'debs pa ni /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so // bcom ldan 'das dang 'phags pa byams pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis brgya byin lan 'debs pa ni /
translated: Because they lack entityness.

original: de nas lha'i dbang bo brgya byin gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de nas lha'i dbang bo brgya byin gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
translated: The reply of Śatakratu, the lord of the gods, through the power of the Blessed One and of the noble Maitreya, is stated in the passage beginning with “Then Śatakratu, the lord of the gods, said to the Blessed One: ‘Blessed One, I do not understand this topic in the same way as the bodhisattva Maitreya understands it.’”

original: bsam pa ni kun rdzob tu khas blangs pa'i rang bzhin rnams don gyi bya ba byed pa nyid kyis skad cig ma yin pas na khyad par can skye ba'i bya ba'i khongs su 'dus pa ma gtogs pa gzhan gyi khongs su gtogs par bya ba ni 'ga' @145a🔽* // yang mi srid do //
analyzed: bsam pa ni kun rdzob tu khas blangs pa'i rang bzhin rnams don gyi bya ba byed pa nyid kyis skad cig ma yin pas na khyad par can skye ba'i bya ba'i khongs su 'dus pa ma gtogs pa gzhan gyi khongs su gtogs par bya ba ni 'ga' @145a * // yang mi srid do //
translated: The idea is that, because of their momentariness, the natures that are accepted conventionally perform the function of an object. Therefore, they are included in the activity of arising, which is a distinctive feature. Apart from that, it is not possible for them to be included in anything else.

original: de pas na rnal 'byor ba'i rjes su yi rang ba'i sems khyad par can gyi rjes thogs la rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po'i sems shin tu khyad par can skye bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de pas na rnal 'byor ba'i rjes su yi rang ba'i sems khyad par can gyi rjes thogs la rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po'i sems shin tu khyad par can skye bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: Therefore, immediately after the special thought of rejoicing of the practitioner, a very special thought of the entity of merit that is accompanied by rejoicing arises.

original: de'i yang rjes thogs la dge ba'i rtsa ba de'i bag chags kyis bsgos pa ches shin tu khyad par du 'phags pa'i sems yongs su sngo ba'i rnam pa can du rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos nyid kyi stobs kyis skye bar 'gyur pa /
analyzed: de'i yang rjes thogs la dge ba'i rtsa ba de'i bag chags kyis bsgos pa ches shin tu khyad par du 'phags pa'i sems yongs su sngo ba'i rnam pa can du rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos nyid kyi stobs kyis skye bar 'gyur pa /
translated: And immediately after that, by the power of the reality of dependent origination, the bodhisattva's mind, imbued with the latent potentialities of that root of virtue, arises in the aspect of thoroughly pure dedication.

original: skad cig gis tha snyad mi 'thad pas na byis pa'i skye bo'i ngor rgyun la ltos pa'i phyir dang / brda la ltos pas sgra 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig gis tha snyad mi 'thad pas na byis pa'i skye bo'i ngor rgyun la ltos pa'i phyir dang / brda la ltos pas sgra 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since it is not tenable that a moment is a continuum, it is in terms of a continuum that the term moment is used in the context of ordinary beings, and since it is in terms of conventional symbols that the term moment is used, the term is applied.

original: dngos po'i de kho na nyid kyi gnas skabs 'di ni 'phags pa byams pas /
analyzed: dngos po'i de kho na nyid kyi gnas skabs 'di ni 'phags pa byams pas /
translated: The noble Maitreya says in the Ornament for Clear Knowledge:🔽The bodhisattva, the great being, should dedicate that thing which is the merit of rejoicing to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i ngag 'dis las dang byed pa po dang
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i ngag 'dis las dang byed pa po dang
translated: This statement by Maitreya indicates that the agent, the action, and the object of the action are all the same.

original: bya ba la sogs pa'i tshul gyis gsungs pa yin la /
analyzed: bya ba la sogs pa'i tshul gyis gsungs pa yin la /
translated: The meaning of the passage is that the Buddha taught the three natures in the manner of the three non-natures, etc.

original: de la yang dngos po'i cha tsam yongs su por te /
analyzed: de la yang dngos po'i cha tsam yongs su por te /
translated: Moreover, one should not, having completely abandoned the aspect of entity,

original: sgra tsam kho na bzung ste byis pa'i skye bo skrag par byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa mi bya'o zhes bya ba 'di yin no //🔽gzhan yang de ltar rjes su yi rang nas rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo'o zhes tshig tu brjod par bya ba yin te zhes sngar 'phags
analyzed: sgra tsam kho na bzung ste byis pa'i skye bo skrag par byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa mi bya'o zhes bya ba 'di yin no // gzhan yang de ltar rjes su yi rang nas rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo'o zhes tshig tu brjod par bya ba yin te zhes sngar 'phags
translated: and having taken up only the sound, imagine that the Buddha frightens childish beings.🔽Moreover, having thus rejoiced, one should say the words, “I dedicate this merit endowed with rejoicing to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.”🔽As previously stated by Subhūti himself, one should accept the intention as explained in the context of the conventional, with the thought that one should accept the words of Subhūti himself.

original: pa rab 'byor nyid kyis kyang rang gi tshig gis kun rdzob kyi phyogs la ji skad bshad pa'i dgongs pa khas blang par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bsam pas 'phags pa rab 'byor ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: pa rab 'byor nyid kyis kyang rang gi tshig gis kun rdzob kyi phyogs la ji skad bshad pa'i dgongs pa khas blang par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bsam pas 'phags pa rab 'byor ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: Thus, with this thought, he says, “Subhūti, how should a Bodhisattva who has newly entered the vehicle understand the three natures, etc.?”

original: gal te ji skad du bshad pa'i dgongs pas mi 'dzin na de'i tshe rnam pa gzhan med pas ji ltar yongs su bsngo bar bya ste /
analyzed: gal te ji skad du bshad pa'i dgongs pas mi 'dzin na de'i tshe rnam pa gzhan med pas ji ltar yongs su bsngo bar bya ste /
translated: If one does not grasp the intention as it has been explained, then, since there is no other alternative, how can one dedicate?

original: ji ltar yang mi rung ba de bas na ji skad bshad pa'i dgongs pa nyid gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ji ltar yang mi rung ba de bas na ji skad bshad pa'i dgongs pa nyid gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Since it is not possible in any way, therefore, one should grasp just the intention as it has been explained.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says, “associated with rejoicing,” and so on.

original: yongs su 'dzin pas legs par yongs su gzung ba dang yongs su bsngo bas legs par yongs @145b su sngo bar ji ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pas legs par yongs su gzung ba dang yongs su bsngo bas legs par yongs @145b su sngo bar ji ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: How can one be well-grasped by grasping, and well-dedicated by dedication?

original: phyin ci ma log pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yongs su bsngo ba'i yid la byed pa'i don bstan pa ni de nas gnas brtan tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yongs su bsngo ba'i yid la byed pa'i don bstan pa ni de nas gnas brtan tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the mental attention to the dedication that has the characteristic of non-error is stated with “Then the elder, the venerable Subhūti,” and so on.

original: brtsams shing zhes bya ba la ni rnam par rtog pa'i shes pas sngon du byas pa'o //
analyzed: brtsams shing zhes bya ba la ni rnam par rtog pa'i shes pas sngon du byas pa'o //
translated: The phrase having composed means having done so with a conceptual cognition.

original: gzhir bcas te zhes bya ba ni mdun du yul gyi dngos por bzhag nas so //
analyzed: gzhir bcas te zhes bya ba ni mdun du yul gyi dngos por bzhag nas so //
translated: The phrase having made it into a basis means having placed it in front of oneself as an object.

original: yongs su bsngo bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tshig gis yongs su sngo ba yin pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pas yongs su bsngo bar byas pa yin no //
analyzed: yongs su bsngo bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tshig gis yongs su sngo ba yin pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pas yongs su bsngo bar byas pa yin no //
translated: Since the phrase should be dedicated indicates dedication, the dedication is done with a conceptual cognition.

original: de pas na rnam par rtog pa thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis rang gi ngo bo snang ba don med pa la don du zhen nas 'jug pa'i phyir 'khrul ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i bsam pas ji ltar 'du shes phyin ci log tu mi 'gyur zhes
analyzed: de pas na rnam par rtog pa thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis rang gi ngo bo snang ba don med pa la don du zhen nas 'jug pa'i phyir 'khrul ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i bsam pas ji ltar 'du shes phyin ci log tu mi 'gyur zhes
translated: Therefore, since all conceptual cognitions engage by mistakenly conceiving a meaning that is meaningless, that is, by conceiving the appearance of intrinsic nature, they are mistaken. With this idea, he says, How could there be a mistaken ideation?

original: bya ba la sogs pa smras pa yin no //🔽lan gdab pa'i phyir 'phags pa rab 'byor gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa yin te /
analyzed: bya ba la sogs pa smras pa yin no // lan gdab pa'i phyir 'phags pa rab 'byor gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa yin te /
translated: and so on.

original: sems de la sems su 'du shes bar ma gyur na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sems de la sems su 'du shes bar ma gyur na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In order to respond to this, he says, Subhūti, if that thought does not become an ideation of thought.

original: yongs su sngo bar byed pa'i sems de la don dam par sems su mngon par zhen par ma gyur zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: yongs su sngo bar byed pa'i sems de la don dam par sems su mngon par zhen par ma gyur zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The thought that is the dedicator should not be reified as a thought in the ultimate sense.

original: de lta na yon tan ci yod ce na /
analyzed: de lta na yon tan ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the virtue of this?

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa yin no //
translated: It is said, “Thus, the bodhisattva-mahāsattva…” and so on.

original: nye ba rab sdu bar bya ba'i phyir ji ltar sems de la zhes bya pa la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: nye ba rab sdu bar bya ba'i phyir ji ltar sems de la zhes bya pa la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to make this clear, it says, “How is it that the thought…” and so on.

original: de ltar yongs su sngo bar byed pa'i sems de ni 'di yin no zhes mngon par zhen pas de kho na nyid du ji ltar sems de mi shes te mi rtogs pa de ltar gal te yong su sngo bar byed na de'i tshe de ltar yang dag par
analyzed: de ltar yongs su sngo bar byed pa'i sems de ni 'di yin no zhes mngon par zhen pas de kho na nyid du ji ltar sems de mi shes te mi rtogs pa de ltar gal te yong su sngo bar byed na de'i tshe de ltar yang dag par
translated: The thought that is the dedicator is not this, and so on. If one dedicates in such a way that one does not know, does not understand, the thought in reality, then at that time, in that way, one is not mistaken with respect to the thought.

original: mi dmigs pa'i rgyu la zhugs pa yin pa'i phyir 'du shes phyin ci log la sogs pa ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i rgyu la zhugs pa yin pa'i phyir 'du shes phyin ci log la sogs pa ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Because one is engaged in the cause of non-apprehension, one is not mistaken with respect to perception and so on.

original: 'di skad du gal te rnam par rtog pa'i yul med pa de la yul dang ldan par gzung na de'i tshe 'khrul bar 'gyur pa zhig na /
analyzed: 'di skad du gal te rnam par rtog pa'i yul med pa de la yul dang ldan par gzung na de'i tshe 'khrul bar 'gyur pa zhig na /
translated: It is said: If one apprehends the non-existent object of conceptualization as an existent object, then one would be mistaken.

original: gang gi phyir 'dis sgyu ma mkhan dang 'dra bar shes pa'i yul med pa de la yul med pa nyid rtogs nas rnam par rtog pas yongs su bsngos pa yin na rang gi ngo bo yongs su shes pa yin pa'i phyir 'khrul bar ji ltar 'gyur zhes brjod🔽pa yin no //🔽shugs kyis brjod pa'i @146a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dis sgyu ma mkhan dang 'dra bar shes pa'i yul med pa de la yul med pa nyid rtogs nas rnam par rtog pas yongs su bsngos pa yin na rang gi ngo bo yongs su shes pa yin pa'i phyir 'khrul bar ji ltar 'gyur zhes brjod pa yin no // shugs kyis brjod pa'i @146a * //
translated: But because this person, like the magician, understands the non-existence of the object of consciousness, and then conceptualizes it, he is not mistaken because he fully understands its nature.

original: don gsal bar byed pa ni /
analyzed: don gsal bar byed pa ni /
translated: The meaning of the indirect expression is clarified:

original: gal te sems gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te sems gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
translated: If one asks, “By what mind does one understand the non-existence of the object of that mind?”

original: ji ltar sgyu ma mkhan gzhan 'ga' zhig /
analyzed: ji ltar sgyu ma mkhan gzhan 'ga' zhig /
translated: Just as a magician, with another conjured object,🔽Knows the non-existence of the object of his mind,🔽So the bodhisattva, with the wisdom born of learning,🔽Knows the non-existence of the object of his mind.

original: sprul pa'i rta sogs spyod yul can //
analyzed: sprul pa'i rta sogs spyod yul can //
translated: Just as a magician, with another conjured object,

original: sems la yul med par shes pa //
analyzed: sems la yul med par shes pa //
translated: Knows the non-existence of the object of his mind,

original: des na 'khrul pa skye mi 'gyur //
analyzed: des na 'khrul pa skye mi 'gyur //
translated: So the bodhisattva, with the wisdom born of learning,🔽Knows the non-existence of the object of his mind.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis yongs su bsngo ba'i sems la sogs pa yang sgyu ma'i skyes bu ltar 'jug pas phyin ci log par mi 'gyur bas yang gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis yongs su bsngo ba'i sems la sogs pa yang sgyu ma'i skyes bu ltar 'jug pas phyin ci log par mi 'gyur bas yang gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the mind of dedication, etc. are engaged like an illusory person, so they are not erroneous. Therefore, he says, “If, etc. ”

original: sems gang zhes bya ba ni yongs su bsngo bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: sems gang zhes bya ba ni yongs su bsngo bar bya ba'o //
translated: “That mind” is the one to be dedicated.

original: 'di ltar shes shing zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba dang mjug gi gnas skabs su 'chad par 'gyur ba'i zad pa nyid la sogs pa rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar shes shing zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba dang mjug gi gnas skabs su 'chad par 'gyur ba'i zad pa nyid la sogs pa rtogs pa'o //
translated: “Knowing thus” is the realization of extinction, etc., as will be explained in the context of the conclusion.

original: 'di ltar sems te zhes bya ba ni dngos gzhi'i gnas skabs su'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar sems te zhes bya ba ni dngos gzhi'i gnas skabs su'o //
translated: “Thinking thus” is in the context of the main practice.

original: sems de'i chos nyid kyang de yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sems de'i chos nyid kyang de yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “The reality of that mind is also that”

original: yongs su sngo bar byed pa'i sems ni ngo bo nyid dang bral ba'i phyir zad pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos nyid yin no //
analyzed: yongs su sngo bar byed pa'i sems ni ngo bo nyid dang bral ba'i phyir zad pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos nyid yin no //
translated: means that the mind of dedication is the reality of extinction, etc., because it is free of intrinsic reality.

original: chos gang dag gi zhes bya ba ni dngos po la sogs pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: chos gang dag gi zhes bya ba ni dngos po la sogs pa rnams kyis so //
translated: “The reality of those dharmas” is the reality of things, etc.

original: chos gang dag ces bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs par ro //
analyzed: chos gang dag ces bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs par ro //
translated: The phrase “those phenomena” refers to omniscience and so forth.

original: don 'di nyid ma 'ongs pa la sogs pa 'gres gsum gyi dbye bas bstan par bya ba'i phyir 'das pa rnams ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: don 'di nyid ma 'ongs pa la sogs pa 'gres gsum gyi dbye bas bstan par bya ba'i phyir 'das pa rnams ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In order to teach this very meaning by means of the threefold division of the future, etc., he says, “Just as in the past, so also in the future, and so also in the present,” and so on.

original: chos de ni mi zad pa'o zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: chos de ni mi zad pa'o zhes bya ba ni //
translated: The phrase “those phenomena are inexhaustible” means

original: chos nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis zad pa med pas na mi zad pa ste sangs rgyas pa nyid do //
analyzed: chos nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis zad pa med pas na mi zad pa ste sangs rgyas pa nyid do //
translated: that they are inexhaustible because they are not exhausted by their very nature as reality.

original: chos kyis ni chos yongs su mi bsngo'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos kyis ni chos yongs su mi bsngo'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase “one phenomenon is not dedicated to another phenomenon” means

original: yongs su bsngo ba'i yid la byed pa'i chos kyis bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po'i chos so //
analyzed: yongs su bsngo ba'i yid la byed pa'i chos kyis bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po'i chos so //
translated: that the phenomenon that is the mental activity of dedication is not dedicated to the phenomenon that is the entity of the act of merit.

original: yongs su bsngo bar bya'o zhes sgra'i rnam pas yongs su bsngos pa yin pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa 'phangs pa yin la /
analyzed: yongs su bsngo bar bya'o zhes sgra'i rnam pas yongs su bsngos pa yin pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa 'phangs pa yin la /
translated: The phrase “one should dedicate” is a verbal expression of dedication.

original: de yang rang bzhin gyis rang gi snang ba don med pa la don du zhen pas 'jug pa'i phyir 'khrul pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: de yang rang bzhin gyis rang gi snang ba don med pa la don du zhen pas 'jug pa'i phyir 'khrul pa ma yin nam /
translated: Moreover, since one engages in the non-existent object of one's own appearance through the conception of an existent object, is it not a delusion?

original: 'du shes phyin ci log la sogs par ji ltar mi 'gyur snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
analyzed: 'du shes phyin ci log la sogs par ji ltar mi 'gyur snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
translated: How could it not be a mistaken discrimination and so forth?

original: 'di ltar de ni yongs su bsngo ba de la mngon par zhen pa med do zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni yongs su bsngo ba de la mngon par zhen pa med do zhes smos so //
translated: The response to the qualm Why is that? is, In that case, there is no manifest clinging to that dedication.

original: 'di skad du gang gi tshe sgro btags pa dang yang dag pa nyid kyis rang bzhin gyi dbye ba mi shes pa de'i tshe snang ba @146b dang rnam par brtag par bya ba'i don dang gcig tu byas nas gang gi so sor snang ba don med pa la
analyzed: 'di skad du gang gi tshe sgro btags pa dang yang dag pa nyid kyis rang bzhin gyi dbye ba mi shes pa de'i tshe snang ba @146b dang rnam par brtag par bya ba'i don dang gcig tu byas nas gang gi so sor snang ba don med pa la
translated: This is saying that when one does not understand the distinction between the nature of superimposition and reality, then one sees appearance and the object of investigation as one, and one engages in the non-existent object of one's own appearance

original: don du zhen nas 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir 'khrul par 'gyur ba zhig nas /
analyzed: don du zhen nas 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir 'khrul par 'gyur ba zhig nas /
translated: through the conception of an existent object. Therefore, it is a delusion.

original: gang gi phyir rnam par rtog pa'i yul du sgro btags pa rnams la ni sgro btags pa'i bdag nyid can brdzun pa nyid du nges shing kun rdzob tu rang gi mtshan nyid rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes pa'i spyod yul /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam par rtog pa'i yul du sgro btags pa rnams la ni sgro btags pa'i bdag nyid can brdzun pa nyid du nges shing kun rdzob tu rang gi mtshan nyid rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes pa'i spyod yul /
translated: Because those that are superimposed as objects of conceptual thought are definitely false, having the nature of superimposition.🔽And those that are the domain of nonconceptual consciousness, having the nature of illusion-like reality, are also seen as having a different nature, the nature of illusion-like nonerror.

original: sgyu ma lta bu'i bdag nyid can la yang sgyu ma lta bu'i bdag nyid can phyin ci ma log pa'i rang bzhin du tha dad par mthong ba dang / gang gi tshe yongs su bsngo ba la mngon par mi chags pa dang / bsngo bar bya ba'i sems sngo bar byed pa'i sems kyis mi shes so zhes kyang rtogs pa dang /
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu'i bdag nyid can la yang sgyu ma lta bu'i bdag nyid can phyin ci ma log pa'i rang bzhin du tha dad par mthong ba dang / gang gi tshe yongs su bsngo ba la mngon par mi chags pa dang / bsngo bar bya ba'i sems sngo bar byed pa'i sems kyis mi shes so zhes kyang rtogs pa dang /
translated: When one realizes that one does not cling to dedication, and that the dedicating mind does not know the mind that is the object of dedication,

original: chos kyis ni yongs su mi bsngo'o snyam du yang rtogs /
analyzed: chos kyis ni yongs su mi bsngo'o snyam du yang rtogs /
translated: and one also realizes that phenomena are not dedicated,

original: de'i tshe phyin ci ma log ces bya bar ji ltar 'gyur zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe phyin ci ma log ces bya bar ji ltar 'gyur zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: then how could it be called nonerroneous?

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i don nyid ldog pa'i sgo nas gsal bar bya ba'i phyir gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i don nyid ldog pa'i sgo nas gsal bar bya ba'i phyir gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In order to clarify the meaning that has been explained by way of a negation, he says, “If he thinks, ‘I will dedicate this merit,’ etc.

original: rtogs pa med par 'jug pa mi 'byung ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: rtogs pa med par 'jug pa mi 'byung ba ma yin nam /
translated: Isn’t it the case that engagement does not occur without realization?🔽How can consciousness itself be the dedication?

original: shes pa nyid ji ltar yongs su bsngo ba ma yin snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
analyzed: shes pa nyid ji ltar yongs su bsngo ba ma yin snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
translated: The doubt is anticipated with “Why is that?”

original: 'di ltar bsngo ba de la mngon par zhen pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bsngo ba de la mngon par zhen pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: and the response is given with “Because of his attachment to that dedication.”

original: de kho na nyid du na dngos po'i ngo bo ni tshad ma dang 'gal ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid du na dngos po'i ngo bo ni tshad ma dang 'gal ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: The remainder is this: in reality, the nature of things is contrary to valid cognition.

original: dben pa'i yongs su bsngo ba yid la byed pa'i don bstan pa ni gal te yang de 'di snyam du bsod nams mngon par 'du byed pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dben pa'i yongs su bsngo ba yid la byed pa'i don bstan pa ni gal te yang de 'di snyam du bsod nams mngon par 'du byed pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The meaning of the mental attention to the dedication to voidness is taught with “If he thinks, ‘I will dedicate this merit,’ etc.

original: bsod nams mngon par 'du byed pa zhes bya ba la bsod nams ni ma chags pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams mngon par 'du byed pa zhes bya ba la bsod nams ni ma chags pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase “the creation of merit” means the roots of virtue that are not attached.

original: de'i mngon par 'du byed pa ni de kun nas slong bar byed pa'i sems pa'o //
analyzed: de'i mngon par 'du byed pa ni de kun nas slong bar byed pa'i sems pa'o //
translated: The creation of that is the intention that motivates it.🔽It is peace because it is the cause for the pacification of all violence through its similarity to an illusion.
