original: sgyu ma dang mtshungs pa nyid kyis nye bar 'tshe ba thams cad rab tu zhi ba'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir zhi ba'o //🔽zhi ba nyid la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du mngon par zhen pa yang phyin ci log yin no zhes smras pa ni /
analyzed: sgyu ma dang mtshungs pa nyid kyis nye bar 'tshe ba thams cad rab tu zhi ba'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir zhi ba'o // zhi ba nyid la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du mngon par zhen pa yang phyin ci log yin no zhes smras pa ni /
translated: The phrase “the error of attachment to the essential nature of peace” means the following.

original: gal te 'du byed thams cad ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te 'du byed thams cad ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase “if all formations” is stated in order to show that.🔽The phrase “if one does not understand them to be of such an essential nature as peace” is stated in order to show that.🔽The phrase “at that time, the perfection of wisdom” is stated in order to show that.🔽The phrase “the perfection of wisdom” is stated in order to show that.🔽The phrase “the perfection of wisdom” is stated in order to show that.

original: gal te zhi ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa de lta bu'i rang bzhin du yang dag par mi shes pa de'i tshe yang dag pa'i nyid du zhugs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir na de'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar🔽ro // sangs rgyas @147a * //
analyzed: gal te zhi ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa de lta bu'i rang bzhin du yang dag par mi shes pa de'i tshe yang dag pa'i nyid du zhugs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir na de'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar🔽ro // sangs rgyas @147a * //
translated: The phrase “the perfection of wisdom” is stated in order to show that.🔽The phrase “the perfection of wisdom” is stated in order to show that.🔽The phrase “the perfection of wisdom” is stated in order to show that.🔽The phrase “the perfection of wisdom” is stated in order to show that.🔽The phrase “the perfection of wisdom” is stated in order to show that.🔽The phrase “the perfection of wisdom” is stated in order to show that.🔽The phrase “the perfection of wisdom” is stated in order to show that.🔽The phrase “the perfection of wisdom” is stated in order to show that.🔽The phrase “the perfection of wisdom” is stated in order to show that.🔽The phrase “the perfection of wisdom” is stated in order to show that.🔽The phrase “the perfection of wisdom” is stated in order to show that.🔽The phrase “the perfection of wisdom” is stated in order to show that.🔽The phrase “the perfection of wisdom” is stated in order to show that.🔽The phrase “the perfection of wisdom” is stated in order to show that.🔽The phrase “the perfection of wisdom” is stated in order to show that.🔽The phrase “the perfection of wisdom” is stated in order to show that.🔽The phrase “the perfection of wisdom” is stated in order to show that.🔽The phrase “the perfection of wisdom” is stated in order to show that.🔽The phrase “the perfection of wisdom” is stated in order to show that.🔽The phrase “the perfection of wisdom” is stated in order to show that.

original: kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rang bzhin rjes su dran pa'i yongs su bsngo ba yid la byed pa bstan pa'i phyir gang yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rang bzhin rjes su dran pa'i yongs su bsngo ba yid la byed pa bstan pa'i phyir gang yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate the mental attention of dedication that is the nature of the root of the wholesome, he says: Whatever the Blessed Buddhas have fully gone to nirvana...

original: de yang bsngo ba ci 'dra ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni sgyu ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: de yang bsngo ba ci 'dra ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni sgyu ma lta bu'o //
translated: and also in accordance with the dedication, it is like an illusion.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni yongs su sngo bar byed pa'i sems te kun rdzob tu ma brtags na nyams dga' bar rang gi rgyu snga ma la brten nas dge ba'i rtsa ba nyid skyes pas na de'i rigs can no //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni yongs su sngo bar byed pa'i sems te kun rdzob tu ma brtags na nyams dga' bar rang gi rgyu snga ma la brten nas dge ba'i rtsa ba nyid skyes pas na de'i rigs can no //
translated: And also means the mind that is dedicated. Since the root of the wholesome is generated in dependence on its own former cause, it is of the nature of the conventional, which is delightful when not investigated.

original: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi tshul gyis go rims bzhin du don bya ba dag la nus pa dang mi nus pa nyid kyis na de'i mtshan nyid can dang de'i rigs su gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi tshul gyis go rims bzhin du don bya ba dag la nus pa dang mi nus pa nyid kyis na de'i mtshan nyid can dang de'i rigs su gtogs pa'o //
translated: It is characterized by that and belongs to that class, because it is able and unable to perform a function in accordance with the mode of the general and particular characteristics.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin yin pas na de'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin yin pas na de'i rang bzhin no //
translated: It is of the nature of that, because it is of the nature of the dharmadhatu.

original: gal te de ltar shes na zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma nyid du zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: gal te de ltar shes na zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma nyid du zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: If one knows thus, means if one knows the emptiness of the three times.🔽The rest is as stated.🔽Since actions are preceded by mind, how can they be dedicated?

original: bya ba rnams ni blo sngon du 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir zhes pa nyid na ji ltar yongs su bsngo ba ma yin snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
analyzed: bya ba rnams ni blo sngon du 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir zhes pa nyid na ji ltar yongs su bsngo ba ma yin snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
translated: The doubt is anticipated and responded to with why is it so?

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mtshan ma'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mtshan ma'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, are not in the mode of signs, etc.

original: dgag par bya ba med na dgag pa mi 'thad pas stong pa nyid la sogs pa de la de kho na nyid du mngon par zhen pa ni phyin ci log yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so ;
analyzed: dgag par bya ba med na dgag pa mi 'thad pas stong pa nyid la sogs pa de la de kho na nyid du mngon par zhen pa ni phyin ci log yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so ;
translated: Since negation is not tenable without something to be negated, the intention is that the misapprehension of emptiness, etc. as reality is a perversion.

original: / rnam pa gzhan dag kyang smras pa de ni gang 'das pa de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: / rnam pa gzhan dag kyang smras pa de ni gang 'das pa de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Other aspects are also stated: that which has passed is not that which has passed, etc.

original: ma thob pa zhes bya ba ni da ltar gyi dus nyid du ma chud pa'o //
analyzed: ma thob pa zhes bya ba ni da ltar gyi dus nyid du ma chud pa'o //
translated: Non-attainment refers to not being included in the present time.

original: gnas par mi dmigs zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gnas par mi dmigs zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Abiding is not apprehended.

original: ngo bo nyid dang bral bas gnas par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang bral bas gnas par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not tenable that it would endure, being devoid of intrinsic reality.

original: mtshan ma yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mtshan ma yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Nor is it a sign.

original: lhan cig byed pa'i rgyud kyis mtshan ma ma yin la /
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa'i rgyud kyis mtshan ma ma yin la /
translated: It is not a sign by way of a co-originating cause.

original: nye bar len pa'i rgyu nyid kyis yul ma yin no //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i rgyu nyid kyis yul ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it an object by way of a cause of appropriation.

original: gal te de ltar mtshan mar 'dzin zhing zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te de ltar mtshan mar 'dzin zhing zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If one were to apprehend a sign in that way,

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i tshul gyis dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i tshul gyis dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of objectifying in the manner explained.🔽If one does not think,

original: mi sems na zhes bya ba ni de kho na bzhin du dgag pa la mngon par zhen par dngos po'i de kho na nyid yongs su mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi sems na zhes bya ba ni de kho na bzhin du dgag pa la mngon par zhen par dngos po'i de kho na nyid yongs su mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of not thoroughly understanding the reality of things, one is attached to a negation just as it is.

original: des phyin ci log pa yin pa'i phyir yongs su bsngos pa yin no //
analyzed: des phyin ci log pa yin pa'i phyir yongs su bsngos pa yin no //
translated: Because of that, it is a perversion, and therefore it is a dedication.

original: mtshan mar mi byed pas yongs su bsngo ba yin na 'o na ni shing la sogs pa yang yin par 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: mtshan mar mi byed pas yongs su bsngo ba yin na 'o na ni shing la sogs pa yang yin par 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa bsu nas /
translated: If it is a dedication because of not making a sign, then even a piece of wood and so on would be.🔽Fearing that, he says,

original: de ste dran pa dang bral bas zhes smos so //
analyzed: de ste dran pa dang bral bas zhes smos so //
translated: If one were to dedicate through being free from recollection.

original: dran pa @147b med pas shing la sogs pa'i dngos po stong pa nyid la sogs pa la mtshan mar mi byed pa de ltar na yang dngos po'i de kho na nyid yongs su ma shes pa yin pa'i phyir mi sems pa yin no //
analyzed: dran pa @147b med pas shing la sogs pa'i dngos po stong pa nyid la sogs pa la mtshan mar mi byed pa de ltar na yang dngos po'i de kho na nyid yongs su ma shes pa yin pa'i phyir mi sems pa yin no //
translated: Because of the absence of mindfulness, one does not form mental images of empty things such as wood, etc. However, because one has not fully understood the reality of things, one does not think.

original: de bzhin du dran pa dang bral ba'am khong du chud pas lha sbyin la sogs pa ci yang yid la mi byed pa de lta na yang snga ma bzhin mi sems pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du dran pa dang bral ba'am khong du chud pas lha sbyin la sogs pa ci yang yid la mi byed pa de lta na yang snga ma bzhin mi sems pa yin te /
translated: Similarly, one who is without mindfulness or who has not understood does not pay attention to anything, such as Devadatta, etc. However, as before, one does not think.

original: des na de bzhin du phyin ci log yin pa'i phyir yongs su bsngos pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni ngag gi don yin no //
analyzed: des na de bzhin du phyin ci log yin pa'i phyir yongs su bsngos pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni ngag gi don yin no //
translated: Therefore, because of the error in that way, it is not a dedication. This is the meaning of the verse.

original: gal te mtshan mar byed pa dang mtshan mar mi byed pas yongs su bsngo ba ma yin na de'i tshe'o na ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mtshan mar byed pa dang mtshan mar mi byed pas yongs su bsngo ba ma yin na de'i tshe'o na ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: If it is not a dedication because of the formation of mental images and the absence of the formation of mental images, then how is it to be done?

original: de ste mtshan ma de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de ste mtshan ma de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: If it is to be done, then it is said, “If one forms mental images of those mental images, etc.”

original: 'di skad du mig btsums pa'am dmus long la sogs pa dang 'dra bar rkyen ma tshang bas yid la mi byed pa tsam gyis dngos po la sogs pa'i phyin ci log gi bag chags spong bar mi 'gyur te /🔽'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa las la ngas pa dang 'dra bar /
analyzed: 'di skad du mig btsums pa'am dmus long la sogs pa dang 'dra bar rkyen ma tshang bas yid la mi byed pa tsam gyis dngos po la sogs pa'i phyin ci log gi bag chags spong bar mi 'gyur te / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa las la ngas pa dang 'dra bar /
translated: It is not so, because it is not the case that the latent propensities for error with respect to things and so on are eliminated merely by not attending to them, as in the case of someone with eyes shut or blind.

original: rnal 'byor pa la slar yang dngos po la mngon par zhen pa'i rtsa ba can gyi 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i tshogs skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa la slar yang dngos po la mngon par zhen pa'i rtsa ba can gyi 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i tshogs skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, like one who has arisen from the meditative attainment of nonperception, the host of afflictions such as attachment rooted in manifest clinging to things will arise again for the yogi.

original: phyin ci log spangs pa med par yang sngon nye bar dmigs pa'i gzugs la sogs pa la yang shin tu gsal bar nyams su myong bas bskyed pa'i yid la byed pa spong bar byed nus pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: phyin ci log spangs pa med par yang sngon nye bar dmigs pa'i gzugs la sogs pa la yang shin tu gsal bar nyams su myong bas bskyed pa'i yid la byed pa spong bar byed nus pa yang ma yin te /
translated: And without eliminating error, it is not possible to eliminate the attention that is generated by the experience of form and so on that was previously observed, because

original: me yongs su ma spangs par tsha ba yongs su mi spong ba bzhin no //
analyzed: me yongs su ma spangs par tsha ba yongs su mi spong ba bzhin no //
translated: without eliminating fire, heat cannot be eliminated.

original: 'di ltar gzugs la sogs pa'i log par rtogs pa 'di dag tsher ma la sogs pa bton pa dang 'dra bar sems las bsal bar bya ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs la sogs pa'i log par rtogs pa 'di dag tsher ma la sogs pa bton pa dang 'dra bar sems las bsal bar bya ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Thus, these misconceptions of form and so on are not to be removed from the mind, like thorns and so on.

original: 'on kyang dngos po la sogs pa la yod pa nyid la sogs par phyin ci log pa'i sa bon dang bral bas yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang dngos po la sogs pa la yod pa nyid la sogs par phyin ci log pa'i sa bon dang bral bas yin no //
translated: However, they are removed by being free from the seeds of error, such as the existence of things and so on.

original: de'i phyir de ma log par de mi spong bas skyes bu'i rab rib kyi skyon dang 'dra bar brdzun pa'i gzugs la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa rab tu 'jug pa su zhig gis bzlog par nus /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ma log par de mi spong bas skyes bu'i rab rib kyi skyon dang 'dra bar brdzun pa'i gzugs la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa rab tu 'jug pa su zhig gis bzlog par nus /
translated: Therefore, since they are not removed without removing that, who can stop the engagement of attachment to false form and so on, like the fault of a person’s cataracts?

original: phyin ci log gi sa bon de yang rnal 'byor pa'i shes rab kyi mig gis brtags na chos thams cad yang dag pa'i shes pa'i snang bas mthong ba'i phyir mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: phyin ci log gi sa bon de yang rnal 'byor pa'i shes rab kyi mig gis brtags na chos thams cad yang dag pa'i shes pa'i snang bas mthong ba'i phyir mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Moreover, when the seeds of error are examined with the eye of the wisdom of yogins, they do not arise because all phenomena are seen with the light of correct knowledge.

original: de ltar gyur nas las rtsa ba drungs nas phyung ba'i shing bzhin du sa bon med pa nyid kyis rnam par rtog pa ngan pa sems la de kho na nyid phyis 'byung bar mi 'gyur @148a * //
analyzed: de ltar gyur nas las rtsa ba drungs nas phyung ba'i shing bzhin du sa bon med pa nyid kyis rnam par rtog pa ngan pa sems la de kho na nyid phyis 'byung bar mi 'gyur @148a * //
translated: Thus, like a tree whose root has been completely dug up, because of the absence of seeds, those bad thoughts will not arise in the mind again later on.

original: ro ; / de lta na yang mtshan ma la ste /
analyzed: ro ; / de lta na yang mtshan ma la ste /
translated: Even so, with regard to signs,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dge ba'i tshogs dang yongs su sngo bar byed pa'i sems la sgyu ma lta bur sems shing kho na nyid du de'i rang bzhin du mngon par zhen pa med pas mtshan mar byed do zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dge ba'i tshogs dang yongs su sngo bar byed pa'i sems la sgyu ma lta bur sems shing kho na nyid du de'i rang bzhin du mngon par zhen pa med pas mtshan mar byed do zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: it is said that he makes them into signs by thinking of the mind that dedicates the Tathāgata’s wholesome roots as being like an illusion, and by not settling down on their nature as real.

original: thabs la mkhas pa'i yangs su bsngo ba'i yid la byed pa'i bstan par bya ba'i phyir 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa'i yangs su bsngo ba'i yid la byed pa'i bstan par bya ba'i phyir 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In order to teach the mental attention of dedication that is skillful means, he says, “Thus, a bodhisattva great being…”

original: thabs la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa rjes su sgrub kyang mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa rjes su sgrub kyang mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: “Skillful means” is the accomplishment of generosity and so on without apprehending anything.

original: tha dad pa'i phyir thabs la mkhas pa la slob pa rgyal ba'i yum mnyan pa la sogs pa dang 'brel pa ci zhig yod snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i phyir thabs la mkhas pa la slob pa rgyal ba'i yum mnyan pa la sogs pa dang 'brel pa ci zhig yod snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
translated: To answer that doubt, he says, Why is that?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //🔽'di skad du gang gi phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas sbyin pa la sogs pa mi dmigs pa'i yongs su bsngo bar bya ba gang yin pa de nyid thabs la mkhas pa la slob pa de'i phyir rgyal ba'i yum mnyan pa la sogs pa med
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so // 'di skad du gang gi phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas sbyin pa la sogs pa mi dmigs pa'i yongs su bsngo bar bya ba gang yin pa de nyid thabs la mkhas pa la slob pa de'i phyir rgyal ba'i yum mnyan pa la sogs pa med
translated: He says, Because it is based on the perfection of wisdom, etc.

original: par mi 'byung ngo zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: par mi 'byung ngo zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: This is what he means: Because the perfection of wisdom dedicates the giving, etc., to the nonapprehension of the three sectors, it is the study of skill in means. Therefore, the study of the Mother of the Conquerors does not occur without it.

original: de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir de la gang 'di skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir de la gang 'di skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: To make that clear, he says, In this regard, someone might say, etc.

original: de la de skad ma zer cig ces brjod par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba ni de skad ces smra bar 'os pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de la de skad ma zer cig ces brjod par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba ni de skad ces smra bar 'os pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: One should say to him, Do not say that! This means that it is not proper to say that.

original: tha dad pa'i phyir yongs su bsngo ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang 'brel pa ci zhig yod snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i phyir yongs su bsngo ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang 'brel pa ci zhig yod snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
translated: Since they are different, what connection is there between the dedication and the perfection of wisdom? In order to dispel that doubt, he says, Why is it so?

original: bdag de dag kyang 'gags la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: bdag de dag kyang 'gags la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Because those selves are ceased, etc.

original: sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba sogs par byed pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams dang de'i bag chags rnams de kho na nyid du ma skyes pa yin pas /
analyzed: sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba sogs par byed pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams dang de'i bag chags rnams de kho na nyid du ma skyes pa yin pas /
translated: The wholesome roots, etc., are mental factors and mental qualities that are produced by the mind, and their predispositions are not really produced.

original: bdag gi dngos po de dag gi dngos po 'gags pa dang 'du byed de dag 'gags pas te zhes bya pa'i tshig gnyis smos pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag gi dngos po de dag gi dngos po 'gags pa dang 'du byed de dag 'gags pas te zhes bya pa'i tshig gnyis smos pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the two phrases because those selves are ceased and because those compounded things are ceased are used.

original: de nyid sbyor ba dngos gzhi dang mjug gi gnas skabs su dmigs su med pas go rims bzhin du zhi ba dpen pa dmigs pa dang bral ba yin no zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: de nyid sbyor ba dngos gzhi dang mjug gi gnas skabs su dmigs su med pas go rims bzhin du zhi ba dpen pa dmigs pa dang bral ba yin no zhes sbyar ro //
translated: Since it is not an object of observation in the context of the preparation, actual basis, and conclusion of that, it is respectively peaceful, sublime, and free from an object of observation.

original: yang na rnam pa dang bcas pa dang rnam pa med pa dang gzhan gyi rnam pa can gyi shes pas gzung bar mi @148b nus pa'i phyir grangs ji lta ba bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na rnam pa dang bcas pa dang rnam pa med pa dang gzhan gyi rnam pa can gyi shes pas gzung bar mi @148b nus pa'i phyir grangs ji lta ba bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: Or, since it cannot be apprehended by a consciousness that has an aspect, that is without an aspect, or that has another’s aspect, it should be expressed in just the same way as the number of those.

original: bsam pa ni gang gi phyir bsngo bar bya ba'i chos rnams ni de kho na nyid du ma skyes pa yin pa'i phyir yongs su sngo bar byed pa'i shes pa'i lam las 'das pa nyid yin pas yongs su bsngo bar mi 'thad pa de'i phyir rnam par rtog
analyzed: bsam pa ni gang gi phyir bsngo bar bya ba'i chos rnams ni de kho na nyid du ma skyes pa yin pa'i phyir yongs su sngo bar byed pa'i shes pa'i lam las 'das pa nyid yin pas yongs su bsngo bar mi 'thad pa de'i phyir rnam par rtog
translated: The thought is this: Since the phenomena that are to be dedicated are not produced in reality, they are beyond the path of the consciousness that dedicates them, and thus it is not tenable that they are dedicated. Therefore, the imagination of what is unreal

original: pas lhag par sgro btags nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i stobs kyis chos rnams sgyu ma lta bur lhag par mos pa'i phyir na yang dag pa'i thabs la mkhas pas phyin ci log par yongs su bsngo bar bya bar nus so zhes bya ba 'di
analyzed: pas lhag par sgro btags nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i stobs kyis chos rnams sgyu ma lta bur lhag par mos pa'i phyir na yang dag pa'i thabs la mkhas pas phyin ci log par yongs su bsngo bar bya bar nus so zhes bya ba 'di
translated: Therefore, by the power of the perfection of wisdom, one should dedicate to enlightenment with the correct method, with the correct skill in means, with the correct superimposition, with the correct imagination that phenomena are like illusions.🔽This is the point.

original: yin no // mtshan ma med pa'i yongs su bsngo ba'i yid la byed pa bstan pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: yin no // mtshan ma med pa'i yongs su bsngo ba'i yid la byed pa bstan pa'i phyir ;
translated: In order to teach the attention of the signless dedication,

original: 'on kyang gang zag de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'on kyang gang zag de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, “However, that person…” and so on.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin dang bral ba'i de kho na nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid la /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin dang bral ba'i de kho na nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid la /
translated: In reality, just as it is, which is free from the nature of entity and non-entity and so on,🔽one grasps it as having some nature such as emptiness and so on.

original: stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i rang bzhin 'ga' zhig tu 'dzin pa'i phyir mtshan mar byas shing /
analyzed: stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i rang bzhin 'ga' zhig tu 'dzin pa'i phyir mtshan mar byas shing /
translated: Therefore, one makes signs.

original: yang dang yang du yid la byed pa rnam par brtags nas phyis rnam par rtog pa don med pa yang dag pa ji lta pa bzhin ma yin pa la don du zhen pas yang dag pa ji lta bar 'du shes shing don dam par 'du shes par gyur
analyzed: yang dang yang du yid la byed pa rnam par brtags nas phyis rnam par rtog pa don med pa yang dag pa ji lta pa bzhin ma yin pa la don du zhen pas yang dag pa ji lta bar 'du shes shing don dam par 'du shes par gyur
translated: Having repeatedly examined mental activity, later, due to the conception of a meaning that is pointless, not real, and not as it is, as having meaning,

original: pas / rnam par rtog pa'i snang pa don med bzhin du dmigs pa la /
analyzed: pas / rnam par rtog pa'i snang pa don med bzhin du dmigs pa la /
translated: one dedicates to the attainment of enlightenment the observation of pointless conceptual appearances as if they were not observed.

original: mi dmigs par 'tshang rgyab nyid du yongs su sngo bar byed de zhes bya ba ni ngag gi don to //
analyzed: mi dmigs par 'tshang rgyab nyid du yongs su sngo bar byed de zhes bya ba ni ngag gi don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the verse.

original: don du dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ji ltar de ltar yongs su bsngo ba mi gnang snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhen zhes bya bas bsu nas /
analyzed: don du dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ji ltar de ltar yongs su bsngo ba mi gnang snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhen zhes bya bas bsu nas /
translated: Why is it that one should not dedicate in that way, since the object is not observed?

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to this question, the text says, “The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones,” and so on.

original: 'di skad du gang gi phyir gang zag de ni stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i rnam pas yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa bla na med pa'i byang chub la mtshan mar byed cing rnam par rtog par byed pa dag gang gi rnam par rtog pa snang ba'i
analyzed: 'di skad du gang gi phyir gang zag de ni stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i rnam pas yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa bla na med pa'i byang chub la mtshan mar byed cing rnam par rtog par byed pa dag gang gi rnam par rtog pa snang ba'i
translated: This is what is being said: “Because those persons who superimpose and conceptualize the unsurpassed enlightenment of complete nirvana through the aspects of emptiness and so on,

original: rnam pas de bzhin du nye bar dmigs pa de bas na sgro btags pa'i don gyi rang bzhin 'dzin pa'i phyir gsor mi rung ba nyid de'i dmigs pa chen po yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pas de bzhin du nye bar dmigs pa de bas na sgro btags pa'i don gyi rang bzhin 'dzin pa'i phyir gsor mi rung ba nyid de'i dmigs pa chen po yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: in the same way that they are conceptualized, apprehend them as such. Therefore, because they grasp the nature of superimposed objects, they are incurable. That is their great object.”🔽Because the object is made clear and so on, the dedication of those who have that notion does not perform a great function.

original: nye bar dmigs pa ni yid dang ba la sogs par byed pa'i phyir de'i 'du shes can gyi yongs su bsngo ba don chen po byed pa ma yin snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /🔽yongs su bsngo ba @149a * //
analyzed: nye bar dmigs pa ni yid dang ba la sogs par byed pa'i phyir de'i 'du shes can gyi yongs su bsngo ba don chen po byed pa ma yin snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas / yongs su bsngo ba @149a * //
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni dug dang bcas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de ni dug dang bcas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: That dedication is said to be “poisoned” and so on.

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i chos kyi de kho na nyid rtog pa las nyams pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir dug dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i chos kyi de kho na nyid rtog pa las nyams pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir dug dang bcas pa'o //
translated: It is poisonous because it causes the loss of the realization of the reality of the Dharma which is greatly desired.

original: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gdon par dka' ba thams cad kyi rgyu nyid yin pas na zug rdu dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gdon par dka' ba thams cad kyi rgyu nyid yin pas na zug rdu dang bcas pa ste /
translated: It is painful because it is the cause of all the sufferings of cyclic existence which are difficult to bear.

original: las dang po pa rnams kyi yid dang ba la sogs par byed pa yin yang tshad ma dang 'gal ba'i phyir na zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: las dang po pa rnams kyi yid dang ba la sogs par byed pa yin yang tshad ma dang 'gal ba'i phyir na zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: Although it causes the faith, etc. of beginners, it is not valid knowledge because it is in contradiction with valid knowledge.

original: 'di dag gsal bar bya ba'i phyir 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'di dag gsal bar bya ba'i phyir 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In order to clarify these, he says, for example, like a poisonous snake, etc.

original: de la dug gi nyes pa'i tshul yongs su shes pa nyid yin pa'i phyir mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: de la dug gi nyes pa'i tshul yongs su shes pa nyid yin pa'i phyir mkhas pa'o //
translated: Among them, the wise one is so called because he fully understands the nature of the poison.

original: dug gi rang gi ngo bo mi shes pas na byis pa'o //
analyzed: dug gi rang gi ngo bo mi shes pas na byis pa'o //
translated: The fool is so called because he does not understand the nature of the poison.

original: dug gi rang gi ngo bo shes na yang 'chi bar nus pa nyid du nges par mi 'dzin pas na shes rab 'chal ba'o //
analyzed: dug gi rang gi ngo bo shes na yang 'chi bar nus pa nyid du nges par mi 'dzin pas na shes rab 'chal ba'o //
translated: The one of confused wisdom is so called because, even though he understands the nature of the poison, he does not grasp that it is certain to kill.

original: bde ba skyed par byed pa nyid kyis na bde ba thob par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba skyed par byed pa nyid kyis na bde ba thob par byed pa'o //
translated: It is the cause of the attainment of pleasure because it generates pleasure.

original: tha mar sdug bsngal gyi 'bras bu can yin pas sdug bsngal bar smin par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: tha mar sdug bsngal gyi 'bras bu can yin pas sdug bsngal bar smin par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is the cause of the maturation of suffering because it has suffering as its result in the end.

original: kha cig ces bya ba ni dmigs pa'i 'du shes can no //
analyzed: kha cig ces bya ba ni dmigs pa'i 'du shes can no //
translated: Some, says, are those who have the notion of an objective referent.

original: log par zin cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gsum ni go rims bzhin du thos pa dang bsam pa dang / sgom pa'i gnas skabs su log par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: log par zin cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gsum ni go rims bzhin du thos pa dang bsam pa dang / sgom pa'i gnas skabs su log par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: The three phrases beginning with “misapprehending” refer to the states of listening, reflection, and meditative concentration, respectively, because one misapprehends them.

original: / legs par smras pa'i don ma shes shing zhes bya ba ni sgyu ma lta bu'i don ni phyin ci log thams cad ldog pa'i dogs pa can du ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / legs par smras pa'i don ma shes shing zhes bya ba ni sgyu ma lta bu'i don ni phyin ci log thams cad ldog pa'i dogs pa can du ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Not understanding the meaning of the well-spoken, means not understanding the meaning of illusion-like as the basis for the reversal of all errors.

original: don yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du khong du ma chud pa dag ces bya ba ni dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo sgyu ma lta bu yin par nges par 'dzin pa'i nus pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du khong du ma chud pa dag ces bya ba ni dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo sgyu ma lta bu yin par nges par 'dzin pa'i nus pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Not penetrating the meaning just as it is, means being devoid of the ability to ascertain the illusion-like intrinsic reality of things.

original: las dang po pa rnams kyi yid dang bar byed pa'i phyir na gang gis de'i 'du shes can la yongs su bsngo bar 'gyur ba /
analyzed: las dang po pa rnams kyi yid dang bar byed pa'i phyir na gang gis de'i 'du shes can la yongs su bsngo bar 'gyur ba /
translated: Because it causes the minds of beginners to be confident,

original: dmigs pa skyon dang bcas pa ji ltar yin snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
analyzed: dmigs pa skyon dang bcas pa ji ltar yin snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
translated: it is said, “Why is that?” in order to anticipate the doubt, “How can the object be faulty for one who has the perception of that?”

original: dmigs pa ni dug dang bcas pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs te tshad ma dang 'gal ba'i phyir zhes bya bar 'dod do //
analyzed: dmigs pa ni dug dang bcas pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs te tshad ma dang 'gal ba'i phyir zhes bya bar 'dod do //
translated: “The object is poisonous” is stated. It is asserted that it is because it contradicts valid knowledge.

original: de ltar bslab par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bslab par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bslab par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bslab par mi bya'o //
translated: “One should not train in that way” means one should not train by way of an object.

original: sangs rgyas kyis rjes su snang ba'i yongs su bsngo ba'i yid la byed pa'i byed pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis rjes su snang ba'i yongs su bsngo ba'i yid la byed pa'i byed pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the mental activity of the dedication that is illuminated by the Buddha,

original: @149b yang des ji ltar bslab par bya zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: @149b yang des ji ltar bslab par bya zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: “How should one train?” and so on is stated.

original: skur pa mi gdab par 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: skur pa mi gdab par 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “One who does not wish to denigrate” means

original: de bzhin gshegs pas bstan pa'i don nyams su blangs pas 'bras bu thob par mthong ba'i phyir spong bar byed par mi 'dod pas so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas bstan pa'i don nyams su blangs pas 'bras bu thob par mthong ba'i phyir spong bar byed par mi 'dod pas so //
translated: Because he sees that the result is attained by practicing the meaning taught by the Tathagata, he does not wish to abandon it.

original: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi spyan chos thams cad rnam par mi rtog pa'i yul can gyis mkhyen cing /🔽sangs rgyas kyi spyan zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi spyan chos thams cad rnam par mi rtog pa'i yul can gyis mkhyen cing / sangs rgyas kyi spyan zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The so-called Buddha-wisdom is the knowledge by means of the eye of wisdom, the subject that is non-conceptual with regard to all dharmas.

original: rnam pa thams cad du chos thams cad mngon par byang chub pa'i yul can gyis gzigs pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du chos thams cad mngon par byang chub pa'i yul can gyis gzigs pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The so-called Buddha-eye is the vision by means of the subject that is the full enlightenment of all dharmas in every way.

original: chos nyid gang gis zhes bya ba ni sgyu ma lta bu nyid kyis so //
analyzed: chos nyid gang gis zhes bya ba ni sgyu ma lta bu nyid kyis so //
translated: By means of which reality means by means of illusion-like-ness.

original: rjes su snang ba zhes bya ba ni ji ltar lam thams cad mi dmigs par dmigs pa'i yid la byed pas yongs su bsngo ba nyid kyis gnang ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su snang ba zhes bya ba ni ji ltar lam thams cad mi dmigs par dmigs pa'i yid la byed pas yongs su bsngo ba nyid kyis gnang ba'o //
translated: The so-called appearance is the permission by means of the mental attention that observes all paths as non-apprehended objects, by means of the dedication itself.

original: gnod par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni skyon med pa nyid kyis nyes pa ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: gnod par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni skyon med pa nyid kyis nyes pa ma byas pa'o //
translated: The so-called no harm is the non-fault by means of the faultlessness itself.

original: nye bar dmigs pa'i yul dang bral ba'i phyir dug med pa'i yongs su bsngo ba'o //
analyzed: nye bar dmigs pa'i yul dang bral ba'i phyir dug med pa'i yongs su bsngo ba'o //
translated: It is a dedication free from poison, because it is free from the object of reference.

original: gzugs kyi sku dang chos kyi sku thob pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir go rims bzhin du yongs su bsngo ba chen po yin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyi sku dang chos kyi sku thob pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir go rims bzhin du yongs su bsngo ba chen po yin no //
translated: It is a great dedication, because it is the cause for attaining the Body of Form and the Dharma Body.

original: chos kyi dbyings su bsngo ba yin no zhes bya'o //🔽sbyor ba dang mjug gi gnas skabs su yongs su rgyas pa'i phyir yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings su bsngo ba yin no zhes bya'o // sbyor ba dang mjug gi gnas skabs su yongs su rgyas pa'i phyir yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
translated: It is a dedication to the Dharma-element.🔽It is complete, because it is extended in the situation of the application and the conclusion.

original: dngos gzhi'i gnas skabs su yang dag par rab tu 'jug pa nyid yin pa'i phyir shin tu yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos gzhi'i gnas skabs su yang dag par rab tu 'jug pa nyid yin pa'i phyir shin tu yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //
translated: It is very complete, because it is correctly engaged in the situation of the main practice.

original: khams gsum par ma gtogs pa'i bsngo ba yid la byed pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: khams gsum par ma gtogs pa'i bsngo ba yid la byed pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the dedication that is not included in the three realms, he says:

original: gzhan yang rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gzhan yang rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Moreover, son or daughter of noble family...

original: mi rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is non-conceptual,

original: 'dod pa la sogs pa khams gsum ni dmigs su med pa yin pa'i phyir mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa la sogs pa khams gsum ni dmigs su med pa yin pa'i phyir mi gnas pa'o //
translated: because the three realms of desire and so forth are not apprehended.

original: de la 'dod pa'i khams ni lha'i ris drug dang / gling bzhi pa'i mi dang / yi dags dang / byol song dang / dmyal ba'i dbye bas nyi shu'o //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa'i khams ni lha'i ris drug dang / gling bzhi pa'i mi dang / yi dags dang / byol song dang / dmyal ba'i dbye bas nyi shu'o //
translated: The desire realm is twenty in number, divided into six divine types, humans of the four continents, ghosts, animals, and hell beings.

original: gzugs kyi khams ni steng gi gnas bcu bdun te /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams ni steng gi gnas bcu bdun te /
translated: The form realm is the seventeen higher abodes.

original: bsam gtan gsum re re zhing gsum dang bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa brgyad do //
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum re re zhing gsum dang bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa brgyad do //
translated: Each of the three concentrations is threefold, and the fourth concentration is eightfold.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams ni gnas med de skye bas rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams ni gnas med de skye bas rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: The formless realm has no location, but is fourfold by birth.

original: yang na bsam gtan gyi gong na dbyibs dang bcas pa'i gzugs med pa'i bsam pa ni drug yin no @150a * //🔽zhes 'dod do //
analyzed: yang na bsam gtan gyi gong na dbyibs dang bcas pa'i gzugs med pa'i bsam pa ni drug yin no @150a * // zhes 'dod do //
translated: Or, it is said that there are six formless concentrations above the concentrations, which have shape.

original: 'das pa la sogs pa'i dus gsum du mi gnas pa nyid kyis na 'das pa ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs pa'i dus gsum du mi gnas pa nyid kyis na 'das pa ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: It is said that it is not past, and so on, because it does not abide in the three times, past and so on.

original: 'dod pa la sogs pa'i khams rnams dang 'das pa la sogs pa'i dus su gnas pa'i sems kyi skad cig ma yongs su sngo bar byed pa'i phyir ji ltar de la mi gnas snyam nas de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes rtog pa la /
analyzed: 'dod pa la sogs pa'i khams rnams dang 'das pa la sogs pa'i dus su gnas pa'i sems kyi skad cig ma yongs su sngo bar byed pa'i phyir ji ltar de la mi gnas snyam nas de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes rtog pa la /
translated: Why is that?

original: dus gsum dang khams gsum ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: dus gsum dang khams gsum ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The response is: “Except for the three times and the three realms, etc.”

original: 'di skad du dus gsum dang khams gsum ni kho na nyid du ma skyes pa yin pa'i phyir ma gtogs pa nyid yin pas ji ltar de la gnas nas yongs su bsngo bar bya /
analyzed: 'di skad du dus gsum dang khams gsum ni kho na nyid du ma skyes pa yin pa'i phyir ma gtogs pa nyid yin pas ji ltar de la gnas nas yongs su bsngo bar bya /
translated: This is what is being said: since the three times and the three realms are not born in reality, they are excluded. How can one abide in them and dedicate?

original: chos gang du zhes bya ba ni 'tshang rgya ba nyid la'o //
analyzed: chos gang du zhes bya ba ni 'tshang rgya ba nyid la'o //
translated: “In which Dharma” refers to enlightenment.

original: yongs su bsngo ba ni chud ma zos pa yin te zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings dang 'dra bar zad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su bsngo ba ni chud ma zos pa yin te zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings dang 'dra bar zad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Dedication is non-exhaustion” means that it is like the realm of phenomena, because it is inexhaustible.

original: ma gtogs pa'o zhes mngon par zhen pa ni 'ching ba yin pas de la ste yongs su bsngo ba de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: ma gtogs pa'o zhes mngon par zhen pa ni 'ching ba yin pas de la ste yongs su bsngo ba de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The phrase except for indicates that attachment to the idea of a self is a fetter.

original: nye bar bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir de la gang la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: nye bar bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir de la gang la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In order to summarize, the phrase in regard to that is stated.

original: 'dri ba'i sgo nas yang dag par ston par byed pa yin pa'i phyir 'phags pa rab 'byor legs so zhes bya ba byin pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dri ba'i sgo nas yang dag par ston par byed pa yin pa'i phyir 'phags pa rab 'byor legs so zhes bya ba byin pa yin te /
translated: Since he is teaching by way of a question, the phrase Excellent, Subhuti! is given.

original: gzhan du na 'phags pa byams pas bstan pa yin pa'i phyir gzhan dag la legs so zhes bya ba byin pa legs par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan du na 'phags pa byams pas bstan pa yin pa'i phyir gzhan dag la legs so zhes bya ba byin pa legs par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: Otherwise, since it is taught by the noble Maitreya, how could it be excellent for others to give their assent?

original: chos phyin ci ma log par bstan pa med pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: chos phyin ci ma log par bstan pa med pa ma yin nam /
translated: Is it not the case that the teaching of the Dharma is not erroneous?🔽 How is the act of teaching accomplished?

original: ji ltar ston pa'i bya ba byas pa yin snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
analyzed: ji ltar ston pa'i bya ba byas pa yin snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
translated: In order to dispel this doubt, the phrase Why is that? is stated.

original: rab 'byor yongs su bsngo ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: rab 'byor yongs su bsngo ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Subhuti, the phrase in regard to that is stated.

original: 'di skad du gang gi phyir yongs su bsngo ba 'di dag thams cad sgyu ma dang 'dra bas chos kyi dbyings su bsngo ba yin pas de bas na phyin ci log par ston pas sangs rgyas kyi bya ba byed pa yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad du gang gi phyir yongs su bsngo ba 'di dag thams cad sgyu ma dang 'dra bas chos kyi dbyings su bsngo ba yin pas de bas na phyin ci log par ston pas sangs rgyas kyi bya ba byed pa yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: This is what is being said: because all these dedications are like an illusion, they are dedicated to the dharma-element. Therefore, the Buddha acts on behalf of beings by teaching the absence of error.

original: de bas na de'i 'og tu bsod nams chen po 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i bsngo ba yid la byed par bya ste /
analyzed: de bas na de'i 'og tu bsod nams chen po 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i bsngo ba yid la byed par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, after that, one should bring to mind the dedication that is called “the arising of great merit.”

original: de yang chung du dang 'bring dang chen po'i dbye bas rnams pa gsum yod pa las /
analyzed: de yang chung du dang 'bring dang chen po'i dbye bas rnams pa gsum yod pa las /
translated: Moreover, it is threefold, distinguished as lesser, middling, and great.

original: chung ngu'i dbang du mdzad nas chos nyid 'di la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi zhes bya ba nas mngon par shes pa lnga thob par gyur kyang zhes bya @150b ba'i bar du gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: chung ngu'i dbang du mdzad nas chos nyid 'di la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi zhes bya ba nas mngon par shes pa lnga thob par gyur kyang zhes bya @150b ba'i bar du gsungs pa yin no //
translated: With reference to the lesser, it is said, “In this reality, the Lord Buddhas…” up to “…attain the five superknowledges.”

original: 'di skad du sems can dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la brten pa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: 'di skad du sems can dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la brten pa nas brtsams te /
translated: This is what is being said: starting from the sentient beings who rely on the path of the ten virtues,

original: mngon par shes pa lnga rnams kyi bsod nams mngon par 'du byed pa chung ngur gyur pa bas mi dmigs pa'i yid la byed pas rjes su yi rang ba sngon du 'gro ba'i yongs su bsngo ba bsod nams lhag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir chung ngu'i khyad par
analyzed: mngon par shes pa lnga rnams kyi bsod nams mngon par 'du byed pa chung ngur gyur pa bas mi dmigs pa'i yid la byed pas rjes su yi rang ba sngon du 'gro ba'i yongs su bsngo ba bsod nams lhag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir chung ngu'i khyad par
translated: The dedication of merit that is preceded by rejoicing with nonapprehending attention is superior to the lesser merit of the five types of superknowledge.

original: gyis phye ba'i bsod nams chen po 'byung ba'i yongs su bsngo ba'i yid la byed pa chung ngu yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: gyis phye ba'i bsod nams chen po 'byung ba'i yongs su bsngo ba'i yid la byed pa chung ngu yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the attention of dedication that produces great merit, which is distinguished by lesser merit, is lesser.

original: 'bring bstan par bya ba'i phyir yang rab 'byor stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas rang sangs rgyas su gyur kyang zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa yang yin no //
analyzed: 'bring bstan par bya ba'i phyir yang rab 'byor stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas rang sangs rgyas su gyur kyang zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa yang yin no //
translated: In order to teach the medium, it is said, “Subhūti, if someone were to establish the sentient beings of a three-billion-fold world-system as having the ten powers of the Tathāgata, up to the eighteen aspects of the Buddha’s unique qualities, and as having the level of pratyekabuddhas.”

original: 'di skad du 'bras bu dang po la gnas pa nas brtsams te rang sangs rgyas kyi bar du bsod nams mngon par 'du byed pa 'bring du 'gyur bas ni de mi dmigs pa'i dmigs pa yid la byed pas rjes su yi rang ba sngon du 'gro ba'i yongs
analyzed: 'di skad du 'bras bu dang po la gnas pa nas brtsams te rang sangs rgyas kyi bar du bsod nams mngon par 'du byed pa 'bring du 'gyur bas ni de mi dmigs pa'i dmigs pa yid la byed pas rjes su yi rang ba sngon du 'gro ba'i yongs
translated: In this way, from the beginning of the first result up to the level of a pratyekabuddha, the merit that is created is middling.🔽🔽

original: su bsngo ba bsod nams chen po yin pa'i phyir 'bring gi khyad par gyi dbye ba bsod nams chen po 'byung ba'i yid la byed pa 'bring yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: su bsngo ba bsod nams chen po yin pa'i phyir 'bring gi khyad par gyi dbye ba bsod nams chen po 'byung ba'i yid la byed pa 'bring yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: It is said that from the beginning of the first result up to the level of a pratyekabuddha, the merit of the middling is the middling mental contemplation that is the source of great merit, since it is the great merit of rejoicing that is preceded by nonapprehending nonobservation and then dedicating it to great enlightenment.

original: chen po bstan pa'i phyir rab 'byor yang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: chen po bstan pa'i phyir rab 'byor yang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: To teach the great, it says, “Subhūti, if someone were to give gifts in a great trichiliocosm,

original: sbyin pa de yang dmigs pa'i 'du shes kyis byin la zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: sbyin pa de yang dmigs pa'i 'du shes kyis byin la zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa yin te /
translated: and that giving is given with the perception of attributes,” and so on.

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams gang ga'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag gi sems can bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu zhugs pa rnams kyis dmigs pa dang bcas pas de snyed dam de bas lhag pa'i gos pa
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams gang ga'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag gi sems can bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu zhugs pa rnams kyis dmigs pa dang bcas pas de snyed dam de bas lhag pa'i gos pa
translated: The merit of those who have entered to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment in as many worlds as there are grains of sand in the Ganges river in a great trichiliocosm is great merit through offering all their robes, alms, and so on for that many eons.

original: dang bsod snyoms la sogs pa thams cad kyis bskal pa de snyed cig tu bsnyen bskur byas pa'i bsod nams chen por gyur pa bas de mi dmigs pa'i yid la byed pas rjes su yi rang ba sngon du 'gro ba ni bsod nams ches lhag pa yin pa'i
analyzed: dang bsod snyoms la sogs pa thams cad kyis bskal pa de snyed cig tu bsnyen bskur byas pa'i bsod nams chen por gyur pa bas de mi dmigs pa'i yid la byed pas rjes su yi rang ba sngon du 'gro ba ni bsod nams ches lhag pa yin pa'i
translated: But the merit of rejoicing in that with nonapprehending mental attention is greater.

original: phyir chen po'i khyad par gyi bye brag gis bsod nams chen po 'byung ba'i yongs su bsngo ba'i yid la byed pa chen po yin no zhes bya ba ni spyi'i don yin no //
analyzed: phyir chen po'i khyad par gyi bye brag gis bsod nams chen po 'byung ba'i yongs su bsngo ba'i yid la byed pa chen po yin no zhes bya ba ni spyi'i don yin no //
translated: The mental attention of great dedication that produces great merit through the distinction of greatness is the general meaning.

original: yan lag gi don yang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: yan lag gi don yang brjod par bya ste /
translated: The subsidiary meaning should also be stated.

original: zhugs pa'i zhes bya ba ni smon pa dang / 'jug pa'i sems dag gis @151a * //
analyzed: zhugs pa'i zhes bya ba ni smon pa dang / 'jug pa'i sems dag gis @151a * //
translated: The those who have entered are those who have entered by means of the aspiration and the application of the thought of enlightenment.

original: zhugs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhugs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is what is meant by those who have entered.

original: de dag thams cad kyis zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa'i 'du shes kyis byin la /
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyis zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa'i 'du shes kyis byin la /
translated: By all of them means by the perception of the objective supports.

original: rnam grangs des na zhes 'og nas 'chad pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: rnam grangs des na zhes 'og nas 'chad pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase for this reason is to be supplied from below.

original: de nyid bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa ni /
translated: This is what is being taught:

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so ;
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so ;
translated: In the great billion world universe and so on.

original: / gzhan yang gzhan dag kho na na zhes bya ba ni de ni ma yin pa gzhan dag na'o //
analyzed: / gzhan yang gzhan dag kho na na zhes bya ba ni de ni ma yin pa gzhan dag na'o //
translated: Moreover, in other places means in other places than that.

original: rim gro byas te zhes bya ba ni cig car bsnyen bkur byed pa'o //
analyzed: rim gro byas te zhes bya ba ni cig car bsnyen bkur byed pa'o //
translated: Having honored means having served.

original: bde bar sbyar ba thams cad ces bya ba ni khrus dang dril phyis la sogs pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: bde bar sbyar ba thams cad ces bya ba ni khrus dang dril phyis la sogs pa rnams kyis so //
translated: All the comforts means bathing, anointing, and so on.

original: bde ba la sogs par gnas pa thams cad kyis zhes bya ba ni 'chag pa la sogs pa'i gnas pas ji ltar 'dod par nye bar gnas shing zhes phyi ma dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs par gnas pa thams cad kyis zhes bya ba ni 'chag pa la sogs pa'i gnas pas ji ltar 'dod par nye bar gnas shing zhes phyi ma dang sbyar ro //
translated: All the abodes of happiness and so on means that they abide as they wish in the abodes of walking and so on.

original: rnam grangs des na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam grangs des na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: By this enumeration means

original: sems can de dag thams cad yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu zhugs par gyur la /
analyzed: sems can de dag thams cad yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu zhugs par gyur la /
translated: that all those sentient beings have entered into complete enlightenment.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan dang gzhan gnas pa'i sems can thams cad la rnam grangs 'dis sems can re re'i don byed pa rim gyis bsnyen bkur byed la sbyin pa de dag yang dmigs pa'i tshul 'du shes kyis byin na zhes bya ba'i bar
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan dang gzhan gnas pa'i sems can thams cad la rnam grangs 'dis sems can re re'i don byed pa rim gyis bsnyen bkur byed la sbyin pa de dag yang dmigs pa'i tshul 'du shes kyis byin na zhes bya ba'i bar
translated: By this enumeration, each sentient being is served in turn, and that giving is given with the perception of the mode of objectification, as stated above.🔽Those sentient beings are that many means

original: du'o // sems can de dag grangs de lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ;
analyzed: du'o // sems can de dag grangs de lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ;
translated: that they are that many.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams na gnas pa'i sems can gzhan de dag thams cad las re res yongs su brtags te zhes bya ba byas nas yang byang chub sems dpa' de rnam pa thams cad nyid la byang chub sems dpa' re res bskal pa de
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams na gnas pa'i sems can gzhan de dag thams cad las re res yongs su brtags te zhes bya ba byas nas yang byang chub sems dpa' de rnam pa thams cad nyid la byang chub sems dpa' re res bskal pa de
translated: Having imagined that each of all those other sentient beings who dwell in the world-realms as explained above, that bodhisattva again, for as many eons as there are grains of sand in the Ganges River,

original: snyed du rim gror byas pa zhes bya ba ni ngag gi don to //
analyzed: snyed du rim gror byas pa zhes bya ba ni ngag gi don to //
translated: worships each bodhisattva. This is the meaning of the words.

original: 'gres snga ma las 'di'i khyad par ni rim gyis zhes bya ba yin par dgongs so //
analyzed: 'gres snga ma las 'di'i khyad par ni rim gyis zhes bya ba yin par dgongs so //
translated: The difference from the previous verse is that it is gradual.

original: rnam grangs 'dis sbyin pa byin zhing zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam grangs 'dis sbyin pa byin zhing zhes bya ba ni /
translated: By this enumeration, he gives gifts.

original: ji ltar bskal pa gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du byang chub sems dpa' gcig la byang chub sems dpa' gcig cig bsnyen bkur byed la /
analyzed: ji ltar bskal pa gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du byang chub sems dpa' gcig la byang chub sems dpa' gcig cig bsnyen bkur byed la /
translated: Just as one bodhisattva serves another bodhisattva for as many eons as there are grains of sand in the Ganges River,

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' gcig po de nyid bskal pa gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du bsnyen bkur byed pa'i rim pa 'dis 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan dang gzhan gyis yang dag par bsdus pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de thams cad la bde bar
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' gcig po de nyid bskal pa gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du bsnyen bkur byed pa'i rim pa 'dis 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan dang gzhan gyis yang dag par bsdus pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de thams cad la bde bar
translated: In the same way, that one bodhisattva would make offerings to all those bodhisattvas included in other world systems, in order to bring about their happiness.

original: sbyar ba'i don du sbyin @151b pa byin zhing bshad ma thag pa'i rim pas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de dag thams cad kyis kyang sbyin pa sbyin na'o //
analyzed: sbyar ba'i don du sbyin @151b pa byin zhing bshad ma thag pa'i rim pas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de dag thams cad kyis kyang sbyin pa sbyin na'o //
translated: And all those bodhisattvas would also make offerings, in the manner just described, to that one bodhisattva.

original: gzugs can zhig lags na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzugs can zhig lags na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If he were to have a form,

original: rdul phra rab kyi rang bzhin gyi gzugs kyi phung por gyur na'o //
analyzed: rdul phra rab kyi rang bzhin gyi gzugs kyi phung por gyur na'o //
translated: if he were to become a form aggregate consisting of atoms.

original: mi shong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rab tu mang bas mi shong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi shong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rab tu mang bas mi shong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It would not be possible, because of the great number.

original: dmigs pa'i 'du shes can gyi sbyin pa'i rang bzhin gyi bsod nams mngon par 'du bya ba ni gzhal du med pa yin yang ji ltar na rgyu'i bar du mi bzod snyam pa'i dgos pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas 'di ltar zhes bya
analyzed: dmigs pa'i 'du shes can gyi sbyin pa'i rang bzhin gyi bsod nams mngon par 'du bya ba ni gzhal du med pa yin yang ji ltar na rgyu'i bar du mi bzod snyam pa'i dgos pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas 'di ltar zhes bya
translated: The merit of giving that has the nature of an object of observation and is a compositional factor is immeasurable. But how could it be the cause of the immeasurable?

original: ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The purpose of this is as follows.

original: 'di skad du gang gi phyir de rnams kyi sbyin pa shin tu mang bar byin pa gcig la sogs pa'i grangs dang bral ba yin na yang tshad med pa la sogs pa'i grangs dang ldan pas tshad med pa dang shin tu mang ba la sogs pa'i grangs kyis
analyzed: 'di skad du gang gi phyir de rnams kyi sbyin pa shin tu mang bar byin pa gcig la sogs pa'i grangs dang bral ba yin na yang tshad med pa la sogs pa'i grangs dang ldan pas tshad med pa dang shin tu mang ba la sogs pa'i grangs kyis
translated: This is saying, “Because their giving is extremely abundant, it is free from the enumeration of one and so on. But because it has the enumeration of immeasurability and so on, it is immeasurable.

original: chod pa yin no //
analyzed: chod pa yin no //
translated: It is cut off by the enumeration of immeasurability and so on.

original: de bas na de'i rgyu can gyi bsod nams mngon par 'du bya ba yongs su bsngo ba'i bsod nams kyi phung po tshad la sogs pa'i grangs dang bral ba'i rgyu'i bar du yang mi bzod do zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de'i rgyu can gyi bsod nams mngon par 'du bya ba yongs su bsngo ba'i bsod nams kyi phung po tshad la sogs pa'i grangs dang bral ba'i rgyu'i bar du yang mi bzod do zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the mass of merit of the dedication of the merit of giving that is its cause is free from the enumeration of the measure of the cause and so on. It is said that it is not even the cause of that.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis lha'i bu rnams gus par byas te byed brjod pa ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis lha'i bu rnams gus par byas te byed brjod pa ni /
translated: The sons of the gods, through the blessing of the Lord, respectfully said:

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The Lord, it is so, etc.

original: theg pa gsum gyis 'dul ba'i sems can rnams la lam ston pa'i rgyur gyur ba'i bya ba dang ldan pa nyid kyis 'gro ba'i don byed pa nyid kyi phyir yongs su bsngo ba chen po lags te zhes bya'o //
analyzed: theg pa gsum gyis 'dul ba'i sems can rnams la lam ston pa'i rgyur gyur ba'i bya ba dang ldan pa nyid kyis 'gro ba'i don byed pa nyid kyi phyir yongs su bsngo ba chen po lags te zhes bya'o //
translated: It is a great dedication because it is the cause for teaching the path to beings who are to be disciplined by the three vehicles, and because it is the very means for accomplishing the welfare of beings.🔽How is it so?

original: ji ltar na de lta bu yin zhes rtogs pa la /🔽de ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: ji ltar na de lta bu yin zhes rtogs pa la / de ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: It is so, etc.

original: gang gi phyir thabs la mkhas pa yod par gyur na de tsam du gzhal du med pa la sogs pa'i grangs dang ldan pa rab tu grags pa'i bsod nams kyi phung po de nyid zil gyis mnan pa de'i phyir yongs su bsngo ba chen po yin no zhes
analyzed: gang gi phyir thabs la mkhas pa yod par gyur na de tsam du gzhal du med pa la sogs pa'i grangs dang ldan pa rab tu grags pa'i bsod nams kyi phung po de nyid zil gyis mnan pa de'i phyir yongs su bsngo ba chen po yin no zhes
translated: Because when there is skill in means, that very mass of merit, which is well known to have a magnitude of immeasurable, etc., is surpassed. Therefore, it is a great dedication.

original: bya ba ni ngag gi don yin no //
analyzed: bya ba ni ngag gi don yin no //
translated: This is the meaning of the verse.

original: yang dag par brten pas dad pas phul du byung ba nges par skyes pa nyid kyis mchod pa sngon du 'gro ba can rab tu bsngags pa'i don smras pa ni de nas sum cu rtsa gsum gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par brten pas dad pas phul du byung ba nges par skyes pa nyid kyis mchod pa sngon du 'gro ba can rab tu bsngags pa'i don smras pa ni de nas sum cu rtsa gsum gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: And because of the right support, the one who has definitely produced the excellence of faith, having made the offering, speaks the meaning of the praise, Then, the Thirty-Three gods... and so on.

original: mdun dang kun du rab tu bkram pa dang gtor bas na go rims bzhin du mngon par rab tu gtor nas zhes bya ba'i don gyi dbye ba yin no //
analyzed: mdun dang kun du rab tu bkram pa dang gtor bas na go rims bzhin du mngon par rab tu gtor nas zhes bya ba'i don gyi dbye ba yin no //
translated: Because of the spreading and scattering in front and all around, the meaning of the division is having scattered well and completely, respectively.

original: @152a * // de bzhin du lha'i ris gzhan dag nas kyang zhes bya ba ni 'thab bral la sogs pa rnams nas so //
analyzed: @152a * // de bzhin du lha'i ris gzhan dag nas kyang zhes bya ba ni 'thab bral la sogs pa rnams nas so //
translated: Similarly, from other god realms means from the Yāma and so on.

original: de skad du zhes bya ba sum cu rtsa gsum pa ltar yongs su bsngo ba chen po lags te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra 'byin zhing yang dang yang du zlos pas dbyangs rjes su sgrogs pa'o //
analyzed: de skad du zhes bya ba sum cu rtsa gsum pa ltar yongs su bsngo ba chen po lags te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra 'byin zhing yang dang yang du zlos pas dbyangs rjes su sgrogs pa'o //
translated: Saying like that means like the Thirty-Three gods, and so on, with the sound of great dedication. Repeating it again and again, he proclaims the sound.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te zhes bya ba ni yongs su bsngo ba chen po lags te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i 'gres kyi zhabs thams cad du de skad du sgra 'byin cing dbyangs rjes su sgrog go zhes bya ba'i tshig gnyis sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i🔽tha tshig go //
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te zhes bya ba ni yongs su bsngo ba chen po lags te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i 'gres kyi zhabs thams cad du de skad du sgra 'byin cing dbyangs rjes su sgrog go zhes bya ba'i tshig gnyis sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Thus, and so on means that all the verses of the conclusion should be supplied, such as this is the great dedication.

original: yun ring po de tsam du bsags pa dang zhes bya ba ni dus yun ring por nye bar bsgrubs pa'o //
analyzed: yun ring po de tsam du bsags pa dang zhes bya ba ni dus yun ring por nye bar bsgrubs pa'o //
translated: Accumulated for such a long time means: accomplished over a long period of time.

original: rgya cher yang dag par bsgrubs pa ni zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rgya cher yang dag par bsgrubs pa ni zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Widely accomplished means:

original: sbyor ba du ma'i sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba du ma'i sgrub pa'o //
translated: accomplished with many preparations.

original: gzhan yang yongs su bsngo ba'i che ba'i bdag nyid bstan pa'i phyir de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi lha'i bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang yongs su bsngo ba'i che ba'i bdag nyid bstan pa'i phyir de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi lha'i bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, in order to teach the greatness of the dedication, the Bhagavān said, “Then the Bhagavān said to the gods of the Pure Abodes,” and so on.

original: sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams mngon par 'du bya ba sbyor ba la sogs pa chen po nyid yin yang /
analyzed: sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams mngon par 'du bya ba sbyor ba la sogs pa chen po nyid yin yang /
translated: The great merit that arises from generosity, which is the activity of preparation, and so on,

original: sbyor ba la sogs pa chung dus bskyed pas yongs su bsngo ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po'i rgyu'i bar du yang ji ltar mo bzod snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
analyzed: sbyor ba la sogs pa chung dus bskyed pas yongs su bsngo ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po'i rgyu'i bar du yang ji ltar mo bzod snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
translated: Thus, beginning with “Why is that?”

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He says, “Thus, the bodhisattva,” etc.

original: dmigs pa dang bcas pa ni tshad ma dang 'gal ba'i phyir phyin ci log yin no zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa ni tshad ma dang 'gal ba'i phyir phyin ci log yin no zhes dgongs so //
translated: He thinks that the one with an objective mental orientation is mistaken, because it contradicts valid cognition.

original: rjes su yi rang sngon du 'gro ba yin yang mos pa yid la byed pas sgrub pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad la sgyu ma'i skyes bu ltar chos thams cad mi dmigs par bsgoms pas sems can thams cad kyi don du bla na med pa yang dag
analyzed: rjes su yi rang sngon du 'gro ba yin yang mos pa yid la byed pas sgrub pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad la sgyu ma'i skyes bu ltar chos thams cad mi dmigs par bsgoms pas sems can thams cad kyi don du bla na med pa yang dag
translated: Although it is preceded by rejoicing, all the roots of virtue that are accomplished by the mental attention of imagination are dedicated to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment for the sake of all sentient beings, by meditating on the non-apprehension of all things, like a magical person.

original: par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad la theg pa gsum gyis nges par 'byung ba'i lam nye bar ston pa'i bya ba byed pa dang ldan pa'i yongs su bsngo ba yid la byed
analyzed: par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad la theg pa gsum gyis nges par 'byung ba'i lam nye bar ston pa'i bya ba byed pa dang ldan pa'i yongs su bsngo ba yid la byed
translated: Because it is to be dedicated to perfect enlightenment, the bodhisattva should perform the dedication that is endowed with the activity of teaching all beings the path of deliverance by means of the three vehicles.

original: pa gcig kho na 'ga' zhig la mngon par zhen pa yin pas de'i gnyen po'i don du bshad pa'i tshul gyis skye bo blo dman pa rnams la phan gdags @152b par bya ba'i phyir rab tu dbye ba rnam pa bcu gnyis su byas pa yin la /
analyzed: pa gcig kho na 'ga' zhig la mngon par zhen pa yin pas de'i gnyen po'i don du bshad pa'i tshul gyis skye bo blo dman pa rnams la phan gdags @152b par bya ba'i phyir rab tu dbye ba rnam pa bcu gnyis su byas pa yin la /
translated: Since there is only one dedication, it is a mental activity, and since it is the antidote to attachment to any one thing, it is explained in twelve categories in order to benefit those of lesser intelligence.

original: shes rab rno ba rnams kyi brnyas pa bzlog pa'i phyir ni shin tu rgyas par phye ba yin no //
analyzed: shes rab rno ba rnams kyi brnyas pa bzlog pa'i phyir ni shin tu rgyas par phye ba yin no //
translated: But for the sake of those of sharp faculties, it is explained in detail in order to prevent their contempt.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As it is said:

original: yongs su bsngo ba khyad par can //
analyzed: yongs su bsngo ba khyad par can //
translated: The special dedication

original: de yis byed pa mchog yin no //🔽de ni dmigs med rnam pa can //
analyzed: de yis byed pa mchog yin no // de ni dmigs med rnam pa can //
translated: is the supreme activity.🔽It has the aspect of the absence of a referential object

original: phyin ci ma log mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log mtshan nyid do //
translated: and the characteristic of non-error.

original: dben dang sangs rgyas bsod nams tshogs //
analyzed: dben dang sangs rgyas bsod nams tshogs //
translated: Solitude, the Buddha, the accumulation of merit,

original: rang bzhin dran pa'i spyod yul can //
analyzed: rang bzhin dran pa'i spyod yul can //
translated: The nature, the sphere of mindfulness,🔽The signless, together with the means,🔽Rejoicing in the Buddha, not belonging to the three realms,

original: thabs bcas mtshan ma med pa dang // sangs rgyas rjes su yi rang dang / khams gsum gtogs pa ma yin dang / chung dang 'bring dang chen po yi //
analyzed: thabs bcas mtshan ma med pa dang // sangs rgyas rjes su yi rang dang / khams gsum gtogs pa ma yin dang / chung dang 'bring dang chen po yi //
translated: And small, middling, and great

original: bsngo ba gzhan ni rnam pa gsum //
analyzed: bsngo ba gzhan ni rnam pa gsum //
translated: The other dedications are of three kinds.

original: bsod nams cher 'byung bdag nyid do //
analyzed: bsod nams cher 'byung bdag nyid do //
translated: They are for the sake of the great arising of merit.

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no //🔽rjes su yi rang ba'i yid la byed pas rang dang gzhan gyi bsod nams kyi bya ba mnyam pa nyid 'thob pas na de'i 'og tu rjes su yi rang ba yid la byed pa bsten par bya ba'i phyir de rnams bcom ldan 'das la zhes bya ba la
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no // rjes su yi rang ba'i yid la byed pas rang dang gzhan gyi bsod nams kyi bya ba mnyam pa nyid 'thob pas na de'i 'og tu rjes su yi rang ba yid la byed pa bsten par bya ba'i phyir de rnams bcom ldan 'das la zhes bya ba la
translated: Thus it is said.🔽Since one obtains the sameness of meritorious deeds of oneself and others through the mental attention of rejoicing, after that one should rely on the mental attention of rejoicing. Therefore, it is said,

original: sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /🔽ji tsam gyis na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sogs pa gsungs pa yin te / ji tsam gyis na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Those who have gone for refuge to the Buddha, etc.🔽To what extent?

original: rnam pa ji tsam gyis so //
analyzed: rnam pa ji tsam gyis so //
translated: means by what kind of aspect.

original: mi 'dzin / rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: mi 'dzin / rlom sems su mi byed /
translated: Do not grasp at, do not conceive of,

original: mi dmigs zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: mi dmigs zhes bya ba ste /
translated: do not apprehend

original: de kho na nyid du ste /
analyzed: de kho na nyid du ste /
translated: means in reality.

original: sbyor ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase “in the context of the stages of practice” should be supplied.

original: mi rtog rnam par mi rtog yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi rtog rnam par mi rtog yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “He does not conceive of them, does not conceive them to be real, and does not conceive them to be unreal”

original: go rims bzhin du 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang ldan zhes bya bar sbyar ro //🔽rtog pas rnam par bsgrubs te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: go rims bzhin du 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang ldan zhes bya bar sbyar ro // rtog pas rnam par bsgrubs te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: means that he does not conceive of them as past, future, or present, respectively.🔽“He does not conceive of them as having arisen from conceptual elaboration”

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtogs pa las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtogs pa las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: means that they do not arise from unreal imagination.

original: de ltar byung ba'i rang dang spyi'i ngo bo dang bral bas go rims bzhin du ma skyes pa nges par ma skyes pa zhes bya ba ni yin no //
analyzed: de ltar byung ba'i rang dang spyi'i ngo bo dang bral bas go rims bzhin du ma skyes pa nges par ma skyes pa zhes bya ba ni yin no //
translated: Since they do not arise in that way, they are free of any specific or general identity.

original: 'das pa la sogs pa nas 'ong ba med pas na 'ong ba med pa'o //
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs pa nas 'ong ba med pas na 'ong ba med pa'o //
translated: Since they do not come from the past, they do not come.

original: ma 'ongs par 'gro bar 'gyur ba med pas na 'gro ba med pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs par 'gro bar 'gyur ba med pas na 'gro ba med pa'o //
translated: Since they do not go to the future, they do not go.

original: chos nyid ces bya ba ni sgyu ma lta bu'i ngo bo nyid do//
analyzed: chos nyid ces bya ba ni sgyu ma lta bu'i ngo bo nyid do//
translated: “Reality” means the nature that is like an illusion.

original: 'di tsam gyis na zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'i rnam pa 'di dag tsam gyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis na zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'i rnam pa 'di dag tsam gyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This much means just this much that has been explained.

original: rnam par grol ba ci lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba ci lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Just as is liberation means

original: ji ltar nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa dang bral zhing ma skyes pa'i mtshan nyid ji lta ba bzhin du'o //
analyzed: ji ltar nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa dang bral zhing ma skyes pa'i mtshan nyid ji lta ba bzhin du'o //
translated: just as is the freedom from the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience, which have the characteristic of non-arising.

original: de kho na nyid du kun nas @153a * //
analyzed: de kho na nyid du kun nas @153a * //
translated: In reality,

original: nyon mongs pa'i chos dang mi ldan pas de dag ma bcings pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i chos dang mi ldan pas de dag ma bcings pa'o //
translated: since he is not endowed with the phenomena of affliction, he is not bound.

original: rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams dang bral bas ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams dang bral bas ma grol ba'o //
translated: Since he is not endowed with the phenomena of purification, he is not liberated.
