original: gang gi phyir ston gzigs pa'i snang ba thogs pa mi mnga' ba can gyis mkhyen pa'i bdag las dang 'bras bu bdag gis bye brag gi cha ji ltar snang ba bzhin du 'gro ba la phan par bzhed pa thugs rje'i bdag nyid can gyi gzigs pa po bcom
analyzed: gang gi phyir ston gzigs pa'i snang ba thogs pa mi mnga' ba can gyis mkhyen pa'i bdag las dang 'bras bu bdag gis bye brag gi cha ji ltar snang ba bzhin du 'gro ba la phan par bzhed pa thugs rje'i bdag nyid can gyi gzigs pa po bcom
translated: The one who sees thus, the one who knows, the one who is the nature of compassion, who is the one who desires to benefit migrating beings, who is the one who sees the world with unobstructed vision, who is the one who is the nature of the self of karma and its results, who is the one who is the nature of the self of the appearance of the aspect of the particular, who is the one who is the nature of the self of the appearance of the aspect of the particular, who is the one who is the nature of the self of the appearance of the aspect of the particular, who is the one who is the nature of the self of the appearance of the aspect of the particular, who is the one who is the nature of the self of the appearance of the aspect of the particular, who is the one who is the nature of the self of the appearance of the aspect of the particular, who is the one who is the nature of the self of the appearance of the aspect of the particular, who is the one who is the nature of the self of the appearance of the aspect of the particular, who is the one who is the nature of the self of the appearance of the aspect of the particular, who is the one who is the nature of the self of the appearance of the aspect of the particular, who is the one who is the nature of the self of the appearance of the aspect of the particular, who is the one who is the nature of the self of the appearance of the aspect of the particular, who is the one who is the nature of the self of the appearance of the aspect of the particular, who is the one who is the nature of the self of the appearance of the aspect of the particular, who is the one who is the nature of the self of the appearance of the aspect of the particular, who is the one who is the nature of the self of the appearance of the aspect of the particular, who is the one who is the nature of the self of the appearance of the aspect of the particular, who is the one who

original: ldan 'das des bye brag tu gsungs pa de bas na dbang po las 'das pa yin na yang thams cad ji ltar mthong ba bzhin du gnas so zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: ldan 'das des bye brag tu gsungs pa de bas na dbang po las 'das pa yin na yang thams cad ji ltar mthong ba bzhin du gnas so zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The Lord has taught this in detail. Therefore, although it is beyond the scope of the senses, it is as if it were seen.

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas pa na ma chags pa dag gi'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas pa na ma chags pa dag gi'o //
translated: The bodhisattvas who are not attached to either samsara or nirvana.

original: rjes su yi rang ba'i skabs su bsngo'i zhes rjes su yid la byed pa'i zhar la brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: rjes su yi rang ba'i skabs su bsngo'i zhes rjes su yid la byed pa'i zhar la brjod pa yin no //
translated: The word “and” in the verse is an expletive, indicating that the bodhisattvas rejoice in the merits of all beings.

original: sgyu ma lta bu nyid kyis 'khor ba chen po mi thob pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu nyid kyis 'khor ba chen po mi thob pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because of their illusoriness, they do not attain the great samsara.

original: 'jig pa med pas mi 'jig pa'o zhes bya bar spyar ro //
analyzed: 'jig pa med pas mi 'jig pa'o zhes bya bar spyar ro //
translated: Because they are not destroyed, they are indestructible.

original: lus kyis legs par spyod pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lus kyis legs par spyod pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Good bodily conduct.

original: srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i lus kyi las rnam pa gsum med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i lus kyi las rnam pa gsum med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are free of the three kinds of bodily actions killing, stealing, and sexual misconduct.

original: ngag gis legs par spyod pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ngag gis legs par spyod pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Good verbal conduct.

original: brdzun du smra ba la sogs pa'i ngag gi las rnam pa bzhi dang bral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: brdzun du smra ba la sogs pa'i ngag gi las rnam pa bzhi dang bral ba'i phyir /
translated: Because they are free of the four kinds of verbal actions lying, slander, harsh speech, and gossip.

original: yid kyis legs par spyod pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yid kyis legs par spyod pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase who are mentally well-behaved means

original: brnab sems la sogs pa yid kyi rnam pa gsum dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brnab sems la sogs pa yid kyi rnam pa gsum dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: that they are free from the three mental types of misdeeds: covetousness, malice, and wrong views.

original: snga ma bzhin du de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dogs pa bsu nas dgongs pa de nyid kyis 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' de dag thams cad ni dmigs pa can zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dogs pa bsu nas dgongs pa de nyid kyis 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' de dag thams cad ni dmigs pa can zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: As before, the Lord anticipates the question Why is that? and answers with the statement For all those bodhisattvas are conceptualizers, and so forth.

original: mtshang 'bru ba zhes bya ba ni phra ma dang tshig rtsub po dang ngag kyal ba smra bas so //
analyzed: mtshang 'bru ba zhes bya ba ni phra ma dang tshig rtsub po dang ngag kyal ba smra bas so //
translated: The phrase they will be reproached means that they will be reproached with slander, harsh words, and idle speech.

original: brdegs te zhes bya ba ni dbyig pa la sogs pas 'tshog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brdegs te zhes bya ba ni dbyig pa la sogs pas 'tshog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase they will be beaten means that they will be beaten with sticks and so forth.

original: spros kyang zhes bya ba ni nan gyis nges par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spros kyang zhes bya ba ni nan gyis nges par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase they will be persecuted means that they will be persecuted with force.

original: nga rgyal dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni kha cig dregs pa'i dngos po nga rgyal dang bcas pa'i phyir ro zhes 'dod do //
analyzed: nga rgyal dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni kha cig dregs pa'i dngos po nga rgyal dang bcas pa'i phyir ro zhes 'dod do //
translated: The phrase they will be arrogant means that some will be arrogant with the arrogance of conceit.

original: la la ni nga rgyal dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni sgra gyur pa zhes bya ba'i don la 'jug go zhes zer ro //
analyzed: la la ni nga rgyal dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni sgra gyur pa zhes bya ba'i don la 'jug go zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say that “with pride” means “with a transformation of sound.”

original: de bzhin du de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dogs pa bsu nas /
translated: Similarly, why is that?

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: To respond to that doubt, he says, “Because bodhisattvas…” and so on.

original: brtson 'grus @153b 'bar ba rtsom pa bstan pa'i phyir gnas pa dang nye bar gzung ba yin pas 'dug cing chags pas mngon par gnas na zhes bya ba gnyis gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: brtson 'grus @153b 'bar ba rtsom pa bstan pa'i phyir gnas pa dang nye bar gzung ba yin pas 'dug cing chags pas mngon par gnas na zhes bya ba gnyis gsungs pa yin no //
translated: In order to teach the blazing of effort, he says, “If they are seated, they are seated with a mind that is not attached to the enjoyment of resting or lying down.”

original: spro ba med pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi zhum pa dang bral bas na yid mi gsod cing zhes bya'o //
analyzed: spro ba med pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi zhum pa dang bral bas na yid mi gsod cing zhes bya'o //
translated: They are not discouraged because they are free from discouragement, which is characterized by lack of enthusiasm.

original: rmugs pa dang gnyid kyis zhes bya ba /
analyzed: rmugs pa dang gnyid kyis zhes bya ba /
translated: “Drowsiness and sleep”

original: gti mug gi cha sems las su mi rung ba nyid ni rmugs pa'o //
analyzed: gti mug gi cha sems las su mi rung ba nyid ni rmugs pa'o //
translated: means that sluggishness is the unserviceability of mind that is a part of delusion.

original: zho la sogs pa la nye bar longs spyod pa'i rgyu la brten nas gti mug gi cha'i sems mngon par sdud pa'i mtshan nyid ni gnyid do //
analyzed: zho la sogs pa la nye bar longs spyod pa'i rgyu la brten nas gti mug gi cha'i sems mngon par sdud pa'i mtshan nyid ni gnyid do //
translated: Sleep is the characteristic of the mind’s withdrawal due to the factor of delusion, based on the cause of enjoyment of curd, etc.

original: snga ma bzhin du de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dogs pa bsu nas /
translated: “Why is it so?” is the question that is anticipated.

original: de bzhin du 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: “It is just so” and so on is stated.

original: bsam gtan bzhi la mnyam par gzhag pa la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi la mnyam par gzhag pa la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Having become equipoised in the four meditative concentrations” means

original: gzugs kyi khams kyis bsdus pa'i 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan bzhi bsgoms par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams kyis bsdus pa'i 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan bzhi bsgoms par gyur pa'o //
translated: having cultivated the four worldly meditative concentrations included in the form realm.

original: de bzhin du de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dogs pa bsu na /
analyzed: de bzhin du de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dogs pa bsu na /
translated: “Why is it so?” is the question that is anticipated.

original: snga ma bzhin du de ltar byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du de ltar byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “Thus, Bodhisattvas” and so on is stated, as before.

original: de la bsdus pa'i don ni 'di lta yin te /
analyzed: de la bsdus pa'i don ni 'di lta yin te /
translated: The condensed meaning of this is as follows.

original: rab tu dga' ba'i sems kyis kun rdzob kyi thabs kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams la dmigs nas rjes su yi rang bar bya ba ni rjes su yid la byed pa yin no//
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba'i sems kyis kun rdzob kyi thabs kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams la dmigs nas rjes su yi rang bar bya ba ni rjes su yid la byed pa yin no//
translated: The subsequent mental attention is the mental attention of rejoicing, which is the mental attention that, with a very joyful mind, focuses on the roots of virtue of the conventional method and rejoices in them.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And thus it is said:

original: thabs dang mi dmigs pa dag gis /🔽dge ba'i rtsa la yi rang ba /
analyzed: thabs dang mi dmigs pa dag gis / dge ba'i rtsa la yi rang ba /
translated: By means of the method and nonapprehension,🔽one rejoices in the roots of virtue.

original: rjes su yi rang yid byed pa //
analyzed: rjes su yi rang yid byed pa //
translated: The mental attention of rejoicing

original: bsgom pa yin par 'dir brjod do //🔽zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bsgom pa yin par 'dir brjod do // zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: is said to be the meditation here.🔽In the Illumination of the Ornament of Clear Realization,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bshad pa mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan gyi snang ba las /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bshad pa mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan gyi snang ba las /
translated: an explanation of the Perfection of Wisdom

original: rjes su yi rang ba dang yongs su bsngo ba'i le'u zhes bya ste drug pa'o /🔽// / zag pa dang bcas pa'i bsgom pa'i lam gyi 'og tu zag pa med pa'i bsgom pa'i lam brjod par bya'o //🔽de yang rnam pa gnyis yod pa la /
analyzed: rjes su yi rang ba dang yongs su bsngo ba'i le'u zhes bya ste drug pa'o /🔽// / zag pa dang bcas pa'i bsgom pa'i lam gyi 'og tu zag pa med pa'i bsgom pa'i lam brjod par bya'o //🔽de yang rnam pa gnyis yod pa la /
translated: , this is the sixth chapter, on rejoicing and dedication.

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid ston pas dang po sgrub pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bsgom pa'i lam bstan pa'i don du de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid ston pas dang po sgrub pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bsgom pa'i lam bstan pa'i don du de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Since it shows its own nature, in order to teach the path of meditation that is the characteristic of the first practice, then the venerable Śāriputra said to the Blessed One, and so on.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ye shes yongs su sgrub pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ye shes yongs su sgrub pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The attainment of omniscient wisdom is

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes bskyed pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes bskyed pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause for generating the wisdom of the Tathāgata.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid @154a * //🔽ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid @154a * // ces bya ba ni /
translated: Omniscience is

original: gzugs la sogs pa phyin ci ma log par gzigs pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa phyin ci ma log par gzigs pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: because it is the nature of seeing form and so on without error.

original: de de bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gis ni dad pa phul du byung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir mngon par bsgrub pa ni ye shes kyi rang bzhin yin par rgya cher bstan par bya ba'i don du bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs🔽pa gsol te /
analyzed: de de bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gis ni dad pa phul du byung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir mngon par bsgrub pa ni ye shes kyi rang bzhin yin par rgya cher bstan par bya ba'i don du bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs🔽pa gsol te /
translated: With the words That is so and so on, in order to extensively teach that the accomplishment is of the nature of wisdom due to having the highest faith, the Blessed One said, and so on.

original: dro bar gtogs pa'i ye shes kyi snang ba nyid yin pas na gsal bar snang bar bgyid pa lags so //
analyzed: dro bar gtogs pa'i ye shes kyi snang ba nyid yin pas na gsal bar snang bar bgyid pa lags so //
translated: Because it is the light of the wisdom that belongs to the heat stage, it is the illuminator.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid rab tu 'dud pas na phyag 'tshal ba'o //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid rab tu 'dud pas na phyag 'tshal ba'o //
translated: It is the homage because it is the bowing of body, speech, and mind.

original: gang gi phyir sdud par 'os pa nyid la yin pas na phyag bgyi bar 'os pa lags so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sdud par 'os pa nyid la yin pas na phyag bgyi bar 'os pa lags so //
translated: It is the one worthy of homage because it is the one worthy of being gathered.

original: rtse mo'i gnas skabs nyid thob pa nyid kyis nam dad pa la sogs pa dang ma 'dres pa yin pa sogs pa med pa lags so //
analyzed: rtse mo'i gnas skabs nyid thob pa nyid kyis nam dad pa la sogs pa dang ma 'dres pa yin pa sogs pa med pa lags so //
translated: It is the one without defilement because it is the one that has attained the state of summit and is not mixed with faith, etc.

original: bzod pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis na ngan song du 'jug par byed pa'i las rnams dang bral bas 'jig rten thams cad kyis mi gos pa lags so //
analyzed: bzod pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis na ngan song du 'jug par byed pa'i las rnams dang bral bas 'jig rten thams cad kyis mi gos pa lags so //
translated: It is the one unstained by the world because it is free from the actions that cause one to enter the evil destinies, due to its very nature of acceptance.

original: chos kyi mchog gi ngo bo nyid kyis na 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir snang bar bgyid pa lags so //
analyzed: chos kyi mchog gi ngo bo nyid kyis na 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir snang bar bgyid pa lags so //
translated: It is the illuminator because it is the cause of the arising of supramundane wisdom, due to its very nature of the supreme mundane state.

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pas rang gis mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i khams gsum ba'i nyon mongs pa spang bas na khams gsum pa thams cad kyi rab rib dang bral bar bgyid pa lags so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pas rang gis mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i khams gsum ba'i nyon mongs pa spang bas na khams gsum pa thams cad kyi rab rib dang bral bar bgyid pa lags so //
translated: By abandoning the afflictions of the three realms to be abandoned by seeing with the perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering, one is free from the cataracts of the three realms.

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pas rnam par grol ba mngon sum du byed pas na nyon mongs pa dang lta ba'i mun pa thams cad sel ba lags so //🔽sdug bsngal la sogs pa rjes su shes pa'i bzod pas 'phags pa'i chos kyi rigs rtogs par byed pas na brten par bgyid pa lags so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pas rnam par grol ba mngon sum du byed pas na nyon mongs pa dang lta ba'i mun pa thams cad sel ba lags so // sdug bsngal la sogs pa rjes su shes pa'i bzod pas 'phags pa'i chos kyi rigs rtogs par byed pas na brten par bgyid pa lags so //
translated: By directly realizing the liberation of Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering, one eliminates all the darkness of affliction and view.🔽By the perseverance for subsequent knowledge of the truth of suffering, one realizes the lineage of ārya dharmas.

original: sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pas nges par 'dzin par byed pas na mchog tu bgyid pa lags so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pas nges par 'dzin par byed pas na mchog tu bgyid pa lags so //
translated: By subsequent knowledge of the truth of suffering, one ascertains the lineage of ārya dharmas.

original: kun 'byung ba la shes pa la sogs pa'i bzod pa la sogs skad cig ma bzhis snga ma bzhin du bya ba byed pas byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyis bde legs su bgyid pa lags so //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba la shes pa la sogs pa'i bzod pa la sogs skad cig ma bzhis snga ma bzhin du bya ba byed pas byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyis bde legs su bgyid pa lags so //
translated: The four moments of forbearance and knowledge of the truth of origination, and so on, function as before, and thus the factors of enlightenment bring about well-being.

original: snang bar bgyid pa lags so //
analyzed: snang bar bgyid pa lags so //
translated: They illuminate.

original: 'jigs pa dang nye bar 'tshe ba thams cad rab tu spang ba dang / snang bar bgyid pa lags so zhes bya ba'i tshig bzhi dang go @154b rims bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'jigs pa dang nye bar 'tshe ba thams cad rab tu spang ba dang / snang bar bgyid pa lags so zhes bya ba'i tshig bzhi dang go @154b rims bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The four phrases “they abandon all fear and harm” and so on should be applied in order.🔽They are the eye because they fully grasp the fleshly eye, the divine eye, the eye of wisdom, the eye of the buddhas, and the eye of Dharma.

original: sha dang lha dang shes rab dang sangs rgyas dang chos kyi spyan yongs su 'dzin pas na snga ba bzhin 'gog pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pas lam ston pa lags so //
analyzed: sha dang lha dang shes rab dang sangs rgyas dang chos kyi spyan yongs su 'dzin pas na snga ba bzhin 'gog pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pas lam ston pa lags so //
translated: The forbearance and knowledge of the dharma of cessation is the path.

original: 'gog pa la chos shes pas mig lags so //
analyzed: 'gog pa la chos shes pas mig lags so //
translated: The knowledge of the dharma of cessation is the eye.

original: rjes su shes pa'i bzod pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po dang bral bas 'phags pa'i chos kyi ris rtogs pa'i phyir gti mug gi mun pa dang rab rib rnams ma mchis par bgyid pa lags so //
analyzed: rjes su shes pa'i bzod pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po dang bral bas 'phags pa'i chos kyi ris rtogs pa'i phyir gti mug gi mun pa dang rab rib rnams ma mchis par bgyid pa lags so //
translated: The receptivity to the subsequent knowledge of the truth of suffering, by being free from the small, middling, and great degrees of the opposing factors, makes the darkness and blindness of delusion disappear, because it realizes the class of the noble dharmas.

original: 'gog pa la rjes su shes pas gdon mi za bar nges par 'dzin pa'i phyir rab ri ba dang bral bar bgyid pa lags so //
analyzed: 'gog pa la rjes su shes pas gdon mi za bar nges par 'dzin pa'i phyir rab ri ba dang bral bar bgyid pa lags so //
translated: The subsequent knowledge of the truth of suffering makes the darkness disappear, because it definitely apprehends the truth of suffering.

original: de bzhin du lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pas chos thams cad mi bgyid pa lags so //
analyzed: de bzhin du lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pas chos thams cad mi bgyid pa lags so //
translated: Similarly, the receptivity to the knowledge of the dharmas with regard to the truth of the path makes all dharmas unfabricated.

original: lam la chos shes pas lam du 'dzud pa lags so //
analyzed: lam la chos shes pas lam du 'dzud pa lags so //
translated: The knowledge of the dharmas with regard to the truth of the path makes one enter the path.

original: lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid lags so //
analyzed: lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid lags so //
translated: The receptivity to the subsequent knowledge of the truth of the path makes one omniscient.

original: lam la rjes su shes pas nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags dang mtshams sbyor ba thams cad mi bskyed pa lags so //
analyzed: lam la rjes su shes pas nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags dang mtshams sbyor ba thams cad mi bskyed pa lags so //
translated: The subsequent knowledge of the truth of the path makes one not produce any of the afflictive obstructions or the obstructions to omniscience, together with their habitual tendencies and connections.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i bsgom pa'i lam gyis dge ba'i chos rnams bskyed pas na mi 'gog pa lags so //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i bsgom pa'i lam gyis dge ba'i chos rnams bskyed pas na mi 'gog pa lags so //
translated: The path of cultivation of the contaminated is not stopped because it produces virtuous qualities.

original: sgyu ma lta bu yin pa'i phyir grags pa mngon par sgrub pa'i bsgom pa'i lam gyis rang bzhin gyis rtag tu gnas pas na ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa lags so //
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu yin pa'i phyir grags pa mngon par sgrub pa'i bsgom pa'i lam gyis rang bzhin gyis rtag tu gnas pas na ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa lags so //
translated: The path of cultivation of the accomplishment of fame is not produced and not stopped because it is always present by nature, being like an illusion.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i bsgom pa'i lam gyis phul du byung ba'i phan pa mdzad pa nyid yin pa dang rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir yul lags so //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i bsgom pa'i lam gyis phul du byung ba'i phan pa mdzad pa nyid yin pa dang rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir yul lags so //
translated: The path of cultivation of complete purity is the object because it is the most excellent benefit and is empty of its own mark.

original: de yang chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'i dbye bas stobs bcu bgyid pa dang / mi thul ba dang / mgon bgyid pa lags so zhes bya ba'i tshig gsum go rims bzhin du gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'i dbye bas stobs bcu bgyid pa dang / mi thul ba dang / mgon bgyid pa lags so zhes bya ba'i tshig gsum go rims bzhin du gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, the three words “powerful,” “unconquerable,” and “protector” are stated in order, respectively, because of the division into small, medium, and great.

original: ther zug ni tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: ther zug ni tshogs pa ste /
translated: “Firm” is the collection.

original: de la gnas pas na rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i dngos po de la de skad ces bya'o ;
analyzed: de la gnas pas na rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i dngos po de la de skad ces bya'o ;
translated: Because it abides in that, that thing which arises from causes and conditions is called that.

original: / de dag pas ther zug tu gnas pa ma mchis pa'i slad du ste /
analyzed: / de dag pas ther zug tu gnas pa ma mchis pa'i slad du ste /
translated: Because it is not permanent,

original: bar chad med pa'i lam nyid kyis sgrib pa thams cad spong ba yin pas 'khor ba'i gnyen po lags so //
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i lam nyid kyis sgrib pa thams cad spong ba yin pas 'khor ba'i gnyen po lags so //
translated: it is the antidote to saṃsāra, because the uninterrupted path itself abandons all obscurations.

original: rnam par grol ba'i lam gyis yon tan phun sum tshogs pa thams cad mngon par thob pa @155a * //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i lam gyis yon tan phun sum tshogs pa thams cad mngon par thob pa @155a * //
translated: Because the path of liberation manifestly attains all the abundant qualities,

original: yin pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid ston pa lags so //
analyzed: yin pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid ston pa lags so //
translated: it teaches the essence of all phenomena.

original: de ltar de kho na nyid yang dag par rtogs pa rnams phyis bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du theg pa gsum gyis chos ston pas chos kyi 'khor lo lan gsum du bzlas te rnam pa bcu gnyis su bskor ba yongs su rdzogs pa lags so zhes de
analyzed: de ltar de kho na nyid yang dag par rtogs pa rnams phyis bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du theg pa gsum gyis chos ston pas chos kyi 'khor lo lan gsum du bzlas te rnam pa bcu gnyis su bskor ba yongs su rdzogs pa lags so zhes de
translated: Thus, those who have perfectly realized suchness later turn the wheel of the Dharma three times and in twelve aspects, teaching the Dharma through the three vehicles in accordance with the aspirations of beings.

original: ltar 'di rnams kyi don ston par brjod par bya ba yin par sngon gyi slob dpon rnams 'chad do //
analyzed: ltar 'di rnams kyi don ston par brjod par bya ba yin par sngon gyi slob dpon rnams 'chad do //
translated: The former masters explain that the meaning of these words is to be stated.

original: de la chos kyi 'khor lo gang la lan gsum bzlas te rnam pa bcu gnyis su bskor ba yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de la chos kyi 'khor lo gang la lan gsum bzlas te rnam pa bcu gnyis su bskor ba yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The wheel of the Dharma is that in regard to which there are three revolutions and twelve aspects.

original: de la lan gsum du bzlas pa 'di yin te /🔽dge slong dag 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la lan gsum du bzlas pa 'di yin te / dge slong dag 'di lta ste /
translated: The three revolutions are:

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa'o //🔽de mngon par shes nas yongs su shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa'o // de mngon par shes nas yongs su shes par bya'o //
translated: “Monks, this is the noble truth of suffering.

original: yongs su shes so //
analyzed: yongs su shes so //
translated: Having directly known it, I have understood it.

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba 'phags pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba 'phags pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: This is the noble truth of the arising of suffering.

original: de mngon par shes nas spong bar bya'o //
analyzed: de mngon par shes nas spong bar bya'o //
translated: Having directly known it, I have abandoned it.

original: spangs so // 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog pa 'phags pa'i bden pa'o //🔽de mngon par shes nas mngon sum du bya'o //
analyzed: spangs so // 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog pa 'phags pa'i bden pa'o // de mngon par shes nas mngon sum du bya'o //
translated: This is the noble truth of the cessation of suffering.

original: mngon sum du byas so //
analyzed: mngon sum du byas so //
translated: Having directly known it, I have realized it.

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i phyir lam gyi 'phags pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i phyir lam gyi 'phags pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: This is the noble truth of the path that leads to the cessation of suffering.

original: de mngon par shes pa nas bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de mngon par shes pa nas bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should cultivate that insight.

original: ngas bsgoms so zhes pa sngon ma thos pa'i chos thams la tshul bzhin yid la byed pas mngon sum du byed pa'i don nyid kyis na zag pa med pa'i shes rab kyi mig skyes so //
analyzed: ngas bsgoms so zhes pa sngon ma thos pa'i chos thams la tshul bzhin yid la byed pas mngon sum du byed pa'i don nyid kyis na zag pa med pa'i shes rab kyi mig skyes so //
translated: The phrase I have cultivated it refers to the arising of the eye of uncontaminated wisdom, in the sense of directly realizing all the Dharma teachings that one has not previously heard, by properly attending to them in one's thoughts.

original: the tshom med pa nyid kyis na shes pa'o //
analyzed: the tshom med pa nyid kyis na shes pa'o //
translated: It is knowledge because it is free of doubt.

original: yang dag pa'i don nyid yin pa'i phyir rig pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don nyid yin pa'i phyir rig pa'o //
translated: It is awareness because it is the true meaning.

original: rnam par dag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir blo skyes pa'o zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di bden pa gsum po re re la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir blo skyes pa'o zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di bden pa gsum po re re la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: It is intelligence because it is pure. These phrases should be applied to each of the three truths.

original: de bas bden pa bzhi po re re zhing lan gsum bzlas pa yin pas lan gsum du bzlas pa'o //
analyzed: de bas bden pa bzhi po re re zhing lan gsum bzlas pa yin pas lan gsum du bzlas pa'o //
translated: Since each of the four noble truths is stated three times, it is stated three times.

original: mig ces bya ba la sogs pa rnams bzhi yang lan gsum du bzlas pas bden pa re re la gsum yin pa de bas na rnam pa bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: mig ces bya ba la sogs pa rnams bzhi yang lan gsum du bzlas pas bden pa re re la gsum yin pa de bas na rnam pa bcu gnyis so //
translated: Since the four phrases beginning with eye are also stated three times, each truth has three parts. Therefore, there are twelve aspects.

original: 'di dag tsam kho nas 'gro ba'i don rdzogs par byed pa yin pas lan gsum du bzlas te rnam pa gnyis su bskor ba'i chos nyid 'khor lo dang 'dra bar chos kyi 'khor lo ste /
analyzed: 'di dag tsam kho nas 'gro ba'i don rdzogs par byed pa yin pas lan gsum du bzlas te rnam pa gnyis su bskor ba'i chos nyid 'khor lo dang 'dra bar chos kyi 'khor lo ste /
translated: Since the welfare of beings is completed by these alone, the wheel of the Dharma is like a wheel that turns in two ways, in three revolutions.

original: @155b dang po b'a r'a na s'i ra gsungs pa'i mdo gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: @155b dang po b'a r'a na s'i ra gsungs pa'i mdo gang yin pa'o //
translated: The wheel of the Dharma is the sutra that was spoken in Varanasi.

original: ji ltar 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i 'khor lo rin po che ni sngon du 'gro la /
analyzed: ji ltar 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i 'khor lo rin po che ni sngon du 'gro la /
translated: The precious wheel of a universal monarch goes in front,

original: de nyid kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i dpung gi tshogs thams cad ni phyi nas 'brang ngo //
analyzed: de nyid kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i dpung gi tshogs thams cad ni phyi nas 'brang ngo //
translated: and all the troops that follow it go behind it.

original: de bzhin du khams gsum pa ma lus pa mtha' dag gi bdag po de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdo sde sngon du mdzad nas bstan pa'i chos thams cad rab tu 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du khams gsum pa ma lus pa mtha' dag gi bdag po de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdo sde sngon du mdzad nas bstan pa'i chos thams cad rab tu 'byung ba yin no //
translated: In the same way, the sutras of the Tathagata, the lord of the entire three realms, go in front, and all the teachings of the Dharma follow after them.

original: de bas na de ni rgyal ba'i yul gyi bdag pos bskor ba yin pas bcom ldan 'das yum la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na de ni rgyal ba'i yul gyi bdag pos bskor ba yin pas bcom ldan 'das yum la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the Bhagavati is called the wheel of the Dharma because it is turned by the lord of the realm of the Victor.

original: mchog nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: mchog nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: In order to teach the supremacy of the perfection of wisdom, he says, “Bhagavan, how should a Bodhisattva who wishes to fully understand this perfection of wisdom train in it?”

original: lan btab pa ni sh'a ri'i bus ton pa la ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: lan btab pa ni sh'a ri'i bus ton pa la ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Śāriputra’s reply is, “Just as the Tathāgata instructs.”

original: ston pa la byed pa dang 'dra bar nan tan la sogs pas sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ston pa la byed pa dang 'dra bar nan tan la sogs pas sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he practices with perseverance, etc., as if he were the Teacher himself.

original: gzhan du na sangs rgyas nyid yang dag par 'thob par mi 'gyur ro zhes mchog nyid bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du na sangs rgyas nyid yang dag par 'thob par mi 'gyur ro zhes mchog nyid bstan pa yin no //
translated: Otherwise, one would not attain true Buddhahood. Thus he teaches its supremacy.

original: ci'i phyir zhen zhes bya ba ni rgyu gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhen zhes bya ba ni rgyu gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Why? means “for what reason?”

original: de nyid ni de'i gzhi las zhes bya ba smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid ni de'i gzhi las zhes bya ba smos pa yin no //
translated: That itself is what is referred to by “on that basis.”

original: kho bo ni gzhi 'di las zhes bya ba ni bsod nams kyi phung po zil gyis gnon pa'i rgyu las so //
analyzed: kho bo ni gzhi 'di las zhes bya ba ni bsod nams kyi phung po zil gyis gnon pa'i rgyu las so //
translated: I am on that basis means “on the basis of the cause of surpassing the mass of merit.”

original: mngon par sgrub pa'i mchog nyid kyi skabs su yongs su bsngo ba'i yid la byed pas bsod nams kyi phung po zil gyis gnon pa'i rgyu yin par ci'i phyir 'dri zhe na /
analyzed: mngon par sgrub pa'i mchog nyid kyi skabs su yongs su bsngo ba'i yid la byed pas bsod nams kyi phung po zil gyis gnon pa'i rgyu yin par ci'i phyir 'dri zhe na /
translated: Why is it asked, “What is the cause of surpassing the mass of merit?” in the context of the supreme establishment?

original: brjod pa gang du /🔽zag pa dang bcas pa'i yongs su bsngo ba'i yid la byed pa la gang gi stobs kyis sbyin pa la sogs pa'i bsod nams kyi phung po tshad med pa zil gyis gnon par 'gyur ba de 'dra bar mchog nyid yod pa der zag pa med pa'i bsgom pa'i
analyzed: brjod pa gang du / zag pa dang bcas pa'i yongs su bsngo ba'i yid la byed pa la gang gi stobs kyis sbyin pa la sogs pa'i bsod nams kyi phung po tshad med pa zil gyis gnon par 'gyur ba de 'dra bar mchog nyid yod pa der zag pa med pa'i bsgom pa'i
translated: It is said:🔽“In the mental attention of the contaminated dedication, the power of which surpasses the immeasurable mass of merit of generosity, etc., there is such supreme establishment. In that, the uncontaminated path of cultivation is taught to be the supreme establishment.”

original: lam ni shin tu mchog nyid yod do zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir bsod nams kyi phung po yongs su bsngo bas zil gyis gnon par byed pa'i rgyu 'dri ba yin no //
analyzed: lam ni shin tu mchog nyid yod do zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir bsod nams kyi phung po yongs su bsngo bas zil gyis gnon par byed pa'i rgyu 'dri ba yin no //
translated: In order to demonstrate that, the cause of surpassing the mass of merit through dedication is asked.

original: phul du byung ba'i don nyid ni 'on kyang koo shi ka zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: phul du byung ba'i don nyid ni 'on kyang koo shi ka zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of “supreme” is stated in “Moreover, Kauśika,” etc.

original: sbyin pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sbyin pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Regarding “generosity,” etc.,

original: de la sbyin pa ni chos dang mi 'jigs pa dang zang zing gi dbye bas rnam pa gsum mo //🔽de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi ni mi dge ba las ldog pa dang dge ba la @156a * //
analyzed: de la sbyin pa ni chos dang mi 'jigs pa dang zang zing gi dbye bas rnam pa gsum mo // de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi ni mi dge ba las ldog pa dang dge ba la @156a * //
translated: Generosity is threefold, by way of the classification of Dharma, of freedom from fear, and of material things.

original: 'jug pa dang sems can gyi don byed pa'i dbye bas gsungs so //
analyzed: 'jug pa dang sems can gyi don byed pa'i dbye bas gsungs so //
translated: Similarly, morality is said to be threefold, by way of the classification of turning away from the nonvirtuous, of engaging in the virtuous, and of benefiting sentient beings.

original: bzod pa ni chos la nges par rtog pa dang sdug bsngal nyams su len pa dang gzhan gyis gnod pa byed pa la ji mi snyam pa'i dbye bas rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: bzod pa ni chos la nges par rtog pa dang sdug bsngal nyams su len pa dang gzhan gyis gnod pa byed pa la ji mi snyam pa'i dbye bas rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: Patience is threefold, by way of the classification of ascertaining the Dharma, of accepting suffering, and of not retaliating when others harm you.

original: brtson 'grus kyang go cha dang dge ba dang sems can gyi don la sbyor bas rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyang go cha dang dge ba dang sems can gyi don la sbyor bas rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: Exertion is threefold, by way of the classification of armor, of virtue, and of application to the welfare of sentient beings.

original: bsam gtan mngon par sgrub pa dang nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po dang bde bar gnas pa'i dbye bas rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: bsam gtan mngon par sgrub pa dang nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po dang bde bar gnas pa'i dbye bas rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: Meditative stabilization is threefold, by way of the classification of accomplishing meditative stabilization, of being the antidote to the afflictions, and of abiding in bliss.

original: kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa dang / sems can ma lus pa'i don la dmigs pa'i dbye bas shes rab kyi mig rnam pa gsum yod pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa dang / sems can ma lus pa'i don la dmigs pa'i dbye bas shes rab kyi mig rnam pa gsum yod pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: They are devoid of the three kinds of eyes of wisdom, which are distinguished in terms of conventional and ultimate reality and the aim of all sentient beings.

original: dmus long du gyur pa yin te zhes bya ba ni skye bzhin pa nyid na 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i shes rab kyi mig dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: dmus long du gyur pa yin te zhes bya ba ni skye bzhin pa nyid na 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i shes rab kyi mig dang bral ba'o //
translated: They are born blind, because they are devoid of the eye of wisdom that is completely purified of the three spheres.

original: yongs su 'dren pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni kha lo sgyur ba dang bral ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: yongs su 'dren pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni kha lo sgyur ba dang bral ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because they have no guide, because they are devoid of a charioteer.

original: / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam du 'jug pa'i zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam du 'jug pa'i zhes bya ba ni /
translated: They have no chance to enter the path to omniscience,

original: sangs rgyas nyid thob par byed pa'i lam rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa rnams su 'jug pa'i yin pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid thob par byed pa'i lam rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa rnams su 'jug pa'i yin pa'o //
translated: because they have no chance to enter the stages of joy and so on, the path that leads to buddhahood.

original: skal pa yang med na zhes bya ba ni skal ba med cing nus pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: skal pa yang med na zhes bya ba ni skal ba med cing nus pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: And if they have no chance, they have no ability.

original: lta ba yang ga la 'gyur zhes bya ba ni thob par ci'i phyir 'gyur te mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lta ba yang ga la 'gyur zhes bya ba ni thob par ci'i phyir 'gyur te mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: How could there be a view?

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming nyid bshad pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgra zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming nyid bshad pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgra zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The explanation of the very name of the perfections is the word “perfection.”

original: mig rab tu thob pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mig rab tu thob pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Obtains the eye”

original: sbyin ba la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams chos nyid kyi mig dang ldan par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: sbyin ba la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams chos nyid kyi mig dang ldan par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: means that the perfections of generosity and so on come to possess the eye of reality.

original: chos thams cad la mngon par 'du mi byed pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: chos thams cad la mngon par 'du mi byed pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: In order to teach the non-performance of all dharmas, the Lord said, “Śāriputra, the bodhisattva-mahāsattva should not stand in the perfection of giving…” and so on.

original: lan btab pa ni sh'a ri'i bu gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: lan btab pa ni sh'a ri'i bu gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The reply is stated in “Śāriputra, form is like an illusion…” and so on.

original: gzugs la sogs pa sgyu ma lta bu nyid du rtogs pa ni yum mngon par bsgrub pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa sgyu ma lta bu nyid du rtogs pa ni yum mngon par bsgrub pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The realization that form and so on are like an illusion is the accomplishment of the Mother, that is the meaning.

original: nye bar bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir de ltar mngon par 'du byed pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: nye bar bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir de ltar mngon par 'du byed pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to summarize, it is said, “thus, by way of non-performance…”

original: de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir chos @156b thams cad kyi khyad par skye ba med par rtogs pa'i sbyor ba ni mngon par 'du byed pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir chos @156b thams cad kyi khyad par skye ba med par rtogs pa'i sbyor ba ni mngon par 'du byed pa ste /
translated: The application of realizing the non-production of the distinction of all phenomena because of the nature of suchness is non-performance.

original: des phung po rnams rtogs na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des phung po rnams rtogs na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: By that, it is the meaning of “realizing the aggregates.”

original: glegs bam la la las ni mngon par mi sgrub pas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: glegs bam la la las ni mngon par mi sgrub pas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In some texts, it says, “by way of non-performance.”

original: der yang don 'di nyid yin par bzung ngo //
analyzed: der yang don 'di nyid yin par bzung ngo //
translated: There, too, it is to be understood as having this very meaning.

original: chos thams cad mi dmigs par gtod par byed pa'i don du gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: chos thams cad mi dmigs par gtod par byed pa'i don du gsungs pa ni /
translated: The meaning of “directing all phenomena to non-apprehension” is stated:

original: sh'a ri'i bu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de ltar mngon par bsgrubs pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de ltar mngon par bsgrubs pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Śāriputra, by thus accomplishing the perfection of wisdom…” and so on.

original: chos gang yang gtod par byed pa med do zhes bya ba ni ci ltar dmigs pa la sogs pa phyin ci log pa yin pa de ltar na rnal 'byor pa'i rgyud la gtogs pa'i chos gang yang skyed par mi byed pa de'i tshe shes rab kyi pha rol🔽tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro ste phyin ci log pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: chos gang yang gtod par byed pa med do zhes bya ba ni ci ltar dmigs pa la sogs pa phyin ci log pa yin pa de ltar na rnal 'byor pa'i rgyud la gtogs pa'i chos gang yang skyed par mi byed pa de'i tshe shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro ste phyin ci log pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: When a yogi does not generate any dharma belonging to his continuum, in that way that it is an error with respect to objective supports and so forth, then it is called the perfection of wisdom, because it is an error, is the thought.🔽It is reasonable that it causes the attainment of omniscience, otherwise the perfection of wisdom would be pointless.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed pa ni rigs te gzhan du na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa don med pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bsam pa dang ldan pas bcom ldan 'das ci zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol to //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed pa ni rigs te gzhan du na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa don med pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bsam pa dang ldan pas bcom ldan 'das ci zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol to //
translated: With that thought, he asks the Bhagavan, “What is the perfection of wisdom?”

original: phyin ci log gi sgo nas gtod par mi byed do zhes gsungs pa ni dmigs pa ji lta ba de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log gi sgo nas gtod par mi byed do zhes gsungs pa ni dmigs pa ji lta ba de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: He says that it does not bestow through error, “It is just as it is objective supports and so forth.”

original: de la dmigs pa ni phyi'i don du dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa ni phyi'i don du dmigs pa'o //
translated: There, objective supports are objective supports for external objects.

original: ming ni gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po bzhi'o //
analyzed: ming ni gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po bzhi'o //
translated: Name is the four non-material aggregates.

original: mngon par 'du byed pa ni sgyu ma lta bu nyid 'di ni de kho na nyid yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sems kyi rtsol ba'o //🔽rnam pa gzhan rnam par bcad pas gzhan du gtod par byed pa yin no zhes smras pa ni bcom ldan 'das 'o na ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa ni sgyu ma lta bu nyid 'di ni de kho na nyid yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sems kyi rtsol ba'o // rnam pa gzhan rnam par bcad pas gzhan du gtod par byed pa yin no zhes smras pa ni bcom ldan 'das 'o na ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Formation is the mental effort of the thought, “This is the suchness of illusion-likeness,” etc.🔽The statement, “It is the directing of the mind to another object by way of the exclusion of other aspects,” is referred to by the Lord in the passage beginning with “Kausika, how is it that you direct your mind to all-knowledge?”

original: koo shi ka ji ltar gtod par mi byed do zhes bya ba ni sgyu ma lta bu'i rnam pa gang gis phyin ci log tu mngon par zhen pa ci yang gtod par mi byed pa de ltar thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gtod par byed do zhes bya ba'i
analyzed: koo shi ka ji ltar gtod par mi byed do zhes bya ba ni sgyu ma lta bu'i rnam pa gang gis phyin ci log tu mngon par zhen pa ci yang gtod par mi byed pa de ltar thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gtod par byed do zhes bya ba'i
translated: The passage, “Kausika, it is not directed,” means that it is not directed in any way by the aspect of illusion-like falsity.

original: tha tshig go / chos gang yang mi skyed ces bya ba ni rnam par byang ba rnams so //
analyzed: tha tshig go / chos gang yang mi skyed ces bya ba ni rnam par byang ba rnams so //
translated: The passage, “It is not produced,” refers to the purification.

original: chos gang yang mi 'gog ces bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: chos gang yang mi 'gog ces bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: The passage, “It is not stopped,” refers to the defilement.

original: nye bar gnas la zhes bya ba ni skye ba ma mchis pa'i slad du'o //
analyzed: nye bar gnas la zhes bya ba ni skye ba ma mchis pa'i slad du'o //
translated: Abides means that it does not arise.🔽Does not abide means that it does not cease.

original: gnas pa yang ma lags zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa ma @157a * //
analyzed: gnas pa yang ma lags zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa ma @157a * //
translated: Thus, the Lord has said that clinging is bondage.🔽 The four phrases makes distant, makes accumulated, makes purified, and makes attained are to be applied respectively to the paths of application, seeing, cultivation, and beyond training.

original: mchis pa'i slad du'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: mchis pa'i slad du'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The Lord has said that clinging is bondage.🔽 The four phrases makes distant, makes accumulated, makes purified, and makes attained are to be applied respectively to the paths of application, seeing, cultivation, and beyond training.🔽The Lord has said that clinging is bondage.🔽 The four phrases makes distant, makes accumulated, makes purified, and makes attained are to be applied respectively to the paths of application, seeing, cultivation, and beyond training.

original: de ltar mngon par zhen pa yang 'ching ba yin no zhes smras pa ni bcom ldan 'das gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ltar mngon par zhen pa yang 'ching ba yin no zhes smras pa ni bcom ldan 'das gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The Lord has said that clinging is bondage.

original: sbyor ba dang / mthong ba dang / sgom pa dang / khyad par gyi lam rnams su go rims bzhin du ring du bgyid /🔽gsog tu bgyid do zhes bya ba'i tshig bzhi sbyar ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba dang / mthong ba dang / sgom pa dang / khyad par gyi lam rnams su go rims bzhin du ring du bgyid / gsog tu bgyid do zhes bya ba'i tshig bzhi sbyar ro //
translated: The four phrases makes distant, makes accumulated, makes purified, and makes attained are to be applied respectively to the paths of application, seeing, cultivation, and beyond training.🔽The Lord has said that clinging is bondage.🔽 The four phrases makes distant, makes accumulated, makes purified, and makes attained are to be applied respectively to the paths of application, seeing, cultivation, and beyond training.🔽The Lord has said that clinging is bondage.

original: rnam pa gzhan gyis kyang ring du byed pa la sogs pa gsungs pa ni rab 'byor rnam grangs gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan gyis kyang ring du byed pa la sogs pa gsungs pa ni rab 'byor rnam grangs gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The four phrases makes distant, makes accumulated, makes purified, and makes attained are to be applied respectively to the paths of application, seeing, cultivation, and beyond training.🔽The Lord has said that clinging is bondage.🔽 The four phrases makes distant, makes accumulated, makes purified, and makes attained are to be applied respectively to the paths of application, seeing, cultivation, and beyond training.

original: gzugs la sogs pa mngon par rtogs pa'i rnam grangs des ni 'gyur ba kho na'o zhes bya ba'i tshig go //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa mngon par rtogs pa'i rnam grangs des ni 'gyur ba kho na'o zhes bya ba'i tshig go //
translated: The Lord has said that clinging is bondage.🔽 The four phrases makes distant, makes accumulated, makes purified, and makes attained are to be applied respectively to the paths of application, seeing, cultivation, and beyond training.

original: chos nyid kyi gzugs la sogs pa nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa rtogs pas yum ring du byed pa la sogs pa yin snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhen zhes bya bas
analyzed: chos nyid kyi gzugs la sogs pa nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa rtogs pas yum ring du byed pa la sogs pa yin snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhen zhes bya bas
translated: In this way, how is it that by realizing form and so on one distances oneself from the Mother?

original: bsu nas / rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yongs su gsal bar byas nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //🔽'di skad du gang gi phyir sgyu ma lta bu nyid kyis gzugs la sogs pa nyid rgyal ba'i yum yin no zhes rang bzhin gcig pa nyid du rigs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yongs su gsal bar byas nas gzugs la sogs pa tha
analyzed: bsu nas / rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yongs su gsal bar byas nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so // 'di skad du gang gi phyir sgyu ma lta bu nyid kyis gzugs la sogs pa nyid rgyal ba'i yum yin no zhes rang bzhin gcig pa nyid du rigs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yongs su gsal bar byas nas gzugs la sogs pa tha
translated: In response, Subhūti, this perfection of wisdom, having been fully revealed, and so on is stated.🔽This is saying, because form and so on are the Mother of the Victor by way of being illusionlike, it is understood by reasoning that they are of one nature.🔽This perfection of wisdom, having been fully revealed, form and so on are not realized to be different.

original: dad par rtogs pa phyin ci log yin pa de bas na gzugs la sogs pa rtogs pas yum ring du byed pa la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: dad par rtogs pa phyin ci log yin pa de bas na gzugs la sogs pa rtogs pas yum ring du byed pa la sogs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, by realizing form and so on one distances oneself from the Mother.

original: don chen po nyid ni bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: don chen po nyid ni bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: “Bhagavan, it is thus:

original: don chen po sangs rgyas nyid sgrub pas na pha rol tu phyin pa chen po lags so //
analyzed: don chen po sangs rgyas nyid sgrub pas na pha rol tu phyin pa chen po lags so //
translated: The great perfections are great because they accomplish the great meaning, Buddhahood.

original: de la chen por mi bgyid ces bya ba ni lhag pa skyed par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la chen por mi bgyid ces bya ba ni lhag pa skyed par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “One does not make them great” means one does not increase them.

original: chung ngur mi bgyid ces bya ba ni gnas rnams 'grib par mi byed pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: chung ngur mi bgyid ces bya ba ni gnas rnams 'grib par mi byed pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: “One does not make them small” means one does not diminish them.

original: / de nyid ci rigs par bshad pa ni sdud par mi byed g-yeng bar mi bgyid ces bya ba yin te /
analyzed: / de nyid ci rigs par bshad pa ni sdud par mi byed g-yeng bar mi bgyid ces bya ba yin te /
translated: “One does not contract them” and “one does not expand them” means one does not add to them.

original: grags pa tsam gang yin pa ni don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pas /🔽de'i don du rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi 'bras bu can gyi bstan pa yin no zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: grags pa tsam gang yin pa ni don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pas / de'i don du rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi 'bras bu can gyi bstan pa yin no zhes dgongs so //
translated: “One does not make them famous” means one does not make them well known.🔽“One does not make them obscure” means one does not make them unknown.

original: stobs dang ldan @157b par mi bgyid ces bya ba ni sngon med cing sgro 'dogs pa'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: stobs dang ldan @157b par mi bgyid ces bya ba ni sngon med cing sgro 'dogs pa'i tshul gyis so //
translated: “One does not make them powerful” means one does not make them powerful in the manner of non-existent superimposition.

original: stobs ma mchis par yang mi bgyid do zhes bya ba ni yod bzhin pa la skur pa mi 'debs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stobs ma mchis par yang mi bgyid do zhes bya ba ni yod bzhin pa la skur pa mi 'debs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He does not make it weak, because he does not deprecate what exists.

original: so so'i skye bo'i skabs su ni phyin ci log gi stobs kyis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid chung ngur 'gyur la /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i skabs su ni phyin ci log gi stobs kyis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid chung ngur 'gyur la /
translated: In the context of the stage of ordinary beings, omniscience is small due to the power of error.🔽In the context of liberation, it is great due to the power of the Mother, being free from error.

original: grol ba'i skabs su ni yum gyi mthus phyin ci log dang bral bas chen por 'gyur ba yin nam des ji ste 'di skad brjod snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
analyzed: grol ba'i skabs su ni yum gyi mthus phyin ci log dang bral bas chen por 'gyur ba yin nam des ji ste 'di skad brjod snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
translated: Why is that?

original: bcom ldan 'das thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol to //
translated: The Blessed One, omniscience...

original: 'di skad du gang gi phyir phyin ci log dang bral na yum gyi mthu gnas pa nyid kyis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni ma bsdus pa ma g-yengs pa de bas na chen por mi byed chung ngur mi byed do zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad du gang gi phyir phyin ci log dang bral na yum gyi mthu gnas pa nyid kyis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni ma bsdus pa ma g-yengs pa de bas na chen por mi byed chung ngur mi byed do zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: This is what is being said: Because it is free from error, omniscience is not made great or small by the power of the Mother, because it is not contracted or distracted.

original: de la yang mngon par zhen pa 'ching ba yin no zhes smras pa ni gal te de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la yang mngon par zhen pa 'ching ba yin no zhes smras pa ni gal te de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: To this, the statement attachment to that is bondage is the passage beginning If, Subhūti, one were to apprehend....

original: de ltar 'tshal na yang zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa ltar dmigs par rtog na'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'tshal na yang zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa ltar dmigs par rtog na'o //
translated: Even if one understands in that way means even if one conceives of an object as just explained.

original: smos kyang ci 'tshal zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin ste /
analyzed: smos kyang ci 'tshal zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin ste /
translated: What need is there to mention... means the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'on kyang dmigs pa chen por 'gyur ba nyid kyis ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'on kyang dmigs pa chen por 'gyur ba nyid kyis ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: However, it is not because of being a great object.

original: gang gis de yod pas spyod par mi 'gyur ba dmigs pa la nyes pa ci zhig yod snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
analyzed: gang gis de yod pas spyod par mi 'gyur ba dmigs pa la nyes pa ci zhig yod snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
translated: What is the fault of an object if one does not engage in practice because of that? The passage beginning Why is it so? anticipates this doubt.

original: sems can 'di dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: sems can 'di dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The passage beginning These sentient beings....

original: 'di skad du gang gi phyir sems can mya ngan las bzla'o snyam par dmigs pa 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dra bar byung bas na rgyu mthun pa ste /
analyzed: 'di skad du gang gi phyir sems can mya ngan las bzla'o snyam par dmigs pa 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dra bar byung bas na rgyu mthun pa ste /
translated: This is what is being said: Because this reference, 'I will liberate sentient beings from suffering,' is similar to the perfection of wisdom, it is a natural outcome.

original: de dang rjes su 'brel pa'i 'bras bur gyur pa ma yin pa de bas na dmigs pa yod pas de la spyod pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de dang rjes su 'brel pa'i 'bras bur gyur pa ma yin pa de bas na dmigs pa yod pas de la spyod pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: It is not a result that is related to that. Therefore, it is said that 'one does not practice it because of a reference.'

original: yang 'di ji ltar yin snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: yang 'di ji ltar yin snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Again, the question is asked, How is this? with the words Why is that?🔽The response is The perfection of wisdom is the nature of the non-existence of sentient beings.

original: sems can rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa nyid kyi rang bzhin te gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa nyid kyi rang bzhin te gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which has it is called that.

original: 'di snyam du sems can ma skyes pa'i rang bzhin can yum gyi rgyu mthun @158a * //
analyzed: 'di snyam du sems can ma skyes pa'i rang bzhin can yum gyi rgyu mthun @158a * //
translated: This is the thought: The nature of sentient beings is unborn. The perfection of wisdom is the nature of the non-existence of sentient beings.

original: pa'i 'bras bu sems can du dmigs pa yin pa ji ltar 'gyur zhes bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: pa'i 'bras bu sems can du dmigs pa yin pa ji ltar 'gyur zhes bsams pa yin no //
translated: How could the result of the practice be the observation of sentient beings?

original: sems can skye ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i don 'di nyid sems can ngo bo nyid ma mchis pas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: sems can skye ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i don 'di nyid sems can ngo bo nyid ma mchis pas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The meaning of the non-arisen nature of sentient beings is stated in the line “Since sentient beings are devoid of intrinsic reality,” and so on.

original: de la ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa dang dben pa dang bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni go rims bzhin du brtags pa la sogs pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de la ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa dang dben pa dang bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni go rims bzhin du brtags pa la sogs pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: There, the absence of intrinsic reality, voidness, and inconceivability should be understood as the imagined and so on, respectively.

original: sems can mi 'jig pa'i chos nyid ni rtag pa kho nar gnas pa'i de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: sems can mi 'jig pa'i chos nyid ni rtag pa kho nar gnas pa'i de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The reality of the indestructibility of sentient beings is the suchness that always abides.

original: sems can sgyu ma dang 'dra ba nyid du mthong ba'i lam gyis ma rtogs pa ni sems can mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi brgya ba nyid do //
analyzed: sems can sgyu ma dang 'dra ba nyid du mthong ba'i lam gyis ma rtogs pa ni sems can mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi brgya ba nyid do //
translated: The non-realization of the path that sees sentient beings as like an illusion is the non-complete realization of sentient beings.

original: sems can snga ma bzhin du bsgom pa'i lam gyis ma rtogs pa ni sems can don ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ba nyid do //
analyzed: sems can snga ma bzhin du bsgom pa'i lam gyis ma rtogs pa ni sems can don ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ba nyid do //
translated: The non-realization of sentient beings, as before, by the path of meditation, is just the non-manifestation of perfect enlightenment for the sake of sentient beings.

original: sems can gyi stobs tshad mas mi gnod pa sgyu ma lta bu nyid du nus pa yod pa de thob pa ni yang dag par sgrub pa nyid do //
analyzed: sems can gyi stobs tshad mas mi gnod pa sgyu ma lta bu nyid du nus pa yod pa de thob pa ni yang dag par sgrub pa nyid do //
translated: The attainment of the power of sentient beings, which is not harmed by valid cognition, is just the attainment of the power of illusion. That is the perfect accomplishment.

original: des de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par bsgrub par rig par bgyi'o //
analyzed: des de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par bsgrub par rig par bgyi'o //
translated: By that, the power of the Tathāgata should be known as the perfect accomplishment of the perfection of wisdom.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i ngo bo nyid la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kho na mngon par bsgrub pa'i bsgom pa'i lam yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i ngo bo nyid la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kho na mngon par bsgrub pa'i bsgom pa'i lam yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: The path of meditation that accomplishes just the characteristics of the nature and so forth as explained should be known.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And it is said:

original: de yi ngo bo nyid mchog nyid //
analyzed: de yi ngo bo nyid mchog nyid //
translated: The supreme nature of that

original: kun la mngon par 'du mi byed //
analyzed: kun la mngon par 'du mi byed //
translated: is the non-performance of all.

original: chos rnams dmigs su med par ni //
analyzed: chos rnams dmigs su med par ni //
translated: The non-apprehension of phenomena

original: gtod bar byed pa don chen nyid //🔽ces gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gtod bar byed pa don chen nyid //🔽ces gsungs pa yin no //
translated: is the great purpose.

original: de'i 'og tu gnyis pa shin tu rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid bsgom par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu gnyis pa shin tu rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid bsgom par bya ba yin la /
translated: After that, one should cultivate the characteristic of the very pure.

original: de ni skye ba dang mi skye ba'i rgyu go rims bzhin du yongs su gzung ba dang dor bas yin no //
analyzed: de ni skye ba dang mi skye ba'i rgyu go rims bzhin du yongs su gzung ba dang dor bas yin no //
translated: That is by taking up and rejecting the causes of arising and non-arising, respectively.

original: de bas na re zhig skyed pa'i rgyu bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na re zhig skyed pa'i rgyu bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to show the cause of arising,

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: the Bhagavān says, “Bhikṣus, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who…” and so on.

original: nem nur mi bgyid ces bya ba ni lam gzhan mi 'dod pas so //
analyzed: nem nur mi bgyid ces bya ba ni lam gzhan mi 'dod pas so //
translated: “Does not doubt” means not desiring another path.

original: the tshom mi 'tshal zhes bya ba ni yid gnyis med pas so //
analyzed: the tshom mi 'tshal zhes bya ba ni yid gnyis med pas so //
translated: “Does not wonder” means being without two minds.

original: rmongs par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni mi shes pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //🔽rjes su 'gro bar bgyid pa ni chos kyis so //
analyzed: rmongs par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni mi shes pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro // rjes su 'gro bar bgyid pa ni chos kyis so //
translated: “Does not become confused” means being free from ignorance.🔽“Follows” means by the Dharma.

original: rjes su 'tshal bar bgyid pa ni don gyis so //
analyzed: rjes su 'tshal bar bgyid pa ni don gyis so //
translated: “Understands” means by the meaning.

original: de dag gi tshul @158b nas ni gnyis ltar gzhan la rjes su rtogs par bgyid pa zhes go rims bzhin du de ltar don gyi dbye bas brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gi tshul @158b nas ni gnyis ltar gzhan la rjes su rtogs par bgyid pa zhes go rims bzhin du de ltar don gyi dbye bas brjod par bya'o //
translated: The method of these should be understood as causing others to understand in two ways, according to the order, by the division of the meaning.

original: yun ring po ji srid cig spyad cing bsrungs par rig par bgyi zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yun ring po ji srid cig spyad cing bsrungs par rig par bgyi zhes bya ba la /
translated: For how long a time should one know that one has practiced and guarded?

original: yun ring po ji srid cig ni dus ring po'o //
analyzed: yun ring po ji srid cig ni dus ring po'o //
translated: For how long a time means for a long time.

original: spyad pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa nyams su blangs pa ste /
analyzed: spyad pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa nyams su blangs pa ste /
translated: Practice means the performance of giving and so on.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i byang chub tu ma bsngos par bsrungs shing bskyangs pa'i ngang tshul 'di la yod pas de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i byang chub tu ma bsngos par bsrungs shing bskyangs pa'i ngang tshul 'di la yod pas de skad ces bya'o //
translated: This is called having the nature of guarding and protecting without dedicating to the enlightenment of the Sravakas and so on.

original: bsnyen bkur byas shing zhes bya ba ni 'khor la sogs pa yongs su phul bas so //
analyzed: bsnyen bkur byas shing zhes bya ba ni 'khor la sogs pa yongs su phul bas so //
translated: Having served means having offered retinue and so on.

original: yongs su dris nas zhes bya ba ni the tshom skyes pa'i don yongs su zhus pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su dris nas zhes bya ba ni the tshom skyes pa'i don yongs su zhus pa ste /
translated: Having asked means having asked about the meaning of doubts.

original: de dag gis ni sangs rgyas la bsten pa ston to //
analyzed: de dag gis ni sangs rgyas la bsten pa ston to //
translated: These show the reliance on the Buddha.

original: gang gis ni mos pa'i stobs las bsnyen bkur byas pa la sogs pa rtogs par byed pa mos pa dang bsnyen bkur byed pa la sogs pa la 'brel pa ci yod snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
analyzed: gang gis ni mos pa'i stobs las bsnyen bkur byas pa la sogs pa rtogs par byed pa mos pa dang bsnyen bkur byed pa la sogs pa la 'brel pa ci yod snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
translated: By what? is the question, How is it that the power of faith is understood through such things as service?

original: sh'a ri'i bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The question is answered by Śāriputra, and so forth.

original: 'di skad du khyad par can gyi rgyu med par de lta bu'i mos pa la sogs pa 'byung ba mi srid pas de bzhin gshegs pa la bsnyen bkur byas pa la sogs pa'i rgyu rjes su dpog pa yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad du khyad par can gyi rgyu med par de lta bu'i mos pa la sogs pa 'byung ba mi srid pas de bzhin gshegs pa la bsnyen bkur byas pa la sogs pa'i rgyu rjes su dpog pa yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: This is what is being said: Since it is impossible for such faith, and so forth, to arise without a special cause, the cause of such things as service to the Tathāgata is inferred.

original: rna ba blags te zhes bya ba ni ma yengs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rna ba blags te zhes bya ba ni ma yengs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: To give ear means to be undistracted.

original: gus par nyan to zhes bya ba la ni dkyil 'khor la sogs pa byas nas nyan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gus par nyan to zhes bya ba la ni dkyil 'khor la sogs pa byas nas nyan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: To listen respectfully means to listen after performing the mandala offering, and so forth.

original: gtam gyi bar chad mi byed do zhes bya ba ni skabs la ma bab pa'i don mi smra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtam gyi bar chad mi byed do zhes bya ba ni skabs la ma bab pa'i don mi smra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: To not interrupt the conversation means not to speak a topic that is out of turn.

original: yun ring por spyad pa zhes pa gsungs pas ni sbyin ba la sogs par bshad do //
analyzed: yun ring por spyad pa zhes pa gsungs pas ni sbyin ba la sogs par bshad do //
translated: The phrase for a long time explains the perfections of generosity and so on.

original: sangs rgyas mang po la bsnyen bkur byas pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas mang po bsten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mang po la bsnyen bkur byas pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas mang po bsten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase having served many buddhas means having attended many buddhas.

original: mnyan pa rgyu dang bcas pa la sogs pa la mngon par ma zhen pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di mnyan pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: mnyan pa rgyu dang bcas pa la sogs pa la mngon par ma zhen pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di mnyan pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach the non-attachment to listening and so on along with their causes, the Bhagavān said having listened to this perfection of wisdom, and so on.

original: rtogs pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig bzhi ni de 'di'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig bzhi dang go rims bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //🔽de la rnam pa dang rtags dang mtshan ma dag ni rang dang @159a * //
analyzed: rtogs pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig bzhi ni de 'di'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig bzhi dang go rims bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o // de la rnam pa dang rtags dang mtshan ma dag ni rang dang @159a * //
translated: The four phrases beginning with realizing should be connected in order with the four phrases beginning with this is.

original: spyi dag dang gnyi ga'i tshul du go rims bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: spyi dag dang gnyi ga'i tshul du go rims bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: Therein, the aspects, signs, and marks should be known in order as the modes of the individual, the general, and both.

original: rgyu'i stobs kyis mnyan pa yang kun rdzob tu yin gyi de kho na nyid du ni ma yin no zhes gsungs pa ni rab 'byor de lta ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i stobs kyis mnyan pa yang kun rdzob tu yin gyi de kho na nyid du ni ma yin no zhes gsungs pa ni rab 'byor de lta ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The power of the cause is also listening, but that is conventionally, not in reality. Subhuti, it is not so, he said.

original: de nyid ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: That is what is said in This perfection of wisdom, etc.

original: phung po la sogs pa rtogs bzhin pas kyang mnyan pa la sogs pa ji ltar mi nus snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa rtogs bzhin pas kyang mnyan pa la sogs pa ji ltar mi nus snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
translated: If one understands the aggregates, etc., how can one not be able to listen, etc.? The doubt is resolved by Why is that?

original: rab 'byor chos thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: rab 'byor chos thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Subhuti, all dharmas, etc. is said.

original: de la da ltar byung ba'i phung po la sogs pa rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir chos thams cad dben pa nyid don //
analyzed: de la da ltar byung ba'i phung po la sogs pa rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir chos thams cad dben pa nyid don //
translated: There, the present aggregates, etc., are all dharmas, because of the emptiness of their own marks.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtha' gnyis dang bral ba'i phyir chos thams cad shin tu dben pa nyid do //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtha' gnyis dang bral ba'i phyir chos thams cad shin tu dben pa nyid do //
translated: All dharmas are extremely isolated, because of being free from the two extremes of cause and effect.

original: de bas dus gsum stong pa nyid yin pas phung po la sogs pa rnams su de kho na nyid du bstan par mi nus so zhes bya ba ni ngag gi don yin no //
analyzed: de bas dus gsum stong pa nyid yin pas phung po la sogs pa rnams su de kho na nyid du bstan par mi nus so zhes bya ba ni ngag gi don yin no //
translated: If one were to teach them as not different from that, then the Lord would not have said, “The perfection of wisdom is the genetrix and the nurse of the Bodhisattvas, the great beings.”🔽If one were to teach them as both different and not different from that, then the Lord would not have said, “The perfection of wisdom is the genetrix and the nurse of the Bodhisattvas, the great beings.”🔽If one were to teach them as neither different nor not different from that, then the Lord would not have said, “The perfection of wisdom is the genetrix and the nurse of the Bodhisattvas, the great beings.”🔽If one were to teach them as having a nature, then the Lord would not have said, “The perfection of wisdom is the genetrix and the nurse of the Bodhisattvas, the great beings.”🔽If one were to teach them as having no nature, then the Lord would not have said, “The perfection of wisdom is the genetrix and the nurse of the Bodhisattvas, the great beings.”

original: de ltar de las tha dad par bstan pa bya bar yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar de las tha dad par bstan pa bya bar yin no zhe na /
