translated: If one were to teach them as having a nature and also as having no nature, then the Lord would not have said, “The perfection of wisdom is the genetrix and the nurse of the Bodhisattvas, the great beings.”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //🔽rnam pa gzhan ma bkag na ni ji ste 'di ltar 'gyur snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhen zhes bya bas bsu nas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so // rnam pa gzhan ma bkag na ni ji ste 'di ltar 'gyur snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhen zhes bya bas bsu nas /
translated: If one were to teach them as neither having a nature nor having no nature, then the Lord would not have said, “The perfection of wisdom is the genetrix and the nurse of the Bodhisattvas, the great beings.”

original: rab 'byor phung po dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //🔽skye ba'i rgyu dang bral bas na stong pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor phung po dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so // skye ba'i rgyu dang bral bas na stong pa'o //
translated: If one were to teach them as having an own-being, then the Lord would not have said, “The perfection of wisdom is the genetrix and the nurse of the Bodhisattvas, the great beings.”🔽If one were to teach them as having no own-being, then the Lord would not have said, “The perfection of wisdom is the genetrix and the nurse of the Bodhisattvas, the great beings.”

original: rang gi ngo bo nges par gzung du med pas na dben pa'o //🔽'bras bu'i nus pa dang bral bas na zhi ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nges par gzung du med pas na dben pa'o //🔽'bras bu'i nus pa dang bral bas na zhi ba'o //
translated: If one were to teach them as having an own-being and also

original: 'di skad du chos thams cad sdud par byed pa phung po la sogs pa ni de kho na nyid du ngo bo nyid med pa yin na de las tha dad par bstan par mi nus so zhes bya ba brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad du chos thams cad sdud par byed pa phung po la sogs pa ni de kho na nyid du ngo bo nyid med pa yin na de las tha dad par bstan par mi nus so zhes bya ba brjod pa yin no //
translated: This is what is being said: “If the aggregates and so on, which subsume all phenomena, are ultimately devoid of intrinsic reality, then it is impossible to teach them as being different from that.”

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nye bar sdud pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nye bar sdud pa yin no //
translated: “Thus” and so on concludes.

original: 'du shes pa dang kun shes pa dag ni go rims bzhin du rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'du shes pa dang kun shes pa dag ni go rims bzhin du rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The perception and understanding of the individual and general characteristics, respectively.

original: btags pa ni de'i brda nye bar 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: btags pa ni de'i brda nye bar 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The designation is the apprehension of the signifier of that.

original: tha snyad ni btags pa sngon du 'gro bas phan pa dang gnod pa thob pa spang ba'o //
analyzed: tha snyad ni btags pa sngon du 'gro bas phan pa dang gnod pa thob pa spang ba'o //
translated: The convention is the avoidance of obtaining benefit and harm through the prior designation.🔽Since there is a gradation of faculties, this should be analyzed and explained.

original: dbang po'i rim pa yod pas 'di rnam par phye ste lung bstan par bya ba yin zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor gyi don du @159b gang gis thabs mkhas pa chung ngu la sogs pa'i rim pa'i dbye bas bsgoms pas
analyzed: dbang po'i rim pa yod pas 'di rnam par phye ste lung bstan par bya ba yin zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor gyi don du @159b gang gis thabs mkhas pa chung ngu la sogs pa'i rim pa'i dbye bas bsgoms pas
translated: This is for the purpose of the perfection of wisdom yoga. By the gradation of lesser and so on of skillful means, one meditates on the three natures.

original: de rnal 'byor thob par 'gyur bas 'di ni phye ste brjod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de rnal 'byor thob par 'gyur bas 'di ni phye ste brjod par bya ba yin no //
translated: Since he will attain yoga, this should be explained.

original: 'dis ni thabs la mkhas pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni thabs la mkhas pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This teaches skill in means.

original: ji skad du brjod pa'i rten pa la sogs pa gsum ni skyed pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: ji skad du brjod pa'i rten pa la sogs pa gsum ni skyed pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The three, faith in the teaching, etc., are the generating cause.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And thus it is said:

original: sangs rgyas bstan dang sbyin sogs dang // thabs la mkhas pa gang yin pa //🔽'di la mos pa'i rgyu dag yin //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bstan dang sbyin sogs dang // thabs la mkhas pa gang yin pa // 'di la mos pa'i rgyu dag yin //
translated: The Buddha's teaching, generosity, etc., and skill in means,

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: are the causes of faith in this.

original: mi skye ba'i rgyu bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mi skye ba'i rgyu bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the cause of non-arising,

original: rab 'byor yang rnam grangs gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsung so //
analyzed: rab 'byor yang rnam grangs gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsung so //
translated: it is said, Subhuti, by what method?

original: mi mos pa'i rgyu ci zhig yin snyam pa'i dgos pa de ci'i phyir zhen zhes bya bas bsu nas /
analyzed: mi mos pa'i rgyu ci zhig yin snyam pa'i dgos pa de ci'i phyir zhen zhes bya bas bsu nas /
translated: What is the cause of lack of faith? The purpose is asked, Why is that?

original: sngon yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: sngon yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Then it is said, Previously, etc.

original: 'khor de nas 'byol te zhes bya ba la spong ba'i sems kyis zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: 'khor de nas 'byol te zhes bya ba la spong ba'i sems kyis zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: Having left that assembly means with a rejecting mind.

original: bsags la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sbyor pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs gsum du go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: bsags la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sbyor pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs gsum du go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The three states of preparation, etc. are to be connected respectively with the three phrases beginning with “accumulated. ”

original: lus kyis mthun par mi byed pa ni lus nye bar mi byed pas so //
analyzed: lus kyis mthun par mi byed pa ni lus nye bar mi byed pas so //
translated: Non-cooperation by the body is not to make the body available.

original: sems kyis mthun par mi byed pa ni sems rnam par g-yengs pas so //
analyzed: sems kyis mthun par mi byed pa ni sems rnam par g-yengs pas so //
translated: Non-cooperation by the mind is to be distracted.

original: mi shes mi rig khong du mi chud ces bye ba ni go rims bzhin du mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang lung gi tshad mas so //
analyzed: mi shes mi rig khong du mi chud ces bye ba ni go rims bzhin du mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang lung gi tshad mas so //
translated: “Not knowing, not understanding, not penetrating” is by the means of valid knowledge of direct perception, inference, and scriptural tradition, respectively.

original: de nyid kyis na rig par mi byed de gzhan dag ces bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na rig par mi byed de gzhan dag ces bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: “Not making it known to others” is the remainder.

original: spong ba ni rang gi ngo bo 'dor ba'o //
analyzed: spong ba ni rang gi ngo bo 'dor ba'o //
translated: Abandonment is the relinquishing of one’s own nature.

original: skur bar 'gyur ba ni mthu la snyon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skur bar 'gyur ba ni mthu la snyon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Denial is the denial of power.

original: mi snyam par brjod pa ni yid du mi 'ong ba'i tshig smra ba'o //🔽bcom zhing zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi snyam par brjod pa ni yid du mi 'ong ba'i tshig smra ba'o // bcom zhing zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Unpleasant speech is the speaking of unpleasant words.🔽“Destroyed” is because of not producing the roots of virtue.

original: bsregs pa ni mi dge ba'i bag chags bskyed pas so //
analyzed: bsregs pa ni mi dge ba'i bag chags bskyed pas so //
translated: “Burned” is because of producing the propensities of non-virtue.

original: bsod nams chung ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa gsum chung ngu dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: bsod nams chung ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa gsum chung ngu dang ldan pas so //
translated: Those of little merit are those who have little of the three: generosity, etc.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba chung ba zhes bya ba ni byams pa la sogs pa chung ngu yod pas so //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba chung ba zhes bya ba ni byams pa la sogs pa chung ngu yod pas so //
translated: Those of little root of virtue are those who have little love, etc.

original: phyir ldog cing zhes bya ba ni byed 'dod pa nyid med bar byed pas so //
analyzed: phyir ldog cing zhes bya ba ni byed 'dod pa nyid med bar byed pas so //
translated: They turn away means they do not even want to do it.

original: 'bral bar byed ces bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo 'dor bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bral bar byed ces bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo 'dor bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They separate means they abandon their own nature.

original: ldog par byed de zhes bya ba ni yang 'jug pa las ldog pas so //🔽de rnam pa thams cad nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: ldog par byed de zhes bya ba ni yang 'jug pa las ldog pas so // de rnam pa thams cad nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: They turn back means they turn back from engaging in it.

original: thams cad nas ni sangs rgyas dkon mchog la sogs pa'i rang @160a * //🔽bzhin gyis so //
analyzed: thams cad nas ni sangs rgyas dkon mchog la sogs pa'i rang @160a * // bzhin gyis so //
translated: In all ways means in terms of the nature of the jewel of the Buddha, etc.

original: thams cad nas ni de bzhin gshegs pa sh'akya thub pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: thams cad nas ni de bzhin gshegs pa sh'akya thub pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: In every way means in terms of the nature of the Tathagata Sakyamuni, etc.

original: rnam pa thams cad ni chung ngu'i chung ngu la sogs pa'i dbye bas so //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad ni chung ngu'i chung ngu la sogs pa'i dbye bas so //
translated: In all aspects means in terms of the distinctions of lesser-lesser, etc.

original: thams cad du ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims la sogs pa'i rnam pas so //
analyzed: thams cad du ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims la sogs pa'i rnam pas so //
translated: In all ways, by the aspect of superior morality, etc.

original: nye bar gzhag pa ni bskyed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar gzhag pa ni bskyed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is established because it is generated.

original: kun nas bslang ba ni 'jig pa med pas so //
analyzed: kun nas bslang ba ni 'jig pa med pas so //
translated: It is motivated because it is not destroyed.

original: dmyal ba chen po rnams su zhes bya ba ni 'dzam bu'i gling gi 'og gi stong phrag nyi shu na de'i tshad tsam gyi dmyal ba chen po mnar med pa'o //
analyzed: dmyal ba chen po rnams su zhes bya ba ni 'dzam bu'i gling gi 'og gi stong phrag nyi shu na de'i tshad tsam gyi dmyal ba chen po mnar med pa'o //
translated: In the great hells means in the great hell Incessant, which is twenty thousand leagues beneath Jambudvipa and of equal extent.

original: de'i steng na rab tu tsha ba dang / tsha ba dang / du 'bod chen po dang ; du 'bod dang / bsdus 'joms pa dang / thig nag dang / yang sos te /
analyzed: de'i steng na rab tu tsha ba dang / tsha ba dang / du 'bod chen po dang ; du 'bod dang / bsdus 'joms pa dang / thig nag dang / yang sos te /
translated: Above that are the great hells Extremely Hot, Hot, Great Wailing, Wailing, Gathering, Black Line, Reviving,

original: dmyal ba chen po brgyad do //
analyzed: dmyal ba chen po brgyad do //
translated: and the eight great hells.

original: mes 'jig pa'i bskal ba zhes bya ba ni dmyal ba'i 'gro ba nas bzung ste tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gyi bar gyi 'jig rten sems can 'gal yang lus par ma gyur pa de'i tshe snod kyi 'jig rten stong par nyi ma bdun byung nas rim gyis chu'i dkyil
analyzed: mes 'jig pa'i bskal ba zhes bya ba ni dmyal ba'i 'gro ba nas bzung ste tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gyi bar gyi 'jig rten sems can 'gal yang lus par ma gyur pa de'i tshe snod kyi 'jig rten stong par nyi ma bdun byung nas rim gyis chu'i dkyil
translated: The so-called eon of destruction by fire is when the world, from the realm of the hells up to the world of Brahma, is empty of sentient beings, and then the world of the environment is destroyed.

original: 'khor nas brtsams te bsam gtan dang po'i bar du sreg pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor nas brtsams te bsam gtan dang po'i bar du sreg pa'o //
translated: Seven suns appear and gradually burn up the world, starting from the circle of water up to the first concentration.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan na zhes bya ba ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po gzhan du'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan na zhes bya ba ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po gzhan du'o //
translated: In other world systems means in other trichiliocosms.🔽What is the cause of experiencing much suffering?

original: sdug bsngal mang po nyams su myong ba'i rgyu ci zhig yin snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
analyzed: sdug bsngal mang po nyams su myong ba'i rgyu ci zhig yin snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
translated: That doubt is anticipated by “Why is that?”

original: de dag de lta bur zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te go sla'o //
analyzed: de dag de lta bur zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te go sla'o //
translated: The response is “They are like that…” and so on, which is easy to understand.

original: mtshams ma mchis pa lnga'i las ni ma bsad pa dang / pha bsad pa dang / dgra bcom pa bsad pa dang / dge 'dun gyi dbyen dang / de bzhin gshegs ba'i sku la ngan sems kyis khrag phyung ba ste /
analyzed: mtshams ma mchis pa lnga'i las ni ma bsad pa dang / pha bsad pa dang / dgra bcom pa bsad pa dang / dge 'dun gyi dbyen dang / de bzhin gshegs ba'i sku la ngan sems kyis khrag phyung ba ste /
translated: The five heinous actions are: killing one's mother, killing one's father, killing an arhat, causing a schism in the order, and out of malice, wounding a buddha.

original: las lnga po 'di dag byas pa'i rjes thogs nyid la mnar med pa'i sems can dmyal ba chen por skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir mtshams med pa'o //
analyzed: las lnga po 'di dag byas pa'i rjes thogs nyid la mnar med pa'i sems can dmyal ba chen por skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir mtshams med pa'o //
translated: These five actions are heinous because they are the causes for being born in the great hell of Avici immediately after death.

original: 'bras bu dang rgyu dang rang bzhin gsum gyi 'dra ba med pas na /
analyzed: 'bras bu dang rgyu dang rang bzhin gsum gyi 'dra ba med pas na /
translated: They are not similar to the three, result, cause, and nature.

original: go rims bzhin du gzugs brnyan du'am /
analyzed: go rims bzhin du gzugs brnyan du'am /
translated: They are not similar to a reflection,

original: rjes su mthun pa'am /
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa'am /
translated: or to a concordant cause,

original: tshul mthun pa tsam du yang 'dra ba ma lags so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: tshul mthun pa tsam du yang 'dra ba ma lags so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: or to a mere similarity.

original: sdug bsngal ba rnams la snying rje 'jug pa yin nam /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba rnams la snying rje 'jug pa yin nam /
translated: Do you have compassion for those who are suffering?

original: de dag dang 'grogs pa la sogs pa ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
analyzed: de dag dang 'grogs pa la sogs pa ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
translated: Why do you associate with them and so forth?

original: sh'a ri'i bu de lta bu'i gang zag de dag ni zhes bya ba @160b la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu de lta bu'i gang zag de dag ni zhes bya ba @160b la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The Lord said, Those persons, Sariputra, are like rotten leaves.

original: gzhan dag la yang rang gi nyes pa dgod pas na lo 'dab rul ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag la yang rang gi nyes pa dgod pas na lo 'dab rul ba lta bu'o //
translated: They are like rotten leaves because they are like rotten leaves that fall from their stalks.

original: 'bru ma rungs par byed pa'i rtsva'i rigs dang 'dra ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i 'bru ma rungs par byed pa'i phyir nag po'i rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: 'bru ma rungs par byed pa'i rtsva'i rigs dang 'dra ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i 'bru ma rungs par byed pa'i phyir nag po'i rang bzhin can no //
translated: They are of a dark nature because they are like a kind of grass that spoils the grain, since they spoil the Bodhisattvas.

original: sprul nag po dang 'dra bar zhe sdang mang ba'i phyir nag po nye bar bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: sprul nag po dang 'dra bar zhe sdang mang ba'i phyir nag po nye bar bskyed pa'o //
translated: They are dark producers because they are like black snakes, since they are full of hatred.

original: tshul ma yin pas brlag par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir de lta bu'i sdig pa byed pa dang lhan cig snying rje'i yul yin pa nyid kyis 'grogs pa dang yul gyi bgo bsha' la sog pa yongs su spongs bar bya ste /
analyzed: tshul ma yin pas brlag par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir de lta bu'i sdig pa byed pa dang lhan cig snying rje'i yul yin pa nyid kyis 'grogs pa dang yul gyi bgo bsha' la sog pa yongs su spongs bar bya ste /
translated: They are to be avoided like a pit of fire means that one should avoid associating with and sharing the Dharma with those who commit such evil deeds, since they are objects of compassion.

original: tshul ma yin pa nye bar spyod pa 'di dang po la 'grogs pa la sogs pas 'phongs shing brlag par 'gyur ba de bas na dam pa'i chos sun 'byin pa ni ring du spang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshul ma yin pa nye bar spyod pa 'di dang po la 'grogs pa la sogs pas 'phongs shing brlag par 'gyur ba de bas na dam pa'i chos sun 'byin pa ni ring du spang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should avoid for a long time the disparagement of the true Dharma, since this improper conduct is the cause of the loss and destruction of the body, etc.

original: chos la sun 'byin gang zhig la bya zhe na /
analyzed: chos la sun 'byin gang zhig la bya zhe na /
translated: With regard to the disparagement of the Dharma, what is it?

original: sh'a ri'i bu gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: To respond to that, he says, Śāriputra, those who, etc.

original: tshad yod bzhin du ci'i phyir mi gsung snyam pa'i dogs pa /
analyzed: tshad yod bzhin du ci'i phyir mi gsung snyam pa'i dogs pa /
translated: Why does he not speak about the measure of the body, etc., when it is present?

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhe bya bas bsu na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhe bya bas bsu na /
translated: To respond to that, he says, Why is that?

original: gang zag de lta bu'i lus kyi tshad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang zag de lta bu'i lus kyi tshad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He says, the measure of the body of such a person, etc.

original: gang gi phyir dmyal ba chen po'i lus kyi tshad thos na sdug bsngal che ba nyid du go bas 'jigs pa chen pos gnyen po kun tu spyod pa la sogs pa dang de 'gal bar de 'bral du khrag dron po kha nas skyug pa la sogs par 'gyur
analyzed: gang gi phyir dmyal ba chen po'i lus kyi tshad thos na sdug bsngal che ba nyid du go bas 'jigs pa chen pos gnyen po kun tu spyod pa la sogs pa dang de 'gal bar de 'bral du khrag dron po kha nas skyug pa la sogs par 'gyur
translated: Because, having heard the measure of the body in the great hells, one understands the great suffering and, through great fear, one engages in the practice of the antidote, etc., and that is incompatible with it, one vomits hot blood from the mouth, etc., and dies.

original: bas de bas na tshad ma bstan to zhes bya ba ni spyi'i don yin no /
analyzed: bas de bas na tshad ma bstan to zhes bya ba ni spyi'i don yin no /
translated: Therefore, the measure is taught. This is the general meaning.

original: 'chi ba tsam yang sdug bsngal mi bzad pa dang nad kyis reg cing zhes bya ba ni chung ngu 'bring dang chen po'i dbye bas tshig gsum gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'chi ba tsam yang sdug bsngal mi bzad pa dang nad kyis reg cing zhes bya ba ni chung ngu 'bring dang chen po'i dbye bas tshig gsum gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Death alone is unbearable suffering, and being touched by illness. This is stated in three phrases due to the division into small, medium, and great.

original: phyi ma'i skye bo mang po la gdags pa snang bar bgyis par 'gyur gyi zhes bya ba ni mi dge ba'i las byed pa rnams skyo ba bskyed pas chos kyi snang bya yin no //
analyzed: phyi ma'i skye bo mang po la gdags pa snang bar bgyis par 'gyur gyi zhes bya ba ni mi dge ba'i las byed pa rnams skyo ba bskyed pas chos kyi snang bya yin no //
translated: It will illuminate the designation for many future beings. This is the light of the Dharma, since it generates disgust in those who perform non-virtuous actions.

original: skyo bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni de'i rgyu yin pas de skad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: skyo bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni de'i rgyu yin pas de skad ces bya ba'o //
translated: One will become disgusted. This is so-called because it is the cause of that.

original: lus kyi las dang ngag gi las dang yid kyi las shin tu bsdam par bgyi'o zhes bya ba ni go rims bzhin du dran pa dang shes bzhin la brten nas lus dang ngag dang yid kyi dge ba'i las nyams su blang bar gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: lus kyi las dang ngag gi las dang yid kyi las shin tu bsdam par bgyi'o zhes bya ba ni go rims bzhin du dran pa dang shes bzhin la brten nas lus dang ngag dang yid kyi dge ba'i las nyams su blang bar gsungs pa yin no //
translated: One should restrain the bodily action, verbal action, and mental action. This is stated as the practice of virtuous bodily, verbal, and mental actions based on mindfulness and introspection, respectively.

original: go zlog par byed pa la nye pa ci zhig yod snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
analyzed: go zlog par byed pa la nye pa ci zhig yod snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
translated: Why is that?🔽The Blessed One said, “Thus,

original: bcom ldan 'das de @161a * //🔽ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de @161a * // ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Bhagavan, those who are of that kind,

original: de lta bus zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi bka' ma yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rang bzhin gyis so //
analyzed: de lta bus zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi bka' ma yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rang bzhin gyis so //
translated: with that kind of nature, will say, ‘This is not the word of the Buddha.’

original: 'di ni gtsor nye bar mtshon pa tsam du zad de lus dang yid kyi phyin ci log gis kyang zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gtsor nye bar mtshon pa tsam du zad de lus dang yid kyi phyin ci log gis kyang zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: This is just the primary indication; one should understand that there are also the errors of body and mind.

original: 'das ma thag pa'i ngag gis nyes par smras pa'i skabs nye bar bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'das ma thag pa'i ngag gis nyes par smras pa'i skabs nye bar bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In order to include the topic of the immediately preceding speech that was badly spoken, he said, “Bhagavan, those who are of that kind, with that kind of nature, will say, ‘This is not the word of the Buddha.’

original: gzhan du na de ma thag tu gsungs zin pa la zhu ba ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan du na de ma thag tu gsungs zin pa la zhu ba ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: Otherwise, how could there be a question about what was just said?

original: sun dbyung bar sems par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni phan tshun 'gal bar brjod pas so //
analyzed: sun dbyung bar sems par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni phan tshun 'gal bar brjod pas so //
translated: They will think to refute’ means that they will say things that are mutually contradictory.

original: skur par sems par 'gyur zhes bya ba snga ma dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: skur par sems par 'gyur zhes bya ba snga ma dang 'dra'o //
translated: The phrase they will think of disparaging it is the same as before.

original: phyir gzhil bar sems par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad ma dang 'gal bas so //
analyzed: phyir gzhil bar sems par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad ma dang 'gal bas so //
translated: The phrase they will think of rejecting it is because it contradicts direct perception and the other valid cognitions.

original: skyes bu gti mug can zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: skyes bu gti mug can zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase they are foolish people means that they are ignorant.

original: rang gi nyid la 'jug pa dang // rang gi 'dul la snang phyir dang // zab pa'i phyir dang rgya che'i phyir//
analyzed: rang gi nyid la 'jug pa dang // rang gi 'dul la snang phyir dang // zab pa'i phyir dang rgya che'i phyir//
translated: Because it engages its own nature, because it appears in its own training, because it is profound, and because it is vast,

original: chos nyid dang ni 'gal ba med //
analyzed: chos nyid dang ni 'gal ba med //
translated: it is not in contradiction with reality.

original: ces gsungs pas sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid gang mdo sde la 'jug pa dang / 'dul ba la snang ba dang / chos nyid dang mi 'gal ba yin no zhes ma rtogs pas /
analyzed: ces gsungs pas sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid gang mdo sde la 'jug pa dang / 'dul ba la snang ba dang / chos nyid dang mi 'gal ba yin no zhes ma rtogs pas /
translated: Because it is said, it is not in contradiction with reality, the characteristic of what the Buddha taught is that it engages the sūtras, it appears in the vinaya, and it is not in contradiction with reality.

original: mdo sde la sogs pas yang dag par bsdus par rgyal ba'i yum gyi rang bzhin nges par mi 'dzin pas rmongs pa'o //
analyzed: mdo sde la sogs pas yang dag par bsdus par rgyal ba'i yum gyi rang bzhin nges par mi 'dzin pas rmongs pa'o //
translated: Because they do not understand this, they are ignorant of the nature of the Mother of the Victorious Ones, which is perfectly included in the sūtras and so forth, and they do not uphold it.

original: 'di snyam du sde pa'i gzhung gi mdo sde tshad nyung zad la mi 'jug pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin du tshad yongs su chad pa'i 'dul ba'i sde snod la mthong ba'i phyir dang / de bzhin du gang zag la bdag med pa la sogs pa'i chos nyid du gzhag pa dang /
analyzed: 'di snyam du sde pa'i gzhung gi mdo sde tshad nyung zad la mi 'jug pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin du tshad yongs su chad pa'i 'dul ba'i sde snod la mthong ba'i phyir dang / de bzhin du gang zag la bdag med pa la sogs pa'i chos nyid du gzhag pa dang /
translated: They think, because the sutra collection of the scriptural collection of the sravakas is limited in extent, because the vinaya collection is limited in extent and because the Abhidharma is limited in extent, the Mahayana is not the word of the Buddha.🔽

original: mi mthun pa'i phyir theg pa chen po sangs rgyas kyi bka' ma yin pa ni spangs pas rmongs par mi 'gyur ro bya bar sems na /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyir theg pa chen po sangs rgyas kyi bka' ma yin pa ni spangs pas rmongs par mi 'gyur ro bya bar sems na /
translated: If you think that the Mahayana is not the word of the Buddha because it is not included in the small number of sutras of the sects,🔽because the Vinaya canon has a fixed size, and because it is inconsistent with the teachings of the individual no self and so on,🔽then you should also reject the loose sutras because they are not included in the sutra canon and are not the word of the Buddha.

original: de lta yin na ni mdo sde lhug pa rnams kyang mdo sde'i sde snod rnams su ma gsungs pas sangs rgyas kyi bka' ma yin par khas blang bar bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin na ni mdo sde lhug pa rnams kyang mdo sde'i sde snod rnams su ma gsungs pas sangs rgyas kyi bka' ma yin par khas blang bar bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, you would have to accept that the loose sutras are not the word of the Buddha because they are not stated in the sutra canon.

original: de bzhin du mdo sde'i sde snod re rer mdo sde'i sde snod gzhan rnams rnam pa thams cad 'jug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du mdo sde'i sde snod re rer mdo sde'i sde snod gzhan rnams rnam pa thams cad 'jug pa ma yin no //
translated: Similarly, each sutra canon does not include all the other sutra canons in every way.

original: de bzhin du 'dul ba re re la 'dul ba gzhan rnams kyi rnam pa thams cad snang ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dul ba re re la 'dul ba gzhan rnams kyi rnam pa thams cad snang ba ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, the aspects of the other Vinayas do not appear in each Vinaya.

original: de bzhin du sde ba re re'i chos nyid du gzhag pa gang yin pa de sde pa gzhan rnams kyi chos @161b nyid dang mthun pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du sde ba re re'i chos nyid du gzhag pa gang yin pa de sde pa gzhan rnams kyi chos @161b nyid dang mthun pa ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, the Dharma of each school is not in agreement with the Dharma of the other schools.

original: de ltar na sde pa bco brgyad kyis phye ba'i mdo sde dang 'dul ba dang mngon pa'i sde snod phan tshun gcig la gcig gzhung dang don tha dad pa rnams sangs rgyas kyi bka' yin par ji ltar 'grub /
analyzed: de ltar na sde pa bco brgyad kyis phye ba'i mdo sde dang 'dul ba dang mngon pa'i sde snod phan tshun gcig la gcig gzhung dang don tha dad pa rnams sangs rgyas kyi bka' yin par ji ltar 'grub /
translated: In this way, how can the Baskets of Sūtra, Vinaya, and Abhidharma, which are divided into eighteen schools, be established as the word of the Buddha when their texts and meanings are different from one another?

original: des na 'dis ni khyab pa ma yin pa la sangs rgyas kyi bka'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes khas 'che bas na rmongs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: des na 'dis ni khyab pa ma yin pa la sangs rgyas kyi bka'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes khas 'che bas na rmongs pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is a delusion, because it is claimed that the definition of the word of the Buddha is not universal.

original: yang na yid kyi nyes pa rang bzhin stug pa ste //
analyzed: yang na yid kyi nyes pa rang bzhin stug pa ste //
translated: Or, it is the thick natural fault of the mind.

original: mi rig pa yi gzugs la'ang mi rig na //
analyzed: mi rig pa yi gzugs la'ang mi rig na //
translated: If one does not know the form of the unknown,

original: the tshom za ba'i chos la smos ci dgos //
analyzed: the tshom za ba'i chos la smos ci dgos //
translated: what need is there to mention the Dharma of doubt?

original: de'i phyir btang snyoms gzhag legs nyes pa med //
analyzed: de'i phyir btang snyoms gzhag legs nyes pa med //
translated: Therefore, there is no fault in the good or bad of setting equanimity.

original: ces bya ba'i don 'di ma shes pas na skyes bu gti mug ces bya'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba'i don 'di ma shes pas na skyes bu gti mug ces bya'o //
translated: Because of not understanding this meaning, one is called a deluded person.

original: sun dbyung bar sems pa zhes bya ba ni phan tshun 'gal bar brjod pas so //
analyzed: sun dbyung bar sems pa zhes bya ba ni phan tshun 'gal bar brjod pas so //
translated: The thought of reproach is because of mutually contradictory statements.

original: spong bar sems zhes bya ba ni snga ma dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: spong bar sems zhes bya ba ni snga ma dang 'dra'o //
translated: The thought of abandoning is as before.

original: phyir gzhil bar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad ma dang 'gal bas so //
analyzed: phyir gzhil bar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad ma dang 'gal bas so //
translated: The thought of rejection and so on is because of contradicting direct perception and so on.

original: dam pa'i chos spong bar byed pa 'di'i rgyu rnam pa bzhi bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos spong bar byed pa 'di'i rgyu rnam pa bzhi bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the four kinds of causes of abandoning the true Dharma,

original: bcom ldan 'das rigs kyi bu 'am rigs kyi bu mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rigs kyi bu 'am rigs kyi bu mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it is said, Blessed One, son of noble family or daughter of noble family, etc.

original: rnam pa bzhi po de dag ces bya ba ni bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs pa dang / zab pa'i chos la ma mos pa dang phung po la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa dang / sdig pa'i grogs pos yongs su zin pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi po de dag ces bya ba ni bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs pa dang / zab pa'i chos la ma mos pa dang phung po la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa dang / sdig pa'i grogs pos yongs su zin pa ste /
translated: The four kinds are being blessed by Mara, not being interested in the profound Dharma, strongly clinging to the aggregates, etc., and being taken over by evil friends.

original: spong ba'i rgyu bzhis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: spong ba'i rgyu bzhis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that the four causes of abandonment are the four causes of the realization of the perfection of wisdom.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And it is said:

original: chos kyis phongs pa'i rgyu dag ni //
analyzed: chos kyis phongs pa'i rgyu dag ni //
translated: The causes of the loss of the Dharma🔽are being overcome by the darkness of Mara,🔽lacking interest in the path of the profound Dharma,🔽clinging to the aggregates and so on,

original: bdud kyi thibs kyis non pa dang // zab mo'i chos lam mos dang / phung po la sogs mngon zhen dang // sdig pa'i grogs pos yongs zin pa'o //
analyzed: bdud kyi thibs kyis non pa dang // zab mo'i chos lam mos dang / phung po la sogs mngon zhen dang // sdig pa'i grogs pos yongs zin pa'o //
translated: and being seized by evil companions.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bshad pa mngon par rtogs pa rgyan gyi snang ba las /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bshad pa mngon par rtogs pa rgyan gyi snang ba las /
translated: This concludes the section on the causes of the loss of the Dharma.

original: sems can dmyal ba'i le'u zhes bya ste bdun pa'o /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba'i le'u zhes bya ste bdun pa'o /
translated: This concludes the seventh chapter, on the hells, from the commentary on the perfection of wisdom in eight thousand lines called Illuminating the Meaning.

original: // / de ltar rtogs pa dang ma rtogs pa'i rgyu thob pa dang yongs su spang ba'i yul gsungs nas /
analyzed: // / de ltar rtogs pa dang ma rtogs pa'i rgyu thob pa dang yongs su spang ba'i yul gsungs nas /
translated: Having explained the causes of realization and non-realization, the objects to be attained and abandoned,

original: skabs su bab pa shin tu rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bsgom pa'i lam gyi rnam par dag pa spyir bstan pa'i don du zab pa nyid ston par byed bas /
analyzed: skabs su bab pa shin tu rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bsgom pa'i lam gyi rnam par dag pa spyir bstan pa'i don du zab pa nyid ston par byed bas /
translated: in order to generally teach the purity of the path of cultivation, which is the present topic, the purity of the extremely pure characteristics, the profundity is taught.

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni mngon par mi brtson pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //🔽dka' zhing sdug bsngal bas lhag par mos pa yin pas na mos @162a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni mngon par mi brtson pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so // dka' zhing sdug bsngal bas lhag par mos pa yin pas na mos @162a * //
translated: The Lord said, “Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom is not for those who do not strive, etc.”

original: par dka' ba ste /
analyzed: par dka' ba ste /
translated: It is difficult to be interested in the perfection of wisdom because it is difficult and painful.🔽Therefore, it is difficult to be interested in.

original: lhag par mos par dka' ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lhag par mos par dka' ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is difficult to be interested in.

original: so so'i skye bo dang 'phags pa'i dbye bas ni 'ching ba dang grol ba nyid yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo dang 'phags pa'i dbye bas ni 'ching ba dang grol ba nyid yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn’t it the case that there is bondage and liberation, distinguished as ordinary and noble?🔽How can form be neither bound nor liberated?

original: ji ltar na gzugs ma bcings ma grol ba yin snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhen zhes bya bas bsu nas /
analyzed: ji ltar na gzugs ma bcings ma grol ba yin snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhen zhes bya bas bsu nas /
translated: To answer the question, “Why is that?”

original: gzugs ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: gzugs ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: he says, “Because form has no intrinsic nature.”

original: dus gsum gyi gzugs ni rig pas rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus gsum gyi gzugs ni rig pas rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because form in the three times is not its own nature.

original: spyir bstan nas 'das pa la sogs pa'i dbye bas rab 'byor gzugs kyi sngon gyi mtha' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: spyir bstan nas 'das pa la sogs pa'i dbye bas rab 'byor gzugs kyi sngon gyi mtha' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Having taught in general, he teaches in detail, distinguishing past, etc., saying, “Subhūti, the prior limit of form, etc.”

original: de bzhin du de ci'i phyir zhen zhes dogs pa bsu nas ;
analyzed: de bzhin du de ci'i phyir zhen zhes dogs pa bsu nas ;
translated: Likewise, in response to the qualm, “Why is that?”

original: sngon gyi mtha' ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: it is said, “Because the prior limit is essenceless.”

original: rgyu de kho nas ma skyes pa nyid kyis sngon gyi mtha'i ngo bo nyid da ltar byung ba'i gzugs gang la med pa de la de skad ces brjod do //
analyzed: rgyu de kho nas ma skyes pa nyid kyis sngon gyi mtha'i ngo bo nyid da ltar byung ba'i gzugs gang la med pa de la de skad ces brjod do //
translated: Because of that very cause, it is not arisen. Therefore, it is said that the prior limit is the essence of the present form.

original: snga ma bzhin du de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dogs pa bsu nas /
translated: In response to the qualm, “Why is that?” as before,

original: phyi ma'i mtha' ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha' ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: it is said, “Because the later limit is essenceless.”

original: rgyu de kho nas ma skyes pa nyid kyi mtha' 'bras bu ngo bo nyid 'di la med pas zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: rgyu de kho nas ma skyes pa nyid kyi mtha' 'bras bu ngo bo nyid 'di la med pas zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: Because of that very cause, it is not arisen. Therefore, it is said that the later limit is the essence of the present form.

original: de bzhin du de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dogs pa bsu nas /
translated: In response to the qualm, “Why is that?”

original: da ltar byung ba ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: it is said, “Because the present is essenceless.”

original: gzugs la sogs pa rang gi ngo bo stong pa nyid kyis da ltar byung ba mtshan nyid dang bral ba yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rang gi ngo bo stong pa nyid kyis da ltar byung ba mtshan nyid dang bral ba yin no //
translated: Form, etc., is devoid of the characteristic of the present, by reason of the emptiness of own-nature.

original: mos par dka' ba ni so so'i skye bo'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mos par dka' ba ni so so'i skye bo'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Difficult to believe, because it is not the domain of ordinary people.

original: shin tu mos par dka' ba ni 'dzin pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyi yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu mos par dka' ba ni 'dzin pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyi yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Very difficult to believe, because it is not the domain of those who are free from the attachment of grasping.

original: gzugs la sogs pa dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid dag ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i dbye bas tha dad par rtogs pa'i phyir ji ltar na shin tu mos par dka' ba yin snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid dag ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i dbye bas tha dad par rtogs pa'i phyir ji ltar na shin tu mos par dka' ba yin snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na
translated: How can it be very difficult to believe, since the nature of form, etc., and the perfection of wisdom are realized as different, by the division into conventional and ultimate?

original: zhes bya bas bsu nas /
analyzed: zhes bya bas bsu nas /
translated: In order to remove this doubt, he says, Why is that?

original: rab 'byor gzugs kyi rnam par dag pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: rab 'byor gzugs kyi rnam par dag pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: and then says, Subhuti, by the purity of form, etc.

original: sna tshogs pa nyid kyi dbye ba med pas tha dad ba'o ;
analyzed: sna tshogs pa nyid kyi dbye ba med pas tha dad ba'o ;
translated: It is not different, because there is no division of variety.

original: / rab tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid kyis chod pa med pas na mchad pa'o //
analyzed: / rab tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid kyis chod pa med pas na mchad pa'o //
translated: It is uninterrupted because it is not interrupted by the characteristic of differentiation.

original: yang na rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi sna tshogs pa dang bral bas go rims bzhin du gsungs so //
analyzed: yang na rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi sna tshogs pa dang bral bas go rims bzhin du gsungs so //
translated: Or else, it is taught in order, respectively, because it is free from the variety of particular and universal characteristics.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Subhuti, it is thus, etc.

original: kun rdzob de bzhin nyid gang yin //
analyzed: kun rdzob de bzhin nyid gang yin //
translated: The conventional is suchness.

original: de nyid dam pa'i don phyir bzhed//
analyzed: de nyid dam pa'i don phyir bzhed//
translated: It is accepted as the ultimate,

original: @162b tha dad min phyir rigs de yang //
analyzed: @162b tha dad min phyir rigs de yang //
translated: because it is not different. That lineage

original: ji ltar snang ba bzhin du gnas //
analyzed: ji ltar snang ba bzhin du gnas //
translated: is just as it appears.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis bdag dang bdag gi la sogs par mngon par zhen pa dang bral bas gzugs la sogs pa sgyu ma lta bur gyur pa'i rnam par dag pa yin pa da nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad dang bral ba nyid kyis na rgyun du
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis bdag dang bdag gi la sogs par mngon par zhen pa dang bral bas gzugs la sogs pa sgyu ma lta bur gyur pa'i rnam par dag pa yin pa da nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad dang bral ba nyid kyis na rgyun du
translated: In this way, by being free from the adherence to self and being mine, etc., the purification of form, etc., is like an illusion. Just that is the separation from all adverse elements.

original: zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnam par dag pa yin la /
analyzed: zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnam par dag pa yin la /
translated: The fruits of stream-enterer, etc. are the purification of the perfection of wisdom.

original: de bzhin du 'bras bu rnam par dag pa gang yin pa de ni gzugs la sogs pa rnam par dag pa yin pas gnyis su byar med pa yin pa'i phyir tha dad de ma chad pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'bras bu rnam par dag pa gang yin pa de ni gzugs la sogs pa rnam par dag pa yin pas gnyis su byar med pa yin pa'i phyir tha dad de ma chad pa'o //
translated: Likewise, since the purity of form, etc. is the purity of the effect, they are not to be differentiated, i.e., they are not to be distinguished, because they are not dual.

original: de bas 'bras bu rnam par dag pas gzugs la sogs pa rnam par dag pa dang / de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa rnam par dag pas 'bras bu rnam par dag pa'o zhes bya bar bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bas 'bras bu rnam par dag pas gzugs la sogs pa rnam par dag pa dang / de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa rnam par dag pas 'bras bu rnam par dag pa'o zhes bya bar bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, the purity of the effect is the purity of form, etc. and likewise, the purity of form, etc. is the purity of the effect. This is the meaning of the statement.

original: de skad du yang /🔽'bras bu dag pa gzugs la sogs //
analyzed: de skad du yang / 'bras bu dag pa gzugs la sogs //
translated: And thus it is said:🔽The purity of the effect is the purity of form, etc.

original: dag pa nyid de gang gi phyir //
analyzed: dag pa nyid de gang gi phyir //
translated: That is because

original: de gnyis tha dad ma yin zhing //🔽gcad du med pas dag par brjod //
analyzed: de gnyis tha dad ma yin zhing // gcad du med pas dag par brjod //
translated: those two are not differentiated

original: ces bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
translated: and are not to be distinguished, i.e., are not to be distinguished.

original: de ltar rnam par dag pa spyir brjon  nas /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par dag pa spyir brjon  nas /
translated: Thus, having generally discussed purity,

original: khyad par du bstan pa'i phyir rab 'byor gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: khyad par du bstan pa'i phyir rab 'byor gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: in order to teach it specifically, he says, Moreover, Subhuti, etc.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase “the purity of omniscience”

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: means the purity of the three kinds of omniscience.

original: de bas na 'di skad du nyan thos rnams kyi nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i phyogs gcig gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa spangs pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'di skad du nyan thos rnams kyi nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i phyogs gcig gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa spangs pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the purity of omniscience is due to the elimination of the afflictive obstructions by the śrāvakas and the elimination of the class of afflictive obstructions and the class of obstructions to the knowable, which are the conceptualizations of the apprehending subject, by the pratyekabuddhas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi theg pa gsum gyi lam gyi sgrib pa spangs pas lam shes pa nyid rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi theg pa gsum gyi lam gyi sgrib pa spangs pas lam shes pa nyid rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The purity of the knowledge of the path is due to the elimination of the obstructions to the path of the three vehicles by the bodhisattvas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas pa rnam pa thams cad du spangs ba'i phyir shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings las byung ba nyid ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par dag
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas pa rnam pa thams cad du spangs ba'i phyir shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings las byung ba nyid ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par dag
translated: Because the tathāgatas completely abandon the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience together with their imprints, they are the purity of the knowledge of all aspects that arises from the completely pure dharmadhātu.

original: pa yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: pa yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: This is what is being said.

original: de skad du yang /🔽nyon mongs shes bya lam gsum gyi //
analyzed: de skad du yang / nyon mongs shes bya lam gsum gyi //
translated: And it is said:🔽The purity of learners, rhinoceroses,🔽and bodhisattvas is due to🔽the decrease of the three:

original: nyams phyir slob ma bse ru dang // rgyal sras rnams kyi dag pa ste //
analyzed: nyams phyir slob ma bse ru dang // rgyal sras rnams kyi dag pa ste //
translated: afflictions, objects of knowledge, and the path.

original: sangs @163a * //
analyzed: sangs @163a * //
translated: The purity of buddhas

original: rgyas rnam kun shin tu ba //🔽zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyas rnam kun shin tu ba // zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: is in every way complete.

original: lam shes nyid kyi skabs su rnam par dag pa bshad pa'i zhar la /
analyzed: lam shes nyid kyi skabs su rnam par dag pa bshad pa'i zhar la /
translated: In the context of the knowledge of the path, the purity of the knowledge of all aspects is explained.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang nyan thos la sogs pa'i rnam par dag pa go rims bzhin du shin tu ba dang / cig shos su bshad pa de ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang nyan thos la sogs pa'i rnam par dag pa go rims bzhin du shin tu ba dang / cig shos su bshad pa de ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: In the context of the purity of the tathāgatas and the purity of śrāvakas and so on, what is the purity of the tathāgatas and what is the purity of the others?

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Then, the venerable Śāriputra said to the Lord, etc.🔽It is profound, etc.

original: zab po zhes bya ba dang / gsal bar bgyid pa dang / snang bar bgyid pa dang / mtshams sbyor ba ma mchis pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa ma mchis pa dang / thob pa ma mchis pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa ma mchis pa dang /
analyzed: zab po zhes bya ba dang / gsal bar bgyid pa dang / snang bar bgyid pa dang / mtshams sbyor ba ma mchis pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa ma mchis pa dang / thob pa ma mchis pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa ma mchis pa dang /
translated: It is illuminating, illuminating, connecting, uncontaminated, unattainable, non-realization,

original: mngon par grub pa ma mchis pa dang / shin tu skye ba ma mchis pa ste /
analyzed: mngon par grub pa ma mchis pa dang / shin tu skye ba ma mchis pa ste /
translated: non-establishment, and utterly non-arising.

original: 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bus gsol pa'i tshig dgu ni go rims bzhin du chung ngu'i chung du la sogs pa bsgom pa'i lam rnam pa dgu'i rang bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bus gsol pa'i tshig dgu ni go rims bzhin du chung ngu'i chung du la sogs pa bsgom pa'i lam rnam pa dgu'i rang bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: The nine statements of the noble Śāriputra should be expressed as the nature of the nine aspects of the path of cultivation, such as the lesser of the lesser, etc., in order.

original: tshig re re zhing bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: tshig re re zhing bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: Each statement, the Lord said, because of purity.

original: chen po'i chen po la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam pa dgu spangs pa dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: chen po'i chen po la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam pa dgu spangs pa dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The nine types of adverse factors, such as the great of the great, etc., are to be abandoned.

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang gzugs kyi khams dang gzugs med pa'i khams su zhes smos pas na 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pa'i sa dgu po bsgom pa'i lam gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang gzugs kyi khams dang gzugs med pa'i khams su zhes smos pas na 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pa'i sa dgu po bsgom pa'i lam gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Since it is said, “in the desire realm, form realm, and formless realm,” the nine levels such as the desire realm, etc., should be taken as the path of meditation.

original: gang yang 'dod pa'i khams dang srid rtsen //🔽byang chub lam gyi yan lag spangs //
analyzed: gang yang 'dod pa'i khams dang srid rtsen // byang chub lam gyi yan lag spangs //
translated: Some say: Those who say, “The desire realm and the summit of existence🔽are abandoned by the branches of the path to enlightenment,”

original: zhes brjod pa de ni thabs la mi mkhas pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes brjod pa de ni thabs la mi mkhas pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: are unskilled in means.

original: nyan thos kyi dbang du byas pa yin pas de dang 'di la 'gal ba med do zhes bya ba ni kha cig go //🔽gzhan dag ni mi lcogs pa med par gnas pa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi dbang du byas pa yin pas de dang 'di la 'gal ba med do zhes bya ba ni kha cig go // gzhan dag ni mi lcogs pa med par gnas pa nas brtsams te /
translated: Since this is from the perspective of śrāvakas, there is no contradiction with this.

original: ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi mthar thug pa'i bar gyi sa dgu ni bsgom pa'i lam yin no zhes 'chad do //
analyzed: ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi mthar thug pa'i bar gyi sa dgu ni bsgom pa'i lam yin no zhes 'chad do //
translated: Others explain that the nine levels, beginning with the level of unrestricted access concentration and ending with the base of nothingness, are the path of meditation.

original: 'dod ba'i khams la sogs pa smos pa ni der yum don dam par gnas pa med par ston pa lhur byed pa yin gyi sa dgu bshad pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod ba'i khams la sogs pa smos pa ni der yum don dam par gnas pa med par ston pa lhur byed pa yin gyi sa dgu bshad pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The statement about the desire realm, etc. is intended to show that the Mother is not ultimately present there, but it is not an explanation of the nine levels.

original: de'i bsdus pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i bsdus pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The condensed meaning of this is as follows:

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i sa dgu la so so 'am go rims bzhin du mi mthun pa'i phyogs chen po'i chen po la sogs pa rnam pa dgu'i gnyen po'i ngo bor go rims bzhin du lam chung ngu'i chung du la sogs @163b pa rnam pa dgu 'byung ba
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i sa dgu la so so 'am go rims bzhin du mi mthun pa'i phyogs chen po'i chen po la sogs pa rnam pa dgu'i gnyen po'i ngo bor go rims bzhin du lam chung ngu'i chung du la sogs @163b pa rnam pa dgu 'byung ba
translated: On the nine levels as they have been explained, the nine paths, from the small of the small up to the great of the great, arise in order as the antidotes to the nine aspects of the opposing side, from the great of the great down to the small of the small.

original: ni rnam pa thams cad dang / cig shos su rnam par dag pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir rnam par dag pa shin tu ba dang cig shos zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ni rnam pa thams cad dang / cig shos su rnam par dag pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir rnam par dag pa shin tu ba dang cig shos zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: They are the causes of complete and incomplete purification, respectively, and so are called complete and incomplete purification.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As it is said:

original: sa dgu la ni chen po yi //
analyzed: sa dgu la ni chen po yi //
translated: On the nine levels, the great

original: chen po la sogs dri ma yi //
analyzed: chen po la sogs dri ma yi //
translated: of the great, etc., defilements

original: gnyen po chung ngu'i chung du la //
analyzed: gnyen po chung ngu'i chung du la //
translated: are the antidotes to the small of the small,

original: sogs pa'i lam ni dag pa yin //🔽zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sogs pa'i lam ni dag pa yin //🔽zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: etc., paths of purification.

original: ji ltar na nye bar ma btags pa'i shin tu ba'i rnam par dag pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na nye bar ma btags pa'i shin tu ba'i rnam par dag pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it the purity of the non-adherence of the bodhisattva?

original: gsol pa bcom ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gsol pa bcom ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: He says, “Blessed One, etc. ”

original: ma 'tshal zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: ma 'tshal zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo'o //
translated: “I do not know” is in terms of its own nature.

original: yang dag par rab tu ma 'tshal zhes bya ba ni rab dbye ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu ma 'tshal zhes bya ba ni rab dbye ba'o //
translated: “I do not understand” is in terms of its differentiation.

original: rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Because of purity” is because it is the antidote to the three realms.

original: ci zhig ces bya ba ni 'di yul gang du gtogs pa zhus pa yin gyi spong ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ci zhig ces bya ba ni 'di yul gang du gtogs pa zhus pa yin gyi spong ba ni ma yin no //
translated: “What” is asking about the realm to which it belongs, not about the abandonment.

original: de nyid ni gzugs mi shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid ni gzugs mi shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: “The form, etc.” is just that.

original: gzugs rtag tu gnas pa'i ci'i phyir mi shes snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
analyzed: gzugs rtag tu gnas pa'i ci'i phyir mi shes snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
translated: The doubt, “Why does form not know itself? ” is anticipated by “Why is that? ”

original: sh'a ri'i bu rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: and answered by “Śāriputra, it is because of purity. ”

original: de kho na nyid du na dngos po med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na nyid du na dngos po med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because it does not exist in reality.

original: gnyen po'i phyogs ni chen po'i chen po la sogs pa yin zhing mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni chung ngu'i chung du la sogs par rigs pa ma yin nam de ci ltar na gzhan du bstan zhes rtog pa la /
analyzed: gnyen po'i phyogs ni chen po'i chen po la sogs pa yin zhing mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni chung ngu'i chung du la sogs par rigs pa ma yin nam de ci ltar na gzhan du bstan zhes rtog pa la /
translated: The antidote is the great of the great, etc., and the counteragent is the small of the small, etc. How is it taught otherwise?

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: To this he says, Bhagavan, the perfection of wisdom is the knowledge of all things.

original: gnod par mi bgyid ces bya ba ni chos kyi de kho na nyid gnas pa sel bar mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnod par mi bgyid ces bya ba ni chos kyi de kho na nyid gnas pa sel bar mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Not harming means not eliminating the reality of dharmas as it abides.

original: phan par mi bgyid ces bya ba ni sngon med pa mi skyed pa'i phyir ro zhes snga ma dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: phan par mi bgyid ces bya ba ni sngon med pa mi skyed pa'i phyir ro zhes snga ma dang sbyar ro //
translated: Not benefiting means not producing what did not exist before. This is connected to the previous.

original: chos gang yang yongs su mi 'dzin zhes bya ba ni gnyen po'i phyogs so //
analyzed: chos gang yang yongs su mi 'dzin zhes bya ba ni gnyen po'i phyogs so //
translated: Not grasping any dharma at all is the antidote.

original: yongs su mi gtong ngo zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: yongs su mi gtong ngo zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
translated: Not relinquishing is the counteragent.

original: ma 'tshal zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni skabs kyi spyi'i don ni 'di yin te ;
analyzed: ma 'tshal zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni skabs kyi spyi'i don ni 'di yin te ;
translated: Not understanding and so on refers to the general meaning of the context.

original: gnyen po ni chen po la sogs pa yin la /
analyzed: gnyen po ni chen po la sogs pa yin la /
translated: The antidote is the great stage and so on.🔽

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni chung ngu'i chung du la sogs pa yin par rigs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni chung ngu'i chung du la sogs pa yin par rigs pa ma yin nam /
translated: But is it not logical that the antidote is greater and so on, and that the counter-agent is lesser and so on?

original: ji ltar gzhan du bstan zhes rgol ba la /
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan du bstan zhes rgol ba la /
translated: How is it taught otherwise?

original: don dam phan par byed pa dang gnod pa gang yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba lan dang / de bzhin du kun @164a * //
analyzed: don dam phan par byed pa dang gnod pa gang yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba lan dang / de bzhin du kun @164a * //
translated: The reply is that ultimately there is no benefit or harm whatsoever, and similarly,

original: rdzob tu dri ma phra mo bsal ba khrus mkhan 'bad pa chen po byed pa'i dpe dang / gnyen po'i phyogs chung ngu'i chung du la sogs pa rim pa skye ba don gyis 'phangs par lan btab pas khams gsum gyi rnam pa can gyi shes pa dang /
analyzed: rdzob tu dri ma phra mo bsal ba khrus mkhan 'bad pa chen po byed pa'i dpe dang / gnyen po'i phyogs chung ngu'i chung du la sogs pa rim pa skye ba don gyis 'phangs par lan btab pas khams gsum gyi rnam pa can gyi shes pa dang /
translated: in the conventional, the example of a bathman who makes great effort to remove subtle stains and the reply that the lesser and lesser aspects of the antidote and so on are implicitly suggested by the meaning of the arising of the stages of the path.

original: shes bya dag mi dmigs pa'i phyir ji skad bstan pa'i bsgom pa'i lam skad cig ma tha ma de'i chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid sgyu ma lta bur rtogs pa gang yin pa de nyid mtha' dag gi gnyen po'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: shes bya dag mi dmigs pa'i phyir ji skad bstan pa'i bsgom pa'i lam skad cig ma tha ma de'i chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid sgyu ma lta bur rtogs pa gang yin pa de nyid mtha' dag gi gnyen po'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
translated: Because the object of knowledge is not observed, the very realization of the illusion-like equality of all phenomena in the final moment of the path of cultivation as it has been taught is the very essence of the antidote to all.

original: de lta yin dang dngos kyi shin tu rnam par dag pa ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi yin par rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de lta yin dang dngos kyi shin tu rnam par dag pa ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi yin par rnam par gzhag go //
translated: If that is so, the actual complete purity is posited as belonging to the Bhagavan Buddha.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And it is said:

original: da la klan ka spangs pa yis //
analyzed: da la klan ka spangs pa yis //
translated: By abandoning objections🔽The path is asserted as the antidote

original: lam ni 'jal dang gzhal bya dag / mnyam pa nyid kyis khams gsum gyi //
analyzed: lam ni 'jal dang gzhal bya dag / mnyam pa nyid kyis khams gsum gyi //
translated: To the three realms through equality

original: gnyen po nyid du 'dod pa yin //🔽zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyen po nyid du 'dod pa yin // zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: With the object of evaluation.

original: bsgom pa'i lam yongs su rdzogs pa'i 'og tu de'i skabs su gzugs rnam par dag pa gang yin pa dang 'bras bu rnam par dag pa gang yin pa zhes sngar gsungs pa gang yin pa de bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam yongs su rdzogs pa'i 'og tu de'i skabs su gzugs rnam par dag pa gang yin pa dang 'bras bu rnam par dag pa gang yin pa zhes sngar gsungs pa gang yin pa de bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: And after the path of cultivation is complete, in order to teach what was previously stated, namely, “the purity of form and the purity of the result,”

original: bcom ldan 'das bdag rnam par dag pas gzugs rnam par dag pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bdag rnam par dag pas gzugs rnam par dag pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The Bhagavat has said, “O Subhuti, the purity of form is the purity of the self, and so on.”

original: ji ltar gzhan gyis yongs su brtags pa'i bdag don dam par skye ba med par rnam par dag pa yin pa de bzhin du gzugs pa la sogs pa nas thams cad mkhyen pa'i mthar thug pa'i bar gyi rnam par dag pa yin par shes par bya'o zhes bya
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan gyis yongs su brtags pa'i bdag don dam par skye ba med par rnam par dag pa yin pa de bzhin du gzugs pa la sogs pa nas thams cad mkhyen pa'i mthar thug pa'i bar gyi rnam par dag pa yin par shes par bya'o zhes bya
translated: Just as the self imagined by others is ultimately unarisen and pure, so one should understand that form and so on up to omniscience are pure.🔽This is the meaning of the three repetitions.

original: ba ni 'dres gsum gyi don yin no gzugs la sogs pa dang bdag nyid ni kun rdzob 'ba' zhig tu don gyi bya ba la go rims bzhin du nus pa dang mi nus pa gnyis kyis bden pa dang brdzun pa'i dbye bas phye ba yin gyi don dam
analyzed: ba ni 'dres gsum gyi don yin no gzugs la sogs pa dang bdag nyid ni kun rdzob 'ba' zhig tu don gyi bya ba la go rims bzhin du nus pa dang mi nus pa gnyis kyis bden pa dang brdzun pa'i dbye bas phye ba yin gyi don dam
translated: The Bhagavat has said that form and so on and the self are divided into true and false by their ability or inability to perform the function of an object only conventionally,

original: par ni ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs par bcom ldan 'das kyis thams cad du shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: par ni ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs par bcom ldan 'das kyis thams cad du shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: but not ultimately, because everything is extremely pure.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i bsgom pa'i lam la de kho na nyid du na rtog pa med do zhes bcom ldan 'das bdag rnam par dag par thob pa yang ma mchis mngon par rtogs pa yang ma mchis so zhes gsol ba yin no //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i bsgom pa'i lam la de kho na nyid du na rtog pa med do zhes bcom ldan 'das bdag rnam par dag par thob pa yang ma mchis mngon par rtogs pa yang ma mchis so zhes gsol ba yin no //
translated: The Lord has said, In reality, there is no realization and no clear knowledge on the path of meditation as it has been explained.

original: de la 'thob pa ma mchis pa ni dang po skyes pas thob tu rung ba'i mtshan nyid can du'o //
analyzed: de la 'thob pa ma mchis pa ni dang po skyes pas thob tu rung ba'i mtshan nyid can du'o //
translated: Here, no realization is in the sense of being fit for the attainment of the first stage.

original: mngon par rtogs pa ma mchis @164b pa ni rnam par grol ba'i lam gyis so //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa ma mchis @164b pa ni rnam par grol ba'i lam gyis so //
translated: And no clear knowledge is in the sense of the path of liberation.

original: de ltar de kho na nyid du ma yin no zhes bya ba ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar de kho na nyid du ma yin no zhes bya ba ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Thus, in reality, there is none means because of complete purification,

original: stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: which is to say, because of emptiness.

original: kun rdzong tu thams cad yod do zhes smras pa ni bcom ldan 'das bdag mu ma mchis pas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzong tu thams cad yod do zhes smras pa ni bcom ldan 'das bdag mu ma mchis pas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The statement, Conventionally, all exists, is the passage beginning Lord, since there is no end to beings.

original: ma brtags pa gcig pu na nyams dga' ba rgyu snga ma snga ma'i bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin mu med pas gzugs la sogs pa mu med par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ma brtags pa gcig pu na nyams dga' ba rgyu snga ma snga ma'i bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin mu med pas gzugs la sogs pa mu med par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that form, etc. should be known to be limitless because of the limitless nature of the identity of each preceding cause, when not examined.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rigs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i skye ba dang bral ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rigs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i skye ba dang bral ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of complete purity means because of the absence of birth that accords with reasoning.

original: lam shes pa nyid nye bar bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de'i gang de ltar rtogs pa de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol te /
analyzed: lam shes pa nyid nye bar bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de'i gang de ltar rtogs pa de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol te /
translated: In order to include knowledge of the path, he says, Blessed One, the bodhisattva mahāsattva who realizes that in that way, etc.

original: de ltar bshad ma thag pa'i mog mog por byed pa la sogs pa'i rim pas rtogs shing khong du chud pa gang yin pa de ni nyed pa med pa nyid kyis byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam shes pa nyid kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin
analyzed: de ltar bshad ma thag pa'i mog mog por byed pa la sogs pa'i rim pas rtogs shing khong du chud pa gang yin pa de ni nyed pa med pa nyid kyis byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam shes pa nyid kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin
translated: That realization and comprehension through the process of making pale, etc., as just explained, is the perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattvas' knowledge of the path, because it is without obscuration.

original: pa yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: pa yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that it is the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bshad pa mngon par rtogs pa rgyan gyi snang ba las lam shes pa ste skabs gnyis pa'o; ;
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bshad pa mngon par rtogs pa rgyan gyi snang ba las lam shes pa ste skabs gnyis pa'o; ;
translated: This concludes the section on the knowledge of the path from the Illumination of the Ornament of the Middle Way, a commentary on the perfection of wisdom.

original: // gzhi thams cad yongs su shes pa med par lam yang dag par yongs su shes par mi 'gyur bas thams cad shes pa nyid brjod ba'i don du 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas pa ni /
analyzed: // gzhi thams cad yongs su shes pa med par lam yang dag par yongs su shes par mi 'gyur bas thams cad shes pa nyid brjod ba'i don du 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas pa ni /
translated: Since the path cannot be correctly understood without understanding all bases, in order to express the knowledge of all, it does not abide in saṃsāra or nirvāṇa.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so ;
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so ;
translated: To express this, it says “This perfection of wisdom . . .” and so forth.

original: / sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dus gsum pa'i chos rnams skye ba med pa'i rnam par mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pas nyan thos la sogs pa'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir lkog tu gyur pa ste /
analyzed: / sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dus gsum pa'i chos rnams skye ba med pa'i rnam par mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pas nyan thos la sogs pa'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir lkog tu gyur pa ste /
translated: The perfection of wisdom of the buddhas and bodhisattvas is the object of the buddhas alone because it is the realization of the equality of the nonarising of phenomena of the three times.

original: bskal pa'i rang bzhin can gang yin pa 'di ni tshu rol gyi 'gram 'khor bar ma yin te shes rab kyis nyes dmigs mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bskal pa'i rang bzhin can gang yin pa 'di ni tshu rol gyi 'gram 'khor bar ma yin te shes rab kyis nyes dmigs mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not on this side, in samsara, because it sees the faults through wisdom.

original: pha rol gyi 'gram mya ngan las 'das par ma yin te brtse bas gzhan gyi don byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pha rol gyi 'gram mya ngan las 'das par ma yin te brtse bas gzhan gyi don byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not on the other side, in nirvana, because it acts for the sake of others through compassion.

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis las ma gtogs par dbus su yang gnas pa ma yin @165a * //
analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis las ma gtogs par dbus su yang gnas pa ma yin @165a * //
translated: It does not stand between the two, in samsara and nirvana,

original: te dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: te dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is non-substantial.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni shes rab dang snying rje dag yang dag par rtogs pas 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyi gar dmigs pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni shes rab dang snying rje dag yang dag par rtogs pas 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyi gar dmigs pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is utterly pure, because of the realization of wisdom and compassion, it is free from the reference to both samsara and nirvana.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As has been said:

original: tshu rol pha rol mtha' la min //
analyzed: tshu rol pha rol mtha' la min //
translated: Not on this side, not on the other side,

original: de dag bar na mi gnas pa //
analyzed: de dag bar na mi gnas pa //
translated: not between the two,

original: dus rnams mnyam pa nyid shes phyir //
analyzed: dus rnams mnyam pa nyid shes phyir //
translated: because of the knowledge of the equality of the times,

original: shes rab pha rol phyin par 'dod //
analyzed: shes rab pha rol phyin par 'dod //
translated: it is accepted as the perfection of wisdom.

original: ces gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ces gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is the meaning of the above citation.🔽Since the sravakas and so on do not know the three times to be equality, they are far from the perfection of wisdom.

original: kun shes pa nyid kyi skabs su bzlog ste bstan pas nyan thos la sogs pa la ni dus gsum mnyam pa nyid du shes pa med pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ring bar gyur pa yin pas rang gi rtogs pa
analyzed: kun shes pa nyid kyi skabs su bzlog ste bstan pas nyan thos la sogs pa la ni dus gsum mnyam pa nyid du shes pa med pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ring bar gyur pa yin pas rang gi rtogs pa
translated: Therefore, the perfection of wisdom is to be understood as mere realization of the self, since it is devoid of compassion and wisdom.

original: tsam gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni snying brtse ba dang shes rab dang bral ba yin pa'i phyir dngos po dang dngos po med par dmigs pa nyid kyis 'khor ba 'am mya ngan las 'das pa la yin par shes par bya'o ;🔽/ de bzhin du 'og ma rnams la yang la lar ni rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo nas /🔽la lar ni ldog pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: tsam gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni snying brtse ba dang shes rab dang bral ba yin pa'i phyir dngos po dang dngos po med par dmigs pa nyid kyis 'khor ba 'am mya ngan las 'das pa la yin par shes par bya'o ; / de bzhin du 'og ma rnams la yang la lar ni rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo nas / la lar ni ldog pa'i sgo nas /
translated: It is to be understood that in some places the perfection of wisdom is taught through the forward order, in some places through the reverse order, and in some places through both the forward and reverse orders.

original: la lar ni gnyi ga'i sgo nas kyang ston pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: la lar ni gnyi ga'i sgo nas kyang ston pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: It is to be understood that in some places the perfection of wisdom is taught through the forward order, in some places through the reverse order, and in some places through both the forward and reverse orders.

original: rten cing 'brel 'byung gang yin pa //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel 'byung gang yin pa //
translated: Whatever is dependently arisen

original: de nyid khyod ni stong par bzhed //
analyzed: de nyid khyod ni stong par bzhed //
translated: You accept that as emptiness.

original: ces bya ba'i tshul gyis na dus gsum mnyam pa nyid du shes pa ni dngos po'i don rtogs pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: ces bya ba'i tshul gyis na dus gsum mnyam pa nyid du shes pa ni dngos po'i don rtogs pa nyid yin la /
translated: Thus, the knowledge of the equality of the three times is itself the realization of the meaning of things.

original: de yang thams cad la yod pa nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: de yang thams cad la yod pa nyid ma yin nam /
translated: And is that not present in everyone?

original: ci ltar na nyan thos la sogs pa yang dag pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las ring bar gyur pa yin zhen /
