analyzed: ci ltar na nyan thos la sogs pa yang dag pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las ring bar gyur pa yin zhen /
translated: How is it that the śrāvakas and so on are far from the perfection of correct wisdom?

original: bcom ldan 'das de ltar yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol pa yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ltar yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol pa yin te /
translated: The Blessed One, in the same way, etc.

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni dngos po la sogs pa gzhan gyi rnam pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni dngos po la sogs pa gzhan gyi rnam pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: The word “also” indicates not only other aspects such as things,

original: 'on kyang de ltar gang du yang mi gnas so zhes mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan ma dang ldan pas kyang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽'dor bar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'on kyang de ltar gang du yang mi gnas so zhes mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan ma dang ldan pas kyang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // 'dor bar 'gyur /
translated: but also those who possess the signs of clinging, thinking “It does not abide anywhere in that way.”🔽They will be rejected.

original: ring du bgyid par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ring du bgyid par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: They will be far away.

original: de'i tshe dang dus phyi ma dag tu go rims bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe dang dus phyi ma dag tu go rims bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: At that time and in the future, they should be explained in order.

original: mtshan mar shes pas rgyal ba'i yum las ring bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba 'di la rgyu ci zhig yod snyam du dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
analyzed: mtshan mar shes pas rgyal ba'i yum las ring bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba 'di la rgyu ci zhig yod snyam du dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
translated: What is the reason for the statement in the Mother of the Victorious Ones that one goes far away through the knowledge of signs? The doubt that this gives rise to is resolved by Why is that?

original: rab 'byor ming las kyang zhes @165b bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: rab 'byor ming las kyang zhes @165b bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Subsequently, Subhūti, it is because of the name... and so forth is stated.

original: de la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas btags pa tsam ni ming ngo //
analyzed: de la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas btags pa tsam ni ming ngo //
translated: Among those, the mere designation such as perfection of wisdom and so forth is the name.

original: kun brtags pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po ni mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: kun brtags pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po ni mtshan ma'o //
translated: The entity that has the characteristic of the imputed and so forth is the sign.

original: zhen pa'i gnas su phyin ci log pa ni chags pa'o //
analyzed: zhen pa'i gnas su phyin ci log pa ni chags pa'o //
translated: The attachment to the abode of clinging is clinging.

original: 'di skad du sgyu ma mkhan gyi sbrul pa'i dngos po snang ba la de'i rang gi ngo bo mi shes pa dag dngos por mngon por zhen pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med par mi snang ba de bzhin du dge ba'i bshes gnyen la sogs pa thabs mkhas
analyzed: 'di skad du sgyu ma mkhan gyi sbrul pa'i dngos po snang ba la de'i rang gi ngo bo mi shes pa dag dngos por mngon por zhen pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med par mi snang ba de bzhin du dge ba'i bshes gnyen la sogs pa thabs mkhas
translated: In the same way that an illusory object created by a magician appears, but those who do not know its nature conceive it to be a real thing, and thus it does not appear to be essenceless,🔽in the same way, because they lack skill in means and🔽because they lack the right conditions, when they understand that things are not real, they become attached to the characteristics of what they have observed.

original: pa dang dang bral ba'i phyir mchan ma dang ldan par rtogs pa na phyin ci log gi mtshan nyid dmigs pa la chags par gyur pas na dngos po'i rang bzhin ma shes pa'i nyan thos la sogs pa rnams la ni mnyam pa nyid du yongs su shes pa
analyzed: pa dang dang bral ba'i phyir mchan ma dang ldan par rtogs pa na phyin ci log gi mtshan nyid dmigs pa la chags par gyur pas na dngos po'i rang bzhin ma shes pa'i nyan thos la sogs pa rnams la ni mnyam pa nyid du yongs su shes pa
translated: Thus, because they do not understand the nature of things, the śrāvakas and so on do not have a complete understanding of sameness.

original: med pa de bas na de dag la rgyal ba'i yum ring bar gyur pa yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: med pa de bas na de dag la rgyal ba'i yum ring bar gyur pa yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is said that for them the Mother of the Victorious Ones is far away.

original: byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa dngos po la mngon par zhen pa'i 'khrul ba'i mtshan bsal ba rnams kyis ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos yongs su shes pa nyid de'i mnyam pa nyid du yongs su shes pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa dngos po la mngon par zhen pa'i 'khrul ba'i mtshan bsal ba rnams kyis ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos yongs su shes pa nyid de'i mnyam pa nyid du yongs su shes pa yin te /
translated: For the Bodhisattvas and others who are free from the signs of error that consist in the addiction to entities, the thorough knowledge of form, etc. is the thorough knowledge of their sameness.

original: de'i phyir de dag la yum 'di yang dag par nye bar gyur par don gyi shugs kyis bstan to zhes smras pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag la yum 'di yang dag par nye bar gyur par don gyi shugs kyis bstan to zhes smras pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the Mother is also taught by the force of the meaning to be present for them.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras /
translated: The Lord has said, etc.

original: chags pa 'di dag kyang zhes bya ba ni ming la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chags pa 'di dag kyang zhes bya ba ni ming la sogs pa'o //
translated: These attachments are to name, etc.

original: ji tsam du zhes smos pas ni shin tu rnam par dag pa la sogs bsdu'o //
analyzed: ji tsam du zhes smos pas ni shin tu rnam par dag pa la sogs bsdu'o //
translated: The phrase, to the extent that, includes the very pure, etc.

original: legs par bshad cing zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi lung dang rtogs pa las bzlog te gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: legs par bshad cing zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi lung dang rtogs pa las bzlog te gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Well taught means that it is taught in contrast to the scriptures and realizations of the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas.

original: legs par bstan te zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po'i lung yongs su rdzogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: legs par bstan te zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po'i lung yongs su rdzogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Well taught” means that the scriptures of the Great Vehicle are complete.

original: shin tu mthar gtugs pa zhes bya ba ni yon tan ma lus pa'i rab kyi mthar thug pa rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: shin tu mthar gtugs pa zhes bya ba ni yon tan ma lus pa'i rab kyi mthar thug pa rtogs pa yin no //
translated: “Ultimate” means that the realization of all good qualities is complete.

original: 'di dag nyid ni nyan thos dang byang chub sems dpa'i dbye ba las zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag nyid ni nyan thos dang byang chub sems dpa'i dbye ba las zhes bya'o //
translated: These are the differences between the disciples and the bodhisattvas.

original: de skad du yang /🔽de ni mtshan mar dmigs sgo nas //
analyzed: de skad du yang / de ni mtshan mar dmigs sgo nas //
translated: As it is said:🔽They are far away through the apprehension of signs

original: thabs ma yin pas ring ba ste //
analyzed: thabs ma yin pas ring ba ste //
translated: and through the lack of skill in means.

original: de ni thabs la mkhas pa yis //🔽yang dag nye ba nyid du bshad //
analyzed: de ni thabs la mkhas pa yis // yang dag nye ba nyid du bshad //
translated: But through skill in means

original: ces gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ces gsungs pa yin no //
translated: they are said to be truly near.🔽Thus, although the Mother Scripture is to be practiced for a long time, it is the antidote for the disciples, etc.,

original: de ltar yum las ring bar rjes su bsgrub pa ni nyan thos la sogs pa rnams kyi gnyen po nyid yin yang dngos por dmigs pa phyin ci log tu 'jug pa nyid kyis spang bar bya ba yin @166a * //
analyzed: de ltar yum las ring bar rjes su bsgrub pa ni nyan thos la sogs pa rnams kyi gnyen po nyid yin yang dngos por dmigs pa phyin ci log tu 'jug pa nyid kyis spang bar bya ba yin @166a * //
translated: but it is to be abandoned because it is engaged in the error of objectifying things.

original: pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin par bstan pa'i phyir tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor chags pa gang yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin par bstan pa'i phyir tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor chags pa gang yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: In order to teach that it is the adversary of the bodhisattvas, it is said: “Venerable Subhuti, what is attachment?”

original: stong pa'i zhes bya ba ni mu stegs kyis yongs su brtags pa'i bdag dang bral ba'o snyam du shes pa ni zhes 'og nas 'chad pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: stong pa'i zhes bya ba ni mu stegs kyis yongs su brtags pa'i bdag dang bral ba'o snyam du shes pa ni zhes 'og nas 'chad pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: “Empty” means free from the self imagined by the heterodox.

original: sems dang po bskyed pas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pas zhes bya ba la /
translated: “By the first production of the thought” means

original: 'dir sems bskyed pas ni sbyin pa la sogs pa byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos nye bar mtshon pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir sems bskyed pas ni sbyin pa la sogs pa byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos nye bar mtshon pa'o //
translated: Here, the production of the thought indicates the factors of enlightenment such as generosity.

original: 'di tsam zhes bya ba ni tshad med pa la sogs pa grangs kyis mchod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di tsam zhes bya ba ni tshad med pa la sogs pa grangs kyis mchod pa'o //
translated: “This much” refers to worship by number such as the immeasurables.

original: ji ltar na sems bskyed pa chags pa yin zhes smras pa ni /
analyzed: ji ltar na sems bskyed pa chags pa yin zhes smras pa ni /
translated: How is the production of the thought attachment?

original: 'phags pa rab 'byor rnam grangs gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa rab 'byor rnam grangs gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is said: “Noble Subhuti, by what method?” and so on.

original: phyin ci log tu 'jug pas na koo shi ka gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu 'jug pas na koo shi ka gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Because of engaging in error, it is said Kausika, if and so on.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i sems dang po'o zhes de ltar mngon par zhen pa'i tshul gyis gang gi tshe byang chub sems de yang dag par shes shing de bzhin du byang chub kyi sems dang po 'di yongs su bsngo bar bya'o zhes mngon par zhen pa'i tshul
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i sems dang po'o zhes de ltar mngon par zhen pa'i tshul gyis gang gi tshe byang chub sems de yang dag par shes shing de bzhin du byang chub kyi sems dang po 'di yongs su bsngo bar bya'o zhes mngon par zhen pa'i tshul
translated: When that thought of enlightenment is known in such a way, and when this first thought of enlightenment is thus dedicated, thinking I will dedicate it in this way, then at that time, by this method, it is attached.

original: gyis gang gi tshe yongs su bsngo ba de'i tshe rnam grangs 'dis chags pa yin no zhes bya ba ni ngag gi don to //
analyzed: gyis gang gi tshe yongs su bsngo ba de'i tshe rnam grangs 'dis chags pa yin no zhes bya ba ni ngag gi don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the sentence.

original: ci'i phyir de ltar phyin ci log yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de ltar phyin ci log yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it so erroneous?

original: rigs kyi bu 'am rigs kyi bu mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'am rigs kyi bu mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: It is said son of a good family or daughter of a good family and so on.

original: yongs su bsngo bar mi nus so zhes bya ba ni sems kyi rang bzhin ma skyes pa nyid ni ji skad bshad pa'i dbye ba rnam pa bcu gnyis kyis phye ba'i yongs su bsngo ba'i yid la byed pas yongs su bsngo bar mi nus so //
analyzed: yongs su bsngo bar mi nus so zhes bya ba ni sems kyi rang bzhin ma skyes pa nyid ni ji skad bshad pa'i dbye ba rnam pa bcu gnyis kyis phye ba'i yongs su bsngo ba'i yid la byed pas yongs su bsngo bar mi nus so //
translated: One cannot dedicate with the mental activity of dedication that is divided into the twelve aspects as explained above.

original: 'di nye bar mtshon pa yin pa'i phyir gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin gyis yang dag par shes par yang mi nus so zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di nye bar mtshon pa yin pa'i phyir gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin gyis yang dag par shes par yang mi nus so zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: One should understand that one cannot know the nature of the perfection of wisdom as either one or many, because this is an illustration.

original: yang dag par shes shing yongs su bsngo na zhes bya ba'i tshig gnyis kyi skabs su bab pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag par shes shing yongs su bsngo na zhes bya ba'i tshig gnyis kyi skabs su bab pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the two phrases “knowing perfectly” and “dedicating” are in the proper sequence.

original: 'di skad du gang gi phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po rnams kyi stong pa nyid dang dus gsum pa'i chos zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa gnyis ka'i gnas su gyur pa rnams kyi 'das pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid dang /
analyzed: 'di skad du gang gi phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po rnams kyi stong pa nyid dang dus gsum pa'i chos zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa gnyis ka'i gnas su gyur pa rnams kyi 'das pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid dang /
translated: This is what is being said: because the emptiness of the form and other aggregates and the three times, which are the basis of both the contaminated and the uncontaminated, are the nature of the past, etc.,

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs rnams rjes su sgrub pa la /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs rnams rjes su sgrub pa la /
translated: The perception of the reality of the practice of the factors of enlightenment such as generosity is the counteragent to the error.

original: de kho na nyid du dmigs pa'i 'du shes ni phyin ci log tu 'jug pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin @166b pa de'i phyir 'di dag gi rang bzhin de nyid ni yang dag par shes par mi nus so zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de kho na nyid du dmigs pa'i 'du shes ni phyin ci log tu 'jug pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin @166b pa de'i phyir 'di dag gi rang bzhin de nyid ni yang dag par shes par mi nus so zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is said that their reality cannot be known correctly.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And it is said:🔽The emptiness of the aggregates such as form,🔽the dharmas included in the three times,

original: gzugs sogs phung po stong nyid dang // dus gsum gtogs pa'i chos rnams dang // sbyin sogs byang chub phyogs rnams la //🔽spyod pa'i 'du shes mi mthun phyogs //
analyzed: gzugs sogs phung po stong nyid dang // dus gsum gtogs pa'i chos rnams dang // sbyin sogs byang chub phyogs rnams la // spyod pa'i 'du shes mi mthun phyogs //
translated: and the factors of enlightenment such as generosity,

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: the perception of practice is the counteragent.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ni ji skad bshad pa'i don las bzlog pa gnyen po'i phyogs yin par ni koo shi ka de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ni ji skad bshad pa'i don las bzlog pa gnyen po'i phyogs yin par ni koo shi ka de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod do //
translated: For the bodhisattvas, the opposite of the previously explained meaning is the counteragent. This is stated by “Kausika, therefore…” and so on.

original: gang gi phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs spang bar bya ba yin la de bas na yang dag pa'i rjes su rtogs pas te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs spang bar bya ba yin la de bas na yang dag pa'i rjes su rtogs pas te /
translated: Because the adverse factors are to be relinquished, therefore, through correct realization,

original: sbyin par bya ba dang sbyin pa po dang len pa la sogs pa mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sbyin pa la sogs pa gzhan dag la yang dag par bstan pa la sogs pa bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sbyin par bya ba dang sbyin pa po dang len pa la sogs pa mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sbyin pa la sogs pa gzhan dag la yang dag par bstan pa la sogs pa bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: one should teach generosity, etc. to others through the method of non-apprehending the gift, giver, and receiver, etc. This is the meaning.

original: de ltar na bdag nyid la yang gnod pa mi byed cing zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ltar na bdag nyid la yang gnod pa mi byed cing zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Thus, one does not harm oneself.

original: de bzhin du yang dag par rtogs pa'i tshul gyis sbyin pa la sogs pa yang rang nyid gnas pa'i phyir bdag nye bar dmigs pa'i phyin ci log gi khyad par gyis rnam par 'jig par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang dag par rtogs pa'i tshul gyis sbyin pa la sogs pa yang rang nyid gnas pa'i phyir bdag nye bar dmigs pa'i phyin ci log gi khyad par gyis rnam par 'jig par mi byed pa'o //
translated: In the same way, through the method of correct realization, one does not destroy generosity, etc. by the special error of self-apprehension, in order to maintain oneself.

original: 'di dag ces bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa la dmigs pa sngar brjod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ces bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa la dmigs pa sngar brjod pa'o //
translated: These refers to the previously mentioned objects such as form.

original: chags pa shin tu rags pa chos nyid dang mi 'gal bar ston pas legs so legs so zhes bya ba byin te /
analyzed: chags pa shin tu rags pa chos nyid dang mi 'gal bar ston pas legs so legs so zhes bya ba byin te /
translated: He gave the approval Excellent, excellent! to the teaching of the very gross attachment that does not contradict reality.

original: chags pa rab tu phra ba'i don du gsungs pa ni rab 'byor de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chags pa rab tu phra ba'i don du gsungs pa ni rab 'byor de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The statement of the meaning of very subtle attachment is Subhuti, therefore, etc.

original: mtshan mar yid la byed na zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi sku la sogs par dmigs pas mngon sum du phyogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan mar yid la byed na zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi sku la sogs par dmigs pas mngon sum du phyogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If one attends to the sign means that one attends to the objective sign of the form body, etc., and thus makes it present.

original: yang ji ltar na de lta bu chags pa yin par bshad ce na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar na de lta bu chags pa yin par bshad ce na /
translated: Moreover, how is that explained as attachment?

original: rab 'byor mtshan ma ji srid pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: rab 'byor mtshan ma ji srid pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Subhuti, as far as there is a sign, etc. is stated.

original: skabs kyi don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: skabs kyi don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of the context is this:

original: bdag nyid la sogs pa med par rtogs pas 'khor gsum rnam par dag pas sbyin pa la sogs pa la rang gzhan nges par sbyor ba ni yang dag par zhugs pa yin pa'i phyir dang / chags pa'i tshogs kyi gnas thams cad bkag pas blang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir rnam pa thams cad du gnyen po yin no //🔽da bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa yid la byed pa la sogs pa ni bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi rgyu yin pa nyid kyi gnyen @167a * //
analyzed: bdag nyid la sogs pa med par rtogs pas 'khor gsum rnam par dag pas sbyin pa la sogs pa la rang gzhan nges par sbyor ba ni yang dag par zhugs pa yin pa'i phyir dang / chags pa'i tshogs kyi gnas thams cad bkag pas blang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir rnam pa thams cad du gnyen po yin no // da bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa yid la byed pa la sogs pa ni bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi rgyu yin pa nyid kyi gnyen @167a * //
translated: Since one is definitely engaged in generosity and so on for oneself and others by means of the pure three spheres, due to the realization of the absence of self and so on, it is the antidote in all aspects because it is to be adopted since it stops all the abodes of the mass of attachment.

original: po yin na yang chags pa phra mo'i ngo bo nyid kyis rnam pa thams cad du gnyen po'i phyogs ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: po yin na yang chags pa phra mo'i ngo bo nyid kyis rnam pa thams cad du gnyen po'i phyogs ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The mental attentions of the tathāgatas and so on are the cause of the accumulation of merit, and although they are antidotes, they are not the side of the antidote in all aspects because they are by nature subtle attachment.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As it is said:

original: sbyin la sogs la ngar 'dzin med //
analyzed: sbyin la sogs la ngar 'dzin med //
translated: There is no grasping at “I” in generosity and so on,

original: gzhan dag de la sbyor byed pa //
analyzed: gzhan dag de la sbyor byed pa //
translated: but others are engaged in that.

original: da ni chags pa'i mtha' 'gog pas //🔽rgyal la sogs la chags pa phra //
analyzed: da ni chags pa'i mtha' 'gog pas // rgyal la sogs la chags pa phra //
translated: Now, since the extreme of attachment is stopped,

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: attachment to the victors and so on is subtle.

original: yang ji ltar chags pa phra mo mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes pas bsu nas /
analyzed: yang ji ltar chags pa phra mo mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes pas bsu nas /
translated: This is the question raised by the phrase “why is it so?”

original: rab 'byor mtshan ma las ni chags pa 'byung ste zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: rab 'byor mtshan ma las ni chags pa 'byung ste zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Subhuti, attachment arises from signs.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says “in that case,” etc.

original: de kho na nyid ni 'di yin no zhes nges par gzung bas mtshan mar byar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de kho na nyid ni 'di yin no zhes nges par gzung bas mtshan mar byar mi rung ngo //
translated: Since it is ascertained that this is the way things really are, it is not suitable to be taken as a sign.

original: yang dang yang du yul du byed pas dmigs par byar mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni khyad par ro //
analyzed: yang dang yang du yul du byed pas dmigs par byar mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni khyad par ro //
translated: It is not suitable to be taken as an object, since it is not an object of repeated experience. This is the distinction.

original: de ni mthong ba dang thos pa dang rtogs pa dang rnam par rig pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pas blta bas mthong ba'o //
analyzed: de ni mthong ba dang thos pa dang rtogs pa dang rnam par rig pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pas blta bas mthong ba'o //
translated: It is not seen, heard, discerned, or cognized. “ Seen” is by the eye consciousness.

original: rna ba'i rnam par shes pas nyan pas thos pa'o //
analyzed: rna ba'i rnam par shes pas nyan pas thos pa'o //
translated: “ Heard” is by the ear consciousness.

original: sna dang lce dang lus kyi rnam par shes pas nyams su myong ba'i phyir rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: sna dang lce dang lus kyi rnam par shes pas nyams su myong ba'i phyir rtogs pa'o //
translated: It is realized because it is experienced by the nose, tongue, and body consciousnesses.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pas nye bar dmigs pas rnam par rig pa nyid ni de ma yin no zhes re re dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pas nye bar dmigs pas rnam par rig pa nyid ni de ma yin no zhes re re dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: It is not just a representation because it is perceived by the mental consciousness.

original: 'di nyid shes bya dang shes pa zab pa'i dbye bas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di nyid shes bya dang shes pa zab pa'i dbye bas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol ba yin te /
translated: This very [emptiness] is the profound distinction between the object of knowledge and the knower.

original: rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo ste de bzhin nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo ste de bzhin nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Nature means one's own essence, which is the meaning of suchness.

original: dben pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni nye bar dmigs pa thams cad kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dben pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni nye bar dmigs pa thams cad kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of being isolated means being empty of all objects of perception.

original: rang bzhin zab pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes pa'i ngo bo nyid ni rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa yin pas nyan thos la sogs pa'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir zab pa yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin zab pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes pa'i ngo bo nyid ni rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa yin pas nyan thos la sogs pa'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir zab pa yin no //
translated: The profound nature means that the essence of consciousness is by nature unarisen, so it is profound because it is not the object of śrāvakas and so on.

original: rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang rang bzhin dben pas na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang rang bzhin dben pas na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because they are naturally isolated.

original: go rims bzhin du mi 'gyur ba dang / phyin ci ma log par yongs su grub pa dang ; yongs su ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du mi 'gyur ba dang / phyin ci ma log par yongs su grub pa dang ; yongs su ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that they are unchanging, unmistaken, and unfabricated, respectively.

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: gang gi phyir chos thams cad kyi rigs shes bya'i rang bzhin no ngo bo nyid kho nas stong pa nyid yin pas de dag zab pa yin pa de'i phyir tshul 'ga' zhig gis dmigs pa ni chags pa phra mo yin pas mi mthun pa'i @167b phyogs yin no
analyzed: gang gi phyir chos thams cad kyi rigs shes bya'i rang bzhin no ngo bo nyid kho nas stong pa nyid yin pas de dag zab pa yin pa de'i phyir tshul 'ga' zhig gis dmigs pa ni chags pa phra mo yin pas mi mthun pa'i @167b phyogs yin no
translated: Because the nature of all phenomena is emptiness, they are profound. Therefore, any apprehension of them in any way is a subtle attachment and is therefore an opposing factor.

original: zhes brjod pa yin no //🔽de skad du yang /🔽chos kyi lam ni rang bzhin gyis //
analyzed: zhes brjod pa yin no // de skad du yang / chos kyi lam ni rang bzhin gyis //
translated: Thus it is said:🔽The path of phenomena is profound

original: dben ba'i phyir na de zab nyid //
analyzed: dben ba'i phyir na de zab nyid //
translated: because it is naturally isolated.

original: ces gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ces gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: 'o na de ji ltar spang zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de ji ltar spang zhe na /
translated: If that is so, how is it abandoned?

original: rang bzhin dpen pas na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rang bzhin dpen pas na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because they are naturally isolated.

original: dngos bor khas blangs pa'i nyes ba dang bral ba nyid kyis na gang gi phyir rang bzhin gyis dben pa nyid yin pa de bas na phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya ba'o //🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes smos pas na 'o na ni chos thams cad dang dben pa ma yin no zhes rtog pa la /
analyzed: dngos bor khas blangs pa'i nyes ba dang bral ba nyid kyis na gang gi phyir rang bzhin gyis dben pa nyid yin pa de bas na phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya ba'o // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes smos pas na 'o na ni chos thams cad dang dben pa ma yin no zhes rtog pa la /
translated: Since it is free from the fault of accepting things as real, therefore means that it is devoid of intrinsic nature, and so I pay homage to it.

original: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Since it is called the perfection of wisdom, one might think that it is not devoid of all phenomena, and so [the sutra] says, Subhūti, all phenomena are devoid of all phenomena.

original: rang rig pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas na chos thams cad dben pa la rang rig pa'i rang bzhin du rtogs pa med pa'i phyir na ji ltar rang rig pa'i rang bzhin de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir
analyzed: rang rig pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas na chos thams cad dben pa la rang rig pa'i rang bzhin du rtogs pa med pa'i phyir na ji ltar rang rig pa'i rang bzhin de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir
translated: Since it is the nature of self-awareness, one might think, How can the perfection of wisdom be the self-awareness that realizes the emptiness of all phenomena?

original: zhen zhes bya bas bsu nas /
analyzed: zhen zhes bya bas bsu nas /
translated: To dispel that doubt, it says, Why is it so?

original: 'di ltar rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: To that, it says, Subhūti, it is because all phenomena are empty of all phenomena.

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: It is said:

original: gang gi tshe phyi'i dngos por yongs su grub pa med pas na rmi lam la sogs pa dang 'dra bar sos pa'i dbye ba rnam pa sna tshogs par nye bar ston pa'i phyi rol lta bur yongs su bsal ba'i ngo bor rnam par shes pa skye ba yin
analyzed: gang gi tshe phyi'i dngos por yongs su grub pa med pas na rmi lam la sogs pa dang 'dra bar sos pa'i dbye ba rnam pa sna tshogs par nye bar ston pa'i phyi rol lta bur yongs su bsal ba'i ngo bor rnam par shes pa skye ba yin
translated: When external things are not established, consciousness arises in the aspect of external objects that display various kinds of objects, like dreams and so on.🔽Therefore, since the Buddha has realized that wisdom is like an illusion on the conventional level, he has realized that all phenomena are uncreated, empty, and illusionlike, because he is not different from that wisdom.

original: te de bas na ye shes ni kun rdzob tu sgyu ma dang 'dra bar thugs su chud pas de dang tha mi dad pa nyid kyis na chos thams cad ma byas pa stong zhing sgyu ma lta bu'o zhes bcom ldan 'das mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i
analyzed: te de bas na ye shes ni kun rdzob tu sgyu ma dang 'dra bar thugs su chud pas de dang tha mi dad pa nyid kyis na chos thams cad ma byas pa stong zhing sgyu ma lta bu'o zhes bcom ldan 'das mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i
translated: Therefore, he has realized that all phenomena are void.

original: phyir / de rnams dben pa nyid du yang thugs su chud do zhes 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: phyir / de rnams dben pa nyid du yang thugs su chud do zhes 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo las /
translated: The noble Descent into Laṅkā Sūtra says:

original: dngos rnams skye ba kun rdzob tu //
analyzed: dngos rnams skye ba kun rdzob tu //
translated: Things arise conventionally.

original: dam pa'i don du rang bzhin med //
analyzed: dam pa'i don du rang bzhin med //
translated: Ultimately, they are essenceless.

original: des na 'di kun bden pa ste //
analyzed: des na 'di kun bden pa ste //
translated: Therefore, all of this is true.

original: dam pa'i don du bden ma yin //
analyzed: dam pa'i don du bden ma yin //
translated: But ultimately, it is not true.

original: zhes gsungs pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas brjod pa yin no //🔽'das ma thag ba'i don gyi de kho na nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das de lta bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas brjod pa yin no // 'das ma thag ba'i don gyi de kho na nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das de lta bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: This is what is being said.

original: de kho na nyid du na mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid du na mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: In order to clarify the meaning of reality that was just mentioned, the Lord said, “Therefore, Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom should be listened to, etc.🔽” The rest is self-evident.

original: legs par smras pa nyid kyis gzhung 'dzugs par mdzad pa ni /
analyzed: legs par smras pa nyid kyis gzhung 'dzugs par mdzad pa ni /
translated: He establishes the text by its excellence, saying,

original: rab 'byor 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “Subhūti, it is thus.

original: rang bzhin ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: rang bzhin ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: ” What is its nature?

original: rang bzhin gang yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽rang bzhin te ngo @168a * //
analyzed: rang bzhin gang yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / rang bzhin te ngo @168a * //
translated: He says, “That which is the nature, etc.🔽” Nature is essence or suchness.

original: po nyid dam de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de nyid dang ni ngo bo nyid dang bral ba'i phyir rang bzhin med pa'o //
analyzed: po nyid dam de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de nyid dang ni ngo bo nyid dang bral ba'i phyir rang bzhin med pa'o //
translated: That itself is essenceless because it is free from essence.

original: rang bzhin med pa gang yin pa de ni chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa gang yin pa de ni chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin yin te /
translated: That which is essenceless is the nature of all dharmas.

original: 'di lta ste rang gi mtshan nyid med pas te ngo bo nyid pas mtshan nyid gcig pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di lta ste rang gi mtshan nyid med pas te ngo bo nyid pas mtshan nyid gcig pa'i phyir te /
translated: Thus, because of the absence of their own characteristics, i.e., because of their intrinsic realitylessness, they are of one characteristic.

original: rang bzhin gcig pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang bzhin gcig pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: they are of one nature.

original: 'di nyid nye bar sdud pa ni rab 'byor de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di nyid nye bar sdud pa ni rab 'byor de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: This very point is summarized in the passage beginning “Therefore, Subhuti, etc.”

original: dngos po rnams ni rgyu tha dad pa nyid kyis bskyed pas rang bzhin tha dad pa nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: dngos po rnams ni rgyu tha dad pa nyid kyis bskyed pas rang bzhin tha dad pa nyid ma yin nam /
translated: Since things are produced by the difference of their causes, aren’t they of different natures?🔽How can they be of one characteristic?

original: ji ltar na mtshan nyid gcig pa nyid yin snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
analyzed: ji ltar na mtshan nyid gcig pa nyid yin snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
translated: The doubt is anticipated by “Why is that?”

original: rab 'byor chos kyi rang bzhin ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: rab 'byor chos kyi rang bzhin ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: and the response is given in the passage beginning “Subhuti, the nature of dharmas, etc.”

original: 'di snyam du gang gi phyir dngos po 'di rnams kyi skye ba'i ngo bo nyid ni tshad mas gdon pa nyid yin pa'i phyir bskyed pa'i rgyu tha dad pa dang 'brel ba'i dngos po du ma'i rang bzhin nyid med pa ni 'di dag gi sna tshogs pa'i rang
analyzed: 'di snyam du gang gi phyir dngos po 'di rnams kyi skye ba'i ngo bo nyid ni tshad mas gdon pa nyid yin pa'i phyir bskyed pa'i rgyu tha dad pa dang 'brel ba'i dngos po du ma'i rang bzhin nyid med pa ni 'di dag gi sna tshogs pa'i rang
translated: One should think, Because the nature of the arising of these things is ascertained by a valid cognition, they do not have the nature of many things that are related to different causes of arising. Therefore, their nature is not a nature of variety.

original: bzhin don dam pa ma yin pa de bas na rang bzhin gcig pa nyid yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: bzhin don dam pa ma yin pa de bas na rang bzhin gcig pa nyid yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, their nature is a single nature.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Subhuti, in this way, etc.

original: ji skad du gsungs pa'i rim pas gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad rang bzhin gcig pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa'i rim pas gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad rang bzhin gcig pa kho na yin te /
translated: In accordance with the stated procedure, all phenomena such as form, etc., have a single nature,

original: 'di lta ste rang bzhin med pa'o zhes shes pa dang shes bya mnyam pa nyid gcig par yongs su shes pas ni sngar bshad pa'i chags pa phra mo'i rang bzhin gyis chags pa'i mtha' spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di lta ste rang bzhin med pa'o zhes shes pa dang shes bya mnyam pa nyid gcig par yongs su shes pas ni sngar bshad pa'i chags pa phra mo'i rang bzhin gyis chags pa'i mtha' spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: that is, they have no nature. By knowing the sameness of the knower and the known, one abandons the extreme of attachment in the form of subtle attachment, as explained above.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As it is said:🔽

original: chos rnams rang bzhin gcig par ni //
analyzed: chos rnams rang bzhin gcig par ni //
translated: “The single nature of phenomena

original: zhes pas chags pa spong bar 'gyur //
analyzed: zhes pas chags pa spong bar 'gyur //
translated: is taught to abandon attachment.”

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: is the meaning of this.

original: sngar brjod pa'i chos rang bzhin gyis zab pa yang ji ltar zhes smras pa ni /
analyzed: sngar brjod pa'i chos rang bzhin gyis zab pa yang ji ltar zhes smras pa ni /
translated: As for the profound nature of phenomena that was mentioned above, it is asked, “How?”

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab pa lags sam zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab pa lags sam zhes bya ba ste /
translated: “The Bhagavān, is the perfection of wisdom profound?”

original: zur gyis dris pa yin pas na ji ltar zab ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zur gyis dris pa yin pas na ji ltar zab ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Since this is a roundabout question, it means, “How is it profound?”

original: nam mkha' zab pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa thams cad bsal ba'i mi dmigs pas shes bya mnyam pa nyid du ston par byed pas de'i rang bzhin rtogs par dka' ba nyid du brjod pa de'i phyir na nam mkha'
analyzed: nam mkha' zab pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa thams cad bsal ba'i mi dmigs pas shes bya mnyam pa nyid du ston par byed pas de'i rang bzhin rtogs par dka' ba nyid du brjod pa de'i phyir na nam mkha'
translated: As for the phrase “because space is profound,” since all objects of consciousness are eliminated by non-observation, it reveals the equality of objects of knowledge. Therefore, since it is said that its nature is difficult to realize, it is profound like space.

original: ltar zab pa yin @168b no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ltar zab pa yin @168b no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As it is said:

original: mthong ba la sogs bkag pa yis //
analyzed: mthong ba la sogs bkag pa yis //
translated: Because seeing and so on are negated,

original: de ni rtogs par dka' bar bshad //
analyzed: de ni rtogs par dka' bar bshad //
translated: it is explained as difficult to realize.🔽As for the phrase “because it is not observed,” since the nature of phenomena is not observed, it is profound like space.🔽This is the meaning.

original: ces gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ces gsungs pa yin no //
translated: As it is said:🔽Because it is not observed,🔽it is explained as difficult to realize.

original: yang de'i rang bzhin de ltar rtogs dka' ba'i rgyu gang yin zhes gsol ba ni bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rjes su rtogs bar dga' ba lags sam zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: yang de'i rang bzhin de ltar rtogs dka' ba'i rgyu gang yin zhes gsol ba ni bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rjes su rtogs bar dga' ba lags sam zhes bya ba ste /
translated: “ Bhagavan, is the perfection of wisdom difficult to realize?”

original: 'dir yang snga ma ltar zur gyis 'dri ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang snga ma ltar zur gyis 'dri ba yin no //
translated: Here, as before, the question is asked indirectly.

original: su yang mngon bar rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba med do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: su yang mngon bar rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba med do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “ No one is fully awakened.”

original: gang gi phyir gzugs la sogs pa nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i rnam pa'i bar dag gi rang bzhin ni de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir mngon par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas par bsam pa las 'das pa nyid du 'dod pa de bas
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzugs la sogs pa nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i rnam pa'i bar dag gi rang bzhin ni de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir mngon par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas par bsam pa las 'das pa nyid du 'dod pa de bas
translated: Because the nature of form and so on up to the unshared qualities of a buddha is the essence of suchness, it is asserted that it is beyond thought and fully awakened.

original: na 'di ni rtogs par dka' ba'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: na 'di ni rtogs par dka' ba'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, this is difficult to realize.🔽This is the meaning.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As it is said:

original: gzugs la sogs par mi shes phyir //🔽de ni bsam mi khyab par 'dod //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs par mi shes phyir // de ni bsam mi khyab par 'dod //
translated: Because it is not known as form and so on,

original: ces gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ces gsungs pa yin no //
translated: it is asserted to be inconceivable.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid ci'i phyir zhes gsol ba ni bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid lags sam zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid ci'i phyir zhes gsol ba ni bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid lags sam zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Blessed One, is the perfection of wisdom itself inconceivable?

original: ci zhes bya ba lhag ma yin no //
analyzed: ci zhes bya ba lhag ma yin no //
translated: What is?🔽It is not to be known by the mind, it is not to be realized by the mind.

original: sems kyis shes par bya ba ma yin sems kyis rtogs par bya ba ma yin zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir ma byas pa nyid kyis ni mos pa'i yid la byed pas lhag par mos pa yin pas sems kyis shes par bya ba ma yin la /🔽de kho na nyid yid la byed pas yongs su shes pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: sems kyis shes par bya ba ma yin sems kyis rtogs par bya ba ma yin zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir ma byas pa nyid kyis ni mos pa'i yid la byed pas lhag par mos pa yin pas sems kyis shes par bya ba ma yin la / de kho na nyid yid la byed pas yongs su shes pa ma yin pas /
translated: Because it is not made, it is not to be known by the mind, since it is to be believed by the mental activity of faith.🔽It is not to be fully understood by the mind, since it is not to be understood by the mental activity of reality.

original: sems kyis rtogs par bya ba ma yin pa de bas na bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems kyis rtogs par bya ba ma yin pa de bas na bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore it is inconceivable. This is the meaning.🔽How is it not made? The question is:

original: ma byas pa nyid ji ltar zhes gsol ba ni bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma bgyis pa lags sam zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ma byas pa nyid ji ltar zhes gsol ba ni bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma bgyis pa lags sam zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Blessed One, is the perfection of wisdom itself not made?

original: ci zhes pas kha bkang ngo //
analyzed: ci zhes pas kha bkang ngo //
translated: What is the meaning of the phrase “because the agent is not perceived”?

original: byed pa po mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni byed pa po'i rgyu mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa po mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni byed pa po'i rgyu mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning is that the cause of the agent is not perceived.🔽The relation of cause and effect is established by perception and non-perception.🔽Now, if the effect is not perceived, the cause is not perceived.🔽If the effect is perceived, the cause is perceived.🔽But if the effect is not perceived, the cause is not perceived.🔽For example, if the sprout is not perceived, the seed is not perceived.

original: 'di ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni mngon sum dang mi dmigs pas sgrub byed can yin par brjod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni mngon sum dang mi dmigs pas sgrub byed can yin par brjod do //
translated: If the sprout is perceived, the seed is perceived.

original: de la re zhig rnam pa med pas mi rtogs te /
analyzed: de la re zhig rnam pa med pas mi rtogs te /
translated: But if the sprout is not perceived, the seed is not perceived.🔽In the same way, if the effect of consciousness is not perceived, consciousness is not perceived.

original: sems can thams cad rig pa tsam du mtshungs pas na gang las sa bon shes pa las myu gu shes la /
analyzed: sems can thams cad rig pa tsam du mtshungs pas na gang las sa bon shes pa las myu gu shes la /
translated: If the effect of consciousness is perceived, consciousness is perceived.

original: de ma shes pas de mi shes pas nas @169a * //
analyzed: de ma shes pas de mi shes pas nas @169a * //
translated: But if the effect of consciousness is not perceived, consciousness is not perceived.🔽What is the effect of consciousness?

original: bon ni rgyu yin la myu gu ni 'bras bu yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ba /
analyzed: bon ni rgyu yin la myu gu ni 'bras bu yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ba /
translated: The six sense-spheres.🔽What is the cause of the six sense-spheres?🔽Consciousness.🔽What is the cause of consciousness?🔽Name and form.🔽What is the cause of name and form?

original: 'di ni 'di'i shes pa yin gyi 'di ni 'di'i shes pa ni ma yin no zhes gang las rnam par gnas /🔽sa bon las skyes pa'i phyir des sa bon shes pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni 'di'i shes pa yin gyi 'di ni 'di'i shes pa ni ma yin no zhes gang las rnam par gnas / sa bon las skyes pa'i phyir des sa bon shes pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Consciousness.

original: mig las skyes pa de las mig rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig las skyes pa de las mig rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, consciousness is the cause of consciousness.

original: gang las rnam par gnas pa 'dir 'gyur ba /
analyzed: gang las rnam par gnas pa 'dir 'gyur ba /
translated: But how can the mind that is devoid of aspects be the cause of the differentiation of objects?🔽The mind that is devoid of aspects is the cause of the differentiation of objects because it has a special nature that is not shared by other causes.🔽If the mind that is devoid of aspects is the cause of the differentiation of objects, then the mind that is devoid of aspects is the cause of the differentiation of objects because it has a special nature that is not shared by other causes.

original: rnam pa med pa'i sems la yang rgyu'i chos kyis bskyed pa bdag nyid kyi khyad par thun mong ma yin pa 'ga' zhig yod pa yin no zhe na /🔽bdag nyid kyi khyad par zhes bya ba ni rnam pa nyid la ming gzhan btags pa yin na /
analyzed: rnam pa med pa'i sems la yang rgyu'i chos kyis bskyed pa bdag nyid kyi khyad par thun mong ma yin pa 'ga' zhig yod pa yin no zhe na / bdag nyid kyi khyad par zhes bya ba ni rnam pa nyid la ming gzhan btags pa yin na /
translated: If the mind that is devoid of aspects is the cause of the differentiation of objects, then the mind that is devoid of aspects is the cause of the differentiation of objects because it has a special nature that is not shared by other causes.🔽If the mind that is devoid of aspects is the cause of the differentiation of objects, then the mind that is devoid of aspects is the cause of the differentiation of objects because it has a special nature that is not shared by other causes.🔽If the mind that is devoid of aspects is the cause of the differentiation of objects, then the mind that is devoid of aspects is the cause of the differentiation of objects because it has a special nature that is not shared by other causes.🔽If the mind that is devoid of aspects is the cause of the differentiation of objects, then the mind that is devoid of aspects is the cause of the differentiation of objects because it has a special nature that is not shared by other causes.🔽If the mind that is devoid of aspects is the cause of the differentiation of objects, then the mind that is devoid of aspects is the cause of the differentiation of objects because it has a special nature that is not shared by other causes.🔽If the mind that is devoid of aspects is the cause of the differentiation of objects, then the mind that is devoid of aspects is the cause of the differentiation of objects because it has a special nature that is not shared by other causes.🔽If the mind that is devoid of aspects is the cause of the differentiation of objects, then the mind that is devoid of aspects is the cause of the differentiation of objects because it has a special nature that is not shared by other causes.

original: ming gzhan byas pas ni don gzhan du 'gyur bar 'os pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ming gzhan byas pas ni don gzhan du 'gyur bar 'os pa ma yin no //
translated: If the mind that is devoid of aspects is the cause of the differentiation of objects, then the mind that is devoid of aspects is the cause of the differentiation of objects because it has a special nature that is not shared by other causes.

original: de rnam pa ma yin na 'o na de gang yin pa smros shig /🔽nye bar mtshon par dka' ba nyid kyis de 'di'o zhes bstan par mi nus so zhe na /🔽gang kho na las 'di ni sa bon no 'di ni myu gu'o zhes rnam par gnas pa 'dir 'gyur ba de nye bar mtshon pa med na der ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: de rnam pa ma yin na 'o na de gang yin pa smros shig /🔽nye bar mtshon par dka' ba nyid kyis de 'di'o zhes bstan par mi nus so zhe na /🔽gang kho na las 'di ni sa bon no 'di ni myu gu'o zhes rnam par gnas pa 'dir 'gyur ba de nye bar mtshon pa med na der ga la 'gyur te /
translated: If the mind that is devoid of aspects is the cause of the differentiation of objects, then the mind that is devoid of aspects is the cause of the

original: dbyug pa dang rva nye bar mtshon pa med par 'di ni dbyug pa can nam rva can yin no zhes gnas pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dbyug pa dang rva nye bar mtshon pa med par 'di ni dbyug pa can nam rva can yin no zhes gnas pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Without the presence of a stick or horn, it is not possible to say, “This is a stick-holder” or “This is a horn-holder.”

original: rnam pa dang bcas pas kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa dang bcas pas kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it possible to say that the stick-holder or the horn-holder is qualified by the stick or the horn.

original: rnam pa dngos pos khyab pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rnam pa dngos pos khyab pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the form is not pervaded by the thing,

original: zla ba gnyis la sogs pa de med kyang 'di yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zla ba gnyis la sogs pa de med kyang 'di yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: for the form of the stick or the horn exists even when the stick or the horn does not exist.

original: de ltar ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar ni ma yin te /
translated: This is not so,

original: 'di ni 'khrul pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ni 'khrul pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because this is a case of error.

original: gang zhig ma 'khrul pa de ni dngos po med na 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig ma 'khrul pa de ni dngos po med na 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: That which is not an error does not occur when the thing does not exist.

original: gzhan 'khrul pas ni gzhan 'khrul pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba yang legs par ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan 'khrul pas ni gzhan 'khrul pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba yang legs par ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it the case that one error is the cause of another error.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po sgrub pa'i dus na /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po sgrub pa'i dus na /
translated: When the relation of cause and effect is established,

original: 'di ni 'khrul pa'i rnam pa yin la 'di ni ma yin no zhes nges pa'i rgyu mtshan ni tshu rol mthong ba la yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: 'di ni 'khrul pa'i rnam pa yin la 'di ni ma yin no zhes nges pa'i rgyu mtshan ni tshu rol mthong ba la yod pa ma yin la /
translated: there is no reason to determine that this is an erroneous form and that is not.

original: dbang po las 'das pa mthong ba la yang 'di brjod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po las 'das pa mthong ba la yang 'di brjod pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not said that the supersensible is seen.

original: nges pa med par rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po rnam par 'jog pa yang mdzes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nges pa med par rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po rnam par 'jog pa yang mdzes pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not beautiful to posit the relation of cause and effect without certainty.

original: dngos po'i rnam par shes pa yin par yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: dngos po'i rnam par shes pa yin par yang mi 'thad de /
translated: It is not tenable that the consciousness is the form of the object.

original: gal te phyogs gcig gis shes pa shes bya'i rnam pa can yin pas de yongs su gcod par byed na de'i tshe thams cad kyis thams cad rig @169b par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te phyogs gcig gis shes pa shes bya'i rnam pa can yin pas de yongs su gcod par byed na de'i tshe thams cad kyis thams cad rig @169b par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If it is the case that the consciousness is the form of the object because it is the form of the object, then it follows that everything is known by everything,

original: shes pa thams cad dang shes bya nyid la sogs pa dngos po thams cad kyi thun mong gi rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa thams cad dang shes bya nyid la sogs pa dngos po thams cad kyi thun mong gi rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all consciousnesses and all things such as the object are the form of all things in common.

original: shes pa bdag nyid thams cad kyis shes bya'i rnam pa can yin na yang shes bya dag gcig pa nyid kyis rnam par dbye ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shes pa bdag nyid thams cad kyis shes bya'i rnam pa can yin na yang shes bya dag gcig pa nyid kyis rnam par dbye ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir /
translated: Even if the consciousness is the form of the object in all its aspects, because the object is the same as the consciousness, it is not tenable to distinguish them.

original: tha snyad chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha snyad chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, conventional usage would be annihilated.

original: bdag nyid thams cad kyi rig pa rig bya'i rnam pa can yin na ni de med par 'gyur ba'i phyir te shin tu spros pas chog go //
analyzed: bdag nyid thams cad kyi rig pa rig bya'i rnam pa can yin na ni de med par 'gyur ba'i phyir te shin tu spros pas chog go //
translated: If the self were the cognition that is the aspect of the object of cognition, it would not exist when there is no object of cognition.🔽This is enough proliferation.

original: skye bo blo dman pa rnams rjes su 'dzin pas sam gdul bya'i skye bo nye ba'i phyin ci log sbong bar bzhed pas mi mthun pa dang gnyen po dag gi rnam par dbye ba ni ji skad du bshad pa 'di nyid rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: skye bo blo dman pa rnams rjes su 'dzin pas sam gdul bya'i skye bo nye ba'i phyin ci log sbong bar bzhed pas mi mthun pa dang gnyen po dag gi rnam par dbye ba ni ji skad du bshad pa 'di nyid rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Or, in order to take care of those of lesser intelligence, or in order to abandon the error of those disciples who are close, the classification of the discordances and their antidotes should be understood just as it has been explained.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As it is said:

original: de ltar kun shes nyid lugs la //🔽mi mthun gnyen po'i phyogs dag gi /
analyzed: de ltar kun shes nyid lugs la // mi mthun gnyen po'i phyogs dag gi /
translated: Thus, in the system of complete understanding,

original: rnam par dbye ba ma lus pa //🔽ji skad bshad pa 'dir shes bya //
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba ma lus pa // ji skad bshad pa 'dir shes bya //
translated: the classifications of the discordances and their antidotes

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no//🔽de dag rnam par sgom pa'i sbyor ba gang yin zhes sbyor ba'i don du gsol pa ni /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no// de dag rnam par sgom pa'i sbyor ba gang yin zhes sbyor ba'i don du gsol pa ni /
translated: should be understood here as they have been explained.🔽The question about the application of meditating on them is asked in the sense of application:

original: de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Thus, what is the application of meditating on them?

original: gang gi phyir de ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po spang bar bya ba dang / blang bar bya ba yin pa de bas na de'i don du ji ltar spyad par bgyi zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po spang bar bya ba dang / blang bar bya ba yin pa de bas na de'i don du ji ltar spyad par bgyi zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Since thus the adverse and counteragent are to be abandoned and accepted, therefore, for that purpose, how should one practice?

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i sbyor ba gsungs pa ni rab 'byor gal te gzugs la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i sbyor ba gsungs pa ni rab 'byor gal te gzugs la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The application to form, etc. is stated: Subhuti, if one does not practice with form, etc.

original: gang tshe gzugs la mngon par zhen pa'i tshul gyis mi spyod na de'i tshe shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
analyzed: gang tshe gzugs la mngon par zhen pa'i tshul gyis mi spyod na de'i tshe shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
translated: When one does not practice with form in the manner of attachment, then one practices the perfection of wisdom.

original: de bzhin du 'og ma rnams la yang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'og ma rnams la yang shes par bya'o //
translated: So it should be understood for the rest.

original: gzugs la sogs ba mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba'i don du gsungs pa ni gal te gzugs mi rtag pa'o zhes mi spyod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs ba mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba'i don du gsungs pa ni gal te gzugs mi rtag pa'o zhes mi spyod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The application to impermanence, etc. of form, etc. is stated: If one does not practice with the thought, form is impermanent, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa yongs su ma rdzogs pa dang yongs su rdzogs pa'i sbyor ba ni gal te gzugs la sogs pa ma rdzogs pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa yongs su ma rdzogs pa dang yongs su rdzogs pa'i sbyor ba ni gal te gzugs la sogs pa ma rdzogs pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The application of incomplete and complete form, etc. is stated in the passage beginning: “If form, etc. is incomplete, etc.”

original: mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir brtags pa'i gzugs ni yongs su ma rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir brtags pa'i gzugs ni yongs su ma rdzogs pa'o //
translated: Imagined form is incomplete because it is empty of the characteristic of form.

original: yon tan gyi tshogs dang ldan pa'i phyir chos nyid kyi gzugs ni rab tu rdzogs pa'o //🔽de ni gzugs ma yin te zhes bya ba ni chos dang chos can dag @170a * //
analyzed: yon tan gyi tshogs dang ldan pa'i phyir chos nyid kyi gzugs ni rab tu rdzogs pa'o // de ni gzugs ma yin te zhes bya ba ni chos dang chos can dag @170a * //
translated: The form of reality is complete because it possesses the aggregate of virtues.

original: ni blos rnam par brtags pas tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ni blos rnam par brtags pas tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not form, etc. means that the dharma and the possessor of the dharma are different because they are conceptually differentiated by the intellect.

original: gal te de ltar yang mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ba la spyod do zhes 'og nas bshad pa dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te de ltar yang mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ba la spyod do zhes 'og nas bshad pa dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: If one does not practice in this way, one practices the perfection of wisdom. This is to be connected with the explanation that follows.

original: ji skad du gsungs pa'i chos bshad pas khyad par skyes pa nyid kyis bcom ldan 'das gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs ba gsol to //
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa'i chos bshad pas khyad par skyes pa nyid kyis bcom ldan 'das gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs ba gsol to //
translated: The Lord has explained the perfection of wisdom in this way. The Bodhisattva Subhuti, having generated a special understanding through the explanation of the Dharma as taught, asks: “Why, O Lord?” and so on.

original: don gzhan rjod pas rnam pa gzhan bstan pa'i phyir ngo mtshar ba yin te /
analyzed: don gzhan rjod pas rnam pa gzhan bstan pa'i phyir ngo mtshar ba yin te /
translated: It is amazing because it teaches other aspects by expressing other meanings.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar sbyor ba brjod pas chags pa dang bcas pa gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa'i rang bzhin dang chags pa med pa mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi yul brjod pas so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar sbyor ba brjod pas chags pa dang bcas pa gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa'i rang bzhin dang chags pa med pa mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi yul brjod pas so //
translated: For, by expressing the application in that way, it expresses the object of the nature of attachment to form, etc., and the object of the nature of nonattachment to nonapprehension.

original: gzugs la sogs pa la chags pa med pa'i sbyor ba ni rab 'byor gzugs chags ba dang bcas pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa la chags pa med pa'i sbyor ba ni rab 'byor gzugs chags ba dang bcas pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The application of nonattachment to form, etc., is stated in the passage beginning “Subhuti, form is not attached, etc.”

original: chags pa dang bcas pa dang chags pa med pa zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa med pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go ;
analyzed: chags pa dang bcas pa dang chags pa med pa zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa med pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go ;
translated: “Attached” and “nonattached” mean “with an objective reference” and “without an objective reference.”

original: / mngon par zhen par ma byas par ni bsgom par mi nus pa nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: / mngon par zhen par ma byas par ni bsgom par mi nus pa nyid ma yin nam /
translated: But isn’t it impossible to cultivate without taking a stand?

original: ji ltar na 'di skad brjod snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'di skad brjod snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
translated: How can it be said that one should not take a stand?

original: rab 'byor thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te ma chags pa zhes bya ba ni mngon par zhen ba dang bral ba'i phyir ma bcings ma grol ba zhes bya ba'i tshig gnyis ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: rab 'byor thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te ma chags pa zhes bya ba ni mngon par zhen ba dang bral ba'i phyir ma bcings ma grol ba zhes bya ba'i tshig gnyis ni bshad zin to //
translated: Subhuti, the knowledge of all modes, etc. Unattached means free from attachment, because of the absence of the object of attachment. The two words unbound and unfreed have already been explained.

original: yang dag par ma 'das pa'o zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag par ma 'das pa'o zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Not really transcended means that it is the essence of the emptiness of dependent origination.

original: 'di skad du gang gi phyir ji ltar mngon bar zhen pa ni de kho na ma yin pa'i phyir dang de kho na nyid ji lta ngar yang mngon bar ma zhen pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par rtog pas yul du bya bar mi nus pa
analyzed: 'di skad du gang gi phyir ji ltar mngon bar zhen pa ni de kho na ma yin pa'i phyir dang de kho na nyid ji lta ngar yang mngon bar ma zhen pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par rtog pas yul du bya bar mi nus pa
translated: This is what is being said: Because the object of attachment is not the way things really are, and the way things really are is not the object of attachment, the knowledge of all modes cannot be made an object by conceptualization.

original: de'i phyir de la chags pa mi skyed do zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de la chags pa mi skyed do zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, one should not generate attachment to it.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mjug sdud pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mjug sdud pa'o //
translated: Subhuti, thus, etc. is the conclusion.

original: mi 'gyur pa'i sbyor ba ni bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol to //
analyzed: mi 'gyur pa'i sbyor ba ni bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol to //
translated: The unchanging application is stated by the Bhagavat with “Thus, Bhagavat, the perfection of wisdom is not made smaller by the decrease of form, etc.”🔽The object that has the nature of the scriptures is diminished by the end and disappearance of the taught and the non-taught, and likewise, it is increased by the generation in other continuums by the method of not contradicting reasoning and scripture through teaching.

original: gzhung gi bdag nyid can gyi yul ni bstan pa dang ma bstan pa dag gis mthar thug pa dang nub bdag gi sgo nas 'grib par 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin du bstan pas rigs pa dang lung dang mi 'gal ba'i tshul @170b gyis rgyud gzhan la bskyed pas na 'phel zhing ma bstan pas rgyun mi 'chad par nang du yang dag par 'jog pas rang gi rgyud la lhag pa'i don ston pas 'phel ba yin gyi
analyzed: gzhung gi bdag nyid can gyi yul ni bstan pa dang ma bstan pa dag gis mthar thug pa dang nub bdag gi sgo nas 'grib par 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin du bstan pas rigs pa dang lung dang mi 'gal ba'i tshul @170b gyis rgyud gzhan la bskyed pas na 'phel zhing ma bstan pas rgyun mi 'chad par nang du yang dag par 'jog pas rang gi rgyud la lhag pa'i don ston pas 'phel ba yin gyi
translated: It is increased by the teaching of the special meaning in one’s own continuum through uninterrupted placement in meditative equipoise by the non-taught.

original: / 'gyur ba med pa'i rang bzhin can nyid yin pa'i phyir gtso bo'i yum la ni 'di dag thams cad med do gsol ba ni /
analyzed: / 'gyur ba med pa'i rang bzhin can nyid yin pa'i phyir gtso bo'i yum la ni 'di dag thams cad med do gsol ba ni /
translated: However, in the Mother of the Victor, which has the nature of the unchanging, all of these do not exist.

original: de ni bstan kyang mi 'grib ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ni bstan kyang mi 'grib ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The request is “That perfection of wisdom is not diminished by the decrease of form, etc.”

original: mi 'gal bar smras pa nyid kyis rab 'byor legs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa sngon du 'gro bas /
analyzed: mi 'gal bar smras pa nyid kyis rab 'byor legs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa sngon du 'gro bas /
translated: Having spoken without contradiction, he said Subhuti, it is so, and so forth.

original: de nyid dpes gsal bar mdzad pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid dpes gsal bar mdzad pa ni /
translated: In order to clarify that very point with an example, he said,

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: For example, Subhuti, and so forth.

original: byed pa po med pa'i sbyor ba'i don du /
analyzed: byed pa po med pa'i sbyor ba'i don du /
translated: In order to show the meaning of the absence of an agent,

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste sgyu ma'i skyes bu la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste sgyu ma'i skyes bu la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he said, For example, Subhuti, a magical being created by a magician, and so forth.

original: log par snang ba'i rang bzhin yin pas byed pa po ma yin pa'i phyir 'dod chags dang zhe sdang gi nyon mongs pa dag gis rjes su chags par mi 'gyur zhing khong khro bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: log par snang ba'i rang bzhin yin pas byed pa po ma yin pa'i phyir 'dod chags dang zhe sdang gi nyon mongs pa dag gis rjes su chags par mi 'gyur zhing khong khro bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Because it has the nature of false appearance, it is not an agent, so it is not affected by the afflictions of attachment and aversion, and it does not become angry.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de'i nye ba'i nyon mongs par yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de'i nye ba'i nyon mongs par yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Therefore, it is said that it does not become their proximate cause.

original: sbyor ba dka' ba'i rnam pa gsum las rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sbyor ba ched du bya ba dka' ba'i sbyor ba'i sbyor bka' ba'i don du bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol to //
analyzed: sbyor ba dka' ba'i rnam pa gsum las rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sbyor ba ched du bya ba dka' ba'i sbyor ba'i sbyor bka' ba'i don du bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol to //
translated: The Blessed One said to the Bodhisattva Mahasattva Manjushri and so on.

original: ya ya bor mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni yeng yeng por mi 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: ya ya bor mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni yeng yeng por mi 'gyur ba ste /
translated: He will not be distracted means he will not be scattered.

original: phyi rol du g-yeng bar mi 'gyur zhing dga' ba bskyed par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyi rol du g-yeng bar mi 'gyur zhing dga' ba bskyed par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: He will not be distracted externally and will not generate delight, is the meaning.

original: phyir mi ldog pa zhes bya ba ni phyir ldog pa nyid du mi byed pa'o ;
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa zhes bya ba ni phyir ldog pa nyid du mi byed pa'o ;
translated: He will not turn back means he will not turn back.

original: / go cha 'di zhes bya ba ni 'og nas 'chad pa'i go cha'o //
analyzed: / go cha 'di zhes bya ba ni 'og nas 'chad pa'i go cha'o //
translated: This armor means the armor that will be explained below.

original: shes rab la sogs pa khyad par du 'gyur ba yin par rtogs nas 'bad pa byed pa'i phyir bya dka' ba bla lhag pa zhes bya ba gang yin snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhen zhes bya bas bsu nas /
analyzed: shes rab la sogs pa khyad par du 'gyur ba yin par rtogs nas 'bad pa byed pa'i phyir bya dka' ba bla lhag pa zhes bya ba gang yin snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhen zhes bya bas bsu nas /
translated: Since it is understood that wisdom, etc. are distinctive, one strives. Therefore, it is called more difficult to do. The doubt that is thought, What is that? is welcomed by Why is that?

original: gang sems can rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gang sems can rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: It is said, Because of the welfare of sentient beings, etc.

original: 'di skad du chos thams cad nam mkha' lta bur dmigs pas de kho nar shes rab la sogs pa khyad par du 'gyur ba yod pa ma yin yang /
analyzed: 'di skad du chos thams cad nam mkha' lta bur dmigs pas de kho nar shes rab la sogs pa khyad par du 'gyur ba yod pa ma yin yang /
translated: This is what is said: Since all phenomena are perceived as space-like, in reality there is no distinction in wisdom, etc.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i don du go cha gyon par byed pa'i phyir na lhag par bya dka' ba yin no zhes brjod pa yin @171a * //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i don du go cha gyon par byed pa'i phyir na lhag par bya dka' ba yin no zhes brjod pa yin @171a * //
translated: However, because one dons the armor for the sake of omniscience, it is said to be more difficult to do.

original: no // nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa dang chos kyi dbyings dang mtshungs pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das par grags pa'i dbye bas gnyis smos pa yin no //
analyzed: no // nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa dang chos kyi dbyings dang mtshungs pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das par grags pa'i dbye bas gnyis smos pa yin no //
translated: Space-like and dharma-element-like are mentioned twice by the division of mundane and supramundane renown.

original: lam shes pa nyid kyi sbyor ba dka' ba nyid kyi don du de ni bcom ldan 'das nam mkha' yongs su thar bar 'tshal lags so zhes smos te /🔽gang lam shes pa nyid la rab tu sbyor bar 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: lam shes pa nyid kyi sbyor ba dka' ba nyid kyi don du de ni bcom ldan 'das nam mkha' yongs su thar bar 'tshal lags so zhes smos te / gang lam shes pa nyid la rab tu sbyor bar 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: For the sake of the difficulty of application to knowledge of the path, he says, Blessed One, I would liberate space.

original: thams cad shes pa nyid kyi sbyor ba las bya dka' ba nyid kyi don du de ni bcom ldan 'das nam mkha' gdegs  par 'tshal ba lags so zhes smos te /
analyzed: thams cad shes pa nyid kyi sbyor ba las bya dka' ba nyid kyi don du de ni bcom ldan 'das nam mkha' gdegs  par 'tshal ba lags so zhes smos te /
translated: For the sake of the difficulty of application to knowledge of all aspects, he says, Blessed One, I would lift up space.🔽For the sake of the difficulty of application to knowledge of paths, he says, Blessed One, I would liberate space.

original: gang thams cad shes pa nyid byed par 'dod pa zhes kha bskang ngo //
analyzed: gang thams cad shes pa nyid byed par 'dod pa zhes kha bskang ngo //
translated: For the sake of the difficulty of application to knowledge of all aspects, he says, Blessed One, I would lift up space.

original: go cha 'tshal ba zhes bya ba ni bya dka' ba gsum char la spro ba'o //
analyzed: go cha 'tshal ba zhes bya ba ni bya dka' ba gsum char la spro ba'o //
translated: The armor is the enthusiasm for all three difficult tasks.

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i go cha chen po thob pa lags so zhes bya ba ni go cha'i sbyor ba'i byed pa rnams la stong pa nyid dang snying rje chen po'i snying po can gyi 'bad pa chen po phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i go cha chen po thob pa lags so zhes bya ba ni go cha'i sbyor ba'i byed pa rnams la stong pa nyid dang snying rje chen po'i snying po can gyi 'bad pa chen po phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: This is the perfection of great effort with the essence of emptiness and great compassion in the activities of the application of armor.

original: skal ba ji lta ba bzhin du 'bras bu thob pas 'bras bu yod pa'i sbyor ba ni de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: skal ba ji lta ba bzhin du 'bras bu thob pas 'bras bu yod pa'i sbyor ba ni de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The application of having a result, by attaining the result according to one's fortune, is stated from Then and so on.

original: dge slong gzhan zhig gis zhes bya ba ni gtan mad pa'i skyes bu ste /
analyzed: dge slong gzhan zhig gis zhes bya ba ni gtan mad pa'i skyes bu ste /
translated: A certain other monk means a completely non-existent person.

original: ming dang rus la sogs pas mtshon du med pa'i gang zag ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ming dang rus la sogs pas mtshon du med pa'i gang zag ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means a person who cannot be indicated by name, clan, and so on.

original: phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya ba ni stong pa dang ma skyes pa la sogs pa'i sbyor bas rang dang rjes su mthun pa'i rtogs pa skyes pa'i phyir dad pa phul du byung bas 'khor gzhan rnams kyang skal pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa thob par yang
analyzed: phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya ba ni stong pa dang ma skyes pa la sogs pa'i sbyor bas rang dang rjes su mthun pa'i rtogs pa skyes pa'i phyir dad pa phul du byung bas 'khor gzhan rnams kyang skal pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa thob par yang
translated: The phrase I pay homage indicates that, due to the arising of realizations that are in accordance with his own, he has developed the highest form of faith in emptiness, the unborn nature of phenomena, and so forth.🔽🔽

original: dag par ston cing phyag 'tshal ba'o //
analyzed: dag par ston cing phyag 'tshal ba'o //
translated: The phrase homage to you is the homage of the other disciples who, in accordance with their good fortune, attained realization by means of the highest faith in the teaching of the true Dharma, which is the arising of the realization that is in accordance with the teaching of emptiness, non-arising, etc.
