original: sbyor ba nyid ni bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol pa yin no //🔽nam mkha' la zhes bya ba nyid ni shes bya stong pa nyid la'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba nyid ni bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol pa yin no // nam mkha' la zhes bya ba nyid ni shes bya stong pa nyid la'o //
translated: The application itself is the request beginning with the words, Blessed One, it is thus.🔽In the sky means in the emptiness that is the object of knowledge.

original: bla gab med pa la zhes bya ba ni shes pa ngo bo nyid med pa la'o //
analyzed: bla gab med pa la zhes bya ba ni shes pa ngo bo nyid med pa la'o //
translated: In the open air means in the essencelessness that is the subject.🔽In dependence on others means in the teaching of the true Dharma.🔽Without dependence on others means in the realization that is in accordance with the teaching of emptiness, non-arising, etc.

original: gzhan la rag ma las pa'i sbyor ba'i don du bcom ldan 'das rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan la rag ma las pa'i sbyor ba'i don du bcom ldan 'das rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol pa yin no //
translated: For the sake of the application that is not dependent on others, the request begins with the words, Blessed One, any son or daughter of good family...

original: de ni ma yin no zhes bya bas ni gzhan la rag las pa ma yin pa nyid ston par byed da gzhan gyis bsrung ba la sogs pa gzhan la rag las pa nyid yod pa @171b ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni ma yin no zhes bya bas ni gzhan la rag las pa ma yin pa nyid ston par byed da gzhan gyis bsrung ba la sogs pa gzhan la rag las pa nyid yod pa @171b ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase it is not so shows that it is not dependent on another, because protection, etc. by another does not exist.

original: de nyid gsal bar bya ba ni koo shi ka gal te de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar bya ba ni koo shi ka gal te de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: To make that clear, he says, Kausika, if someone, etc.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral ba nyid kyis de la rang nyid kyis bsrung ba la sogs pa 'gyur ba yin gyi gzhan du ma yin no zhes bya ba ni ngag gi don yin no ;
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral ba nyid kyis de la rang nyid kyis bsrung ba la sogs pa 'gyur ba yin gyi gzhan du ma yin no zhes bya ba ni ngag gi don yin no ;
translated: The meaning of the statement is that, because of being inseparable from the perfection of wisdom, protection, etc. by oneself is possible, but not otherwise.

original: / ngo bo nyid med pa'i chos la lhag par mos pas kyang de la rang nyid kyis bsrung ba la sogs pa yin pa ni koo shi ka gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: / ngo bo nyid med pa'i chos la lhag par mos pas kyang de la rang nyid kyis bsrung ba la sogs pa yin pa ni koo shi ka gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The statement, Kausika, moreover, etc. is made in order to show that protection, etc. by oneself is possible through the superior resolve in the Dharma which is devoid of intrinsic reality.

original: rnam pa bdun du snang ba'i shes pa'i sbyor ba ni koo shi ka 'di ji snyam du sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa bdun du snang ba'i shes pa'i sbyor ba ni koo shi ka 'di ji snyam du sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The application of the consciousness that appears in seven aspects is stated in the passage beginning, “Kauśika, what do you think?”

original: de la rnam par shes pa yongs su gyur pa nyid kyis yongs su gyur pa'i snang bas na rmi lam lta bu'o //
analyzed: de la rnam par shes pa yongs su gyur pa nyid kyis yongs su gyur pa'i snang bas na rmi lam lta bu'o //
translated: There, it is like a dream because of the appearance of transformation by the transformation of consciousness itself.

original: sngags dang sman gyi tshogs pa nyid kyis na mnyam par sbyor ba'i snang bas ni sgyu ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: sngags dang sman gyi tshogs pa nyid kyis na mnyam par sbyor ba'i snang bas ni sgyu ma lta bu'o //
translated: It is like an illusion because of the appearance of union by the union of mantra and medicine.

original: med pa nyid kyis na 'gal ba snang bas ni smig rgyu lta bu'o //
analyzed: med pa nyid kyis na 'gal ba snang bas ni smig rgyu lta bu'o //
translated: It is like a mirage because of the appearance of contradiction by nonexistence.

original: sgra'i rkyen la rag las pas na rkyen gyi snang bas ni sgra brnyan lta bu'o //
analyzed: sgra'i rkyen la rag las pas na rkyen gyi snang bas ni sgra brnyan lta bu'o //
translated: It is like an echo because of the appearance of conditions by dependence on the conditions of sound.

original: shes bya'i tshul las mi 'da' bas na mi 'da' bar snang bas ni mi g-yor lta bu'o //
analyzed: shes bya'i tshul las mi 'da' bas na mi 'da' bar snang bas ni mi g-yor lta bu'o //
translated: It is like a reflection because of the appearance of non-transgression by not transgressing the way of the object of knowledge.

original: gzhi med pas na rten med pa'i snang bas ni dri za'i grong khyer lta bu'o //
analyzed: gzhi med pas na rten med pa'i snang bas ni dri za'i grong khyer lta bu'o //
translated: It is like a city of gandharvas because of the appearance of non-support by non-ground.

original: rgyu dang bral bas na byed pa po med pa'i snang bas ni sprul pa lta bu'o zhes dngos po rnams shes par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang bral bas na byed pa po med pa'i snang bas ni sprul pa lta bu'o zhes dngos po rnams shes par gyur pa ste /
translated: Since they are free from causes, they are like emanations, since they are appearances without an agent.

original: de ltar stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las gsungs la /
analyzed: de ltar stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las gsungs la /
translated: Thus it is that the Twenty-Five Thousand teaches that one should understand things in this way.🔽But here, because it is intended to be concise, it is taught that all phenomena are like an echo.

original: 'dir ni mdor bsdus par bzhed pa'i phyir chos thams cad brag ca lta bu'o zhes gsungs pa'i bar ma bstan pa las thog ma dang tha ma gsum gsum bstan pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni mdor bsdus par bzhed pa'i phyir chos thams cad brag ca lta bu'o zhes gsungs pa'i bar ma bstan pa las thog ma dang tha ma gsum gsum bstan pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus one should understand that the first and last of the three are taught in the Twenty-Five Thousand, while the middle one is taught here.

original: des na de ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sbyor ba rnam pa bcu rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo nas bstan pas don gyis na nyan thos la sogs pa'i ni ji skad bstan pa las bzlog pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: des na de ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sbyor ba rnam pa bcu rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo nas bstan pas don gyis na nyan thos la sogs pa'i ni ji skad bstan pa las bzlog pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, because the ten kinds of application of the bodhisattvas are taught in this way, one should understand that the opposite of what is taught here is the application of the śrāvakas and so on.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As it is said:🔽Form and so on, impermanence and so on,🔽not complete and complete,

original: gzugs sogs de mi rtag sogs dang // de ma rdzogs dang rab rdzogs dang // de la chags pa med nyid la //
analyzed: gzugs sogs de mi rtag sogs dang // de ma rdzogs dang rab rdzogs dang // de la chags pa med nyid la //
translated: and nonattachment to that,

original: spyod pa bkag pa'i sbyor ba dang // mi 'gyur byed po med nyid dang // bya dka' rnams gsum sbyor ba dang // skal ba ji bzhin 'bras 'thob pas //
analyzed: spyod pa bkag pa'i sbyor ba dang // mi 'gyur byed po med nyid dang // bya dka' rnams gsum sbyor ba dang // skal ba ji bzhin 'bras 'thob pas //
translated: The three kinds of application to the practice of the perfections, the three kinds of application to the practice of the perfections that are difficult to practice, and the attainment of the result in accordance with one’s fortune.

original: 'bras yod 'dod pa de dang ni //
analyzed: 'bras yod 'dod pa de dang ni //
translated: The existence of the result,

original: gzhan la @172a * //
analyzed: gzhan la @172a * //
translated: and the absence of dependence on another,

original: rag las med gang dang // snang ba rnam bdun shes byed do //🔽zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rag las med gang dang // snang ba rnam bdun shes byed do // zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: and the seven kinds of appearance are to be understood.

original: mnyam pa nyid kyi sgo nas sbyor ba bsgom dgos pas mnyam pa nyid ni de la yang rlom sems su mi byad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid kyi sgo nas sbyor ba bsgom dgos pas mnyam pa nyid ni de la yang rlom sems su mi byad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: One should cultivate the application by way of sameness. Therefore, it says, “He does not falsely project anything in regard to that.”

original: de la mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sems kyis de la rlom sems su mi byed de /
analyzed: de la mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sems kyis de la rlom sems su mi byed de /
translated: He does not falsely project anything in regard to that with a mind that is not in equipoise.

original: gang gi phyir yang dag par rjes su mi mthong bas so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir yang dag par rjes su mi mthong bas so //
translated: Because he does not see anything at all.

original: chos de dag kyang med pa ste gang gi phyir mi snang bas so //
analyzed: chos de dag kyang med pa ste gang gi phyir mi snang bas so //
translated: Those dharmas also do not exist because they do not appear.

original: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sems kyis ni yongs su mi shes te /
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sems kyis ni yongs su mi shes te /
translated: He does not fully understand with a mind that is not in equipoise.

original: gang gi phyir yang dag par mi shes pas so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir yang dag par mi shes pas so //
translated: Because he does not understand correctly.

original: shes pa des rtogs par bya ba'i chos de dag kyang yang dag par med pa yin te /
analyzed: shes pa des rtogs par bya ba'i chos de dag kyang yang dag par med pa yin te /
translated: Those phenomena that are to be realized by that consciousness also do not exist in reality.

original: gang gi phyir mi dmigs pas so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mi dmigs pas so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Because they are not perceived.

original: nye bar bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir gal te de ltar gnas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: nye bar bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir gal te de ltar gnas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: In order to summarize, it is said, “If it is so,” and so on.

original: des na de ltar gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po'i don la rlom pa dang / sngon po la sogs pa'i mtshan ma la rlom pa dang / gzugs rnam pa gnyis sam rnam pa nyi shu zhes bya ba la sogs pa spros pa la rlom pa dang /
analyzed: des na de ltar gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po'i don la rlom pa dang / sngon po la sogs pa'i mtshan ma la rlom pa dang / gzugs rnam pa gnyis sam rnam pa nyi shu zhes bya ba la sogs pa spros pa la rlom pa dang /
translated: Thus, the conceit about the meaning of entities such as form, the conceit about the characteristics such as blue, the conceit about the elaborations such as “form has two types or twenty types,”

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha la sogs pa rtogs par rlom pa rnams bkag pas /
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha la sogs pa rtogs par rlom pa rnams bkag pas /
translated: and the conceit about realization such as the factors of ascertainment and so on are refuted.

original: rtogs pa po dang shes bya'i chos rnam pa thams cad du mi dmigs pa rnam pa zhig sungs pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa po dang shes bya'i chos rnam pa thams cad du mi dmigs pa rnam pa zhig sungs pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that the non-perception of the knower and all aspects of the known phenomena is taught.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As it is said:

original: gzugs la sogs la rlom med pa //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs la rlom med pa //
translated: Not conceiving form and so on,

original: rnam bzhi de yi mnyam pa nyid //
analyzed: rnam bzhi de yi mnyam pa nyid //
translated: the four equalities.

original: ces gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ces gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is the meaning of the above passage.

original: sbyor ba'i mnyam pa nyid rtogs nas mthong ba'i lam bsgom par bya ba yin bas nad ni de brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i mnyam pa nyid rtogs nas mthong ba'i lam bsgom par bya ba yin bas nad ni de brjod par bya'o //
translated: Since the path of insight is to be cultivated after realizing the sameness of application, the author will now discuss that.

original: de yang skad cig ma bcu drug yin pas skad cig ma gzhan med par shes par bya ba'i don du spang por gyur pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyis gsungs pa nyid du bstan par bya ba'i phyir de nas sangs rgyas kyi mthus zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang skad cig ma bcu drug yin pas skad cig ma gzhan med par shes par bya ba'i don du spang por gyur pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyis gsungs pa nyid du bstan par bya ba'i phyir de nas sangs rgyas kyi mthus zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Since it has sixteen moments, in order to show that there is no other moment, in order to show that it is a collection of moments, and in order to show that it is taught by all Buddhas, the root text says, “Then, through the power of the Buddha,” and so on.

original: 'phags pa rnam par grol ba'i sdes bshad do //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnam par grol ba'i sdes bshad do //
translated: This is explained by Ārya Vimuktisena.

original: thabs la mkhas pa'i stobs kyis gzhan rnams kyis sgrub pa dang dgag pa med pa'i phyir 'jig rten gyi khams mi mdzad du bskal pa bzang po'i byang chub sems dpa' @172b stong nges par sangs rgyas nyid brnyes pas sangs rgyas stong zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa'i stobs kyis gzhan rnams kyis sgrub pa dang dgag pa med pa'i phyir 'jig rten gyi khams mi mdzad du bskal pa bzang po'i byang chub sems dpa' @172b stong nges par sangs rgyas nyid brnyes pas sangs rgyas stong zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Because of the power of skillful means, others do not establish or refute it, so the world is not made empty. The statement “a thousand Buddhas” means that a thousand Bodhisattvas of the Fortunate Aeon will definitely attain Buddhahood.

original: ming zhes bya ba ni tshig bsdus pa'i ngag go //
analyzed: ming zhes bya ba ni tshig bsdus pa'i ngag go //
translated: “Name” refers to the speech that is a collection of words.

original: tshig ces bya ba ni su pa'i mtha' can dang ti'i mtha' can gyi yi ge rnams bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: tshig ces bya ba ni su pa'i mtha' can dang ti'i mtha' can gyi yi ge rnams bsdus pa'o //
translated: “Word” refers to the collection of syllables that end in “su” and “ti.”

original: yi ge zhes bya ba ni 'di skad ces bya ba la sogs pa'i yi ge rnams kyis so //
analyzed: yi ge zhes bya ba ni 'di skad ces bya ba la sogs pa'i yi ge rnams kyis so //
translated: “Syllable” refers to the letters such as “a.”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i le'u 'di nyid ces bya ba ni rnam par dag pa'i le'u zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i le'u 'di nyid ces bya ba ni rnam par dag pa'i le'u zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “This very chapter of the perfection of wisdom” means the chapter on purity.

original: de la 'das pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dper byas pa ni des bstan pa'i mthar thug med par shes par bya ba'i don yin no //
analyzed: de la 'das pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dper byas pa ni des bstan pa'i mthar thug med par shes par bya ba'i don yin no //
translated: The example of the past Tathāgatas is for the purpose of knowing that the teaching is endless.

original: byams pa zhes ma 'ongs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dper byas pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i sems can gyi don gyi dogs pa bsal bar bstan pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: byams pa zhes ma 'ongs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dper byas pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i sems can gyi don gyi dogs pa bsal bar bstan pa'i don yin no //
translated: The example of Maitreya, the Tathagata of the future, is given to show that the doubts about the welfare of future sentient beings are removed.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bshad pa mngon par rtogs pa rgyan gyi snang ba las rnam par dag pa'i le'u zhes bya ba ste brgyad pa'o /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bshad pa mngon par rtogs pa rgyan gyi snang ba las rnam par dag pa'i le'u zhes bya ba ste brgyad pa'o /
translated: This concludes the eighth chapter, called “The Pure,” in the Ornament of the Scriptures of the Universal Vehicle, an explanatory commentary on the perfection of wisdom called “Illumination of the Essential Instructions.”

original: // / da ni mthong ba'i lam gyi don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bgyi ba la gsol ba yin te /
analyzed: // / da ni mthong ba'i lam gyi don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bgyi ba la gsol ba yin te /
translated: Now, in order to explain the perfection of wisdom in terms of the path of seeing, the request is made:

original: bden pa re re zhing chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / chos shes pa dang / rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / rjes su shes pa zhes bya ba de ltar skad cig ma bcu drug gi bdag nyid can ni thams cad shes pa nyid kyi skabs su mthong ba'i lam zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bden pa re re zhing chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / chos shes pa dang / rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / rjes su shes pa zhes bya ba de ltar skad cig ma bcu drug gi bdag nyid can ni thams cad shes pa nyid kyi skabs su mthong ba'i lam zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Thus, the path of seeing is said to consist of sixteen moments, namely, the acceptance of the knowledge of the dharma with regard to each of the truths, the knowledge of the dharma, the acceptance of the subsequent knowledge, and the subsequent knowledge.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And thus:

original: sdug bsngal la sogs bden pa la //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la sogs bden pa la //
translated: With regard to the truths of suffering and so on,

original: chos shes rjes su shes pa dang // bzod shes skad cig bdag nyid 'di //🔽kun shes tshul la mthong ba'i lam //
analyzed: chos shes rjes su shes pa dang // bzod shes skad cig bdag nyid 'di // kun shes tshul la mthong ba'i lam //
translated: acceptance and knowledge in a single moment.

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is the path of seeing in the system of complete knowledge.

original: 'di ni ming tsam mo zhes bya ba 'di ni rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan tsam du zad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di ni ming tsam mo zhes bya ba 'di ni rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan tsam du zad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is merely a name. This means it is merely a conceptual reflection.

original: ming de yang 'di'o zhes mi dmigs te zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid du na rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ming de yang 'di'o zhes mi dmigs te zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid du na rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And that name is not apprehended as “this,” because in reality it has no nature.

original: ming zhes gang la bya zhe na /
analyzed: ming zhes gang la bya zhe na /
translated: What is meant by “name”?

original: ngag gi dngos po nyid ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ngag gi dngos po nyid ces bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said to be the entity of speech.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan no //
translated: It is a conceptual reflection.

original: rnam par bstan par bya ba'i don du bden pa'i rnam pa gang yin zhes gsol pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par bstan par bya ba'i don du bden pa'i rnam pa gang yin zhes gsol pa ni /
translated: In order to demonstrate the meaning, it is asked, “What is the aspect of truth?”

original: bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The question is asked, “Bhagavān, why is it so?” and so on.

original: gzugs rtag pa ma yin mi rtag pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir gzugs rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa dang bral bas rtag pa ma yin mi rtag pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba @173a * //🔽ni rnam pa dang po'o //🔽gzugs bcings pa ma yin grol ba ma yin pas mtha' las 'das shing rnam par dag pa'o zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang sdug bsngal ma yin pa dang bral ba nyid kyis bcings pa dang grol ba med pa'i phyir rnam par dag cing rtag pa dang chad
analyzed: gzugs rtag pa ma yin mi rtag pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir gzugs rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa dang bral bas rtag pa ma yin mi rtag pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba @173a * // ni rnam pa dang po'o // gzugs bcings pa ma yin grol ba ma yin pas mtha' las 'das shing rnam par dag pa'o zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang sdug bsngal ma yin pa dang bral ba nyid kyis bcings pa dang grol ba med pa'i phyir rnam par dag cing rtag pa dang chad
translated: Form is neither permanent nor impermanent is the first mode, because form is devoid of permanence and impermanence, etc. due to the absence of intrinsic reality.

original: pa'i mtha' dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: pa'i mtha' dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: Form is neither bound nor liberated is the second mode, because it is devoid of the extremes of permanence and annihilation, since it is devoid of both suffering and non-suffering, and is thus pure, being neither bound nor liberated.

original: rab 'byor rgyu des na zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad phyin ci ma log par mngon par byang chub pa'i rgyu des na chos kyi de kho na nyid ji lta ba bzhin du ston par byed pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid 'chad
analyzed: rab 'byor rgyu des na zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad phyin ci ma log par mngon par byang chub pa'i rgyu des na chos kyi de kho na nyid ji lta ba bzhin du ston par byed pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid 'chad
translated: The phrase for this reason, Subhuti, means that because of the reason that all dharmas are fully enlightened without distortion, this perfection of wisdom itself is explained as teaching the suchness of dharmas just as it is.

original: par 'gyur te /
analyzed: par 'gyur te /
translated: It is explained

original: gzhan dag la ni de lta bu'i chos kyi de kho na nyid ston pa'i nus pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽gzugs yongs su dag pas zhes bya ba ni stong pa dang mi stong pa dang bral ba'i phyir yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag la ni de lta bu'i chos kyi de kho na nyid ston pa'i nus pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // gzugs yongs su dag pas zhes bya ba ni stong pa dang mi stong pa dang bral ba'i phyir yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba ni gsum pa'o //
translated: that others do not have the ability to teach the suchness of dharmas in that way.🔽The phrase because of the purity of form is the third, because of being free from emptiness and non-emptiness.

original: gzugs skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med pa dang kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang rnam par byang ba med pa yongs su dag pas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzugs skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med pa dang kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang rnam par byang ba med pa yongs su dag pas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase because of the purity of the non-arising, non-ceasing, non-affliction, and non-purification of form is the fourth.

original: bdag dang bdag med pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pas ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa dang kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin pa dang rnam par byang ba ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: bdag dang bdag med pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pas ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa dang kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin pa dang rnam par byang ba ma yin pa ste /
translated: Since it is neither a self nor a selflessness, it is unborn and unceasing, neither afflicted nor purified.

original: de ltar rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: Thus, purity is the fourth.

original: nam mkha' yongs su dag pas zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang rgyu ma yin pa gsog yin pa'i phyir nam mkha' dang 'dra bar rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni lnga pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' yongs su dag pas zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang rgyu ma yin pa gsog yin pa'i phyir nam mkha' dang 'dra bar rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni lnga pa'o //
translated: Since space is pure, it is like space, being a mere non-entity. Thus, purity is the fifth.

original: gzugs gos pa med cing yongs su mi 'dzin pas zhes bya ba ni kun 'byung ba dang kun 'byung ba med pa dang bral ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis gos pa med pa zhes bya ba ni drug pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs gos pa med cing yongs su mi 'dzin pas zhes bya ba ni kun 'byung ba dang kun 'byung ba med pa dang bral ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis gos pa med pa zhes bya ba ni drug pa'o //
translated: Since form is not soiled and is not grasped, it is not soiled by any afflictions or secondary afflictions, since it is free from the origin of suffering and the absence of origin. Thus, purity is the sixth.

original: rab tu skye ba dang rab tu mi skye ba med pas kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir yongs su 'dzin pa med pa zhes bya ba ni bdun pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu skye ba dang rab tu mi skye ba med pas kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir yongs su 'dzin pa med pa zhes bya ba ni bdun pa'o //
translated: Since there is no thorough affliction due to the absence of complete arising and complete non-arising, it is called “unapprehended.”

original: nam mkha' dang brag ca sgrar med cing brjod du med la dmigs su med pa zhes bya ba ni rkyen dang rkyen ma yin pa las rnam par grol ba ma yin pa'i phyir nam mkha' dang brag ca dang 'dra bar rang gi ngo bos brjod du med pa
analyzed: nam mkha' dang brag ca sgrar med cing brjod du med la dmigs su med pa zhes bya ba ni rkyen dang rkyen ma yin pa las rnam par grol ba ma yin pa'i phyir nam mkha' dang brag ca dang 'dra bar rang gi ngo bos brjod du med pa
translated: Since it is like space and an echo, it is said to be “inexpressible and non-apprehensible as sound.”

original: zhes bya ba ni brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni brgyad pa'o //
translated: This is the eighth.

original: gang gi phyir 'gog pa dang 'gog pa med pa dang ma 'dres pa de'i phyir 'gog pa'i bden pa'i don brjod pas bstan pa'i sgo nas rgyud gzhan la thob par byar med @173b pa zhes bya ba ni dgu pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'gog pa dang 'gog pa med pa dang ma 'dres pa de'i phyir 'gog pa'i bden pa'i don brjod pas bstan pa'i sgo nas rgyud gzhan la thob par byar med @173b pa zhes bya ba ni dgu pa'o //
translated: Since it is unmixed with cessation and non-cessation, it is said to be “not to be attained in another continuum” through the door of teaching by expressing the meaning of the truth of cessation.🔽This is the ninth.

original: zhi ba dang ma zhi ba med pas dmigs pa med par byed pa zhes bya ba ni bcu pa'o //
analyzed: zhi ba dang ma zhi ba med pas dmigs pa med par byed pa zhes bya ba ni bcu pa'o //
translated: Since there is no peace and no non-peace, it is said to be “non-apprehended.” This is the tenth.

original: nye bar gos pa dang ma gos pa'i chos thams cad kyis gos pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gya nom pa ma yin pa dang bral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: nye bar gos pa dang ma gos pa'i chos thams cad kyis gos pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gya nom pa ma yin pa dang bral ba'i phyir /
translated: Because it is not soiled by any phenomena that are soiled or not soiled. This is the eleventh.🔽Because it is not soiled by any soiled phenomena that are subject to cankers or by any phenomena that are not soiled and are free from cankers.

original: nye bar gos pa'i chos zag pa dang bcas pa dang gos pa med pa'i chos zag pa med pa thams cad kyis gos pa med pa'i phyir mtha' gnyis las 'das shing rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni bcu gcig pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar gos pa'i chos zag pa dang bcas pa dang gos pa med pa'i chos zag pa med pa thams cad kyis gos pa med pa'i phyir mtha' gnyis las 'das shing rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni bcu gcig pa'o //
translated: Because it transcends the two extremes and is pure. This is the twelfth.🔽What need is there to mention those who take up this perfection of wisdom, etc. to: who bear it in mind, study, etc. to: wisely attend to it?🔽For the latter are far superior to the former.

original: ci smos te zhes bya ba ni 'dzin pa la sogs par byed pa ni shin tu yang rnyed pa legs par rnyed pa yin pa ste /
analyzed: ci smos te zhes bya ba ni 'dzin pa la sogs par byed pa ni shin tu yang rnyed pa legs par rnyed pa yin pa ste /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the best, the most excellent, the most sublime, the most exalted, the most worthy of veneration of all the perfections.🔽The perfection of wisdom is the mother of the Bodhisattvas, the great beings, because it gives birth to the Buddhas and Lords.🔽The perfection of wisdom is the guide of the Bodhisattvas, the great beings, because it shows them the way to the cognition of the all-knowing.

original: rna ba'i rnam par shes pas nyams su myong bas 'dzin pa la sogs pa khyad par du 'phags pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rna ba'i rnam par shes pas nyams su myong bas 'dzin pa la sogs pa khyad par du 'phags pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the light of the Bodhisattvas, the great beings, because it removes the darkness from them.🔽The perfection of wisdom is the torch of the Bodhisattvas, the great beings, because it burns up all their defilements.🔽The perfection of wisdom is the lamp of the Bodhisattvas, the great beings, because it sheds light for them.🔽The perfection of wisdom is the saviour of the Bodhisattvas, the great beings, because it delivers them from all misfortune.🔽The perfection of wisdom is the illuminator of the Bodhisattvas, the great beings, because it shows them the path to the cognition of the all-knowing.🔽The perfection of wisdom is the revealer of the Bodhisattvas, the great beings, because it reveals to them the cognition of the all-knowing.🔽The perfection of wisdom is the forerunner of the Bodhisattvas, the great beings, because it goes ahead of them on the way to the cognition of the all-knowing.🔽The perfection of wisdom is the helper of the Bodhisattvas, the great beings, because it helps them to the cognition of the all-knowing.🔽The perfection of wisdom is the companion of the Bodhisattvas, the great beings, because it does not leave them until they are seated on the terrace of enlightenment.🔽The perfection of wisdom is the mother of the Bodhisattvas, the great beings, because

original: de dag la ni mig gi nad 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nges par 'byung ba dang nges par 'byung ba med pa dang bral ba'i phyir nad thams cad mi skye ba zhes bya ba ni bcu gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de dag la ni mig gi nad 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nges par 'byung ba dang nges par 'byung ba med pa dang bral ba'i phyir nad thams cad mi skye ba zhes bya ba ni bcu gnyis pa'o //
translated: They will not develop eye diseases and so on means that all diseases will not arise because they are free from both definite and indefinite emergence. This is the twelfth.

original: mang du skyed par 'gyur ro zhes bya bya ba ni chos brgyad la sogs par brgya byin la sogs pa skye dgu rnams rtog pa la zhugs pa'i nyan pa po shin tu mang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mang du skyed par 'gyur ro zhes bya bya ba ni chos brgyad la sogs par brgya byin la sogs pa skye dgu rnams rtog pa la zhugs pa'i nyan pa po shin tu mang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They will be born many times means that in the eight Dharma realms and so on, many beings such as Indra will be born as listeners who engage in speculation. This is the meaning.

original: dgongs so // lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ni rab 'byor rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dgongs so // lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ni rab 'byor rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The forbearance of Dharma knowledge of the path is stated from Subhuti, that son of good lineage or daughter of good lineage and so on.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas ni lha'i bu rnams la dgongs pa med pas de 'chad pa rnams la de rnams bsrung ba la sogs pa'i rgyu ci zhig yin snyam pa'i dgos pa de ci'i phyir zhen zhes bya bas bsu nas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas ni lha'i bu rnams la dgongs pa med pas de 'chad pa rnams la de rnams bsrung ba la sogs pa'i rgyu ci zhig yin snyam pa'i dgos pa de ci'i phyir zhen zhes bya bas bsu nas /
translated: With that purpose, Why is it so? is asked,

original: rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: and Subhuti, the perfection of wisdom, etc. is said.

original: rin po che bla na med pa'o zhes bya ba ni sdig pa thams cad rab tu zhi ba'i rgyu nyid yin pas lam dang lam ma yin pa dang bral ba'i phyir bla na med pa'i dga' brgyas par byed pas lha'i bu la sogs pa la phan par gyur🔽pa yin pa'i phyir rin po che bla na med pa yin te /
analyzed: rin po che bla na med pa'o zhes bya ba ni sdig pa thams cad rab tu zhi ba'i rgyu nyid yin pas lam dang lam ma yin pa dang bral ba'i phyir bla na med pa'i dga' brgyas par byed pas lha'i bu la sogs pa la phan par gyur pa yin pa'i phyir rin po che bla na med pa yin te /
translated: The unsurpassed jewel is because it is the cause of the pacification of all evil, and because it is free from the path and not the path, it is the unsurpassed jewel that produces joy, and because it benefits the sons of gods, etc.

original: ngan song gcod par byed pas so zhes bya ba ni bcu gsum pa'o //
analyzed: ngan song gcod par byed pas so zhes bya ba ni bcu gsum pa'o //
translated: It is the unsurpassed jewel, because it cuts off the lower realms, is the thirteenth.

original: yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa la nyan pa po'i skye bo mang po yod pa dang bla na med pa'i dga' ba sbyin pa las bsod nams bskyed pa 'ba' zhig tu yang ma zad kyi /
analyzed: yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa la nyan pa po'i skye bo mang po yod pa dang bla na med pa'i dga' ba sbyin pa las bsod nams bskyed pa 'ba' zhig tu yang ma zad kyi /
translated: Moreover, Subhuti, etc. It is not only that merit is produced from the existence of many listeners and the bestowal of unsurpassed joy.

original: chos 'dzin pa de nyid kyi rgyu las sangs rgyas nyid thob pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i gzhi bsod nams bskyed par 'gyur ro @174a * //
analyzed: chos 'dzin pa de nyid kyi rgyu las sangs rgyas nyid thob pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i gzhi bsod nams bskyed par 'gyur ro @174a * //
translated: The very cause of the retention of the Dharma will become the cause of the attainment of Buddhahood, and merit will be produced from that cause.

original: zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: lam la chos shes pa ni gzhan yang 'on kyang rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: lam la chos shes pa ni gzhan yang 'on kyang rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The path of Dharma knowledge is also taught in Moreover, Subhuti, etc.

original: mthu che ba nyid yin bzhin du yang bar chad mang ba la rgyu ci zhig yod snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhen zhes bya bas bsu nas /
analyzed: mthu che ba nyid yin bzhin du yang bar chad mang ba la rgyu ci zhig yod snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhen zhes bya bas bsu nas /
translated: What is the cause of the many obstacles even while having great power? That doubt is removed by Why is it so?

original: rab 'byor 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Subhuti, it is like this, etc.

original: dgra mang ste zhes bya ba ni mthu che ba nyid yin pa'i phyir mang po'i mngon par 'dod pa bya ba nyid kyis na'o //
analyzed: dgra mang ste zhes bya ba ni mthu che ba nyid yin pa'i phyir mang po'i mngon par 'dod pa bya ba nyid kyis na'o //
translated: The phrase many enemies means that because of his great power, he is the one who acts in accordance with the wishes of the many.

original: ji tsam du gtses par gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rnam pa gang gis gong nas gong du gces pa nyid yin pa de ltar dgra mang ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ji tsam du gtses par gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rnam pa gang gis gong nas gong du gces pa nyid yin pa de ltar dgra mang ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase to the extent that he is honored and so on means that to the extent that he is honored in a certain way, to that extent he has many enemies. This is the meaning of the passage.

original: de ltar spyir bstan nas da ni khyad par du ston pas rab 'byor 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //🔽rin po che chen po 'di ni bla na med pa'i rin po che ste zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ltar spyir bstan nas da ni khyad par du ston pas rab 'byor 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so // rin po che chen po 'di ni bla na med pa'i rin po che ste zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Having taught in a general way, the Lord now teaches in a specific way, beginning with the words Subhuti, it is thus.🔽The phrase this great jewel is unsurpassed means that it is a jewel of the good that is nonconceptual, because it is devoid of conceptual thought about all things.

original: sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba'i don du nye bar gnas pa nyid kyis na chos thams cad la rnam par rtog pa med pas rnam par mi rtog pa'i dge pa'i rang bzhin gyi rin po che yin pa'i don gyis na rigs pa dang rigs
analyzed: sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba'i don du nye bar gnas pa nyid kyis na chos thams cad la rnam par rtog pa med pas rnam par mi rtog pa'i dge pa'i rang bzhin gyi rin po che yin pa'i don gyis na rigs pa dang rigs
translated: The phrase it is the best of all jewels means that it is the best of all jewels, because it is the best of all jewels, such as the precious wish-fulfilling gem.

original: pa ma yin pa dang ma 'dres pa'i phyir 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i don du thams cad la thabs la rnam par mi rtog pa nyid kyi rin po che chen po yin no zhes bya ba ni bcu bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: pa ma yin pa dang ma 'dres pa'i phyir 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i don du thams cad la thabs la rnam par mi rtog pa nyid kyi rin po che chen po yin no zhes bya ba ni bcu bzhi pa'o //
translated: Because it is not a part and is not mixed with the other perfections, it is the great jewel of non-discrimination with regard to all the means for the realization of the result.

original: lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa ni rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni chos gang la yang mi gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa ni rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni chos gang la yang mi gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The acceptance of the knowledge of the path is stated in the passage beginning with “Subhuti, the perfection of wisdom does not stand in any dharma at all.”

original: kun brtags pa'i dngos po la ni mi gnas gzhan dbang ni kun nas nyon mongs par mi byed yongs su grub par mi 'dzin to zhes bya ba ni don gyi dbye ba yin no //
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i dngos po la ni mi gnas gzhan dbang ni kun nas nyon mongs par mi byed yongs su grub par mi 'dzin to zhes bya ba ni don gyi dbye ba yin no //
translated: It is said that it does not stand in the imagined reality, it does not stand in the relative reality, and it does not grasp the perfect reality. This is the analysis of the meaning.

original: 'di skad du sgrub pa dang sgrub pa ma yin pa las rnam par grol ba nyid kyis chos thams cad mtshan ma dag dang ma 'brel pa zhes bya ba ni bco lnga pa'o zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad du sgrub pa dang sgrub pa ma yin pa las rnam par grol ba nyid kyis chos thams cad mtshan ma dag dang ma 'brel pa zhes bya ba ni bco lnga pa'o zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: It is said that all dharmas are unattached to signs, because of being free from accomplishment and non-accomplishment. This is the fifteenth.

original: chos rnams yongs su zin kyang ji ltar yongs su mi 'dzin pa yin snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas //
analyzed: chos rnams yongs su zin kyang ji ltar yongs su mi 'dzin pa yin snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas //
translated: How is it that one does not fully grasp dharmas, even though one does grasp them?

original: rab 'byor 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: To this he says, Subhuti, it is thus, etc.

original: don go bar zad do //
analyzed: don go bar zad do //
translated: The meaning is self-evident.

original: lam la rjes su shes pa ni rab 'byor ma skyes pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: lam la rjes su shes pa ni rab 'byor ma skyes pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: As for the knowledge of the path, he says, Subhuti, because it is unborn, etc.

original: nges par 'byin pa dang nges par 'byin pa ma yin pa dang bral ba nyid kyis /
analyzed: nges par 'byin pa dang nges par 'byin pa ma yin pa dang bral ba nyid kyis /
translated: It is free from what leads out and what does not lead out.

original: brjod par bya ba dang @174b rngad par byed pa'i ngo bo mtshan nyid shes bya dang sgra gnyis las shes pa skye ba med pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa bcu drug pa yin no //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba dang @174b rngad par byed pa'i ngo bo mtshan nyid shes bya dang sgra gnyis las shes pa skye ba med pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa bcu drug pa yin no //
translated: The knowledge that arises from the two, the object of knowledge and the word, which have the nature of the characteristic of the expressible and the expressing, is called unborn. This is the sixteenth aspect.

original: rnam pa gzhan gyis gos pa med pa'i don ston pa ni rab 'byor 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan gyis gos pa med pa'i don ston pa ni rab 'byor 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: To show the meaning of being unstained by other aspects, he says, Subhuti, it is thus, etc.

original: 'di ltar chos kyi de kho na nyid la mngon par zhen pa yang nyes pa nyid du gal te de ltar yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos kyi de kho na nyid la mngon par zhen pa yang nyes pa nyid du gal te de ltar yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, even the manifest clinging to the reality of things is a fault.🔽The sixteen aspects such as impermanence are the moments of the cognition of all aspects.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i tshul gyis rnam pa bcu drug po rnams ni thams cad shes pa nyid kyi skad cig ma yin no zhes byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mthong ba'i lam rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo nas bstan pas nyan thos la sogs pa rnams kyi mthong
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i tshul gyis rnam pa bcu drug po rnams ni thams cad shes pa nyid kyi skad cig ma yin no zhes byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mthong ba'i lam rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo nas bstan pas nyan thos la sogs pa rnams kyi mthong
translated: The path of seeing of the bodhisattvas is taught in terms of its subsequent attainment.

original: ba'i lam ni de las bzlog pas mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa can du nges par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ba'i lam ni de las bzlog pas mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa can du nges par bya ba yin no //
translated: The path of seeing of the śrāvakas and so on is the opposite of that. It is ascertained to have the aspects of impermanence and so on.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As it is said:

original: gzugs rtag ma yin mi rtag min //
analyzed: gzugs rtag ma yin mi rtag min //
translated: Form is neither permanent nor impermanent.

original: mtha' las 'das dang rnam dag dang // ma skyes ma 'gags la sogs pa dang // mkha' 'dra chags pa spangs pa dang // yongs su 'dzin las grol ba dang // ngo bo nyid ya sa brjod med dang // gang phyir 'di don brjod pa yis //
analyzed: mtha' las 'das dang rnam dag dang // ma skyes ma 'gags la sogs pa dang // mkha' 'dra chags pa spangs pa dang // yongs su 'dzin las grol ba dang // ngo bo nyid ya sa brjod med dang // gang phyir 'di don brjod pa yis //
translated: inexpressible by nature,🔽and because its meaning cannot be given to others🔽by expressing it,

original: gzhan la sbyin du med pa dang // dmigs pa med par byed pa dang // shin tu rnam pa dag nad mi 'byung //
analyzed: gzhan la sbyin du med pa dang // dmigs pa med par byed pa dang // shin tu rnam pa dag nad mi 'byung //
translated: it is non-apprehensible,🔽and the extremely pure element does not arise.

original: ngan song chang dang 'bras bu ni //🔽mngon du bya la mi rtog nyid //
analyzed: ngan song chang dang 'bras bu ni // mngon du bya la mi rtog nyid //
translated: The fruit of the lower realms🔽is not to be realized, but non-conceptuality

original: mtshan ma dag dang ma 'brel dang // dngos dang ming dang gnyis po la //
analyzed: mtshan ma dag dang ma 'brel dang // dngos dang ming dang gnyis po la //
translated: is not connected with signs,

original: shes pa skye ba med pa ni //
analyzed: shes pa skye ba med pa ni //
translated: and knowledge is unborn🔽in terms of entity, name, or both.

original: kun shes nyid kyi skad cig ma //
analyzed: kun shes nyid kyi skad cig ma //
translated: The moment of complete understanding

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: is the ultimate truth.

original: de ltar rgyas par bstan nas don thams cad sdud par byed pa nyid kyis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi nang nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mjug bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de ltar rgyas par bstan nas don thams cad sdud par byed pa nyid kyis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi nang nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mjug bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir //
translated: Having thus taught in detail, in order to conclude the knowledge of all aspects from among the three knowledges, by condensing all the meanings,

original: rab 'byor yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te zhes bya ba ni thams cad la'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te zhes bya ba ni thams cad la'o //
translated: he says, Subhūti, this perfection of wisdom, etc. Etc. refers to everything.

original: de la 'jug par byed pa ni sems bskyed pa'i sgo nas skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'jug par byed pa ni sems bskyed pa'i sgo nas skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: Among them, causing to enter is generating it by way of generating the thought of enlightenment.

original: nges par 'jug par byed pa ni gdams pa la sogs pas rab tu 'jog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: nges par 'jug par byed pa ni gdams pa la sogs pas rab tu 'jog par byed pa'o //
translated: Causing to definitely enter is causing to be well-placed by way of instruction, etc.

original: yang dag par ston par byed pa ni go cha'i sgrub pas spyi'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: yang dag par ston par byed pa ni go cha'i sgrub pas spyi'i tshul gyis so //
translated: Correctly teaching is by way of the general method of the armor practice.

original: nges par ston par byed pa ni 'jug pa'i sgrub pas khyad par gyi tshul gyis so //
analyzed: nges par ston par byed pa ni 'jug pa'i sgrub pas khyad par gyi tshul gyis so //
translated: Correctly demonstrating is by way of the special method of the practice of engagement.

original: yongs su thob par byed pa ni tshogs kyi sgrub pas thob par byed pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su thob par byed pa ni tshogs kyi sgrub pas thob par byed pa'o //
translated: Causing to attain is causing to attain by way of the practice of the collection.

original: nges par thob par byed @175a * //
analyzed: nges par thob par byed @175a * //
translated: One must definitely obtain it.🔽

original: pa ni nges par 'byung ba'i sgrub pas mthar phyin par byed pa'o zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: pa ni nges par 'byung ba'i sgrub pas mthar phyin par byed pa'o zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: One should supply: “one definitely causes to be attained” by the practice of definite emergence, one causes to be perfected.

original: phyin ci ma log pa'i chos bdud rtsi'i ros tshim pas mchod par byed pa ni /
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i chos bdud rtsi'i ros tshim pas mchod par byed pa ni /
translated: One makes offerings by satisfying with the taste of the nectar of the Dharma, which is unmistaken.

original: de nas lha'i bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: de nas lha'i bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: Then, the god, etc., is stated.

original: ca co dang gzhi byed de zhes bya ba ni rab tu dga' ba 'phel ba las byung ba'i seng ge'i sgra la bya'o zhes kha cig zer ro //
analyzed: ca co dang gzhi byed de zhes bya ba ni rab tu dga' ba 'phel ba las byung ba'i seng ge'i sgra la bya'o zhes kha cig zer ro //
translated: Some say that the “laughter and dancing” is the lion’s roar that arises from the increase of supreme joy.

original: gzhan dag ni dga' ba las skyes pa'i ha ha zhes rgod pa ni ca co yin la de sngon du 'gro bas gar byed pa ni ga zha byed pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni dga' ba las skyes pa'i ha ha zhes rgod pa ni ca co yin la de sngon du 'gro bas gar byed pa ni ga zha byed pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that the “laughter” is the laughter “ha ha” that arises from joy, and that the “dancing” is the dancing that precedes it.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo lan gnyis su zhes bya ba ni dang po b'a r'a na s'ir chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo lan gnyis su zhes bya ba ni dang po b'a r'a na s'ir chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba la ltos pa'o //
translated: The “second turning of the wheel of the Dharma” refers to the first turning of the wheel of the Dharma at Vārāṇasī.

original: de kho na nyid du mngon par zhen pa bsal bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir rab 'byor 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de kho na nyid du mngon par zhen pa bsal bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir rab 'byor 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: In order to dispel the manifest clinging to reality, he says, “Subhūti, this is the perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattvas, the great beings.”

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir chos gang la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir chos gang la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: In order to teach just that, he says, “There is no dharma whatsoever,” and so on.

original: lam shes pa nyid mjug bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: lam shes pa nyid mjug bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to conclude the knowledge of the path, he says, “Blessed One, this is the perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattvas, the great beings.”

original: chags pa ma mchis zhes bya ba ni mngon par zhen pa med pa'o //
analyzed: chags pa ma mchis zhes bya ba ni mngon par zhen pa med pa'o //
translated: “Unattached” means without manifest clinging.

original: dmigs su zin kyang chos mi ston pa'i rgyu ci zhig yin snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i slad du zhen zhes bya bas bsu nas /
analyzed: dmigs su zin kyang chos mi ston pa'i rgyu ci zhig yin snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i slad du zhen zhes bya bas bsu nas /
translated: What is the reason for not teaching the Dharma even when an opportunity has been found? He asks, “Why is that?”

original: chos gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te go sla'o //
analyzed: chos gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te go sla'o //
translated: “Because no dharma whatsoever,” and so on is easy to understand.

original: rab tu bskor bar bya ba ni bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: rab tu bskor bar bya ba ni bskyed par bya'o //
translated: “Should be fully turned” means should be generated.

original: rgyu'i tshogs pa byas pa las chos skye bas na ci ste de skad smra snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
analyzed: rgyu'i tshogs pa byas pa las chos skye bas na ci ste de skad smra snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
translated: To respond to this doubt, he says, Why is it so?

original: bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The Bhagavan said, All phenomena are...

original: rgyu nyid yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: rgyu nyid yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The meaning is that because the cause itself does not exist.

original: ldog pa zhes bya ba ni tho ba la sogs pas 'jig par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ldog pa zhes bya ba ni tho ba la sogs pas 'jig par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Destruction means being destroyed by a hammer and so on.

original: thob la sogs pa rgyun 'jug pa dang 'gal ba'i don skyed pa la zhig pa yin par ltag par zhen pa'i phyir ci ste de skad smra snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
analyzed: thob la sogs pa rgyun 'jug pa dang 'gal ba'i don skyed pa la zhig pa yin par ltag par zhen pa'i phyir ci ste de skad smra snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
translated: Since it is conceived that destruction generates an object that is incompatible with the continuation of the continuum, why do you say that?

original: bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad ni thog ma nas mngon par ma grub pa'o zhes bya ba gsol te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad ni thog ma nas mngon par ma grub pa'o zhes bya ba gsol te /
translated: To respond to this doubt, he says, The Bhagavan said, 'All phenomena are primordially unarisen.'

original: gdod ma nyid nas skye ba'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ma skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: gdod ma nyid nas skye ba'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ma skyes pa yin no //
translated: Since there is no cause of arising from the very beginning, they are unarisen.

original: de nyid ston pa ni chos thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis dben pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gsol te /
analyzed: de nyid ston pa ni chos thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis dben pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gsol te /
translated: The explanation of that is “because all phenomena are void of intrinsic nature.”

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir 'gag par ga la 'gyur zhes bya bar dgongs @175b so ;
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir 'gag par ga la 'gyur zhes bya bar dgongs @175b so ;
translated: What is the point? It is because they are empty of intrinsic nature, so how could they cease?

original: / thams cad shes pa nyid mjug bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir rab 'byor stong pa nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: / thams cad shes pa nyid mjug bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir rab 'byor stong pa nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to conclude the knowledge of all aspects, the Buddha said, “Subhūti, emptiness…” and so on.

original: stong pa nyid la sogs pa ni ma skyes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar bzhed do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la sogs pa ni ma skyes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar bzhed do //
translated: It is accepted that emptiness and so on are not produced.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni thams cad shes pa nyid da //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni thams cad shes pa nyid da //
translated: “This” refers to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: chos thams cad bstan pa yin te zhes bya ba nas brtsams te ;
analyzed: chos thams cad bstan pa yin te zhes bya ba nas brtsams te ;
translated: “The teaching of all phenomena” is easy to understand, from the beginning,

original: su yang sbyin pa'i gnas su byas pa med do zhes bya ba'i bar du don dam pa'i bden pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa yin pa'i phyir go sla'o //
analyzed: su yang sbyin pa'i gnas su byas pa med do zhes bya ba'i bar du don dam pa'i bden pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa yin pa'i phyir go sla'o //
translated: up to “no one is made an object of generosity,” because it is stated from the perspective of ultimate truth.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i tshul gyis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum mjug bsdu bya yin pa la som nyir mi bya'o //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i tshul gyis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum mjug bsdu bya yin pa la som nyir mi bya'o //
translated: One should not doubt that the three knowledges of a knower of all aspects are summarized in the way they have been explained.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And thus:🔽Thus this, and this, and this

original: de ltar 'di dang yang 'di dang / yang 'di yin te rnam gsum po //
analyzed: de ltar 'di dang yang 'di dang / yang 'di yin te rnam gsum po //
translated: are the three in three stages.

original: 'di ni gnas skabs gsum po dag / rdzogs par yongs su bstan pa yin //🔽zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni gnas skabs gsum po dag / rdzogs par yongs su bstan pa yin // zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is the complete teaching of the three.

original: ci'i phyir lam shes pa la ji skad bstan pa de bzhin du thams cad shes pa nyid la bsgom pa'i lam yang logs shig pa med ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir lam shes pa la ji skad bstan pa de bzhin du thams cad shes pa nyid la bsgom pa'i lam yang logs shig pa med ce na /
translated: Why is the path of meditation not separate from the knowledge of paths, as it was explained?

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi phun sum tshogs pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i shes pa dang mthong bas bltas nas 'da' bar bya'o zhes gsungs pas mngon sum du bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams la ma bstan to //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi phun sum tshogs pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i shes pa dang mthong bas bltas nas 'da' bar bya'o zhes gsungs pas mngon sum du bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams la ma bstan to //
translated: Because it is not directly realized by bodhisattvas, since it is said, “The perfection of śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas is to be transcended by looking with the knowledge and seeing of bodhisattvas.”

original: nyan thos la sogs pa rnams la yang ji ltar yongs su mthong ba'i don nyid yang dang yang du mngon du byed pa bsgom pa'i lam yin pas go sla ba'i phyir ma gsungs so //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa rnams la yang ji ltar yongs su mthong ba'i don nyid yang dang yang du mngon du byed pa bsgom pa'i lam yin pas go sla ba'i phyir ma gsungs so //
translated: Also, for śrāvakas and so on, the path of meditation is to repeatedly manifest the meaning that is seen, but it is not mentioned because it is easy to understand.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa ni sngar bshad pa nyid yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa ni sngar bshad pa nyid yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the factors conducive to penetrative insight of bodhisattvas are as previously explained.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams kyi bden pa bzhi la dmigs par byed pa na zag pa dang bcas pa'i sgom pa'i rang bzhin gyi dro ba la sogs pa yin par gsal ba'i phyir ma gsungs so zhes gzung ngo
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams kyi bden pa bzhi la dmigs par byed pa na zag pa dang bcas pa'i sgom pa'i rang bzhin gyi dro ba la sogs pa yin par gsal ba'i phyir ma gsungs so zhes gzung ngo
translated: For śrāvakas and so on, the nature of the contaminated meditation that focuses on the four truths with aspects such as impermanence is not mentioned because it is well known.

original: // lam shes pa'i skabs su nyan thos la sogs pa'i lam yang bshad pas /
analyzed: // lam shes pa'i skabs su nyan thos la sogs pa'i lam yang bshad pas /
translated: Since the paths of śrāvakas and so on are also explained in the context of knowledge of the path,

original: thams cad shes pa nyid kho na ma yin nam /
analyzed: thams cad shes pa nyid kho na ma yin nam /
translated: aren't they all knowledge of all aspects?

original: ci'i phyir thams cad shes pa nyid logs shig tu bstan zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir thams cad shes pa nyid logs shig tu bstan zhe na /
translated: Why is knowledge of all aspects taught separately?

original: de brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de brjod par bya ste /
translated: That will be explained.

original: de la lam shes nyid kyi tshul la ni /
analyzed: de la lam shes nyid kyi tshul la ni /
translated: As for the way of knowledge of the path,🔽it is said that the bodhisattva should cultivate the paths of the śrāvakas, etc.,

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ngag gi / rnam pa mi dmigs sgo nas ni //🔽nyan thos lam 'di shes par bya //🔽zhes bya ba mi dmigs par bsgom pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis nyan thos la @176a * //🔽sogs pa'i lam byang chub sems dpas bsgom par bya'o zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ngag gi / rnam pa mi dmigs sgo nas ni // nyan thos lam 'di shes par bya // zhes bya ba mi dmigs par bsgom pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis nyan thos la @176a * // sogs pa'i lam byang chub sems dpas bsgom par bya'o zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: by way of the four noble truths, through the door of non-apprehension.

original: de bas na mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa 'phangs pa rnams kyis gzhi ma lus pa yongs su shes pa yin pa'i don du thams cad shes pa nyid logs shig tu bshad par gzung ngo //
analyzed: de bas na mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa 'phangs pa rnams kyis gzhi ma lus pa yongs su shes pa yin pa'i don du thams cad shes pa nyid logs shig tu bshad par gzung ngo //
translated: Thus, by the force of the aspects such as impermanence, it is to be understood that all is explained separately as the knowledge of all for the sake of thoroughly knowing the entire basis.

original: 'di la brjod par bya ba mang du yod mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di la brjod par bya ba mang du yod mod kyi /
translated: Although there is much to be said on this point,

original: shin tu spros pas chog go //
analyzed: shin tu spros pas chog go //
translated: enough of this extensive elaboration.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bshad pa mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan gyi snang ba las thams cad shes pa'i le'u ste skabs gsum pa'o /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bshad pa mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan gyi snang ba las thams cad shes pa'i le'u ste skabs gsum pa'o /
translated: This concludes the third chapter on the knowledge of all, from the Illumination of the Ornament of Clear Realization, an explanation of the perfection of wisdom.

original: // / yongs su shes par gyur pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum po dbang du bya ba'i phyir yang rnam pa dang lam dang gzhi shes pa thams cad bsdu ba'i sgo nas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum sgom par byed pa yin pas /
analyzed: // / yongs su shes par gyur pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum po dbang du bya ba'i phyir yang rnam pa dang lam dang gzhi shes pa thams cad bsdu ba'i sgo nas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum sgom par byed pa yin pas /
translated: In order to master the three knowledges that are fully known, one cultivates the three knowledges by means of the knowledge of aspects, the knowledge of the path, and the knowledge of bases.

original: rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs bar rtogs pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs bar rtogs pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: The knowledge of all aspects should be mentioned.

original: de la re zhig rtag pa la sogs par 'dzin pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gnyen po'i chos kyi ngo bo nyid mi rtag pa la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i shes pa'i bye brag rnams rnam pa nyid du rnam par gzhag pa ni spyi'i mtshan nyid yin par
analyzed: de la re zhig rtag pa la sogs par 'dzin pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gnyen po'i chos kyi ngo bo nyid mi rtag pa la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i shes pa'i bye brag rnams rnam pa nyid du rnam par gzhag pa ni spyi'i mtshan nyid yin par
translated: The aspects are the specific cognitions that focus on impermanence, etc., the reality of the Dharma that is the antidote to the discordant class of grasping such things as permanence.

original: shes par bya ste /
analyzed: shes par bya ste /
translated: They should be understood as the general characteristics.

original: de bas na 'di la gzhi med pa'i nyes ba 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na 'di la gzhi med pa'i nyes ba 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the fault of having no basis does not occur in this system.

original: rnam pa de dag kyang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi bye brag gis rnam pa gsum kho nar bzhed do zhes gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa de dag kyang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi bye brag gis rnam pa gsum kho nar bzhed do zhes gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Those aspects are also asserted to be only three in number, by way of the particularities of the three omnisciences.

original: de 'di skad du yang /
analyzed: de 'di skad du yang /
translated: This is also stated in the following:

original: gzhi shes pa yi bye brag rnams //
analyzed: gzhi shes pa yi bye brag rnams //
translated: The particularities of the knowledge of the basis

original: rnam pa zhes bya mtshan nyid de //
analyzed: rnam pa zhes bya mtshan nyid de //
translated: are called aspects.

original: kun mkhyen nyid ni rnam gsum phyir //🔽de ni rnam pa gsum du 'dod //
analyzed: kun mkhyen nyid ni rnam gsum phyir // de ni rnam pa gsum du 'dod //
translated: Since there are three omnisciences,

original: ces gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ces gsungs pa yin no //
translated: they are asserted to be three.

original: de la 'phags pa'i bden pa rten du byas te /
analyzed: de la 'phags pa'i bden pa rten du byas te /
translated: In this regard, taking the ārya truths as the basis,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi dbang du byas nas bden pa gang la rnam pa ji snyed par 'gyur ba'i rnam pa de yongs su ston pa las /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi dbang du byas nas bden pa gang la rnam pa ji snyed par 'gyur ba'i rnam pa de yongs su ston pa las /
translated: from the perspective of the three omnisciences, the aspects that are taught are the number of aspects of each truth.

original: re zhig thams cad shes pa nyid kyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: re zhig thams cad shes pa nyid kyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: From the perspective of the knowledge of all aspects,

original: de skad ces bka' stsal ba dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal ba dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: the Bhagavān said, “Subhūti, it is so,” and so on.

original: 'di ni ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' dang 'dra bar rtag pa'i rang bzhin du ma mchis pa ste yod pa ma yin pa'i slad du ste /
analyzed: 'di ni ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' dang 'dra bar rtag pa'i rang bzhin du ma mchis pa ste yod pa ma yin pa'i slad du ste /
translated: This is the perfection of non-existence. It is non-existent as having the nature of permanence, like space, because it does not exist.

original: rgyur byas nas ma mchis pa ni mi rtag pa'i rnam pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rgyur byas nas ma mchis pa ni mi rtag pa'i rnam pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Non-existence through being compounded is the aspect of impermanence.

original: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa nyid kyi zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad mi dmigs pa @176b dang 'dra bar mnyam pa nyid yin zhing ma skyes pa nyid yin pa'i slad du sdug bsngal ba'i rnam pa rnam pa gzhan dang mi 'dra ba nyid kyis na mi
analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa nyid kyi zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad mi dmigs pa @176b dang 'dra bar mnyam pa nyid yin zhing ma skyes pa nyid yin pa'i slad du sdug bsngal ba'i rnam pa rnam pa gzhan dang mi 'dra ba nyid kyis na mi
translated: The equality of the unequal is the aspect of suffering. It is unequal, without similarity, because of the difference in aspect of all phenomena, which are equal to the non-apprehension of all phenomena, because of being unborn.

original: mnyam zhing 'dra ba med la /
analyzed: mnyam zhing 'dra ba med la /
translated: It is unequal, without similarity,🔽because of the difference in aspect of all phenomena, which are equal to the non-apprehension of all phenomena, because of being unborn.

original: de ni de kho na nyid du mnyam nyid de ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: de ni de kho na nyid du mnyam nyid de ma skyes pa'o //
translated: That is equality in reality, being unborn.

original: dben pa'i zhes bya ba ni shin tu ste /
analyzed: dben pa'i zhes bya ba ni shin tu ste /
translated: Isolation is extremely🔽isolated, because of the emptiness of self.

original: gtan nyid nas bdag stong pa'i slad du stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa'i yon tan thob par byed pa nyid kyis na dben pa'o //
analyzed: gtan nyid nas bdag stong pa'i slad du stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa'i yon tan thob par byed pa nyid kyis na dben pa'o //
translated: It is isolated because it causes the attainment of the quality of the aspect of emptiness.

original: mi brdzi ba'i zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad ni bdag nyid du mi dmigs pa'i slad du mu stegs pa thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir mu stegs pa rnams kyis 'khrugs par mi byed pa nyid kyis na bdag med pa'i rnam pa ni mi🔽brdzi ba yin no //
analyzed: mi brdzi ba'i zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad ni bdag nyid du mi dmigs pa'i slad du mu stegs pa thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir mu stegs pa rnams kyis 'khrugs par mi byed pa nyid kyis na bdag med pa'i rnam pa ni mi brdzi ba yin no //
translated: The aspect of non-subjugation is the aspect of selflessness, because the self cannot be disturbed by the tīrthikas, since all dharmas are not shared in common with all tīrthikas because of the non-apprehension of a self.

original: de ltar na med pa dang // mi skye ba dang / bden pa dang / mi brdzi ba'i rnam pa bzhi ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la grangs ji lta ba bzhin du mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na med pa dang // mi skye ba dang / bden pa dang / mi brdzi ba'i rnam pa bzhi ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la grangs ji lta ba bzhin du mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the four aspects of non-existence, non-arising, truth, and non-subjugation correspond to the four characteristics of impermanence, etc., in the truth of suffering, in that order.🔽The aspect of non-abiding is the aspect of the truth of origination, because the truth of origination is the cause of the body and name.

original: gnas pa ma mchis ba'i zhes bya ba ni de la gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po bzhi ni ming ngo //
analyzed: gnas pa ma mchis ba'i zhes bya ba ni de la gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po bzhi ni ming ngo //
translated: Name refers to the four non-material aggregates.

original: gzugs kyi phung po ni lus so //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po ni lus so //
translated: Body refers to the form aggregate.

original: 'di ni de rnams kyi rgyu yin pa de bas na /
analyzed: 'di ni de rnams kyi rgyu yin pa de bas na /
translated: This is their cause, therefore

original: rigs pas ming ma mchis shing lus ma mchis pa'i slad du rgyu'i rnam pa ni de kho na nyid du na bskyed pa'i gzhi ma yin pa'i don gyis na gnas med pa'o //
analyzed: rigs pas ming ma mchis shing lus ma mchis pa'i slad du rgyu'i rnam pa ni de kho na nyid du na bskyed pa'i gzhi ma yin pa'i don gyis na gnas med pa'o //
translated: The aspect of cause is the absence of a basis, in the sense that, in reality, there is no basis for the production of anything, because of the non-existence of a name and a body.

original: ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa'i zhas bya ba ni skye ba med pa dang / 'gag ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis 'gro ba dang 'ong ba ma mchis pa'i slad du kun 'byung ba'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa'i zhas bya ba ni skye ba med pa dang / 'gag ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis 'gro ba dang 'ong ba ma mchis pa'i slad du kun 'byung ba'i rnam pa ste /
translated: The aspect of origination is the absence of a basis, in the sense that there is no coming or going, because of the non-existence of an intrinsic nature, i.e. because of the non-existence of origination and cessation.

original: rigs pas nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: rigs pas nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'o //
translated: It is equal to space, because of the reasoning.

original: brjod du ma mchis pa'i zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad med pa nyid kyis brjod pa'i kun rdzob tu yang sgras brjod pa med pa'i phyir rtog pa ma mchis pa'i slad du rab tu skye ba'i rnam pa ni brjod pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: brjod du ma mchis pa'i zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad med pa nyid kyis brjod pa'i kun rdzob tu yang sgras brjod pa med pa'i phyir rtog pa ma mchis pa'i slad du rab tu skye ba'i rnam pa ni brjod pa med pa yin no //
translated: The aspect of arising is the absence of expression, in the sense that there is no conceptual differentiation, because of the non-existence of expression, i.e. because of the non-existence of the conventional expression of sound.

original: ming ma mchis pa'i zhes bya ba ni phung po lnga dmigs su ma mchis pa'i slad du sems las byung ba med pa nyid kyis na /
analyzed: ming ma mchis pa'i zhes bya ba ni phung po lnga dmigs su ma mchis pa'i slad du sems las byung ba med pa nyid kyis na /
translated: The aspect of cessation is the absence of a body, in the sense that there is no body, because of the non-existence of a name, i.e. because of the non-existence of the five aggregates.

original: rkyen gyi rnam pa ni ming med ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rkyen gyi rnam pa ni ming med ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The aspect of condition is called “nameless.”

original: de ltar na gnas med pa dang / nam mkha' dang // brjod du med pa dang / ming med pa'i rnam pa bzhi ni kun 'byung gi bden pa la go rims bzhin du rgyu la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur ro //🔽'gro ba ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos thams cad gang du yang 'gro ba med pa'i slad du 'gog pa'i rnam pa ni 'gro ba med pa'o //🔽mi 'phrogs pa zhes bya ba ni gzod ma nas zhi @177a * //🔽ba nyid kyis na yul gyi ngo bo nyid nye bar 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar na gnas med pa dang / nam mkha' dang // brjod du med pa dang / ming med pa'i rnam pa bzhi ni kun 'byung gi bden pa la go rims bzhin du rgyu la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur ro // 'gro ba ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos thams cad gang du yang 'gro ba med pa'i slad du 'gog pa'i rnam pa ni 'gro ba med pa'o // mi 'phrogs pa zhes bya ba ni gzod ma nas zhi @177a * // ba nyid kyis na yul gyi ngo bo nyid nye bar 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, the four aspects of baselessness, space, inexpressibility, and namelessness correspond to the truth of origination in the order of cause and so forth.🔽The aspect of cessation is called “non-going,” because all phenomena, which are by nature cessation, do not go anywhere.

original: chos thams cad gzung du ma mchis pa'i slad du zhi ba'i rnam pa ni mi 'phrogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad gzung du ma mchis pa'i slad du zhi ba'i rnam pa ni mi 'phrogs pa'o //
translated: The aspect of peace is called “unconquerable,” because all phenomena are by nature primordially peaceful, and so cannot be conquered by the objects that grasp at their nature.

original: mi bas pa zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin gyis mi bas ba'i chos dang ldan pa'i slad du gya nom ba ni mi zad ba'o//
analyzed: mi bas pa zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin gyis mi bas ba'i chos dang ldan pa'i slad du gya nom ba ni mi zad ba'o//
translated: The phrase “not to be destroyed” means that it is endowed with the quality of indestructibility because of its essential nature of the realm of the Dharma. The phrase “not to be exhausted” means that it is not subject to destruction.

original: mi skye ba zhes bya ba ni gcig dang du ma'i rgyu nyid dang bral ba nyid kyis chos thams cad mngon par ma grub pa'i slad du nges par 'byung ba'i rnam pa ni skye ba med pa'o //
analyzed: mi skye ba zhes bya ba ni gcig dang du ma'i rgyu nyid dang bral ba nyid kyis chos thams cad mngon par ma grub pa'i slad du nges par 'byung ba'i rnam pa ni skye ba med pa'o //
translated: The phrase “not to arise” means that it is the aspect of deliverance, which is non-arising, because all entities are not actually produced, due to the absence of a cause for their singularity or multiplicity.

original: de ltar na 'gro ba med pa dang / mi 'phrogs pa dang mi zad pa dang skye ba med pa'i rnam pa ni 'gog pa'i bden pa la go rims bzhin du 'gog pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //🔽byed pa po ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni lan ni byed pa por 'dzin pa'i gnyen por yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar na 'gro ba med pa dang / mi 'phrogs pa dang mi zad pa dang skye ba med pa'i rnam pa ni 'gog pa'i bden pa la go rims bzhin du 'gog pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro // byed pa po ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni lan ni byed pa por 'dzin pa'i gnyen por yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, the aspects of “non-going,” “not to be destroyed,” “not to be exhausted,” and “not to arise” are, respectively, the nature of cessation, etc., in relation to the truth of cessation.🔽The phrase “not to be appropriated” is the antidote to the notion that the self is an appropriator.

original: byed pa po mi dmigs pa'i slad du lam gyi rnam pa ni byed pa po med pa'o //
analyzed: byed pa po mi dmigs pa'i slad du lam gyi rnam pa ni byed pa po med pa'o //
translated: The phrase “not to be appropriated” means that it is the aspect of the path, which is the absence of an appropriator, because an appropriator is not perceived.

original: shes pa po med pa ni tshad ma dang 'gal ba nyid kyis na /
analyzed: shes pa po med pa ni tshad ma dang 'gal ba nyid kyis na /
translated: The absence of an experiencer is the aspect of reason, because it is in contradiction with valid cognition.

original: chos thams cad bdag ma mchis shing bdag dmigs su med pa'i slad du rigs pa'i rnam pa ni shes pa po med pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad bdag ma mchis shing bdag dmigs su med pa'i slad du rigs pa'i rnam pa ni shes pa po med pa'o //
translated: The absence of an experiencer is the aspect of reason, because all phenomena are selfless and the self is not perceived.

original: mi 'pho ba zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin gyis 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba dang 'jig pa dang skye ba dag mi 'thad pa'i slad du sgrub pa'i rnam pa ni 'pho ba med pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'pho ba zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin gyis 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba dang 'jig pa dang skye ba dag mi 'thad pa'i slad du sgrub pa'i rnam pa ni 'pho ba med pa'o //
