translated: The absence of transference is the aspect of accomplishment, because transference, birth, destruction, and arising are not tenable due to the nature of the realm of phenomena.

original: 'dul ba med pa zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' dang da ltar byung ba'i dus mi dmigs pa'i slad du nyon mongs pa dul ba mi srid pas nges par 'byin pa'i rnam pa ni 'dul ba med pa'o //
analyzed: 'dul ba med pa zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' dang da ltar byung ba'i dus mi dmigs pa'i slad du nyon mongs pa dul ba mi srid pas nges par 'byin pa'i rnam pa ni 'dul ba med pa'o //
translated: The absence of discipline is the aspect of definite deliverance, because the discipline of afflictions is not possible due to the non-perception of the prior limit, the later limit, and the present time.

original: de ltar na byed pa po med pa dang shes pa po med pa dang 'pho ba med pa dang 'dul ba med pa'i rnam pa bzhi ni lam gyi bden pa pa la go rims bzhin du lam la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen🔽por gyur pa yin no //🔽'di ni rmi lam dang sgra brnyan dang mig yo ra dang smig rgyu dang sgyu ma'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni rigs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i skye ba med pa'i phyir skye ba ma mchis pa rnam par shes par bgyid pa'i slad du rmi
analyzed: de ltar na byed pa po med pa dang shes pa po med pa dang 'pho ba med pa dang 'dul ba med pa'i rnam pa bzhi ni lam gyi bden pa pa la go rims bzhin du lam la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por gyur pa yin no // 'di ni rmi lam dang sgra brnyan dang mig yo ra dang smig rgyu dang sgyu ma'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni rigs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i skye ba med pa'i phyir skye ba ma mchis pa rnam par shes par bgyid pa'i slad du rmi
translated: Thus, the four aspects of the absence of an agent, the absence of a knower, the absence of transmigration, and the absence of one to be disciplined are, in order, the antidote to the afflictive obstructions that are the nature of the path and so forth.🔽This is the perfection of dream, of echo, of eye-disease, of mirage, and of illusion.

original: lam dang sgra brnyan dang mig yor dang smig rgyu dang sgyu ma'i rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: lam dang sgra brnyan dang mig yor dang smig rgyu dang sgyu ma'i rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The five aspects of dream, of echo, of eye-disease, of mirage, and of illusion are for the purpose of understanding non-arising because of the non-existence of arising that accords with reasoning.

original: go rims bzhin du ngo bo nyid med pa dang ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa dang gzod ma nas zhi ba dang rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid ni spyir shes bya'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por gyur pa dag yin te /
analyzed: go rims bzhin du ngo bo nyid med pa dang ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa dang gzod ma nas zhi ba dang rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid ni spyir shes bya'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por gyur pa dag yin te /
translated: The three types of path are the paths of accumulation, preparation, and seeing.🔽The three types of path are the paths of accumulation, preparation, and seeing.🔽The three types of path are the paths of accumulation, preparation, and seeing.🔽The three types of path are the paths of accumulation, preparation, and seeing.

original: thams cad @177b shes pa nyid kyis rang sangs rgyas kyang bsdus pa'i phyir de dag gi shes bya'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po'i bdag nyid can bsgom pa'i lam zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa gnyis yin pas lam rnam pa gsum du 'gyur ba yin no🔽// kun nas nyon mongs pa ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa'i slad du /🔽nyon mongs pa med pa ni /
analyzed: thams cad @177b shes pa nyid kyis rang sangs rgyas kyang bsdus pa'i phyir de dag gi shes bya'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po'i bdag nyid can bsgom pa'i lam zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa gnyis yin pas lam rnam pa gsum du 'gyur ba yin no // kun nas nyon mongs pa ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa'i slad du / nyon mongs pa med pa ni /
translated: The three types of path are the paths of accumulation, preparation, and seeing.🔽The three types of path are the paths of accumulation, preparation, and seeing.🔽The three types of path are the paths of accumulation, preparation, and seeing.🔽The three types of path are the paths of accumulation, preparation, and seeing.🔽The three types of path are the paths of accumulation, preparation, the paths of accumulation, preparation, and seeing.🔽The three types of path are the paths of accumulation, preparation, and seeing.🔽The three types of path are the paths of accumulation, preparation, and seeing.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
translated: The three types of path are the paths of accumulation, preparation, and seeing.🔽The three

original: rnam par byang ba ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni rten nyon mongs pa'i sems can mi dmigs pa'i slad du rnam par byang ba med pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni rten nyon mongs pa'i sems can mi dmigs pa'i slad du rnam par byang ba med pa ni /
translated: “Non-purification” means that since there is no observation of a sentient being who is afflicted, there is no purification.

original: rnam par byang ba ma mchis pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba ma mchis pa'o //
translated: “Non-purification” means that there is no purification.🔽“Non-defilement” means that since space is naturally luminous, it is undefiled because it is free from afflictions and secondary afflictions.

original: gos pa ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba yin pas gos pa ma mchis pa'i slad du nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa med pa ni gos pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gos pa ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba yin pas gos pa ma mchis pa'i slad du nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa med pa ni gos pa med pa'o //
translated: “Non-defilement” means that there is no defilement.

original: spros pa ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa'i rang bzhin gyi rlom sems thams cad las 'das pa'i slad du /
analyzed: spros pa ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa'i rang bzhin gyi rlom sems thams cad las 'das pa'i slad du /
translated: “Non-elaboration” means that since it transcends all conceptual thoughts that have the nature of observation,

original: spros pa yod pa ma yin pa ni spros pa med pa'o //
analyzed: spros pa yod pa ma yin pa ni spros pa med pa'o //
translated: “non-elaboration” means that there is no elaboration.🔽“Non-conceit” means that since all observations are completely destroyed, it is free from movement and shaking.

original: rlom sems ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni nye bar dmigs pa thams cad yang dag par bcom pas g-yo ba ma mchis shing 'gul ba med pa'i slad du rlom sems med pa ni rlom pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rlom sems ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni nye bar dmigs pa thams cad yang dag par bcom pas g-yo ba ma mchis shing 'gul ba med pa'i slad du rlom sems med pa ni rlom pa med pa'o //
translated: “Non-conceit” means that there is no conceit.

original: mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba ji srid par chos kyi dbyings gnas pa nyid kyi nyams pa med pas na mi g-yo ba'o //🔽de ltar na kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa dang / gos pa med pa dang / spros pa med pa dang / rlom sems med pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba ji srid par chos kyi dbyings gnas pa nyid kyi nyams pa med pas na mi g-yo ba'o // de ltar na kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa dang / gos pa med pa dang / spros pa med pa dang / rlom sems med pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i rnam pa ste /
translated: Immovable means that since there is no degeneration of the abiding state of the dhatu of phenomena for as long as samsara exists, it is immovable.🔽Thus, the six aspects of the path of seeing are the antidotes for the six types of conceptual thoughts that obscure the path of seeing of pratyekabuddhas: the afflictions of the obscurations of knowledge, purification, the traces of affliction, the proliferation of form and so on, realization, and degeneration.

original: drug ni go rims bzhin du shes bya'i sgrib pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba dang nyon mongs pa'i bag chags dang gzugs la sogs pa'i spros pa dang / rang gi rtogs pa dang / yongs su nyams par rnam par rtog pa ste drug gi so sor nges pa'i gnyen por gyur pa rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi mthong ba'i lam zag pa med pa shes bya'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po'i bdag nyid can la 'gyur ba dag yin te /
analyzed: drug ni go rims bzhin du shes bya'i sgrib pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba dang nyon mongs pa'i bag chags dang gzugs la sogs pa'i spros pa dang / rang gi rtogs pa dang / yongs su nyams par rnam par rtog pa ste drug gi so sor nges pa'i gnyen por gyur pa rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi mthong ba'i lam zag pa med pa shes bya'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po'i bdag nyid can la 'gyur ba dag yin te /
translated: The path of seeing of pratyekabuddhas is the antidote for the obscurations of knowledge.

original: spyir bsdu na thams cad shes pa nyid kyi rnam pa nyi shu rtsa bdun yin no //
analyzed: spyir bsdu na thams cad shes pa nyid kyi rnam pa nyi shu rtsa bdun yin no //
translated: In brief, there are twenty-seven aspects of the knowledge of all things.

original: de skad du yang /🔽med pa'i rnam pa nas gzung ste //
analyzed: de skad du yang / med pa'i rnam pa nas gzung ste //
translated: As it is said:🔽From the aspect of non-existence

original: mi g-yo ba yi rnam pa'i bar //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba yi rnam pa'i bar //
translated: up to the aspect of non-wavering,🔽In each truth there are four,

original: bden pa so so la bzhi dang // lam la de ni bco lngar bshad //🔽ces gsungs pa @178a * //
analyzed: bden pa so so la bzhi dang // lam la de ni bco lngar bshad // ces gsungs pa @178a * //
translated: and in the path there are fifteen.

original: yin no // de'i 'og tu lam shes pa nyid kyi rnam par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: yin no // de'i 'og tu lam shes pa nyid kyi rnam par brjod par bya'o //
translated: After that, the knowledge of the path should be explained.

original: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / cig shos kyi phyogs la brten nas kun 'byung ba dang lam gyi bden pa dag ni rgyu yin la /
analyzed: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / cig shos kyi phyogs la brten nas kun 'byung ba dang lam gyi bden pa dag ni rgyu yin la /
translated: Therein, the truths of origination and path are causes based on the side of affliction and the side of purification, respectively.

original: sdug bsngal dang 'gog pa'i bden pa dag ni 'bras bu yin no zhes don gyi sgo nas bstan pa /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang 'gog pa'i bden pa dag ni 'bras bu yin no zhes don gyi sgo nas bstan pa /
translated: The truths of suffering and cessation are results. Thus, the meaning is explained.

original: kun 'byung ba dang / lam dang / sdug bsngal dang / 'gog pa'i bden pa la go rims bzhin du rnam pa brgyad dang / bdun dang / lnga dang / bcu drug yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba dang / lam dang / sdug bsngal dang / 'gog pa'i bden pa la go rims bzhin du rnam pa brgyad dang / bdun dang / lnga dang / bcu drug yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the truths of origination, path, suffering, and cessation have eight, seven, five, and sixteen aspects, respectively.

original: de la rgyu ni rnam pa gsum ste /🔽'dun pa dang 'dod chags dang yang srid can gyi srid pa dga' ba dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la rgyu ni rnam pa gsum ste / 'dun pa dang 'dod chags dang yang srid can gyi srid pa dga' ba dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: There are three causes of craving:🔽craving accompanied by delight, which is desire and attachment, and craving accompanied by delight, which is craving for renewed existence.

original: 'dun pa'i gnyen por ni 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dun pa'i gnyen por ni 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The antidote to desire is nonattachment,

original: chos thams cad ni stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis phyin ci ma log pa de bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis phyin ci ma log pa de bzhin nyid de /
translated: because all phenomena are reality, the undifferentiated suchness that is the nature of emptiness.

original: bden pa nyid kyi slad du 'dod chags med pa ni 'dod chags dang bral ba yid la byed pa 'dod chags pa la dgongs pas bstan te /
analyzed: bden pa nyid kyi slad du 'dod chags med pa ni 'dod chags dang bral ba yid la byed pa 'dod chags pa la dgongs pas bstan te /
translated: Nonattachment is taught as the mental attention of nonattachment, which is the absence of attachment, because of its truth, and it is taught with the intention of attachment,

original: bdun pa'i skabs su 'dod chags ni gtso bo yin pas de med na 'dun par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdun pa'i skabs su 'dod chags ni gtso bo yin pas de med na 'dun par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because in the context of the seventh stage, attachment is primary, and when it is absent, desire is taught.

original: yang na 'bras bu'i bdag nyid 'dod chags med pas de'i rgyu ma tshang ba med pa'i 'dun pa med par ston pa yin te gzhan du ma tshang pa med par gyur na 'bras bu mi skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i rigs so //
analyzed: yang na 'bras bu'i bdag nyid 'dod chags med pas de'i rgyu ma tshang ba med pa'i 'dun pa med par ston pa yin te gzhan du ma tshang pa med par gyur na 'bras bu mi skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i rigs so //
translated: Or else, it shows that since there is no attachment in the nature of the result, there is no aspiration for the complete cause of that, because it is reasonable that if the other were complete, the result would not be unarisen.

original: 'dod chags kyi gnyen po'i ldang ba ma mchis pa zhes bya ba gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi gnyen po'i ldang ba ma mchis pa zhes bya ba gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: This is what is said in the statement “There is no arising of the antidote to attachment.”

original: sgyu ma dang 'dra ba nyid kyis ni chos thams cad rnam par mi rtog pa nyid kyi slad du ldang ba zhes bya ba 'dun pa med pas ldang ba med pa ste /
analyzed: sgyu ma dang 'dra ba nyid kyis ni chos thams cad rnam par mi rtog pa nyid kyi slad du ldang ba zhes bya ba 'dun pa med pas ldang ba med pa ste /
translated: By being like an illusion, all phenomena are nonconceptual. Because of that, there is no aspiration called “arising,” so there is no arising.

original: chos rnams la zhen pa med pa la dgongs nas gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: chos rnams la zhen pa med pa la dgongs nas gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is stated with the intention that there is no attachment to phenomena.

original: de ltar byas na 'dod chags kyi gnas skabs su 'dun pa ni dngos su 'jug pa'i rgyu nyid kyi gtso bo yin pas na /
analyzed: de ltar byas na 'dod chags kyi gnas skabs su 'dun pa ni dngos su 'jug pa'i rgyu nyid kyi gtso bo yin pas na /
translated: If it is done in that way, since aspiration is the primary cause of direct engagement in the context of attachment,

original: de med na 'dod chags med par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med na 'dod chags med par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is taught that if it does not exist, attachment does not exist.

original: yang srid kyi rgyu mtshan gyi srid pa dga' ba dang ldang ba'i gnyen po brjod pa ni zhi ba zhes bya ba ste /🔽chos thams cad kyi sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i mtshan ma mi dmigs pa'i slad du /
analyzed: yang srid kyi rgyu mtshan gyi srid pa dga' ba dang ldang ba'i gnyen po brjod pa ni zhi ba zhes bya ba ste / chos thams cad kyi sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i mtshan ma mi dmigs pa'i slad du /
translated: The expression peace is the antidote to the craving for existence, the cause of rebirth, and to the delight in and attachment to existence.

original: sred pa gtso bor gyur pa'i nye bar ma zhi ba med pas zhi ba'o //🔽kun 'byung ni gsum ste 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug go //
analyzed: sred pa gtso bor gyur pa'i nye bar ma zhi ba med pas zhi ba'o // kun 'byung ni gsum ste 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug go //
translated: It is peace because there is no craving, which is the most important of the subsidiary defilements, since one does not apprehend any sign of all dharmas, such as blue or yellow.

original: de'i gnyen po ni skyon ma mchis pa zhes smos te /
analyzed: de'i gnyen po ni skyon ma mchis pa zhes smos te /
translated: The expression faultless refers to the origin of suffering, which is threefold: passion, hatred and delusion.

original: stobs bcu dang mi @178b 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i slad du nyes pa med pa ni skyon med pa ste /
analyzed: stobs bcu dang mi @178b 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i slad du nyes pa med pa ni skyon med pa ste /
translated: It is faultless because of the perfection of the qualities of the ten powers, the four forms of fearlessness, etc.

original: 'dod chags med pa /
analyzed: 'dod chags med pa /
translated: It is the absence of passion,

original: zhe sdang med pa /
analyzed: zhe sdang med pa /
translated: the absence of hatred,

original: gti mug med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gti mug med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the absence of delusion.

original: rab tu skye ba ni yongs su rtog pa ste /
analyzed: rab tu skye ba ni yongs su rtog pa ste /
translated: The expression arising refers to conceptual differentiation,

original: de las 'dod chags la sogs pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las 'dod chags la sogs pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because passion, etc. arise from that.

original: de'i gnyan por ni nyon mongs pa ma mchis pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i gnyan por ni nyon mongs pa ma mchis pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The antidote to that is called “free of afflictions.”

original: gnyis pa la sogs pa mngon par zhen pa'i yongs su rtogs pa mchis pa'i slad du nyon mongs pa'i rgyu rab tu 'byung ba med pa ni nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa la sogs pa mngon par zhen pa'i yongs su rtogs pa mchis pa'i slad du nyon mongs pa'i rgyu rab tu 'byung ba med pa ni nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
translated: Because of the thorough conceptualization of clinging to the second and so on, the non-arising of the cause of afflictions is free of afflictions.

original: 'jig tshogs su lta ba ni nyes pa thams cad kyi rkyen nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs su lta ba ni nyes pa thams cad kyi rkyen nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the view of the transitory collection is the condition of all faults,

original: rkyen ni sems can du mngon bar zhen pa yin la /
analyzed: rkyen ni sems can du mngon bar zhen pa yin la /
translated: the condition is clinging to sentient beings.

original: de'i gnyen por ni sems can ma mchis pa zhes smos te /
analyzed: de'i gnyen por ni sems can ma mchis pa zhes smos te /
translated: The antidote to that is called “free of sentient beings.”

original: phyin ci ma log pa'i don gyis na yang dag pa'i mtha'i slad du rkyen med pa ni sems can med pa'o //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i don gyis na yang dag pa'i mtha'i slad du rkyen med pa ni sems can med pa'o //
translated: Because of the unmistaken meaning, the non-condition of the perfect end is free of sentient beings.

original: de ltar na 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rnam pa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de ltar na 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rnam pa nas brtsams te /
translated: Thus, beginning with the aspect of freedom from attachment,

original: sems can med pa'i rnam pa zhes bya ba'i par dag ni go rims bzhin du rgyu gang yin pa 'dun pa dang / 'dod chags dang / dga' ba dang ldan pa dang / kun 'byung ba gang yin pa 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang /
analyzed: sems can med pa'i rnam pa zhes bya ba'i par dag ni go rims bzhin du rgyu gang yin pa 'dun pa dang / 'dod chags dang / dga' ba dang ldan pa dang / kun 'byung ba gang yin pa 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang /
translated: The aspect of origin is the aspect of the origin of suffering, which is the aspect of origin.🔽The aspect of arising is the aspect of the arising of suffering, which is the aspect of origin.

original: rab tu skye ba gang yin pa yongs su rtog pa dang rkyen gang yin pa sems can du mngon par zhen bya ba ste /
analyzed: rab tu skye ba gang yin pa yongs su rtog pa dang rkyen gang yin pa sems can du mngon par zhen bya ba ste /
translated: The aspect of conditions is the aspect of the conditions of suffering, which is the aspect of origin.

original: de rnams kyi gnyen por gyur pa gsum dang / gsum dang / gcig dang / gcig ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi gnyen por gyur pa gsum dang / gsum dang / gcig dang / gcig ste /
translated: The antidotes to those are three, three, one, and one, respectively.

original: de ltar na kun 'byung gi bden pa la rnam pa brgyad du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na kun 'byung gi bden pa la rnam pa brgyad du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Thus the truth of origin has eight aspects.

original: tshad ma mchis pa zhes bya ba chos thams cad ldang ba zhes bya ba 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i ldang ba ma mchis pa'i slad du mi mthun pa'i phyogs ldog pa'i gnyen po thob pa nyid kyis na sems can tshad med pa'i go skabs 'byed pa'i phyir lam gyi
analyzed: tshad ma mchis pa zhes bya ba chos thams cad ldang ba zhes bya ba 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i ldang ba ma mchis pa'i slad du mi mthun pa'i phyogs ldog pa'i gnyen po thob pa nyid kyis na sems can tshad med pa'i go skabs 'byed pa'i phyir lam gyi
translated: The path of meditation is called immeasurable because it is the cause of the immeasurable result of the infinite qualities of the Buddha.🔽🔽It is called the path of meditation because it is the cause of the infinite qualities of the Buddha.🔽

original: rnam pa ni tshad med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa ni tshad med pa'o //
translated: The aspect of the path is immeasurable, because it opens up the opportunity for immeasurable sentient beings.

original: yang ji ltar sems can tshad med pa'i go skabs 'byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar sems can tshad med pa'i go skabs 'byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: How does it open up the opportunity for immeasurable sentient beings?

original: mtha' gnyis mi rtog pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: mtha' gnyis mi rtog pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: It is said that it is non-conceptual with regard to the two extremes.

original: chos thams cad la mngon par ma chags pa'i slad du 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtha' gnyis spangs pa'i phyir mi rtog pa ni mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad la mngon par ma chags pa'i slad du 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtha' gnyis spangs pa'i phyir mi rtog pa ni mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: Non-conceptual means non-apprehension, because it abandons the two extremes of cyclic existence and nirvana, due to non-attachment to all phenomena.

original: tha mi dad pa zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin gyis chos thams cad dbyer med pa ste /
analyzed: tha mi dad pa zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin gyis chos thams cad dbyer med pa ste /
translated: Non-differentiation means all phenomena are undifferentiated by the nature of the dharma-realm.

original: sna tshogs ma yin pa'i slad du rigs pa'i rnam pa ni dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs ma yin pa'i slad du rigs pa'i rnam pa ni dbyer med pa'o //
translated: The aspect of reasoning is undifferentiated, because it is not various.

original: yang ji ltar na rigs pa @179a * //
analyzed: yang ji ltar na rigs pa @179a * //
translated: Moreover, how is it that the wise🔽are not attached to the world?

original: yin zhe na /
analyzed: yin zhe na /
translated: How is it reasoning?🔽He says,

original: mchog tu mi 'dzin pa'i zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: mchog tu mi 'dzin pa'i zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: “not grasping at the highest,”

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa thams cad la 'dod pa med pa'i slad du /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa thams cad la 'dod pa med pa'i slad du /
translated: because there is no desire for any of the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha levels.

original: de'i rnam par rtog pas ma gos pa ni mchog tu 'dzin pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rnam par rtog pas ma gos pa ni mchog tu 'dzin pa med pa'o //
translated: Not being sullied by its conceptualization is “not grasping at the highest.”

original: mi rtog pa'i zhes bya ba ni rtog pa thams cad zhi ba nyid kyi slad du sgrub pa'i rnam pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: mi rtog pa'i zhes bya ba ni rtog pa thams cad zhi ba nyid kyi slad du sgrub pa'i rnam pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
translated: “Non-conceptual” is the aspect of accomplishment, because all conceptualization is pacified.

original: ji ltar na sgrub pa yin zhe na gzhal du med pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ji ltar na sgrub pa yin zhe na gzhal du med pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: How is it accomplishment? He says, “incalculable,”

original: chos nyid tshad ma mchis pa'i slad du thob pa yongs su nyams pa dang / ma thob pa thob pa dman pa dang gya nom pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pa sngon du 'gro bas shes bya'i mthar thug pa dang bral ba nyid kyis na gzhal du med pa'o //
analyzed: chos nyid tshad ma mchis pa'i slad du thob pa yongs su nyams pa dang / ma thob pa thob pa dman pa dang gya nom pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pa sngon du 'gro bas shes bya'i mthar thug pa dang bral ba nyid kyis na gzhal du med pa'o //
translated: because it is the culmination of objects of knowledge, free from the conceptualization of the inferior and the sublime, which is the degeneration of attainment and the attainment of non-attainment, due to the immeasurability of reality.

original: chags pa ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni de dang der rtogs pa na nam mkha' dang 'dra bar chos thams cad la chags pa ma mchis pa'i slad du nges par 'byung ba'i rnam pa ni chags pa med pa'o //
analyzed: chags pa ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni de dang der rtogs pa na nam mkha' dang 'dra bar chos thams cad la chags pa ma mchis pa'i slad du nges par 'byung ba'i rnam pa ni chags pa med pa'o //
translated: The aspect of emancipation is nonattachment, because, when one realizes this and that, one is nonattached to all phenomena, which are like space.

original: de ltar na tshad med pa dang mtha' gnyis mi rtog pa dang / tha mi dad pa dang / mchog tu 'dzin pa med pa dang / rnam par mi rtog pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / chags pa med pa'i rnam pa dag las go rims bzhin du sems can thams cad la go skabs 'byed pa'i lam gang yin pa dang /
analyzed: de ltar na tshad med pa dang mtha' gnyis mi rtog pa dang / tha mi dad pa dang / mchog tu 'dzin pa med pa dang / rnam par mi rtog pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / chags pa med pa'i rnam pa dag las go rims bzhin du sems can thams cad la go skabs 'byed pa'i lam gang yin pa dang /
translated: Thus, the path that provides an opportunity for all sentient beings is the aspect of nonlimit, the aspect of nonconceptuality regarding the two extremes, the aspect of nondifferentiation, the aspect of nonapprehension of the supreme, the aspect of nonconceptuality, the aspect of nonapprehension of the immeasurable, and the aspect of nonattachment.

original: ji ltar sems can thams cad go skabs 'byed pa dang / rigs pa gang yin pa dang / ji ltar rigs pa dang sgrub pa gang yin pa dang / ji ltar sgrub pa dang nges par 'byung ba gang yin pa de rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ni gnyis dang /
analyzed: ji ltar sems can thams cad go skabs 'byed pa dang / rigs pa gang yin pa dang / ji ltar rigs pa dang sgrub pa gang yin pa dang / ji ltar sgrub pa dang nges par 'byung ba gang yin pa de rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ni gnyis dang /
translated: The nature of those is twofold: the path that provides an opportunity for all sentient beings, the path that is reasonable, the path that is practiced as it is reasonable, and the path that is practiced as it is reasonable and that is emancipation.

original: gnyis dang / gnyis dang gcig ste /
analyzed: gnyis dang / gnyis dang gcig ste /
translated: two, two, and one.

original: de ltar na lam gyi bden pa la rnam pa bdun du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na lam gyi bden pa la rnam pa bdun du 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the truth of the path is sevenfold.

original: mi rtag pa'i zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad med pa nyid kyis rgyu dang rkyen gyis 'dus ma bgyis pa'i slad du rtag pa ni yod pa yin pas med pa'i don ni rtag pa'i don no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad med pa nyid kyis rgyu dang rkyen gyis 'dus ma bgyis pa'i slad du rtag pa ni yod pa yin pas med pa'i don ni rtag pa'i don no //
translated: The meaning of impermanent is the meaning of permanent, because all things are permanent due to their non-existence by way of cause and condition, being uncompounded.

original: sdug bsngal ba'i zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' dang 'dra bar chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyi slad du ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'i zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' dang 'dra bar chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyi slad du ste /
translated: The meaning of suffering is the meaning of bliss, because all things are the same as space, due to the sameness of all things.

original: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal gyi dngos po thams cad la khyab pa yin no //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal gyi dngos po thams cad la khyab pa yin no //
translated: It pervades all things that are the entity of the suffering of conditioned existence.

original: stong pa nyid kyi zhes bya ba ni gnas par byed pa'i bdag dang 'brel pa'i dri dang rjes su 'brel pa tsam du yang chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i slad du gzhan gyis yongs su brtags pa'i bdag la sogs pa dang bral ba nyid kyis na stong pa'o
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi zhes bya ba ni gnas par byed pa'i bdag dang 'brel pa'i dri dang rjes su 'brel pa tsam du yang chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i slad du gzhan gyis yongs su brtags pa'i bdag la sogs pa dang bral ba nyid kyis na stong pa'o
translated: The meaning of empty is the meaning of not empty, because all things are empty due to the non-apprehension of a self imputed by another, such as the self that is related to the smell that causes abiding and is merely related to it.

original: // bdag ma mchis pa'i zhes bya @179b ba ni rang nyid bdag ma yin pa nyid kyis thams cad la mngon par ma chags pa'i slad du gang zag la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pas bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: // bdag ma mchis pa'i zhes bya @179b ba ni rang nyid bdag ma yin pa nyid kyis thams cad la mngon par ma chags pa'i slad du gang zag la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pas bdag med pa'o //
translated: The phrase without a self means that, because of the absence of a self in oneself, there is no self in any person, etc. because of the absence of intrinsic reality.

original: mtshan nyid ma mchis pa'i zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad mngon par ma grub pa'i slad du dngos po med pa ni mtshan nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid ma mchis pa'i zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad mngon par ma grub pa'i slad du dngos po med pa ni mtshan nyid med pa'o //
translated: The phrase without defining characteristics means that, because all things are not established, they are without defining characteristics because of the absence of intrinsic reality.

original: de ltar na de dag ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa'i rnam pa dang / lnga pa ni mtshan nyid med pa'i ram pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar na de dag ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa'i rnam pa dang / lnga pa ni mtshan nyid med pa'i ram pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ste /
translated: Thus, these are the five aspects of impermanence, suffering, emptiness, selflessness, and the absence of defining characteristics.

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la rnam pa ldar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la rnam pa ldar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, there are five aspects of the truth of suffering.

original: stong pa nyid thams cad kyi zhes bya ba ni sngon dang / phyi mar gyur pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi mtha' dang kun nas mtha' gnyis dang ldan pa'i phyir pa ri aan ta zhes bya ba'i dbus med pa nyid kyis mtha' yas mu ma mchis pa'i slad du 'gog pa'i bden pa'i rnam pa stong pa nyid bcu drug ni stong🔽pa nyid thams cad do //🔽de la phyi dang nang gnyi ga'i dngos po rnams 'gog pas /
analyzed: stong pa nyid thams cad kyi zhes bya ba ni sngon dang / phyi mar gyur pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi mtha' dang kun nas mtha' gnyis dang ldan pa'i phyir pa ri aan ta zhes bya ba'i dbus med pa nyid kyis mtha' yas mu ma mchis pa'i slad du 'gog pa'i bden pa'i rnam pa stong pa nyid bcu drug ni stong pa nyid thams cad do // de la phyi dang nang gnyi ga'i dngos po rnams 'gog pas /
translated: All emptinesses means the sixteen aspects of the truth of cessation, which are emptinesses, since they are limitless and boundless due to the nonexistence of a middle, because they possess the two extremes of prior and subsequent characteristics.

original: nang dang phyi rol dang gnyi ga'i stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa gsum ni 'gog pa'i rnam pa gnyid kyi ngo bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: nang dang phyi rol dang gnyi ga'i stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa gsum ni 'gog pa'i rnam pa gnyid kyi ngo bo nyid yin no //
translated: The three aspects of emptiness of internal, external, and both internal and external are the nature of the two aspects of cessation, since they are the cessation of internal, external, and both internal and external things.

original: stong pa nyid dang / snod kyi 'jig rten dang / don dam pa dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas dang / rtag pa dang / chad pa'i mtha' dang / 'khor ba thog ma dang tha ma med pa dang / rtogs pa'i chos dor ba med pa la btags pa'i bdag nyid can gyi mngon par zhen pa rnam pa brgyad 'gog pas go rims bzhin du stong pa nyid stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / snod kyi 'jig rten dang / don dam pa dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas dang / rtag pa dang / chad pa'i mtha' dang / 'khor ba thog ma dang tha ma med pa dang / rtogs pa'i chos dor ba med pa la btags pa'i bdag nyid can gyi mngon par zhen pa rnam pa brgyad 'gog pas go rims bzhin du stong pa nyid stong pa nyid dang /
translated: the emptiness of the great, the ultimate, the compounded, the uncompounded, the infinite, the beginningless and endless, and the nonrejection of the Dharma of realization.🔽The eight types of emptiness are the emptiness of emptiness,

original: chen po stong pa nyid dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid dang / 'dus byas stong pa nyid dang / 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid dang / mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid dang /🔽dor ba med pa stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: chen po stong pa nyid dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid dang / 'dus byas stong pa nyid dang / 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid dang / mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid dang / dor ba med pa stong pa nyid de /
translated: the emptiness of the great, the emptiness of the ultimate, the emptiness of the compounded, the emptiness of the uncompounded, the emptiness of what is beyond extremes, the emptiness of the beginningless and endless, and the emptiness of nonrejection.

original: stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa brgyad ni zhi ba'i rnam pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa brgyad ni zhi ba'i rnam pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
translated: These eight types of emptiness are the nature of the aspects of peace.

original: gya nom pa'i rnam pa ni gzhan gyis yongs su brtags pa'i byed pa po 'gog pas rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa'o ;
analyzed: gya nom pa'i rnam pa ni gzhan gyis yongs su brtags pa'i byed pa po 'gog pas rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa'o ;
translated: The aspect of the sublime is the aspect of emptiness of intrinsic nature, since it refutes the creator imputed by others.

original: / yul du 'khrul pa'i bdag nyid can btags pa dang mtshan nyid dang dus su 'khrul pa rnams 'gog pas chos thams cad dang rang gi mtshan nyid dang mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa gsum ni nges par 'byung ba'i rnam pa'i ngo bo nyid do🔽// ngo bo nyid 'gog pas dngos po med pa'i @180a * //
analyzed: / yul du 'khrul pa'i bdag nyid can btags pa dang mtshan nyid dang dus su 'khrul pa rnams 'gog pas chos thams cad dang rang gi mtshan nyid dang mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa gsum ni nges par 'byung ba'i rnam pa'i ngo bo nyid do // ngo bo nyid 'gog pas dngos po med pa'i @180a * //
translated: The three aspects of emptiness of nonobservation, of the nature of nonentities and of ultimate reality are the nature of the aspect of definite emergence since they refute the identity of error in terms of objects, imputations, characteristics and time.

original: ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa kho na nges par 'byung ba'i bdag nyid can yin te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa kho na nges par 'byung ba'i bdag nyid can yin te /
translated: The aspect of emptiness of the nature of nonentities is definitely the nature of definite emergence since it refutes intrinsic nature.

original: de ltar 'gog pa'i rnam pa dang / zhi ba'i rnam pa dang / bya nom pa'i rnam pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'i rnam pa'i dbang du byas nas nang gi bdag nyid can la sogs pa'i dngos po 'gog pa gang yin pa dang / mngon par zhen pa rnam pa brgyad dang bral bas ji ltar zhi ba yin pa dang /
analyzed: de ltar 'gog pa'i rnam pa dang / zhi ba'i rnam pa dang / bya nom pa'i rnam pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'i rnam pa'i dbang du byas nas nang gi bdag nyid can la sogs pa'i dngos po 'gog pa gang yin pa dang / mngon par zhen pa rnam pa brgyad dang bral bas ji ltar zhi ba yin pa dang /
translated: Thus, in terms of the aspects of cessation, peace, excellence, and definite emergence, the cessation of entities that have an internal nature and so on, the peacefulness that comes from being free from the eight kinds of clinging,

original: rang bzhin gyis ji ltar gya nom pa dang / 'khrul pa rnam pa gsum bsal bas ji ltar nges par 'byung ba dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya bas nges par 'byung ba gang yin pa ni go rims bzhin du gsum dang /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis ji ltar gya nom pa dang / 'khrul pa rnam pa gsum bsal bas ji ltar nges par 'byung ba dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya bas nges par 'byung ba gang yin pa ni go rims bzhin du gsum dang /
translated: the excellence that comes from being naturally peaceful, the definite emergence that comes from dispelling the three kinds of error, and the definite emergence that comes from the nature of non-entityness are, respectively, three,

original: brgyad dang / gcig dang / gsum dang / gcig ste /
analyzed: brgyad dang / gcig dang / gsum dang / gcig ste /
translated: eight, one, three, and one.

original: de ltar 'gog pa'i bden pa la rnam pa bcu drug tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar 'gog pa'i bden pa la rnam pa bcu drug tu 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the truth of cessation has sixteen aspects.

original: spyir ni lam shes pa nyid kyi rnam pa sum cu rtsa drug yin te /🔽de skad du yang /
analyzed: spyir ni lam shes pa nyid kyi rnam pa sum cu rtsa drug yin te /🔽de skad du yang /
translated: In general, the knowledge of the path has thirty-six aspects.

original: rgyu dang lam dang sdug bsngal dang // 'gog pa la ni go rims bzhin //
analyzed: rgyu dang lam dang sdug bsngal dang // 'gog pa la ni go rims bzhin //
translated: in order,

original: de dag brgyad dang bdun dang ni //
analyzed: de dag brgyad dang bdun dang ni //
translated: are proclaimed to be eight, seven,

original: lnga dang bcu drug ces bsgrags so //🔽zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: lnga dang bcu drug ces bsgrags so // zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: five, and sixteen in number.

original: de'i 'og tu rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rnam pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rnam pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: After that, the aspects of the knowledge of all aspects should be described.

original: de la yang 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad kyi dbang du byas pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi rnam pa bsdus par gyur pa yin pa de bas thams cad shes pa nyid kyi lam gyi dbye bas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa byang
analyzed: de la yang 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad kyi dbang du byas pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi rnam pa bsdus par gyur pa yin pa de bas thams cad shes pa nyid kyi lam gyi dbye bas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa byang
translated: Therein, from the perspective of all ārya persons, it is included in the three knowledges. Therefore, the path of the knowledge of all aspects is summarized in the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, such as the applications of mindfulness,

original: chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyi zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyi zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: by the division of the path of the knowledge of all aspects.🔽The thirty-seven factors of enlightenment are the applications of mindfulness, the right efforts, the bases of supernatural power, the faculties, the powers, the branches of enlightenment, and the branches of the path.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos de rnams nyid dmigs su ma mchis pa'i slad du /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos de rnams nyid dmigs su ma mchis pa'i slad du /
translated: Because those factors of enlightenment are not apprehended,

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa nyid pha rol tu phyin pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa nyid pha rol tu phyin pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: the applications of mindfulness, etc. are themselves the perfections. This is the meaning.

original: 'di skad du thams cad shes pa nyid de la dang por bden pa bzhi la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir shes bya dang / shes ba rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid du yongs su brtags pa lus dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos rnams dran ba nye bar gzhag pa'i rnam pa bzhi ni dngos po la yongs su rtog pa'i lam yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad du thams cad shes pa nyid de la dang por bden pa bzhi la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir shes bya dang / shes ba rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid du yongs su brtags pa lus dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos rnams dran ba nye bar gzhag pa'i rnam pa bzhi ni dngos po la yongs su rtog pa'i lam yin te /
translated: It is said that in order to enter the four noble truths, first, in that knowledge of all things, the four foundations of mindfulness of body, feeling, mind, and dharma are the path of thorough examination of things, since they thoroughly investigate objects of knowledge and consciousness as general and specific characteristics.

original: des lus la sogs pa'i dngos po rnam pa bzhi la yongs su rtog pa'i phyir ro //🔽de'i 'og tu zhugs pa la brtson 'grus 'byung bas mi dge ba skyes pa dang ma skyes pa dag go rims bzhin du rnam pa @180b thams cad du spang ba dang mi bskyed pa'i don dang phyir zhing 'byung ba dang skyed pa'i don gyi rgyur gyur pa'i brtson
analyzed: des lus la sogs pa'i dngos po rnam pa bzhi la yongs su rtog pa'i phyir ro // de'i 'og tu zhugs pa la brtson 'grus 'byung bas mi dge ba skyes pa dang ma skyes pa dag go rims bzhin du rnam pa @180b thams cad du spang ba dang mi bskyed pa'i don dang phyir zhing 'byung ba dang skyed pa'i don gyi rgyur gyur pa'i brtson
translated: Because they thoroughly investigate the four kinds of things such as the body.🔽After that, since effort arises in one who has entered the four noble truths, the four perfect abandonments are the path of endeavor, since they are the cause of abandoning and not producing nonvirtue that has arisen and not yet arisen, respectively, and of again and again producing and not producing virtue that has and has not arisen, respectively.

original: 'grus kyi bdag nyid can yang dag par spong ba rnam pa bzhi ni rtsol ba'i lam yin te /
analyzed: 'grus kyi bdag nyid can yang dag par spong ba rnam pa bzhi ni rtsol ba'i lam yin te /
translated: They are the nature of effort.

original: de bzhin du sgrib pa spang ba la sogs pa'i sgo nas brtson 'grus rtsom pa'i phyir ro //🔽brtson 'grus dang ldan pa ni sems las su rung ba nyid du byed pas 'dun pa dang brtson 'grus dang sems dang dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnam pa bzhi ni ting nge 'dzin yongs su sbyang ba'i
analyzed: de bzhin du sgrib pa spang ba la sogs pa'i sgo nas brtson 'grus rtsom pa'i phyir ro // brtson 'grus dang ldan pa ni sems las su rung ba nyid du byed pas 'dun pa dang brtson 'grus dang sems dang dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnam pa bzhi ni ting nge 'dzin yongs su sbyang ba'i
translated: Similarly, one exerts effort through the elimination of obscurations and so on.🔽The four bases of supernormal power are the path of complete training in concentration, because one who possesses effort makes the mind serviceable.

original: lam yin te /
analyzed: lam yin te /
translated: The four are the bases of supernormal power that possess the complete training in concentration, which is the complete training in the mind.

original: de bzhin du 'dun pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas sems las su rung ba nyid bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dun pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas sems las su rung ba nyid bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Similarly, one generates serviceability of mind through aspiration and so on.

original: sems yongs su sbyang ba byas pa'i rjes thogs la dro ba dang rtse mo'i sbyor ba 'byung bas de'i ngo bo nyid dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyi dbang po rnam pa lnga ni mngon par rtogs pa la sbyor ba'i lam yin te /
analyzed: sems yongs su sbyang ba byas pa'i rjes thogs la dro ba dang rtse mo'i sbyor ba 'byung bas de'i ngo bo nyid dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyi dbang po rnam pa lnga ni mngon par rtogs pa la sbyor ba'i lam yin te /
translated: The five faculties of faith, effort, mindfulness, concentration and wisdom are the path of preparation for clear realization, because they are the essence of heat and peak and they arise after the complete training in the mind.

original: dad ba'i dbang po la sogs pas 'phags pa'i lam yang dag par 'grub pa'i bdag por gyur pa /
analyzed: dad ba'i dbang po la sogs pas 'phags pa'i lam yang dag par 'grub pa'i bdag por gyur pa /
translated: The faculties of faith, etc., are the dominant condition for the correct establishment of the noble path.

original: dro ba dang rtse mo la sbyor ba'i phyir ro //🔽dro ba la sogs pa thob pa la /
analyzed: dro ba dang rtse mo la sbyor ba'i phyir ro // dro ba la sogs pa thob pa la /
translated: Because they are applied to heat and summit.🔽The five powers of faith, vigor, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom are the nature of the path connected to clear realization, since they are applied to receptivity and the supreme mundane state.🔽The five powers of faith, etc., are the nature of the path connected to clear realization, since they are applied to receptivity and the supreme mundane state.🔽The five powers of faith, vigor, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom are the nature of the path connected to clear realization, since they are applied to receptivity and the supreme mundane state.

original: bzod pa dang / chos kyi mchog 'byung bas de dag gi ngo bo nyid dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyi stobs rnam pa lnga ni /🔽rnam pa thams cad du mngon par rtogs pa dang 'brel pa'i lam yin te /
analyzed: bzod pa dang / chos kyi mchog 'byung bas de dag gi ngo bo nyid dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyi stobs rnam pa lnga ni / rnam pa thams cad du mngon par rtogs pa dang 'brel pa'i lam yin te /
translated: The five powers of faith, vigor, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom are the nature of the path connected to clear realization, since they are applied to receptivity and the supreme mundane state.🔽The five powers of faith, vigor, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom are the nature of the path connected to clear realization, since they are applied to receptivity and the supreme mundane state.🔽The five powers of faith, vigor, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom are the nature of the path connected to clear realization, since they are applied to receptivity and the supreme mundane state.🔽The five powers of faith, vigor, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom are the nature of the path connected to clear realization, since they are applied to receptivity and the supreme mundane state.🔽The five powers of faith, vigor, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom are the nature of the path connected to clear realization, since they are applied to receptivity and the supreme mundane state.🔽The five powers of faith, vigor, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom are the nature of the path connected to clear realization, since they are applied to receptivity and the supreme mundane state.🔽The five powers of faith, vigor, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom are the nature of the path connected to clear realization, since they are applied to receptivity and the supreme mundane state.🔽The five powers of faith, vigor, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom are the nature of the path connected to clear realization, since they are applied to receptivity and the supreme mundane state.

original: dad pa'i stobs la sogs pas de ma thag tu bden pa rtogs pa'i don du ma dad pa la sogs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs zil gyis gnon pa bzod pa dang chos kyi mchog la sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dad pa'i stobs la sogs pas de ma thag tu bden pa rtogs pa'i don du ma dad pa la sogs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs zil gyis gnon pa bzod pa dang chos kyi mchog la sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The five powers of faith, vigor, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom are the nature of the path connected to clear realization, since they are applied to receptivity and the supreme mundane state.🔽The five powers of faith, vigor, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom are the nature

original: dro ba la sogs pa bzhi po rtogs pa la bden pa mthong ba'i lam 'byung bas dran pa dang / chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dga' ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang /
analyzed: dro ba la sogs pa bzhi po rtogs pa la bden pa mthong ba'i lam 'byung bas dran pa dang / chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dga' ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang /
translated: Since the path of seeing the four truths arises in the realization of the four such as warmth, there is mindfulness, full differentiation of phenomena, effort, joy, pliancy, concentration and equanimity.🔽

original: btang snyoms kyi rnam pa byang chub kyi yan lag bdun ni mngon par rtogs pa'i lam yin te /
analyzed: btang snyoms kyi rnam pa byang chub kyi yan lag bdun ni mngon par rtogs pa'i lam yin te /
translated: The seven aspects of enlightenment are the path of clear realization: mindfulness, the thorough differentiation of phenomena, perseverance, joy, pliancy, samādhi, and equanimity.

original: nges thog mar so sor rang gis de kho na mngon par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges thog mar so sor rang gis de kho na mngon par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The path of seeing is the path of clear realization because it is the first direct realization of suchness by an ārya being.

original: mthong ba'i lam yongs su shes pa la bsgom pa'i lam 'byung bas yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / rtog pa dang / ngag dang / las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba dang / @181a * //🔽rtsol ba dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin te /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam yongs su shes pa la bsgom pa'i lam 'byung bas yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / rtog pa dang / ngag dang / las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba dang / @181a * // rtsol ba dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin te /
translated: The eight aspects of the noble path are the path of definite release: right view, thought, speech, action, livelihood, effort, mindfulness, and samādhi.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad kyi rnam pa ni rnam par dag pa nges par 'byin pa'i lam yin te /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad kyi rnam pa ni rnam par dag pa nges par 'byin pa'i lam yin te /
translated: The eight aspects of the noble path are the path of definite release because they are the means by which one is definitely released from the three realms.

original: mthong ba'i lam gyi steng du 'dis bsgom pas spong bar bya ba'i nyon mongs rnam par dag pa'i don du nges par 'byin pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyi steng du 'dis bsgom pas spong bar bya ba'i nyon mongs rnam par dag pa'i don du nges par 'byin pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: It is called the path of cultivation because one cultivates the path of seeing and because it definitely leads to the purification of the afflictions that are to be eliminated by cultivation.

original: de nyid kyis na byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyi go rims ni 'di yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyi go rims ni 'di yin no //
translated: This is the order of the factors of enlightenment.

original: des na de ltar dngos por yongs su rtogs pa'i lam la sogs pa lam bdun gyi dbang du byas nas kun shes pa nyid kyi lam gyi rten can gyi rnam pa sum cu rtsa bdun du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: des na de ltar dngos por yongs su rtogs pa'i lam la sogs pa lam bdun gyi dbang du byas nas kun shes pa nyid kyi lam gyi rten can gyi rnam pa sum cu rtsa bdun du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Thus, in terms of the seven paths, beginning with the path of thorough understanding, there are thirty-seven aspects that are based on the path of thorough understanding.

original: de'i 'og tu lam shes pa nyid kyi lam gyi dbye ba ni stong ba nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes smos te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu lam shes pa nyid kyi lam gyi dbye ba ni stong ba nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes smos te /
translated: Next, the path of the knowledge of the path is divided into the perfections of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: stong pa nyid dang bdag med pa'i rnam pa'i ngo bo nyid ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo dang po stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang bdag med pa'i rnam pa'i ngo bo nyid ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo dang po stong pa nyid de /
translated: The emptiness gate of liberation is the emptiness perfection, which has the nature of the aspects of emptiness and selflessness.

original: lta bas byas pa'i gnyen po'o //
analyzed: lta bas byas pa'i gnyen po'o //
translated: It is the antidote to the view of a real self.

original: mtshan ma med pa gang yin pa 'gog pa dang mtshan ma'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'i lam gang gis zhes bya bas 'gog pa dang lam gyi bden pa'i rnam pa'i rang bzhin rnam par thar pa'i sgo gnyis pa mtshan ma med pa ni lta ba'i rgyu
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa gang yin pa 'gog pa dang mtshan ma'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'i lam gang gis zhes bya bas 'gog pa dang lam gyi bden pa'i rnam pa'i rang bzhin rnam par thar pa'i sgo gnyis pa mtshan ma med pa ni lta ba'i rgyu
translated: The second door of liberation, signlessness, is the nature of the aspects of the truths of cessation and the path.

original: can gyi rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen po yin no //
analyzed: can gyi rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen po yin no //
translated: It is the antidote to the conception that is the cause of views.

original: zhi ba'i rnam pas mtshan ma med pa yin par gang gsungs pa de ni dngos po'i mtshan ma dang 'brel pa nyan thos kyi lam gyi dbang du byas pa yin pas de dang 'di la 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: zhi ba'i rnam pas mtshan ma med pa yin par gang gsungs pa de ni dngos po'i mtshan ma dang 'brel pa nyan thos kyi lam gyi dbang du byas pa yin pas de dang 'di la 'gal ba med do //
translated: The statement that signlessness is the aspect of peace is from the perspective of the śrāvaka path that is related to the sign of things. Therefore there is no contradiction between that and this.

original: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung gi bden pa'i rnam pa'i ngo bo nyid ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum pa smon pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung gi bden pa'i rnam pa'i ngo bo nyid ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum pa smon pa med pa yin te /
translated: The third door of liberation, wishlessness, is the nature of the aspects of the truths of impermanence, suffering, and origin.

original: khams gsum la smon pa'i gnyen po yin no //
analyzed: khams gsum la smon pa'i gnyen po yin no //
translated: It is the antidote to the wish for the three realms.

original: de ltar na rnam par thar pa'i sgo rnam pa gsum po rnam ni gnyen po'i lam yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rnam par thar pa'i sgo rnam pa gsum po rnam ni gnyen po'i lam yin no //
translated: Thus, the three doors of liberation are the path of the antidote.🔽The perfection of the eight liberations is the eight liberations.

original: 'di rnam par thar pa brgyad kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi 'du shes rnam par ma bshig pa dang rnam par bshig pa yin pa'i phyir go rims bzhin du nang gzugs can dang gzugs can ma yin pa'i bdag nyid bsam gtan nam
analyzed: 'di rnam par thar pa brgyad kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi 'du shes rnam par ma bshig pa dang rnam par bshig pa yin pa'i phyir go rims bzhin du nang gzugs can dang gzugs can ma yin pa'i bdag nyid bsam gtan nam
translated: The first two liberations are based on the fourth concentration, respectively with the perception of form not destroyed and with the perception of form destroyed, and have the nature of the meditative development of the form and formless realms.

original: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la brten te /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la brten te /
translated: The remaining liberations are based on the formless realm.

original: phyi rol gyi gzugs kha dog bzang nga dang kha dog ngan pa rnams la lta ba zhes bya ba 'di dag ni sprul pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por rnam par thar pa gnyis so //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi gzugs kha dog bzang nga dang kha dog ngan pa rnams la lta ba zhes bya ba 'di dag ni sprul pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por rnam par thar pa gnyis so //
translated: The first two liberations are the antidote to the obscuration to emanation, since one sees external forms as beautiful or ugly, respectively with the perception of form not destroyed and with the perception of form destroyed.

original: gzugs sdug pa dang mi sdug pa sprul pa la @181b go rims bzhin du dga' ba dang mi dga' ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa de dag gi gnyen por sdug pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo lus kyis mngon sum du byas nas rdzogs par byas te gnas pa🔽zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid so sor gzugs sdug pa dang mi sdug pa rnams la phan tshun ltos pa'i 'du shes dang phan tshun rjes su zhugs pa'i 'du shes la brten nas phan tshun ro gcig pa'i 'du shes thob pa ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du gzugs
analyzed: gzugs sdug pa dang mi sdug pa sprul pa la @181b go rims bzhin du dga' ba dang mi dga' ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa de dag gi gnyen por sdug pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo lus kyis mngon sum du byas nas rdzogs par byas te gnas pa zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid so sor gzugs sdug pa dang mi sdug pa rnams la phan tshun ltos pa'i 'du shes dang phan tshun rjes su zhugs pa'i 'du shes la brten nas phan tshun ro gcig pa'i 'du shes thob pa ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du gzugs
translated: The antidotes to those afflictions are the liberation door of the beautiful subha, which is the first liberation.🔽The first liberation is the attainment of the perception of the single taste of mutual dependence, based on the perception of mutual dependence and the perception of mutual engagement in relation to the beautiful and the ugly.

original: su mos pa dbang du gyur pa nyid thob pa'i phyir rnam par thar pa gcig yin te /
analyzed: su mos pa dbang du gyur pa nyid thob pa'i phyir rnam par thar pa gcig yin te /
translated: The second liberation is the attainment of mastery over the imagination of form as one wishes.

original: de ltar na rnam par thar pa rnam pa gsum ni sprul pa'i lam yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rnam par thar pa rnam pa gsum ni sprul pa'i lam yin no //
translated: Thus, the three types of liberation are the path of emanation.

original: thar pa dang mthun par gnas pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnam pa bzhi dang / zhi bar gnas pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa'i rnam pa gcig ste /
analyzed: thar pa dang mthun par gnas pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnam pa bzhi dang / zhi bar gnas pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa'i rnam pa gcig ste /
translated: The one aspect of the meditative attainment of the cessation of ideation and sensation is the nature of the path of abiding in peace.

original: de ltar na rnam pa lnga ni mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa'i lam yin no //🔽'di ni mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan bzhi dang gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnam pa dgu ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: de ltar na rnam pa lnga ni mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa'i lam yin no // 'di ni mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan bzhi dang gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnam pa dgu ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam mo //
translated: Thus, these five aspects are the path of abiding in comfort in this life.🔽This is the perfection of the nine serial meditative attainments. The nine serial meditative attainments are the four meditative states, the four formless meditative attainments, and the meditative attainment of cessation.

original: 'di ni bden pa bzhi'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni bden pa bzhis bsdus pa nyon mongs pa dang mi ldan pa'i mtshan nyid bar chad med pa'i lam bzhi ni spong ba'i lam yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni bden pa bzhi'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni bden pa bzhis bsdus pa nyon mongs pa dang mi ldan pa'i mtshan nyid bar chad med pa'i lam bzhi ni spong ba'i lam yin no //
translated: This is the perfection of the four noble truths. The four noble truths are the four aspects of the path of abandonment, which are characterized by the absence of afflictions and are included in the four noble truths.

original: 'di ni sa bcu'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnam pa bcu ni sangs rgyas nyid kyi lam yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni sa bcu'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnam pa bcu ni sangs rgyas nyid kyi lam yin no //
translated: This is the perfection of the ten stages. The ten perfections of giving and so on are the path to buddhahood.

original: de bas na de ltar gnyen po'i lam la sogs pa lam drug gi dbang du byas nas lam shes pa nyid kyi lam gyi rten can gyi rnam pa sum cu rtsa bzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na de ltar gnyen po'i lam la sogs pa lam drug gi dbang du byas nas lam shes pa nyid kyi lam gyi rten can gyi rnam pa sum cu rtsa bzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, in this way, the path of knowledge of the path is based on the path of the six, beginning with the path of the antidote, and has thirty-four aspects.

original: de'i 'og tu rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rnam pa brjod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rnam pa brjod par bya ba yin no //
translated: After that, the aspects of omniscience should be explained.

original: de la ni lam shin tu phul du byung ba yin pa'i phyir gcig bu kho na yin mod kyi khyad par gyi lam 'di'i stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i dbye bas thun mong ma yin pa'i khyad par 'ba' zhig brjod par bya ba yin pas 'di
analyzed: de la ni lam shin tu phul du byung ba yin pa'i phyir gcig bu kho na yin mod kyi khyad par gyi lam 'di'i stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i dbye bas thun mong ma yin pa'i khyad par 'ba' zhig brjod par bya ba yin pas 'di
translated: There, although it is indeed only one because it is the most excellent path, the special path should be explained as having only uncommon distinctions by the divisions of powers, fearlessnesses, and so on.

original: ni stobs bcu'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ni stobs bcu'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is the perfection of the ten powers.

original: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / las kyi rnam par smin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / 'jig rten gyi khams du ma mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / dbang po @182a * //
analyzed: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / las kyi rnam par smin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / 'jig rten gyi khams du ma mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / dbang po @182a * //
translated: The power of knowledge of what is right and wrong, the power of knowledge of the results of action, the power of knowledge of various higher and lower spiritual faculties, the power of knowledge of various elements of the world,

original: mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang /
analyzed: mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang /
translated: the power of knowledge of superior and inferior faculties, the power of knowledge of the paths that lead everywhere, the power of knowledge of the afflictions and their purification, the power of knowledge of recollection of former lives,🔽the power of knowledge of death and rebirth, and the power of knowledge of the destruction of the impurities.

original: 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs las nges par rgyal ba nyid kyis na mi brdzi ba'i slad du stobs kyi rnam pa bcu'o //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs las nges par rgyal ba nyid kyis na mi brdzi ba'i slad du stobs kyi rnam pa bcu'o //
translated: These are the ten powers, because of being invincible due to being definitely victorious over the discordant side.

original: grangs dang chos kyi mtshan nyid dang yul gyi skad dang chos rab tu 'byed pa'i yul la go rims bzhin du thugs su chud pa'i ro myang ba dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa'i thogs pa mi mnga' bas ye shes thams cad chags pa med pa dang thogs pa ma mchis pa'i slad du chos dung /
analyzed: grangs dang chos kyi mtshan nyid dang yul gyi skad dang chos rab tu 'byed pa'i yul la go rims bzhin du thugs su chud pa'i ro myang ba dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa'i thogs pa mi mnga' bas ye shes thams cad chags pa med pa dang thogs pa ma mchis pa'i slad du chos dung /
translated: The perfect knowledge of confidence is the direct realization of the objects of the discernment of phenomena.🔽The four kinds of perfect knowledge are the perfect knowledge of phenomena, meanings, contextual expressions, and confidence.🔽The perfect knowledge of phenomena is the direct realization of the names of phenomena.🔽The perfect knowledge of meanings is the direct realization of the characteristics of phenomena.🔽The perfect knowledge of contextual expressions is the direct realization of the languages of different countries.🔽The perfect knowledge of confidence is the direct realization of the objects of the discernment of phenomena.

original: don dang / nges pa'i tshig dang / spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa'i rnam pa bzhi'o //🔽'di ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa thams cad kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'khrul pa mi mnga' ba dang / ca co mi mnga' ba dang / dran pa nyam pa mi mnga' ba dang / thugs mnyam par ma bzhag pa mi mnga' ba dang /
analyzed: don dang / nges pa'i tshig dang / spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa'i rnam pa bzhi'o // 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa thams cad kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'khrul pa mi mnga' ba dang / ca co mi mnga' ba dang / dran pa nyam pa mi mnga' ba dang / thugs mnyam par ma bzhag pa mi mnga' ba dang /
translated: The four kinds of perfect knowledge are the perfect knowledge of phenomena, meanings, contextual expressions, and confidence.🔽The perfect knowledge of phenomena is the direct realization of the names of phenomena.🔽The perfect knowledge of meanings is the direct realization of the characteristics of phenomena.

original: tha dad pa nyid kyi 'du shes mi mnga' ba dang ; so sor ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms mi mnga' ba ste /
analyzed: tha dad pa nyid kyi 'du shes mi mnga' ba dang ; so sor ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms mi mnga' ba ste /
translated: The perfect knowledge of contextual expressions is the direct realization of the languages of different countries.🔽The perfect knowledge of confidence is the direct realization of the objects of the discernment of phenomena.

original: de ltar na rnam pa drug dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa las brtsams te /
analyzed: de ltar na rnam pa drug dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa las brtsams te /
translated: In terms of the purification of the obscurations to omniscience,

original: 'dun ba dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba las nyams pa mi mnga' ba ste /
analyzed: 'dun ba dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba las nyams pa mi mnga' ba ste /
translated: there is the absence of any decline in aspiration, effort, mindfulness, meditative stabilization, wisdom, and liberation.🔽Thus, there are six aspects.

original: de ltar rnam pa drug dang / sku dang / gsung dang thugs kyi phrin las rnams ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa drug dang / sku dang / gsung dang thugs kyi phrin las rnams ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba ste /
translated: The activities of body, speech, and mind are preceded by and follow after exalted wisdom.🔽Thus, there are three aspects.

original: rnam pa gsum dang / 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba la chags pa med pa dang / thogs pa med pa'i ye shes gsum ni nyan thos la sogs pa dang / thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyis na bgrang ba'i tshul las shin tu @182b 'das pa'i slad du sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi rnam pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum dang / 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba la chags pa med pa dang / thogs pa med pa'i ye shes gsum ni nyan thos la sogs pa dang / thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyis na bgrang ba'i tshul las shin tu @182b 'das pa'i slad du sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi rnam pa yin no //
translated: The three exalted wisdoms of the past, future, and present are unobstructed and unattached. Since they are not shared in common with sravakas and so forth, they are the eighteen aspects of the unshared qualities of a buddha because they transcend the way of enumeration.

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis gsungs pa'i chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid kyi don las mi 'gyur ba nyid kyis na phyin ci ma log pa de bzhin nyid🔽kyi slad du sangs rgyas thams cad kyis gsungs pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi rnam pa ni gcig go //
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis gsungs pa'i chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid kyi don las mi 'gyur ba nyid kyis na phyin ci ma log pa de bzhin nyid kyi slad du sangs rgyas thams cad kyis gsungs pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi rnam pa ni gcig go //
translated: This is the perfection of the unhindered.🔽This is the perfection of the unattached.🔽This is the perfection of the unhindered.🔽This is the perfection of the unattached.🔽This is the perfection of the unhindered.🔽This is the perfection of the unattached.🔽This is the perfection of the unhindered.🔽This is the perfection of the unattached.🔽This is the perfection of the unhindered.🔽This is the perfection of the unattached.🔽This is the perfection of the unhindered.🔽This is the perfection of the unattached.🔽This is the perfection of the unhindered.🔽This is the perfection of the unattached.🔽This is the perfection of the unhindered.🔽This is the perfection of the unattached.🔽This is the perfection of the unhindered.🔽This is the perfection of the unattached.🔽This is the perfection of the unhindered.🔽This is the perfection of the unattached.🔽This is the perfection of the unhindered.🔽This is the perfection of the unattached.🔽This is the perfection of the unhindered.🔽This is the perfection of the unattached.🔽This is the perfection of the unhindered.🔽This is the perfection of the unattached.🔽This is the perfection of the unhindered.🔽This is the perfection of the unattached.🔽This is the perfection of the unhindered.🔽This is the perfection of the unattached.🔽This is the perfection of the unhindered.🔽This is the perfection of the unattached.🔽This is the perfection of the unhindered.🔽This is the perfection of the unattached.🔽This is the perfection of the unhindered.🔽This is the perfection of the unattached.🔽This is the perfection of the unhindered.🔽This is the perfection of the unattached.🔽This is the perfection of the unhindered.🔽This is the perfection of the unattached.🔽This is the perfection of the unhindered.🔽This is the perfection of the unattached.🔽This is the perfection of the unhindered.

original: 'di ni rang 'byung ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni thams cad ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa'i slad du de'i thugs su chud pa ni gzhan la rag ma las pa'i phyir chos thams cad la mnga' sgyur ba'i rang byung gi rnam pa ni gcig
analyzed: 'di ni rang 'byung ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni thams cad ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa'i slad du de'i thugs su chud pa ni gzhan la rag ma las pa'i phyir chos thams cad la mnga' sgyur ba'i rang byung gi rnam pa ni gcig
translated: This is the perfection of the unattached.🔽This

original: go // 'di ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid kyi rnam pa thams cad yongs su mkhyen pa'i slad du rnam pa thams cad du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i sangs rgyas nyid
analyzed: go // 'di ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid kyi rnam pa thams cad yongs su mkhyen pa'i slad du rnam pa thams cad du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i sangs rgyas nyid
translated: This is the knowledge of all aspects of the nature of all phenomena.

original: kyi rnam pa ni gcig go //
analyzed: kyi rnam pa ni gcig go //
translated: The aspects are one.

original: de ltar byas na rnam pa rnams ji ltar dbye ba stobs la sogs pa rnams kyi dang / 'di dag gi rang gi ngo bo gang yin pa de bzhin nyid dang / de dag gang gi yin pa chos thams cad la mnga' sgyur ba'i rang byung dang /
analyzed: de ltar byas na rnam pa rnams ji ltar dbye ba stobs la sogs pa rnams kyi dang / 'di dag gi rang gi ngo bo gang yin pa de bzhin nyid dang / de dag gang gi yin pa chos thams cad la mnga' sgyur ba'i rang byung dang /
translated: Thus, the divisions of the aspects are the powers and so on, their nature is suchness, they belong to the self-arisen one who has mastery over all phenomena,🔽and their purpose is the complete and perfect enlightenment with respect to all aspects of all phenomena.

original: gang gi don du yin pa chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i don du zhes bya ba ni go rims bzhin du bcu dang / bzhi dang / bzhi dang bco brgyad dang / gcig dang / gcig dang /
analyzed: gang gi don du yin pa chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i don du zhes bya ba ni go rims bzhin du bcu dang / bzhi dang / bzhi dang bco brgyad dang / gcig dang / gcig dang /
translated: These are, respectively, ten, four, four, eighteen, one, one,🔽and one.

original: gcig ste / de ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam gyi rten can gyi rnam pa ni sum cu rtsa dgur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gcig ste / de ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam gyi rten can gyi rnam pa ni sum cu rtsa dgur 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the aspects of the path of the knowledge of all aspects are thirty-nine.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la nyan thos la sogs pa'i dbye bas lam tha dad pa'i phyir rnam pa 'di skad du brjod pa dag kho nar rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la nyan thos la sogs pa'i dbye bas lam tha dad pa'i phyir rnam pa 'di skad du brjod pa dag kho nar rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The aspects should be understood in this way, because the paths of the sravakas and so on are differentiated in the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And so it is said:

original: dran pa nyer gzhag nas bzung ste //
analyzed: dran pa nyer gzhag nas bzung ste //
translated: From the foundations of mindfulness

original: sangs rgyas rnam pa'i mthar thug rnams //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnam pa'i mthar thug rnams //
translated: up to the powers of the Buddha,

original: lam gyi bden pa'i rjes mthun par //
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa'i rjes mthun par //
translated: in accordance with the truth of the path,

original: kun mkhyen gsum du phye bas na //
analyzed: kun mkhyen gsum du phye bas na //
translated: the omniscient ones are divided into three.🔽The disciples, the bodhisattvas,

original: slob ma byang chub sems dpa' dang // sangs rgyas rnams la rim bzhin te //
analyzed: slob ma byang chub sems dpa' dang // sangs rgyas rnams la rim bzhin te //
translated: and the Buddhas are in order

original: sum cu bdun dang sum cu bzhi //
analyzed: sum cu bdun dang sum cu bzhi //
translated: thirty-seven, thirty-four,

original: sum cu rtsa dgu dag tu bzhed //🔽ces gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa dgu dag tu bzhed // ces gsungs pa yin no //
translated: and thirty-nine.

original: de la thams cad shes pa nyid kyi rnam pa ni /
analyzed: de la thams cad shes pa nyid kyi rnam pa ni /
translated: The aspects of the knowledge of paths are:

original: nyan thos dang byang chub sems dpa'i bye brag gi go rims bzhin du zag pa med pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dag kyang yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos dang byang chub sems dpa'i bye brag gi go rims bzhin du zag pa med pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dag kyang yin no //
translated: They are also uncontaminated and contaminated, respectively, like the distinction between śrāvakas and bodhisattvas.

original: lam shes pa nyid kyi rnam pa ni /
analyzed: lam shes pa nyid kyi rnam pa ni /
translated: The aspects of the knowledge of the path

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nyon mongs pa shin tu ma spangs pa'i phyir zag pa dang bcas pa kho na yin no //🔽@183a * // rnam ba thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rnam pa ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas par rnam pa thams cad du spangs pas chos thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yin pa'i phyir zag pa med
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nyon mongs pa shin tu ma spangs pa'i phyir zag pa dang bcas pa kho na yin no // @183a * // rnam ba thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rnam pa ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas par rnam pa thams cad du spangs pas chos thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yin pa'i phyir zag pa med
