translated: are only contaminated because bodhisattvas have not abandoned the afflictions.🔽The aspects of the knowledge of all aspects are only uncontaminated

original: pa kho na dag yin te /
analyzed: pa kho na dag yin te /
translated: because perfect buddhas have completely abandoned the afflictions and the obscurations to omniscience together with their traces in every way and thus have the knowledge of all things.

original: rnam pa rnams gcig tu bsdams na rnam pa brgya bdun cu rtsa gsum yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa rnams gcig tu bsdams na rnam pa brgya bdun cu rtsa gsum yin no //
translated: If the aspects are combined into one, there are 73 aspects.🔽The uncontaminated

original: bcu drug las gzhan dri med kyi //
analyzed: bcu drug las gzhan dri med kyi //
translated: are the sixteen.

original: rnam pa yod min zhes gang bshad pa de ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa tsam gyi gnyen po'i rnam pas phye ba las dgongs pa yin pas de dang 'di la 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: rnam pa yod min zhes gang bshad pa de ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa tsam gyi gnyen po'i rnam pas phye ba las dgongs pa yin pas de dang 'di la 'gal ba med do //
translated: The explanation that the aspects do not exist is intended from the point of view of the antidote to the afflictive obstructions alone, so there is no contradiction between that and this.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bshad pa mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan gyi snang ba las bstod pa'i le'u zhes bya ste dgu pa'o /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bshad pa mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan gyi snang ba las bstod pa'i le'u zhes bya ste dgu pa'o /
translated: This is the ninth chapter in the commentary on the Ornament of Clear Realization called Illuminating the Meaning, which explains the chapter on praise.

original: // / sbyor ba khyad par can dag gis rnam pa rnams bsgom dgos la /
analyzed: // / sbyor ba khyad par can dag gis rnam pa rnams bsgom dgos la /
translated: One must cultivate the aspects by means of special applications.

original: de dag kyang sbyor ba po med par brjod par mi nus pas mnyan pa la sogs pa'i snod sbyor ba po bstan par bya ba'i phyir de nas lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te sngon gyi rgyal bal lhag par bya
analyzed: de dag kyang sbyor ba po med par brjod par mi nus pas mnyan pa la sogs pa'i snod sbyor ba po bstan par bya ba'i phyir de nas lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te sngon gyi rgyal bal lhag par bya
translated: And since it is impossible to explain those without an agent of application, in order to teach the vessel of listening and so on, the agent of application, it says then, the lord of the gods, Shakra, and so on.

original: ba byas ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa la dmigs te gtsug lag khang la sogs pa byed pas so //
analyzed: ba byas ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa la dmigs te gtsug lag khang la sogs pa byed pas so //
translated: Having served the victors of the past means having served the tathagatas by building temples and so on.

original: sangs rgyas mang po la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskrun pa ni bsod snyoms la sogs pa phul bas so //🔽dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin par gyur pa ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis lhag par brten pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mang po la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskrun pa ni bsod snyoms la sogs pa phul bas so // dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin par gyur pa ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis lhag par brten pa nyid kyis so //
translated: They are assisted by spiritual friends because they are especially devoted to spiritual friends.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i khyad par gsum dang ldan pa kho na rnam pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi yum 'di gtso bo cher mnyan pa la sogs pa'i snod du gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i khyad par gsum dang ldan pa kho na rnam pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi yum 'di gtso bo cher mnyan pa la sogs pa'i snod du gyur pa yin no //
translated: Only those who have the three special qualities as explained are vessels for the Mother who has the character of the aspects, for listening to her, etc.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And it is said:

original: sangs rgyas rnams la lhag par byas //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams la lhag par byas //
translated: They have served the buddhas well,

original: de las dge ba'i rtsa ba bskrun //
analyzed: de las dge ba'i rtsa ba bskrun //
translated: and planted roots of virtue in their presence.

original: dge ba'i bshes kyi mgon bcas pa //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes kyi mgon bcas pa //
translated: They are protected by spiritual friends

original: 'di mnyan pa yi snod yin no ;
analyzed: 'di mnyan pa yi snod yin no ;
translated: and are vessels for listening to this.

original: / zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: / zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: And:🔽They are vessels for the Mother who has the character of the aspects, for listening to her, for retaining her, for reading her, for explaining her, for reciting her, for worshipping her, and for practicing her.🔽They are vessels for the Mother who has the character of the aspects, for listening to her, for retaining her, for reading her, for explaining her, for reciting her, for worshipping her, and for practicing her.🔽They are vessels for the Mother who has the character of the aspects, for listening to her, for retaining her, for reading her, for explaining her, for reciting her, for worshipping her, and for practicing her.🔽They are vessels for the Mother who has the character of the aspects, for listening to her, for retaining her, for reading her, for explaining her, for reciting her, for worshipping her, and for practicing her.

original: ngan ngon tsam dang zhes bya ba nyung zad tsam dang ngo //
analyzed: ngan ngon tsam dang zhes bya ba nyung zad tsam dang ngo //
translated: They are vessels for the Mother who has the character of the aspects, for listening to her, for retaining her, for reading her, for explaining her, for reciting her, for worshipping her, and for practicing her.

original: sangs rgyas mang po la bsnyen bkur byas pa yin zhes bya ba ni lus kyi bsnyen bkur bya pa la sogs pas mnyes par byas pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mang po la bsnyen bkur byas pa yin zhes bya ba ni lus kyi bsnyen bkur bya pa la sogs pas mnyes par byas pa'o //
translated: He has served many buddhas means he has pleased them by physical service and so on.

original: yongs su zhus shing zhes bya ba ni the tshom skyes pa'i don gtan la dbab par bya ba'i phyir rang gi ngo bo yongs su zhus pas so ;
analyzed: yongs su zhus shing zhes bya ba ni the tshom skyes pa'i don gtan la dbab par bya ba'i phyir rang gi ngo bo yongs su zhus pas so ;
translated: He has asked questions means he has asked about the essence of things in order to resolve doubts that have arisen.

original: / yongs su dri ba byas pa zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs yongs su zhus pa'o //
analyzed: / yongs su dri ba byas pa zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs yongs su zhus pa'o //
translated: He has asked about reasons means he has asked about the causes of things.

original: sangs rgyas mang po la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskrun pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa bcu'i sgrub pa nyams su len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mang po la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskrun pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa bcu'i sgrub pa nyams su len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He has planted wholesome roots with many buddhas means he has practiced the ten perfections such as generosity.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la bsnyen bkur byas pa la sogs pa nyid kyis 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i snod du gyur pa @183b yin no zhes par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la bsnyen bkur byas pa la sogs pa nyid kyis 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i snod du gyur pa @183b yin no zhes par bya ste /
translated: He has served the Tathagatas means he has become a vessel for retention and so on.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As it is said:🔽By the Buddha's teachings, by asking about everything,🔽By generosity, morality, and so on,🔽By the four social practices, by the four means of gathering disciples,

original: sangs rgyas bstan dang kun 'dri dang // sbyin dang tshul khrims sogs spyod pas //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bstan dang kun 'dri dang // sbyin dang tshul khrims sogs spyod pas //
translated: By the perfections, by the stages, by the powers,🔽By the factors of enlightenment, by the immeasurables,🔽By the liberations, by the bases of subjugation, by the bases of mastery,🔽By the bases of totality, by the superknowledges, by the formless states,🔽By the emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness,🔽By the unconditioned and conditioned, by the conditioned and unconditioned,🔽By the unconditioned and unconditioned, by the unconditioned and conditioned,🔽By the unconditioned and unconditioned, by the unconditioned and conditioned,🔽By the unconditioned and unconditioned, by the unconditioned and conditioned,🔽By the unconditioned and unconditioned, by the unconditioned and conditioned,🔽By the unconditioned and unconditioned, by the unconditioned and conditioned,🔽By the unconditioned and unconditioned, by the unconditioned and conditioned,🔽By the unconditioned and unconditioned, by the unconditioned and conditioned,🔽By the unconditioned and unconditioned, by the unconditioned and conditioned,🔽By the unconditioned and unconditioned, by the unconditioned and conditioned,🔽By the unconditioned and unconditioned, by the unconditioned and conditioned,🔽By the unconditioned and unconditioned, by the unconditioned and conditioned,🔽By the unconditioned and unconditioned, by the unconditioned and conditioned,🔽By the unconditioned and unconditioned, by the unconditioned and conditioned,🔽By the unconditioned and unconditioned, by the unconditioned and conditioned,🔽By the unconditioned and unconditioned, by the unconditioned and conditioned,🔽By the unconditioned and unconditioned, by the unconditioned and conditioned,🔽By the un

original: len dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i //
analyzed: len dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i //
translated: And the grasping of the appropriated aggregates,🔽

original: snod du dam pa rnams bzhed do //
analyzed: snod du dam pa rnams bzhed do //
translated: The holy ones accept as a vessel🔽one who is not heedless, who is not proud,🔽who is not attached to gain and honor,

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: who is not attached to the world.

original: brgya byin gyi rtog ba 'di ni rigs pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: brgya byin gyi rtog ba 'di ni rigs pa kho na yin te /
translated: This conception of Sakra is quite reasonable,

original: gang la ji skad du bshad pa'i rgyu yod pa de nyid lhag par mos par byed do zhes gsol ba ni bcom ldan 'das rigs kyi bu'am zhes gsol pa'o //
analyzed: gang la ji skad du bshad pa'i rgyu yod pa de nyid lhag par mos par byed do zhes gsol ba ni bcom ldan 'das rigs kyi bu'am zhes gsol pa'o //
translated: for he requests that one who has the causes as they have been explained should be one who has superior devotion.

original: de bzhin nyid du slob pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gsum ni sbyin pa dang dngos gzhi dang mjug gi gnas skabs su 'am mthong ba dang bsgom pa dang khyad par gyi lam gyi dbye bas gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du slob pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gsum ni sbyin pa dang dngos gzhi dang mjug gi gnas skabs su 'am mthong ba dang bsgom pa dang khyad par gyi lam gyi dbye bas gzung bar bya'o //
translated: The three phrases beginning with “training in suchness” should be taken as referring to the occasion of generosity, the occasion of the basic practice, and the occasion of the conclusion, or as referring to the path of insight, the path of meditation, and the path of no-more-learning.

original: khyad par du 'phags pa'i don rtogs pa med na 'dzin pa la sogs pa tsam gyis phyir mi ldog pa dang 'dra bar ji ltar gzung snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa🔽gsol te / ji skad bshad pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa la bsnyen bkur byas pa dang yongs su 'dir ba dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa la spyod pa rgyu gsum las go bzlog pa ni /
analyzed: khyad par du 'phags pa'i don rtogs pa med na 'dzin pa la sogs pa tsam gyis phyir mi ldog pa dang 'dra bar ji ltar gzung snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol te / ji skad bshad pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa la bsnyen bkur byas pa dang yongs su 'dir ba dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa la spyod pa rgyu gsum las go bzlog pa ni /
translated: The Bhagavān, having been asked with “For what reason?” and so on,🔽said, “Those who have little root of virtue, who are of a nature that does not ask questions, and who are not endowed with previous practice, due to these three causes,🔽will not understand the meaning of the Tathāgata’s words.”

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba chung ba dang / yongs su mi 'dri pa'i rang bzhin can dang sngon spyad pa dang mi ldan pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba'i tshig gsum dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba chung ba dang / yongs su mi 'dri pa'i rang bzhin can dang sngon spyad pa dang mi ldan pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba'i tshig gsum dang sbyar ro //
translated: This is connected with the three phrases “who have little root of virtue,” “who are of a nature that does not ask questions,” and “who are not endowed with previous practice.”

original: 'di skad du gang gi phyir ji skad bstan pa'i sangs rgyas la brten pa la sogs pa'i rgyus shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la lhag pa'i bsam pa khyad par can gyis lhag par mos pa de bas na phyir mi ldog pa ji lta bar gzung
analyzed: 'di skad du gang gi phyir ji skad bstan pa'i sangs rgyas la brten pa la sogs pa'i rgyus shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la lhag pa'i bsam pa khyad par can gyis lhag par mos pa de bas na phyir mi ldog pa ji lta bar gzung
translated: This is what is said: “Because of the causes such as reliance on the Buddha as taught, one has superior aspiration with a special superior intention toward the perfection of wisdom. Therefore, one should be held to be irreversible just as one is.”

original: bar bya'o zhes bzlog pa'i sgo nas brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: bar bya'o zhes bzlog pa'i sgo nas brjod pa yin no //
translated: This is stated by way of reversal.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i rgyu dang bral bas kyang spong bar 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i rgyu dang bral bas kyang spong bar 'gyur ba ni /
translated: “Even if one is devoid of the causes as taught, one will be abandoned.”

original: bcom ldan 'das gang dag 'di la mi mos shing ma rtogs pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang dag 'di la mi mos shing ma rtogs pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: “Bhagavan, those who do not aspire to this, who do not understand it…” and so forth.🔽“How is it that one is understood to have previously abandoned through the intention to abandon in that way?”🔽“Why is that?”

original: ji ltar na de ltar spong ba'i bsam pas sngon spangs pa yin par rtogs snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i s'ad du zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas bcom ldan 'das gang bya ba la sogs pa gsol pa yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar na de ltar spong ba'i bsam pas sngon spangs pa yin par rtogs snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i s'ad du zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas bcom ldan 'das gang bya ba la sogs pa gsol pa yin te /
translated: “Bhagavan, those who…” and so forth.

original: gang gi phyir da ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba chung ba'i phyir na yum spong bar sems pa de'i phyir yang spong ba yin par shes te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir da ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba chung ba'i phyir na yum spong bar sems pa de'i phyir yang spong ba yin par shes te /
translated: Because of the smallness of the root of the wholesome now, he thinks of abandoning his mother. For that reason also, he should know that he is abandoning her.

original: gzhan du na dge ba'i rtsa ba chung ba nyid du mi 'thad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhan du na dge ba'i rtsa ba chung ba nyid du mi 'thad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Otherwise, the smallness of the root of the wholesome would not be tenable. This is the meaning.

original: de nyid ni sngon gyi mtha' ma spyad pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid ni sngon gyi mtha' ma spyad pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol pa yin no //
translated: This is the same as what was said earlier, “because of not practicing in the past,” etc.

original: sh'a ri'i bus rigs pa nyid du bshad do zhes smras pa ni 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa @184a * //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus rigs pa nyid du bshad do zhes smras pa ni 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa @184a * //
translated: Śāriputra said, “It is just as you have explained.” This is the statement beginning with “Noble Śāriputra.”

original: gsol pa'o // 'di la ngo mtshar ci zhig yod /
analyzed: gsol pa'o // 'di la ngo mtshar ci zhig yod /
translated: What is so amazing about this?

original: cung zad kyang med pa nyid de 'bras bu ni rgyu dang rjes su mthun pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cung zad kyang med pa nyid de 'bras bu ni rgyu dang rjes su mthun pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is nothing at all, because the effect accords with the cause.

original: dad pa phul du byung ba yang dag par skyes pa nyid kyis na bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol to //
analyzed: dad pa phul du byung ba yang dag par skyes pa nyid kyis na bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol to //
translated: Because of the perfect generation of excellent faith, he said, “Blessed One,” etc.

original: ji ltar yum la phyag 'tshal bas gzhan la phyag 'tshal ba yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar yum la phyag 'tshal bas gzhan la phyag 'tshal ba yin te /
translated: How is it that by bowing to the Mother, one bows to the others?🔽Because there is no connection.

original: 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes pas bsu nas koo shi ka zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //🔽'di las skyes te zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i gnas skabs su yum la goms par byas pas sangs rgyas nyid thob pa'i phyir 'di las ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid skyes pa yin la sangs rgyas kyi gnas skabs su gdul bya rnams la shes rab
analyzed: 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes pas bsu nas koo shi ka zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so // 'di las skyes te zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i gnas skabs su yum la goms par byas pas sangs rgyas nyid thob pa'i phyir 'di las ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid skyes pa yin la sangs rgyas kyi gnas skabs su gdul bya rnams la shes rab
translated: In response to this doubt, he says, “Why is it so, Kauśika?”

original: kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyis rab tu phye ba yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid yin pas de ltar rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la phyag
analyzed: kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyis rab tu phye ba yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid yin pas de ltar rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la phyag
translated: “Born from this” means that by cultivating the Mother in the state of a bodhisattva, one attains buddhahood. Thus, from this, omniscience is born. And in the state of a buddha, by teaching the perfection of wisdom to those to be trained, the perfection of wisdom itself is distinguished by the wisdom of omniscience. Thus, by the connection of cause and effect, one bows to the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'tshal ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la phyag 'tshal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'tshal ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la phyag 'tshal ba yin no //
translated: The seeking is the salutation to the knowledge of the Omniscient One.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi rgyu nyid dang 'bras bu nyid yin pas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi rgyu nyid dang 'bras bu nyid yin pas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Thus means that it is the cause and effect of the knowledge of the Omniscient One, this is the meaning.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyad par bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gsum ni thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes pa dang go rims bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyad par bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gsum ni thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes pa dang go rims bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The three phrases beginning with one should practice this perfection of wisdom should be connected respectively with the knowledge that has the nature of hearing, reflection, and cultivation.

original: sbyor ba po bstan pa'i 'og tu sbyor ba'i don zhus pa ni bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol pa yin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba po bstan pa'i 'og tu sbyor ba'i don zhus pa ni bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol pa yin no //
translated: After teaching the one who practices, the meaning of practice is asked: Blessed One, how should one practice?

original: zhus pa skabs la bab pa nyid yin pa'i phyir legs so legs so zhes bya ba phyin no //
analyzed: zhus pa skabs la bab pa nyid yin pa'i phyir legs so legs so zhes bya ba phyin no //
translated: Since the question is timely, Excellent, excellent! is said.

original: don 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'chad par 'gyur ba'i sbyor ba nyi shu po 'di las brtsams te de bzhin gshegs pa la rang gis rtogs par bya ba'i don du yongs su 'dri bar bya zhing gzhan gyis rtogs par bya ba'i don du yongs su🔽'dri bar sems shing rtogs par byed la /
analyzed: don 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'chad par 'gyur ba'i sbyor ba nyi shu po 'di las brtsams te de bzhin gshegs pa la rang gis rtogs par bya ba'i don du yongs su 'dri bar bya zhing gzhan gyis rtogs par bya ba'i don du yongs su 'dri bar sems shing rtogs par byed la /
translated: The meaning of this and so forth is that, beginning with these twenty applications that will be explained, one should ask questions of the Tathagata for the sake of understanding for oneself, and one should think and understand for the sake of others understanding.

original: shes par byed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shes par byed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: One should make them understand, meaning one should make them know.

original: de la gzugs la sogs pa la mi gnas pa'i sbyor ba ni koo shi ka byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la gzugs la sogs pa la mi gnas pa'i sbyor ba ni koo shi ka byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The application of not dwelling on form and so forth is stated from Kausika, a bodhisattva and so forth.

original: bzhi dang rang gi ngo bo'i dbye bas gzugs la zhes bya ba dang gzugs so zhes bya ba'i tshig gnyis smos pa yin no //
analyzed: bzhi dang rang gi ngo bo'i dbye bas gzugs la zhes bya ba dang gzugs so zhes bya ba'i tshig gnyis smos pa yin no //
translated: Form and form are the two words that are mentioned by dividing the four and their own nature.

original: de las cir 'gyur zhe na koo shi ka 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa @184b gsungs so //
analyzed: de las cir 'gyur zhe na koo shi ka 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa @184b gsungs so //
translated: What is the result of that? Kausika, it is like this and so forth is stated.

original: 'di skad du gang gi phyir ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis gzugs la sog pa la gnas pa bkag pa de'i phyir de la mi gnas pa ni sbyor ba zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad du gang gi phyir ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis gzugs la sog pa la gnas pa bkag pa de'i phyir de la mi gnas pa ni sbyor ba zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: It is said: “Because the abiding of form, etc. is refuted by way of intrinsic reality, therefore, the non-abiding in that is called ‘application.’ ”

original: mi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i don du gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: mi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i don du gsungs pa ni /
translated: The statement of the meaning of application in non-application is:

original: koo shi ka gzugs so zhes mi smos te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste rnal 'byor du byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: koo shi ka gzugs so zhes mi smos te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste rnal 'byor du byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Kauśika, one does not say ‘form,’ etc. , and one does yoga, i.e., one does not do yoga.

original: de las cir 'gyur zhe na 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de las cir 'gyur zhe na 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: What is the result of that? It is said: “In this way, etc. ”

original: rnal 'byor du byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni de ltar de kho nar sbyor ba med pas rnal 'byor du byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor du byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni de ltar de kho nar sbyor ba med pas rnal 'byor du byed par 'gyur te /
translated: One does yoga means that, since there is no such application in reality, one does yoga.

original: mi sbyor ba nyid de nyid la sbyor ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi sbyor ba nyid de nyid la sbyor ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that non-application itself is application.

original: zab pa'i spyor pa ni bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: zab pa'i spyor pa ni bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The profound application is from “The Blessed One, etc. ”

original: gnas pa mi dmigs pa'i don gyis na gzugs la sogs pa'i de bzhin nyid zab pas thams cad shes pa nyid kyi skabs su zab bo zhes rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas pa mi dmigs pa'i don gyis na gzugs la sogs pa'i de bzhin nyid zab pas thams cad shes pa nyid kyi skabs su zab bo zhes rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the meaning of non-apprehension of abiding, the suchness of form, etc., is profound, and so it is said that the stage of the knowledge of all modes is profound.

original: gting dpag dka' ba'i sbyor ba ni bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: gting dpag dka' ba'i sbyor ba ni bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The application of difficulty of fathoming is stated in the passage beginning, “Bhagavat, this perfection of wisdom is hard to fathom.”

original: rang bzhin gyis rnyog pa med pa'i don gyis gzugs la sogs pa rtogs par dka' bas lam shes pa nyid kyi skabs su rtogs par dka'o zhes smos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis rnyog pa med pa'i don gyis gzugs la sogs pa rtogs par dka' bas lam shes pa nyid kyi skabs su rtogs par dka'o zhes smos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the difficulty of understanding form, etc., by reason of the meaning of natural non-turbidity, it is said that the stage of the knowledge of paths is hard to understand.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir gzung bar dka'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir gzung bar dka'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, it is said that it is hard to grasp.

original: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang des drangs pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pas gzung bar dka' ba'i phyir ro //🔽tshad med pa'i sbyor ba ni /
analyzed: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang des drangs pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pas gzung bar dka' ba'i phyir ro // tshad med pa'i sbyor ba ni /
translated: Because it is hard to grasp by the ear consciousness and by the mental consciousness induced by it.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The application of immeasurability is stated in the passage beginning, “Bhagavat, this perfection of wisdom is immeasurable.”

original: mtha' mi dmigs pa'i don gyis na gzugs la sogs pa tshad med pas na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi skabs su tshad med pa'o zhes dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtha' mi dmigs pa'i don gyis na gzugs la sogs pa tshad med pas na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi skabs su tshad med pa'o zhes dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because form and so on are immeasurable in terms of the meaning of non-apprehension of limit, therefore, in the context of the knowledge of all aspects, they are immeasurable.

original: yang na zab par mngon par byang chub pa dang thun mong ma yin par mngon par byang chub pa'i dbang du byas nas go rims bzhin du zab pa'i sbyor ba la sogs pa rnam pa gsum gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na zab par mngon par byang chub pa dang thun mong ma yin par mngon par byang chub pa'i dbang du byas nas go rims bzhin du zab pa'i sbyor ba la sogs pa rnam pa gsum gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Or else, in terms of profound manifest enlightenment and non-shared manifest enlightenment, respectively, the three aspects such as profound application are stated.

original: legs so zhes bya ba gsungs pa nyid kyis zab pa'i sbyor ba gsal bar bya ba ni sh'a ri'i bu de de bzhin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: legs so zhes bya ba gsungs pa nyid kyis zab pa'i sbyor ba gsal bar bya ba ni sh'a ri'i bu de de bzhin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The statement Excellent! itself clarifies profound application, saying So it is, Shariputra!

original: bsdus pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: bsdus pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The summarized meaning is this:

original: gang gi tshe gzugs la sogs pa zab bo snyam du mngon par ma zhen pa'i tshul gyis de kho na nyid du mi gnas pa de'i tshe phyin ci ma log pa yin pa'i phyir de la zab pa'i sbyor ba 'thob par 'gyur ro //🔽yang gang gi tshe zab pa'o zhes bya bar yang rnal 'byor @185a * //
analyzed: gang gi tshe gzugs la sogs pa zab bo snyam du mngon par ma zhen pa'i tshul gyis de kho na nyid du mi gnas pa de'i tshe phyin ci ma log pa yin pa'i phyir de la zab pa'i sbyor ba 'thob par 'gyur ro // yang gang gi tshe zab pa'o zhes bya bar yang rnal 'byor @185a * //
translated: When one does not abide in reality in the manner of non-attachment, thinking that form, etc. is profound, then, because it is unmistaken, one obtains the application of profundity.

original: du mi byed pa de'i tshe gzugs la sogs pa zab pa zhes bya bar byang mi gnas te /
analyzed: du mi byed pa de'i tshe gzugs la sogs pa zab pa zhes bya bar byang mi gnas te /
translated: Moreover, when one does not even practice yoga, thinking that it is profound, then one does not abide in form, etc. as profound.

original: de ltar gnas ba dang rnal 'byor bkag pas dang gnas pa zab mo'i sbyor ba'i don phyin ci log par bstan pa yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar gnas ba dang rnal 'byor bkag pas dang gnas pa zab mo'i sbyor ba'i don phyin ci log par bstan pa yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, by the negation of abiding and yoga, the meaning of the application of profound abiding is taught in a distorted way.

original: de bzhin du gting dpag dka' ba dang tshad med pa'i sbyor ba'i don dag kyang 'di'i rjes su 'brangs nas brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gting dpag dka' ba dang tshad med pa'i sbyor ba'i don dag kyang 'di'i rjes su 'brangs nas brjod par bya'o //
translated: Likewise, the meanings of the applications of difficulty to fathom and of immeasurability should be stated by way of this example.

original: 'phags pa rnam par grol ba'i sdes zab pa la sogs sbyor ba gsum po 'di dag ni re re zhing chung du dang 'bring dang chen po'i yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnam par grol ba'i sdes zab pa la sogs sbyor ba gsum po 'di dag ni re re zhing chung du dang 'bring dang chen po'i yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: The noble Vimuktasena explains that each of these three applications, beginning with the profound, is of the small, middling, and great types.

original: tshegs chen pos yun ring po nas rtogs pa'i sbyor ba'i don du gsol pa ni /
analyzed: tshegs chen pos yun ring po nas rtogs pa'i sbyor ba'i don du gsol pa ni /
translated: The meaning of the application that is realized after a long time with great difficulty is requested:

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Bhagavan, the perfection of wisdom is profound.

original: la la ni rigs nges pa nyid kyis phyir mi ldog pa yin na yang ma bstan pa yod pas de las dgar bar bya ba'i phyir lus bstan pa zhes smos so //
analyzed: la la ni rigs nges pa nyid kyis phyir mi ldog pa yin na yang ma bstan pa yod pas de las dgar bar bya ba'i phyir lus bstan pa zhes smos so //
translated: Some, even though they are irreversible due to the certainty of their lineage, are not taught. In order to distinguish them from those, the body is mentioned.

original: yum rnam pa thams cad du shes pa med pas yum la the tshom la sogs par 'gyur ba srid pa'i phyir de nyid kyi mdun du brjod pa'i rgyu gang zhig yin snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas bcom ldan 'das
analyzed: yum rnam pa thams cad du shes pa med pas yum la the tshom la sogs par 'gyur ba srid pa'i phyir de nyid kyi mdun du brjod pa'i rgyu gang zhig yin snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas bcom ldan 'das
translated: Since the mother is not known in all aspects, it is possible that doubts, etc. will arise regarding the mother. Therefore, that very doubt, thinking, What is the reason for what was said in her presence? is addressed by Why is that, Bhagavan?

original: de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol to //🔽gang gi phyir de chos kyi dbyings rtogs pa rgyu mthun pa bstan pa'i chos mchog gis log pa'i shes pa med pas nem nur mi bgyid /
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol to // gang gi phyir de chos kyi dbyings rtogs pa rgyu mthun pa bstan pa'i chos mchog gis log pa'i shes pa med pas nem nur mi bgyid /
translated: He said, If, Bhagavan, a Bodhisattva Mahasattva... and so on.

original: yid gnyis kyi shes pa dang bral bas the tshom 'tshal bar mi 'gyur zhing mi shes pa dang bral bas rmongs par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: yid gnyis kyi shes pa dang bral bas the tshom 'tshal bar mi 'gyur zhing mi shes pa dang bral bas rmongs par mi 'gyur la /
translated: Because he has no doubt, he does not doubt; because he has no uncertainty, he does not have uncertainty; because he has no confusion, he does not have confusion; because he has no dispute, he does not have dispute.

original: yang dag pa'i shes pa dang ldan pa nyid kyis na rtsod par mi 'gyur ba de bas na de nyid kyi mdun du bshad par bya'o / zhes 'dod do //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pa dang ldan pa nyid kyis na rtsod par mi 'gyur ba de bas na de nyid kyi mdun du bshad par bya'o / zhes 'dod do //
translated: Therefore, it is said, it should be explained in his presence.

original: skrag pa la sogs par 'gyur ba srid pas don gyi shugs kyis gzhan la ni tshegs chen po yun ring pos rtogs pa'i sbyor ba yin par bstan pa yin no //🔽lung bstan pa thob pa'i sbyor ba ni /
analyzed: skrag pa la sogs par 'gyur ba srid pas don gyi shugs kyis gzhan la ni tshegs chen po yun ring pos rtogs pa'i sbyor ba yin par bstan pa yin no // lung bstan pa thob pa'i sbyor ba ni /
translated: Because fear and so on are possible, it is taught that for others, the meaning is to be understood through implication, and the application is difficult and takes a long time.

original: 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bu yang gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bu yang gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The application of attaining the prediction is taught in the passage beginning with Noble Shariputra, if... and so on.

original: nyes pa cir 'gyur zhes bya ba ni nem nur la sogs pa'i nyes pa cir 'gyur zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyes pa cir 'gyur zhes bya ba ni nem nur la sogs pa'i nyes pa cir 'gyur zhes bya'o //
translated: What is the harm? It is the harm of doubt, etc.

original: rigs kyi stobs kyis 'di las rjes su skrag pa la sogs pa 'gar yang mi 'gyur ro zhes smras pa ni /
analyzed: rigs kyi stobs kyis 'di las rjes su skrag pa la sogs pa 'gar yang mi 'gyur ro zhes smras pa ni /
translated: It is said that through the power of lineage, one does not become frightened, etc.

original: koo shi ka gang lung ma bstan pa gang zhig gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: koo shi ka gang lung ma bstan pa gang zhig gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Kauśika, it is said that “one who is indeterminate” is one who has not been predicted.

original: rgyang ring po rnams zhes bya ba ni yun ring po nas te dus ring po nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgyang ring po rnams zhes bya ba ni yun ring po nas te dus ring po nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Far away” means for a long time; the meaning is that it is for a long time.

original: de nyid brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid brjod pa ni /
translated: That itself is stated:

original: yun ring nas theg pa la yang dag par zhugs pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yun ring nas theg pa la yang dag par zhugs pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “One who has long been engaged in the vehicle.”

original: yang na yun ring po @185b nas te zab mo'i don la lhag par mos pas nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong ma yin pa nas so //
analyzed: yang na yun ring po @185b nas te zab mo'i don la lhag par mos pas nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong ma yin pa nas so //
translated: Or, “for a long time” means that one has long been devoted to the profound meaning, and is not in common with śrāvakas, etc.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di lta ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la je dang po kho nar re zhig thag ring po nas mthong ngo //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di lta ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la je dang po kho nar re zhig thag ring po nas mthong ngo //
translated: In this profound perfection of wisdom, first of all one sees it from afar, saying I see it!

original: de nas mthong bas dga' ste lus kyis phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: de nas mthong bas dga' ste lus kyis phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Then, one is delighted by seeing it, and one prostrates with one's body.

original: de nas rab tu dang ba'i shugs 'phel bas bskor ba la sogs pas bsnyen bskur byed do //
analyzed: de nas rab tu dang ba'i shugs 'phel bas bskor ba la sogs pas bsnyen bskur byed do //
translated: Then, with the increase of the power of faith, one worships with circumambulation and so forth.

original: de nas rim pa bzhin du byas la 'dug ste /
analyzed: de nas rim pa bzhin du byas la 'dug ste /
translated: Then, sitting in the proper order,

original: nyan par byed de de ltar lta ba la sogs pa'i don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thob par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: nyan par byed de de ltar lta ba la sogs pa'i don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thob par gyur pa yin no //
translated: one listens. Thus, one attains the perfection of wisdom for the sake of seeing and so forth.

original: 'dis ni ring po mi thogs par zhes bya ba la ni lta ba la sogs pa'i dus da lta nyid nas ring po mi thogs par ro //
analyzed: 'dis ni ring po mi thogs par zhes bya ba la ni lta ba la sogs pa'i dus da lta nyid nas ring po mi thogs par ro //
translated: Here, not long after means not long after the present time of seeing and so forth.

original: de nyid brjod pa ni lung bstan pa la bsnyen pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid brjod pa ni lung bstan pa la bsnyen pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: That is stated by approaching the prophecy and so forth.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gcig gam zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de bzhin gshegs pa gcig gam gnyis sam gsum las mi 'da' ste zhes bya ba ni de nas byang chub sems dpa' de phyis lung bstan pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de ltar ni
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gcig gam zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de bzhin gshegs pa gcig gam gnyis sam gsum las mi 'da' ste zhes bya ba ni de nas byang chub sems dpa' de phyis lung bstan pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de ltar ni
translated: As for “not passing beyond one tathāgata, etc.,” it is not the case that “not passing beyond one, two, or three tathāgatas” means that “after that, the bodhisattva will obtain a prophecy.”

original: ma yin gyi 'on kyang de rnams las zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ma yin gyi 'on kyang de rnams las zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: However, it means “not passing beyond those.”

original: de nyid ston pas smras pa ni 'on kyang de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de rnams mnyes par byed par 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /🔽gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa gcig gam /
analyzed: de nyid ston pas smras pa ni 'on kyang de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de rnams mnyes par byed par 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa gcig gam /
translated: The Teacher declares just that: “However, they will please those tathāgatas, arhats, and perfectly awakened buddhas,” and so on.

original: gnyis sam / gsum po des yang dag par bcas pa'i bslab pa bsgrubs pas mnyes par byed par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis sam / gsum po des yang dag par bcas pa'i bslab pa bsgrubs pas mnyes par byed par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Moreover, they will please those one, two, or three tathāgatas by practicing the training that they have perfectly received.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mthong na yang lung bstan pas 'bras bu yod par byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa gcig gam gnyis la sogs pa mthong ba ni lung bstan pas mi stong par byed par 'gyur te nges par lung ston pa thob🔽pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mthong na yang lung bstan pas 'bras bu yod par byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa gcig gam gnyis la sogs pa mthong ba ni lung bstan pas mi stong par byed par 'gyur te nges par lung ston pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And if one sees a Tathagata, one will make the result fruitful by prophecy. One who sees one or two Tathagatas will make the result fruitful by prophecy, because one will certainly obtain prophecy.

original: de nyid brjod pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba de lus kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid brjod pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba de lus kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: That is stated: That seeing of a Tathagata, that body, etc.

original: ji srid du lung bstan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nye bar bsdu ba yin te go sla'o //
analyzed: ji srid du lung bstan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nye bar bsdu ba yin te go sla'o //
translated: As long as one is not prophesied, etc. is a summary, easy to understand.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i sbyor ba'i don bstan pa'i phyir de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i sbyor ba'i don bstan pa'i phyir de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In order to teach the meaning of the application of irreversibility, it is said: Then the venerable Śāriputra said to the Lord, etc.

original: smos kyang ci 'tshal zhes bya ba ni 'dir gang thos nas kyang yang dag par 'dzin pa la sogs par byed pa gang yin pa de phyir mi ldog pa'i sbyor ba dang ldan zhing dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di las
analyzed: smos kyang ci 'tshal zhes bya ba ni 'dir gang thos nas kyang yang dag par 'dzin pa la sogs par byed pa gang yin pa de phyir mi ldog pa'i sbyor ba dang ldan zhing dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di las
translated: Here, one who hears and then takes up, etc., is endowed with the practice of irreversibility and the full maturation of the wholesome roots.

original: brtsad du ci zhig yod de the tshom @186a * //
analyzed: brtsad du ci zhig yod de the tshom @186a * //
translated: What need is there to argue about this?🔽There is no doubt at all.

original: ci yang med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ci yang med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: legs par smras pa nyid kyis na blo mthun pas gnas pa ni sh'a ri'i bu de de bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: legs par smras pa nyid kyis na blo mthun pas gnas pa ni sh'a ri'i bu de de bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Since it is well-spoken, the agreement to abide is stated by Śāriputra, “It is so, Blessed One,” and so on.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i sbyor pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das dper gsol bar bdag spobs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol pa yin te /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i sbyor pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das dper gsol bar bdag spobs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol pa yin te /
translated: In order to teach just the practice as explained, he says, “Blessed One, I have the courage to give an example.”

original: dper gsol ba zhes bya ba ni mthun pa'i dpe'o //
analyzed: dper gsol ba zhes bya ba ni mthun pa'i dpe'o //
translated: “Give an example” means a concordant example.

original: rnyed par 'gyur pa ni 'phrad par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rnyed par 'gyur pa ni 'phrad par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “Will find” means will encounter.

original: gzhan dag kyang de 'dzin pa la sogs pa srid pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dzin pa la sogs pas byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smon pa yin par ji ltar shes snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i slad du zhen zhes
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang de 'dzin pa la sogs pa srid pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dzin pa la sogs pas byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smon pa yin par ji ltar shes snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i slad du zhen zhes
translated: Others may also hold it and so forth, so how can it be known that the perfection of wisdom is the complete purification of the root of merit of the bodhisattvas through holding it and so forth?

original: bya bas bsu nas bcom ldan 'das sems can zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol te /
analyzed: bya bas bsu nas bcom ldan 'das sems can zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol te /
translated: Having welcomed this doubt with Why is that?, he asks the Bhagavan, Bhagavan, sentient beings...

original: gang gi phyir chos kyis phongs par 'gyur ba dang mthun pa'i las dang phal cher ma bral ba rnams ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la yang dag par 'dzin pa la sogs pa la rgyab kyis phyogs pa nyid kyis na sems mi mthun par
analyzed: gang gi phyir chos kyis phongs par 'gyur ba dang mthun pa'i las dang phal cher ma bral ba rnams ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la yang dag par 'dzin pa la sogs pa la rgyab kyis phyogs pa nyid kyis na sems mi mthun par
translated: Because those who are mostly not free from karma concordant with the degeneration of the dharma turn their backs on the correct practice of this perfection of wisdom and so forth, their minds are not inclined to it.

original: 'gyur zhing yongs su spong ba la brtson pa nyid kyis na sems ldog par 'gyur ba dang / gang gi phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bsags pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don ma rtogs pas yang dag pa'i mtha' 'di la rab tu mi 'jug cing dad pa thob pas dga' bar yang mi 'gyur ba de bas na gang dag ji lta
analyzed: 'gyur zhing yongs su spong ba la brtson pa nyid kyis na sems ldog par 'gyur ba dang / gang gi phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bsags pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don ma rtogs pas yang dag pa'i mtha' 'di la rab tu mi 'jug cing dad pa thob pas dga' bar yang mi 'gyur ba de bas na gang dag ji lta
translated: Because of striving to turn away and completely abandon the mind, and because of not entering into this limit of reality without having accumulated the roots of virtue, and because of not being pleased by attaining faith in the meaning of the perfection of wisdom, therefore, those who practice just as it is

original: ba bzhin du 'dzin pa la sogs pa byed pa de dag ni dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa yin no zhes bya ba ni ngag gi don yin no //
analyzed: ba bzhin du 'dzin pa la sogs pa byed pa de dag ni dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa yin no zhes bya ba ni ngag gi don yin no //
translated: grasping and so forth have accumulated the roots of virtue. This is the meaning of the words.

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' ni chos kyi dbyings yin la /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' ni chos kyi dbyings yin la /
translated: The limit of reality is the dharmadhatu.

original: de ston par byed pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de skyed ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ston par byed pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de skyed ces bya'o //
translated: Because it teaches that, the perfection of wisdom is said to give rise to it.

original: nges par 'byung ba'i sbyor ba ni bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol to //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i sbyor ba ni bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol to //
translated: The application of definite emergence is stated by Subhuti with Bhagavan, it is thus. For example... and so forth.

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dpag tshad brgya phrag mang po'i 'brog dgon pa na gnas pa'i skyes bu dang 'dra bar bar du gcod pa'i chos spong ba la sogs sgrub pa dang ldan pa gang zhig mnyan pa la sogs pa'i
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dpag tshad brgya phrag mang po'i 'brog dgon pa na gnas pa'i skyes bu dang 'dra bar bar du gcod pa'i chos spong ba la sogs sgrub pa dang ldan pa gang zhig mnyan pa la sogs pa'i
translated: The Bhagavān said, “It is like this…”🔽🔽Just as a person who lives in a wilderness with many hundreds of leagues of empty space, so too, whoever practices the Dharma of abandonment and so on, which is an obstacle to listening and so on,

original: don du rgyal ba'i yum dang phrad pa ni gdon mi za bar nges par 'byung bas bdag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsnyen pa yin no zhes shes par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: don du rgyal ba'i yum dang phrad pa ni gdon mi za bar nges par 'byung bas bdag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsnyen pa yin no zhes shes par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The Bhagavān said, “In the same way, O son of noble family,” and so on. Just like the person who lives in a wilderness with many hundreds of leagues of obstacles, whoever has the practice of abandoning obstacles and so on, when they encounter the Mother of the Victor for the sake of listening and so on, they will certainly attain deliverance. The meaning is that one should know, “I am approaching unsurpassed perfect complete awakening.”

original: de nyid ni de yang nyan thos kyis 'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid ni de yang nyan thos kyis 'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
translated: That very thing is stated by “And that is also for the śrāvakas,” and so on.

original: de dang mi mthun pa'i chos la nye bar ma gnas @186b bzhin du ji ltar na nyan thos la sogs pa'i sar lhung ba'i 'jigs pa med pa yin snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas 'di ltar des zhes bya ba la🔽sogs pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de dang mi mthun pa'i chos la nye bar ma gnas @186b bzhin du ji ltar na nyan thos la sogs pa'i sar lhung ba'i 'jigs pa med pa yin snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas 'di ltar des zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
translated: In response to this question, he says,🔽“Because they have attained the acceptance that phenomena are not produced, etc.”

original: 'di skad du gang gi phyir gang zag la bdag med pa tsam gyis rab tu phye ba nyid kyis na nyan thos la sogs pa'i sa dang mi mthun pa'i chos ma lus pa thams cad dngos po med pa nyid du ston par byed pa'i shes rab kyi pha
analyzed: 'di skad du gang gi phyir gang zag la bdag med pa tsam gyis rab tu phye ba nyid kyis na nyan thos la sogs pa'i sa dang mi mthun pa'i chos ma lus pa thams cad dngos po med pa nyid du ston par byed pa'i shes rab kyi pha
translated: This is what he means: because they have attained the acceptance that the perfection of wisdom, which teaches that all phenomena incompatible with the śrāvaka levels, etc., are nonexistent, is to be seen, etc.,

original: rol tu phyin pa blta ba la sogs pa'i don du bzod pa thob pa yin pa de bas na de dang mi mthun pa'i yum la dmigs pas nyan thos la sogs pa'i sar ltung ba'i dogs pa yod pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: rol tu phyin pa blta ba la sogs pa'i don du bzod pa thob pa yin pa de bas na de dang mi mthun pa'i yum la dmigs pas nyan thos la sogs pa'i sar ltung ba'i dogs pa yod pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: they do not fear falling to the śrāvaka levels, etc., by focusing on a mother that is incompatible with that.

original: legs par smras pa nyid kyis na sh'a ri'i bu de de bzhin no de de bzhin te zhes rjes su mthun pa gnang nas yang nus pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir sh'a ri'i bu ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: legs par smras pa nyid kyis na sh'a ri'i bu de de bzhin no de de bzhin te zhes rjes su mthun pa gnang nas yang nus pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir sh'a ri'i bu ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: It is precisely because of the good speech that the Lord said, So it is, Shariputra, so it is! approvingly, and then in order to generate the ability, he said, Shariputra, it is like this...

original: bar chad med pa'i sbyor ba'i don ni bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste dper na 'di na skyes bu la la zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsol pa yin te /
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i sbyor ba'i don ni bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste dper na 'di na skyes bu la la zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsol pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the uninterrupted application is the request beginning with Bhagavan, it is like this, for example...

original: sdong po'am sdong po'i mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni shing ngam shing gi mtshan ma zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sdong po'am sdong po'i mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni shing ngam shing gi mtshan ma zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: A stump or sign of a stump means a tree or sign of a tree.

original: sdong po la sogs pa ma mthong bas ji ltar rgya mtsho chen po dang nye ba yin snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
analyzed: sdong po la sogs pa ma mthong bas ji ltar rgya mtsho chen po dang nye ba yin snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
translated: Why is it so? is said to remove the doubt of how it is near the great ocean by not seeing a stump, etc.

original: rgya mtsho chen po ni rim gyis dma' ba lags pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol to //
analyzed: rgya mtsho chen po ni rim gyis dma' ba lags pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol to //
translated: The great ocean is gradually sloping and so on is said.

original: 'di skad du gang gi phyir rgya mtsho chen po'i rang bzhin shing la sogs pa dang 'gal ba rim gyis dma' bar rang gi rgyus bskyed pa de'i phyir de dmigs pa'i rang bzhin kho nas shing la sogs pa mi dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir de dang nye ba🔽yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad du gang gi phyir rgya mtsho chen po'i rang bzhin shing la sogs pa dang 'gal ba rim gyis dma' bar rang gi rgyus bskyed pa de'i phyir de dmigs pa'i rang bzhin kho nas shing la sogs pa mi dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir de dang nye ba yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: It is said in this way: “Because the nature of the great ocean is gradually lower, generated by its own cause, which is incompatible with trees and so on, therefore, because of that, trees and so on are not observed by the nature of that observation alone, it is near to that.”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di nyid nyan pa na 'di snyam du rig par bgyi ste zhes bya ba ni rtag tu bsgom pa la sogs pa bsgrub pas bar chad med par sbyor ba'i stobs kyis de ltar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di nyid nyan pa na 'di snyam du rig par bgyi ste zhes bya ba ni rtag tu bsgom pa la sogs pa bsgrub pas bar chad med par sbyor ba'i stobs kyis de ltar shes par bya'o //
translated: When listening to this profound perfection of wisdom, one should think in this way. This is to be understood by the power of application without interruption through accomplishing constant meditation and so on.

original: ji ltar yum mnyan pa'i rgyus 'bras bu lung bstan pa dang nye bar rjes su dpag par bya snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas de ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar yum mnyan pa'i rgyus 'bras bu lung bstan pa dang nye bar rjes su dpag par bya snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas de ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
translated: How is it to be inferred from the cause of listening to the mother, the prediction of the result? Why is it so? Beginning with this, it is said, “It is like this...” and so on.

original: de skad du rgyu don gzhan la ltos pa med pas 'bras bu skye bar rang bar rjes su dpog pa'i rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyis lung bstan pa dang nye bar gyur pa yin par rjes su dpag pas nyes pa med do zhes @187a * //
analyzed: de skad du rgyu don gzhan la ltos pa med pas 'bras bu skye bar rang bar rjes su dpog pa'i rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyis lung bstan pa dang nye bar gyur pa yin par rjes su dpag pas nyes pa med do zhes @187a * //
translated: Thus, since the cause does not depend on another cause, the effect is generated by itself. This is the inference. The statement of the opponent is close to being a declaration, but it is not a declaration because it is an inference.

original: brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: brjod pa yin no //
translated: This is what is said.

original: yang mngon par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang nye ba'i sbyor ba ni /
analyzed: yang mngon par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang nye ba'i sbyor ba ni /
translated: Moreover, the application that is close to manifest complete enlightenment

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste dper na dpyid ka'i dus zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste dper na dpyid ka'i dus zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: is indicated by the statement, “Bhagavan, it is like this. For example, in the spring season…”

original: lo ma rnying pa rnams lhags pa las zhes bya ba ni lo ma rgan po rnams lhung ba na'o //
analyzed: lo ma rnying pa rnams lhags pa las zhes bya ba ni lo ma rgan po rnams lhung ba na'o //
translated: “From the falling of old leaves” means from the falling of old leaves.

original: snga ma bzhin du de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes dogs pa bsu nas de ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes dogs pa bsu nas de ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: “Why is it so?” is a question that anticipates doubt. The response is “It is like this…”

original: sdong po las mtshan ma 'di lta bu dag ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sdong po las mtshan ma 'di lta bu dag ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: “From the trunk, these signs…” and so on.

original: rgyu tshogs pa las 'bras bu skye bar rjes su dpog pa gang yin pa /
analyzed: rgyu tshogs pa las 'bras bu skye bar rjes su dpog pa gang yin pa /
translated: The inference that an effect arises from a cause is

original: don gzhan la ni mi ltos phyir //
analyzed: don gzhan la ni mi ltos phyir //
translated: because it does not depend on another object.

original: de ni rang bzhin yin par brjod //
analyzed: de ni rang bzhin yin par brjod //
translated: That is said to be its intrinsic nature.

original: ces bya ba'i rigs pas 'di'i don ni go bar zad do //
analyzed: ces bya ba'i rigs pas 'di'i don ni go bar zad do //
translated: The meaning of this is understood by the reasoning stated.

original: nye bar bstabs pa lags so zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i chos gsar gyi rten nyid la sogs pa bsgrubs pas mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang nye ba'i sbyor ba'i ma thus bstabs pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar bstabs pa lags so zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i chos gsar gyi rten nyid la sogs pa bsgrubs pas mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang nye ba'i sbyor ba'i ma thus bstabs pa'o //
translated: The application of the term pregnant is because of the establishment of the basis of the new undefiled dharmas, etc., by the application of the proximate cause of manifest complete enlightenment.

original: myur du mngon par rdzogs pa byang chub pa'i sbyor ba'i don ni bcom ldan 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol to //
analyzed: myur du mngon par rdzogs pa byang chub pa'i sbyor ba'i don ni bcom ldan 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol to //
translated: The meaning of the application of the swift manifest complete enlightenment is stated by the Bhagavat with the words, For example...

original: mngal chags pa yin pa'i phyir bud med sbrum ma'o //
analyzed: mngal chags pa yin pa'i phyir bud med sbrum ma'o //
translated: A woman who is pregnant is one in whom the embryo has been implanted.

original: skye ba'i dus dang nye ba nyid kyi phyir mngal lci ba'o //
analyzed: skye ba'i dus dang nye ba nyid kyi phyir mngal lci ba'o //
translated: One who is heavy with child is one who is near the time of delivery.

original: yan lag rkyong ba la sogs pas na lus bskyod na'o //
analyzed: yan lag rkyong ba la sogs pas na lus bskyod na'o //
translated: One who moves the body is one who moves the limbs, etc.

original: sngon gyi tshul bzhin ma lags pa'i yid la bgyid pa ni 'khrig pa'i chos dang rab tu ldan pa'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi tshul bzhin ma lags pa'i yid la bgyid pa ni 'khrig pa'i chos dang rab tu ldan pa'o //
translated: The former improper mental activity is associated with sexual activity.

original: rten cing nges par rten la bsgoms te zhes bya ba ni go rims bzhin du sbyor ba dang dngos gzhi dang mjug gi gnas skabs su'o //
analyzed: rten cing nges par rten la bsgoms te zhes bya ba ni go rims bzhin du sbyor ba dang dngos gzhi dang mjug gi gnas skabs su'o //
translated: Meditating on the dependent origination means in the context of the preparatory, actual, and subsequent stages, respectively.

original: thams cad du yang dang yang du mngon du byed pas na mang du byas pas so //
analyzed: thams cad du yang dang yang du mngon du byed pas na mang du byas pas so //
translated: And by doing it again and again in all situations, it is done much.

original: de ltar bsran dka' ba 'di lta bu'i tshul gyi sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba da ltar ba 'di lus kyis nyams su myong ngo snyam du sems par byed pa zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o ;
analyzed: de ltar bsran dka' ba 'di lta bu'i tshul gyi sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba da ltar ba 'di lus kyis nyams su myong ngo snyam du sems par byed pa zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o ;
translated: Thus, thinking, “I am experiencing with my body the present painful feeling in this way, which is hard to bear,” is the remainder.

original: / nyan pa na de la dpa' zhing zhes bya ba ni brten par gyur pa'i sgrub pa'i chos dang ldan pa 'bras bu chos kyi sku mngon par bsgrubs pa lags pa'i sgrub pa dang ldan pa ni /
analyzed: / nyan pa na de la dpa' zhing zhes bya ba ni brten par gyur pa'i sgrub pa'i chos dang ldan pa 'bras bu chos kyi sku mngon par bsgrubs pa lags pa'i sgrub pa dang ldan pa ni /
translated: When listening, being courageous toward that means having the quality of firmness, having the quality of accomplishment that is the accomplishment of the result, the Dharma body.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i sbyor ba'i mthu las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la nyan pa sngon du 'gro bas dga' zhing gus par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i sbyor ba'i mthu las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la nyan pa sngon du 'gro bas dga' zhing gus par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the verse is that, through the power of the practice as explained, one listens to the perfection of wisdom with joy and respect.

original: gzhan gyi don gyi sbyor ba ni bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol to //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don gyi sbyor ba ni bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol to //
translated: The practice for the benefit of others is expressed in the verse beginning, “Blessed One, Tathagata, etc.”

original: bar zhes smos ba ni mgon dang bcas pa la sogs pa yongs su bsdu'o //
analyzed: bar zhes smos ba ni mgon dang bcas pa la sogs pa yongs su bsdu'o //
translated: The word “also” includes the “with protector” and so on.

original: gang gi phyir lung bstan pa la sogs pas sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la nges par bkod pas na legs par @187b yongs su bzung ba legs par sbyangs pa dang bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i bshes gnyen la rab tu gtad
analyzed: gang gi phyir lung bstan pa la sogs pas sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la nges par bkod pas na legs par @187b yongs su bzung ba legs par sbyangs pa dang bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i bshes gnyen la rab tu gtad
translated: Since they are well established in the stages and perfections through prediction and so on, they are well taken care of. Since they are well trained, the Blessed One has entrusted the bodhisattvas to the spiritual masters.

original: pa de'i phyir ngo mtshar te thugs rje'i yul thams cad yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: pa de'i phyir ngo mtshar te thugs rje'i yul thams cad yin du zin kyang /
translated: Therefore, it is amazing that they are the objects of compassion.

original: bas ma pa khyad par can phun sum tshogs pas skal ba dang ldan pa nyid kyi stobs kyis so sor nges pa'i 'gro ba la phan 'dogs par mdzad pa ni ya mtshan che'o //
analyzed: bas ma pa khyad par can phun sum tshogs pas skal ba dang ldan pa nyid kyi stobs kyis so sor nges pa'i 'gro ba la phan 'dogs par mdzad pa ni ya mtshan che'o //
translated: It is wonderful that he benefits the various beings by the power of his own perfect, special, abundant good fortune.

original: bsam pa khyad par can phun sum tshogs pa nyid ni rab 'byor 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: bsam pa khyad par can phun sum tshogs pa nyid ni rab 'byor 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The perfection of the special intention is stated in the passage beginning “Subhuti, it is thus.”

original: skye bo mang po la phan pa'i phyir zhugs pa ni ma 'ongs pa dang 'brel pa'i don byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye bo mang po la phan pa'i phyir zhugs pa ni ma 'ongs pa dang 'brel pa'i don byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is engaged in the welfare of many people because he is engaged in the benefit of future beings.

original: skye bo mang po la bde ba ni da ltar gyi dus su tshe 'di'i don byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye bo mang po la bde ba ni da ltar gyi dus su tshe 'di'i don byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is the happiness of many people because he is engaged in the benefit of beings in this world.

original: 'jig rten la snying brtse bzhes bya ba ni 'das pa'i dus dang 'brel pa'i dge ba dang mi dge ba byas pa'i bag chags rnams go rims bzhin du 'phel ba dang yongs su zad par bya ba'i phyir 'bad par byed pa ni 'jig rten la snying brtse ba'i
analyzed: 'jig rten la snying brtse bzhes bya ba ni 'das pa'i dus dang 'brel pa'i dge ba dang mi dge ba byas pa'i bag chags rnams go rims bzhin du 'phel ba dang yongs su zad par bya ba'i phyir 'bad par byed pa ni 'jig rten la snying brtse ba'i
translated: He is the compassionate one for the world because he strives to increase and to completely eliminate the habitual tendencies of virtue and nonvirtue that are related to the past.

original: phyir zhugs pa yin no zhes bya ba phyi ma dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: phyir zhugs pa yin no zhes bya ba phyi ma dang sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase he has entered is connected with the latter part of the verse.

original: gzhan yang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs ba dang da ltar byung ba'i dus dang 'brel pa nyid kyis spyir gsungs pa ni skye bo phal po che'i don dang phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir zhugs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs ba dang da ltar byung ba'i dus dang 'brel pa nyid kyis spyir gsungs pa ni skye bo phal po che'i don dang phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir zhugs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Moreover, the phrase he has entered for the sake of the welfare, benefit, and happiness of many people is a general statement based on his connection with the past, present, and future.

original: bla na med pa'i chos ston par 'dod pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba la sogs pa'i sgrub pa dang ldan pa rnams gzhan gyi don byed pa'i phyir chos smra bar 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i chos ston par 'dod pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba la sogs pa'i sgrub pa dang ldan pa rnams gzhan gyi don byed pa'i phyir chos smra bar 'dod pa'o //
translated: The phrase he desires to teach the unsurpassed Dharma refers to the desire to teach the Dharma for the benefit of others, i.e., those who are endowed with the practice of turning the wheel of the Dharma of the perfection of wisdom, etc.

original: 'phel ba dang 'grib pa med pa'i sbyor ba'i don ni bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: 'phel ba dang 'grib pa med pa'i sbyor ba'i don ni bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the application of non-increase and non-decrease is stated by the phrase Blessed One, the bodhisattva...

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i 'phel ba dang / 'grib pa ma mthong bas ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni rjes su gnang ba yin pa'i phyir de'i sbyor ba yin par bshad do //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i 'phel ba dang / 'grib pa ma mthong bas ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni rjes su gnang ba yin pa'i phyir de'i sbyor ba yin par bshad do //
translated: Since he does not see the increase and decrease of form, etc., he is engaged in the perfection of wisdom.

original: chos dang chos ma yin pa la sogs pa mi dmigs par sbyor ba'i don du gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: chos dang chos ma yin pa la sogs pa mi dmigs par sbyor ba'i don du gsungs pa ni /
translated: The meaning of the application to the non-apprehension of dharma, nondharma, etc. is stated:

original: chos yang dag par rjes su mi mthong na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: chos yang dag par rjes su mi mthong na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: “If he does not see dharma, etc.”

original: chos dang chos ma yin pa la sogs pa mi dmigs par sgrub pas de la sbyor ba'i phyir /
analyzed: chos dang chos ma yin pa la sogs pa mi dmigs par sgrub pas de la sbyor ba'i phyir /
translated: Because he accomplishes the non-apprehension of dharma, nondharma, etc., he is engaged in that.

original: de ltar bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus his cultivation is perfected.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rnam pa'i 'du shes 'gog pa'i sbyor ba'i don du brjod pa ni /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rnam pa'i 'du shes 'gog pa'i sbyor ba'i don du brjod pa ni /
translated: The meaning of the application to the cessation of the discriminations of the inconceivable aspects is stated:

original: bcom ldan 'das bstan pa 'di ni bsam gyis mi khyab po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bstan pa 'di ni bsam gyis mi khyab po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: “Bhagavan, this teaching is inconceivable.”

original: chos kyi @188a * //
analyzed: chos kyi @188a * //
translated: The inconceivable is the inconceivable reality of all dharmas.

original: dbyings rang bzhin nyid kyis bsam par mi nus pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbyings rang bzhin nyid kyis bsam par mi nus pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the realm is naturally inconceivable.

original: gal te nger 'dzin pa'i 'dru shes bkag pas gzugs la sogs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o zhes bya bar mi sems na /
analyzed: gal te nger 'dzin pa'i 'dru shes bkag pas gzugs la sogs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o zhes bya bar mi sems na /
translated: If one does not think that form, etc. is inconceivable because the notion of determination is stopped,

original: de'i tshe ji skad du bshad pa'i sbyor bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i tshe ji skad du bshad pa'i sbyor bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: then at that time one practices the perfection of wisdom as explained by the method. This is the meaning.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i sbyor ba'i don zhus pa ni bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i sbyor ba'i don zhus pa ni bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol pa yin no //
translated: The question about the meaning of the application to the non-conceptual is stated in the passage beginning with “Bhagavan, what is the perfection of wisdom?”

original: lan ni sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: lan ni sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The answer is given in the passage beginning with “Śāriputra, the bodhisattva…”

original: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po spyad par 'gyur ba lags zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo thob pa la zhus pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po spyad par 'gyur ba lags zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo thob pa la zhus pa'o //
translated: “Bhagavan, how does the bodhisattva-mahāsattva practice?” This is the question about attaining its own nature.

original: ji ltar spyad par gyur pa zhes ba gyi ba'i ming thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni don dang ldan pa'i ming thob pa las zhus pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar spyad par gyur pa zhes ba gyi ba'i ming thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni don dang ldan pa'i ming thob pa las zhus pa'o //
translated: How does one come to be called one who practices?

original: lan ni sh'a ri'i bu 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: lan ni sh'a ri'i bu 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The answer is given in the passage beginning with Śāriputra, here...🔽If the domain of mind exists in regard to the powers, fearlessnesses, etc., how is there no discursive thought?

original: stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa la sems kyi yul yod pa yin na ji ltar mi rtog snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
analyzed: stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa la sems kyi yul yod pa yin na ji ltar mi rtog snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
translated: The question is anticipated by Why is that?

original: sh'a ri'i bu stobs rnams bsam gyis mi khyab ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu stobs rnams bsam gyis mi khyab ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: and the answer is given in the passage beginning with Śāriputra, the powers are inconceivable...🔽In reality, because of the nature of the dharma-dhātu, one does not discursively think of form, etc., their signs, and their intrinsic identity.

original: de kho na nyid du na chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa dang de'i mtshan ma dang de'i rang gi ngo bor mi rtog pa la sogs par bsgrub pa'i mthus rnam par mi rtog pa'i sbyor bas thob pa yin pa'i phyir bsam
analyzed: de kho na nyid du na chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa dang de'i mtshan ma dang de'i rang gi ngo bor mi rtog pa la sogs par bsgrub pa'i mthus rnam par mi rtog pa'i sbyor bas thob pa yin pa'i phyir bsam
translated: The attainment is by way of non-discursive practice, through the power of accomplishment in non-discursive thought, etc.

original: pa las 'das pa yin pa nyid kyis na stobs la sogs pa bsam du yod par mi rtog go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: pa las 'das pa yin pa nyid kyis na stobs la sogs pa bsam du yod par mi rtog go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Since it is beyond the scope of thought, one should not think that the powers, etc. are thinkable.

original: 'bras bu rin po che sbyin pa'i sbyor ba'i don ni bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni zab po /
analyzed: 'bras bu rin po che sbyin pa'i sbyor ba'i don ni bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni zab po /
translated: The meaning of the application of the gift of the jewel of the result is as follows: The Blessed One said, “The perfection of wisdom is profound,

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rin po che'i phung po'o zhes gsol te //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rin po che'i phung po'o zhes gsol te //
translated: Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom is a heap of jewels.”

original: chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa gnyen po yin pas zab par gyur pa na /
analyzed: chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa gnyen po yin pas zab par gyur pa na /
translated: Since the selflessness of phenomena and persons is the antidote, it is profound.

original: 'bras bu dang po mthong ba la sogs pa'i sgrub pas 'bras bu rin po che spyin pa'i sbyor ba dang ldan la /
analyzed: 'bras bu dang po mthong ba la sogs pa'i sgrub pas 'bras bu rin po che spyin pa'i sbyor ba dang ldan la /
translated: Since it is endowed with the application of the gift of the jewel of the result, it is the result of the path of seeing, etc.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi 'bras bu rin po che sbyin par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir rin po che'i phung po'o //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi 'bras bu rin po che sbyin par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir rin po che'i phung po'o //
translated: Since it gives the jewel of the result of stream enterer, etc., up to the unsurpassed perfect complete enlightenment, it is a heap of jewels.

original: rnam par dag pa'i sbyor pa'i don ni /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i sbyor pa'i don ni /
translated: The meaning of the application of purity is as follows:

original: @188b bcom ldan 'das nam mkha' dag pa'i slad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol pa yin te /
analyzed: @188b bcom ldan 'das nam mkha' dag pa'i slad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol pa yin te /
translated: The phrase because the sky is pure and so forth is the request.

original: nam mkha' ltar rnam par dag pa yin pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa rnam par dag par bsgom pas skyor ba de dang ldan pa rnams kyi nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa slong pa'i rgyur gyur pa nyid kyis na dag pa'i phung po'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' ltar rnam par dag pa yin pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa rnam par dag par bsgom pas skyor ba de dang ldan pa rnams kyi nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa slong pa'i rgyur gyur pa nyid kyis na dag pa'i phung po'o //
translated: Since it is pure like the sky, the pure aggregates are the cause for removing the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience of those who are weary of cultivating the purity of form and so forth.

original: mu mtshams kyi sbyor ba'i don ni bcom ldan 'das rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol pa yin te /
analyzed: mu mtshams kyi sbyor ba'i don ni bcom ldan 'das rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol pa yin te /
translated: The phrase Blessed One, it is amazing and so forth is the request for the application of the boundary.

original: mthu chen po nyid yin yang bar chad byed pa mang po 'byung ba 'di ni ngo mtshar che'o //🔽legs par smras pa yin pa ni /
analyzed: mthu chen po nyid yin yang bar chad byed pa mang po 'byung ba 'di ni ngo mtshar che'o // legs par smras pa yin pa ni /
translated: Even though they have great power, many obstacles arise, so this is amazing.🔽 The phrase well said and so forth is the reply.

original: rab 'byor de de bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
