analyzed: rab 'byor de de bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The phrase Subhūti, it is just so and so forth is the reply.

original: 'di nyid ni rigs pa dang mi ldan no snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhen zhes bya bas bsu nas /
analyzed: 'di nyid ni rigs pa dang mi ldan no snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhen zhes bya bas bsu nas /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor de ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Subhūti, it is because of this, etc.

original: gang gi phyir bdud sdig can par chad bya bar te bya ba'i rgyu mtshan du brtson par byed cing spro bar byed pa de de bas na bar chad mang ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bdud sdig can par chad bya bar te bya ba'i rgyu mtshan du brtson par byed cing spro bar byed pa de de bas na bar chad mang ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because the evil Māra is diligent and enthusiastic to create obstacles, for that reason there are many obstacles. This is the meaning.

original: gal te de ltar yin na ji ltar myur du bri bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar yin na ji ltar myur du bri bar bya zhe na /
translated: If that is so, how should it be written quickly?

original: der myur du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: der myur du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: There, quickly, etc. is stated.

original: lo gcig gis zhes smos pa ni 'phags pa rnam par grol ba'i sdes de tsam gyis dus tshigs la sogs pa'i rkyen tshogs pa yin pas de las phyi rol na dus med do zhes shes par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: lo gcig gis zhes smos pa ni 'phags pa rnam par grol ba'i sdes de tsam gyis dus tshigs la sogs pa'i rkyen tshogs pa yin pas de las phyi rol na dus med do zhes shes par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
translated: The statement “in one year” is explained by Ārya Vimuktisena as follows: “In order to know that the collection of conditions such as the season is complete in just that much time, there is no time outside of that.”

original: de lta na yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba ni lor mngon par brtson pa'i sbyor ba ni /
analyzed: de lta na yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba ni lor mngon par brtson pa'i sbyor ba ni /
translated: Still, Subhuti refers to the practice of striving for a year.

original: gtong ba la sogs pa'i sgrub pa dang ldan pa rnams mu mtshams kyi sbyor ba thob pa yin pas bgegs med par bri bar bya ste /
analyzed: gtong ba la sogs pa'i sgrub pa dang ldan pa rnams mu mtshams kyi sbyor ba thob pa yin pas bgegs med par bri bar bya ste /
translated: Those who possess the practice of giving and so on, who have attained the practice of the boundary, should draw it without obstacles.

original: myur du zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: myur du zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: Quickly is the remainder.

original: gal te lor dris na ji ltar myur ba yin snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhen zhes bya bas bsu nas /
analyzed: gal te lor dris na ji ltar myur ba yin snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhen zhes bya bas bsu nas /
translated: If it is asked in a year, how is it quick? Fearing that doubt will arise, he asks, Why is that?

original: rab 'byor da ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor da ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Then the Lord said to Subhuti, It is thus, etc.

original: 'di ni chos nyid yin te /🔽gang gi phyir rin po che chen po rnams la bar chad byed pa mang du 'byung ba'i da ni chos nyid yin pa de'i phyir rin po che dam pa'i rang bzhin gyi yum bar chad mang yang lo skor gyis bris na myur ba yin no snyam du dgongs
analyzed: 'di ni chos nyid yin te / gang gi phyir rin po che chen po rnams la bar chad byed pa mang du 'byung ba'i da ni chos nyid yin pa de'i phyir rin po che dam pa'i rang bzhin gyi yum bar chad mang yang lo skor gyis bris na myur ba yin no snyam du dgongs
translated: This is the nature of things.

original: pa yin no //
analyzed: pa yin no //
translated: Because there are many obstacles to the great jewels, it is the nature of things. Therefore, even though the mother, whose nature is the highest jewel, has many obstacles, if drawn in a year, it is quick, he thinks.

original: sbyor ba ni ji skad du bshad pa kho nar gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni ji skad du bshad pa kho nar gzung bar bya ste /
translated: The practice is just as it has been explained.

original: de skad du yang /🔽gzugs la @189a * //
analyzed: de skad du yang / gzugs la @189a * //
translated: As it is said:🔽Because they do not dwell in form,

original: sogs par mi gnas phyir //
analyzed: sogs par mi gnas phyir //
translated: and so on,

original: de la sbyor ba bkag pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de la sbyor ba bkag pa'i phyir //
translated: because the practice is stopped there,

original: de yi de bzhin nyid zab phyir //
analyzed: de yi de bzhin nyid zab phyir //
translated: because their suchness is profound,

original: de rnams gting dpag dka' ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de rnams gting dpag dka' ba'i phyir //
translated: because they are difficult to fathom,🔽because they are immeasurable,

original: de dag tshad ni med phyir dang // tshegs chen yun rings rtogs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de dag tshad ni med phyir dang // tshegs chen yun rings rtogs pa'i phyir //
translated: because they are realized with great difficulty and over a long time,🔽because of the prediction, because of irreversibility,🔽because of the uninterrupted emergence,

original: lung bstan phyir mi ldog nyid dang // nges 'byung bar chad med bcas bcas dang // byang chub nye dang myur ba dang // gzhan don 'phel med 'grib med phyir //
analyzed: lung bstan phyir mi ldog nyid dang // nges 'byung bar chad med bcas bcas dang // byang chub nye dang myur ba dang // gzhan don 'phel med 'grib med phyir //
translated: because of the nearness of enlightenment, because of swiftness,🔽because of the increase and decrease of others,

original: chos dang chos min sogs mi mthong //
analyzed: chos dang chos min sogs mi mthong //
translated: because of not seeing virtue, nonvirtue, and so on,

original: gzugs sogs bsam mi khyab mi mthong //
analyzed: gzugs sogs bsam mi khyab mi mthong //
translated: because of not seeing form and so on as inconceivable,🔽because of not conceptualizing the signs of form and so on

original: gzugs sogs de yi mtshan ma dang // de yi ngo bor rnam mi rtog //
analyzed: gzugs sogs de yi mtshan ma dang // de yi ngo bor rnam mi rtog //
translated: and their nature,🔽because of giving the precious fruit,

original: 'bras bu rin chen sbyin byed dang // de ni dag pa mtshams dang bcas //🔽zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu rin chen sbyin byed dang // de ni dag pa mtshams dang bcas //🔽zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: and because of the purity and its boundary.

original: sbyor ba nyi shu po de dag gi go rims 'di ni rims kho na yin te /🔽'di ltar gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad la mngon par zhes pa med pas gnas pa /
analyzed: sbyor ba nyi shu po de dag gi go rims 'di ni rims kho na yin te / 'di ltar gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad la mngon par zhes pa med pas gnas pa /
translated: The order of these twenty kinds of application is just the order in which they occur.

original: mi spyor ba'i sbyor ba la mngon par brtson pa ni /
analyzed: mi spyor ba'i sbyor ba la mngon par brtson pa ni /
translated: Thus, one who is intent on the application of non-application, because of the absence of any attachment to all dharmas such as form,

original: gzugs la sogs pa de dag gi zab pa nyid dang / gting dpag dka' ba nyid dang / tshad med pa nyid rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa de dag gi zab pa nyid dang / gting dpag dka' ba nyid dang / tshad med pa nyid rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: will understand the profundity, the difficulty of fathoming, and the immeasurability of those dharmas such as form.

original: de nas yang dag pa ma yin pa'i sbyor ba byed pa nyid kyis na las dang po pas ni tshegs chen pos 'thob bo //
analyzed: de nas yang dag pa ma yin pa'i sbyor ba byed pa nyid kyis na las dang po pas ni tshegs chen pos 'thob bo //
translated: Then, by the application of non-reality, the beginner will attain with great difficulty.

original: de las gzhan pa ni lung bstan pa dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i sa bde blag tu thob nas nges par 'byung ba dang / mi 'bral bar 'gyur zhing mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa la nye bar 'gyur ba dang / myur du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa ni lung bstan pa dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i sa bde blag tu thob nas nges par 'byung ba dang / mi 'bral bar 'gyur zhing mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa la nye bar 'gyur ba dang / myur du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: But the others, having attained the stage of prediction and the stage of nonregression with ease, will have the certain deliverance, the non-separation, and the nearness of full enlightenment, and they will quickly attain full enlightenment.

original: de nas gzhan gyi don byed cing 'phel ba med pa dang 'grib pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas gzhan gyi don byed cing 'phel ba med pa dang 'grib pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, one acts for the sake of others and becomes free from increase and decrease.

original: de nas chos dang chos ma yin pa la sogs pa spyi dang / gzugs bsam gyis mi khyab pa la sogs pa'i khyad par la 'du shes thams cad spangs pa'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa ni /
analyzed: de nas chos dang chos ma yin pa la sogs pa spyi dang / gzugs bsam gyis mi khyab pa la sogs pa'i khyad par la 'du shes thams cad spangs pa'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa ni /
translated: Then, because of the elimination of all notions of the general, such as of virtue and nonvirtue, and of the specific, such as of the inconceivability of form, there is the absence of conceptualization.

original: 'bras bu rin po che sbyin pas mchog tu rnam par dag pa'i mthar thug pa thob par 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: 'bras bu rin po che sbyin pas mchog tu rnam par dag pa'i mthar thug pa thob par 'gyur ba ni /
translated: The result is the attainment of the ultimate perfection of supreme purity through the gift of the precious Dharma.

original: snga ma kho nar lo skor gyi sbyor bas sems kyi rgyud yongs su sbyangs pa yin pas sbyor ba'i go rims ni mngon par rtogs pas rab tu phye ba yin no //
analyzed: snga ma kho nar lo skor gyi sbyor bas sems kyi rgyud yongs su sbyangs pa yin pas sbyor ba'i go rims ni mngon par rtogs pas rab tu phye ba yin no //
translated: Since the mind-stream is completely purified by the yoga of the year before, the sequence of the yogas is distinguished by the realizations.

original: yon tan mthong ba sngon du btang na sbyor ba rnams la shin tu goms par byed pa sbyor ba'i 'og tu de ngag gi yon tan brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: yon tan mthong ba sngon du btang na sbyor ba rnams la shin tu goms par byed pa sbyor ba'i 'og tu de ngag gi yon tan brjod par bya'o //
translated: After the yogas, the qualities of the path should be mentioned, since one becomes very familiar with the yogas when one has seen the qualities.🔽The qualities of the path

original: de las dang por bdud kyi mthu bcom pa'i yon tan brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de las dang por bdud kyi mthu bcom pa'i yon tan brjod pa ni /
translated: The qualities of the path are mentioned in the second half of the root verse.

original: bcom ldan 'das @189b shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yi ger 'dri ba la zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das @189b shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yi ger 'dri ba la zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The Blessed One, this perfection of wisdom, when it is written out in letters, etc.

original: yi dam ma nyams pa'i zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa klog pa la sogs par yi dam bcas pa las ma nyams pa'o //
analyzed: yi dam ma nyams pa'i zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa klog pa la sogs par yi dam bcas pa las ma nyams pa'o //
translated: Not having failed in one's vow means not having failed in the vow to read the perfection of wisdom, etc.

original: bar chad byed mi nus so zhes bya ba ni mthu med par 'gyur ba'o /
analyzed: bar chad byed mi nus so zhes bya ba ni mthu med par 'gyur ba'o /
translated: It cannot be obstructed means it cannot be impeded.

original: // / de srid tsam du bgegs mi nus pas na bcom ldan 'das gang gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol pa yin no //
analyzed: // / de srid tsam du bgegs mi nus pas na bcom ldan 'das gang gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol pa yin no //
translated: Since it cannot be obstructed to that extent, the Blessed One, at that time, etc.

original: ji ltar na deng sang zhes bya ba ni de nyid rnam pa gang gis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar na deng sang zhes bya ba ni de nyid rnam pa gang gis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: How is it that nowadays? means by what aspect of that?

original: de ni gang gi mthus zhes bya ba ni gang gi nus pas so //
analyzed: de ni gang gi mthus zhes bya ba ni gang gi nus pas so //
translated: That is by whose power? means by whose ability?

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi mthus zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pas zhus pa gnyis byas pa'i phyir phyis de nyid kyi lan btab pa yin no //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi mthus zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pas zhus pa gnyis byas pa'i phyir phyis de nyid kyi lan btab pa yin no //
translated: By the power of the perfect Buddha means the answer to that itself is given later, because two questions were asked by way of conceptualization.

original: 'di skad du sbyor ba bsgom pa'i skabs su de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi byin gyi rlabs thob pas bdud kyi mthu bcom pa'i yon tan 'byung ba'i phyir 'dzin par byed pa la sogs par 'gyur pa yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad du sbyor ba bsgom pa'i skabs su de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi byin gyi rlabs thob pas bdud kyi mthu bcom pa'i yon tan 'byung ba'i phyir 'dzin par byed pa la sogs par 'gyur pa yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: It is said, At the time of cultivating the application, by attaining the blessing of the Tathagatas, the qualities of destroying the power of Mara arise, and so one becomes one who holds them, and so forth.

original: de rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthu ji ltar yin snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
analyzed: de rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthu ji ltar yin snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
translated: If one wonders how the power of the Tathagatas is in them, that is addressed by Why is that?

original: sh'a ri'i bu 'di ni chos rnams kyi chos nyid de zhes bya ba gsungs pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu 'di ni chos rnams kyi chos nyid de zhes bya ba gsungs pa ni go sla'o //
translated: The statement This, Shariputra, is the true nature of dharmas is easy to understand.

original: de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir gang 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med grangs med pa dag na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir gang 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med grangs med pa dag na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: In order to clarify that very point, it is said In immeasurable, countless world systems... and so forth.

original: gnyis pa sangs rgyas kyis dgongs shing mkhyen pa'i yon tan brjod pa ni /
analyzed: gnyis pa sangs rgyas kyis dgongs shing mkhyen pa'i yon tan brjod pa ni /
translated: The second, the praise of the qualities of being contemplated and known by the Buddhas, is stated from

original: rigs kyi bu 'am rigs kyi bu mo gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'am rigs kyi bu mo gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: the line Shariputra, any sons or daughters of good family...

original: dgongs par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni nus pa bskyed pas gzigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgongs par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni nus pa bskyed pas gzigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase will be seen means that they will be seen because their potential has been generated.

original: yongs su gzung bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni mthu bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su gzung bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni mthu bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase will be taken care of means that they will be taken care of because their power has been generated.🔽This is the extensive explanation of that.

original: de nyid rgya cher bstan pa ni bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid rgya cher bstan pa ni bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The Blessed One, the bodhisattva mahāsattvas who...

original: sbyor ba dang dngos gzhi dang mjug gi gnas skabs su de bzhin gshegs pas dgongs pa'i stobs kyis sangs rgyas kyis dgongs shing mkhyen pa nyid kyi yon tan 'byung bas mnyan pa la sogs pa byed par 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: sbyor ba dang dngos gzhi dang mjug gi gnas skabs su de bzhin gshegs pas dgongs pa'i stobs kyis sangs rgyas kyis dgongs shing mkhyen pa nyid kyi yon tan 'byung bas mnyan pa la sogs pa byed par 'gyur ba ni /
translated: In the context of the preparatory, main, and concluding practices, the qualities of being contemplated by the Tathāgata, being known by the Buddha, and being understood by the Buddha arise through the power of the Buddha's intention.

original: bcom ldan 'das sangs rgyas kyi mthu dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig smos pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sangs rgyas kyi mthu dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig smos pa yin no //
translated: The Blessed One, by the power of the Buddha... and so on.

original: legs par smras pa nyid kyis @190a * //
analyzed: legs par smras pa nyid kyis @190a * //
translated: Because of the excellence of speech,

original: na sh'a ri'i bu de de bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: na sh'a ri'i bu de de bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: the Blessed One said, Śāriputra, it is so, it is so.

original: gsum pa sangs rgyas kyis mngon sum du mdzad pa'i yon tan bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gsum pa sangs rgyas kyis mngon sum du mdzad pa'i yon tan bstan pa ni /
translated: The third, the teaching of the qualities directly realized by the Buddha,

original: sh'a ri'i bu de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pas mkhyen to zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pas mkhyen to zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: is stated in the passage beginning with “Śāriputra, the Tathāgata knows those bodhisattvas.”

original: khyad par can gyi don bskyed pa'i dgongs pas lha'i spyan gyis mkhyen no //
analyzed: khyad par can gyi don bskyed pa'i dgongs pas lha'i spyan gyis mkhyen no //
translated: He knows them with the divine eye, intending to generate the special meaning.

original: shes rab kyi spyan gyis byin gyis brlabs so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi spyan gyis byin gyis brlabs so //
translated: He blesses them with the eye of wisdom.

original: chos kyi spyan gyis gzigs so //
analyzed: chos kyi spyan gyis gzigs so //
translated: He sees them with the eye of Dharma.🔽He directly sees them with the eye of a buddha.

original: sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis rnam par gzigs so zhes bya ba ni gsal ba kho nar zad do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis rnam par gzigs so zhes bya ba ni gsal ba kho nar zad do //
translated: This is stated clearly.

original: de gang zhig yin zhe na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de gang zhig yin zhe na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: What are they? They are stated in the passage beginning with “those bodhisattva great beings.”

original: de ni 'di skad du de bzhin gshegs pas mkhyen cing gzigs pa thob pas sangs rgyas kyis mngon sum du mdzad pa'i yon tan dang ldan ba mnyan pa la sogs pa byed pa gang yin pa de ni mkhyen to zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du de bzhin gshegs pas mkhyen cing gzigs pa thob pas sangs rgyas kyis mngon sum du mdzad pa'i yon tan dang ldan ba mnyan pa la sogs pa byed pa gang yin pa de ni mkhyen to zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: That is to say, it is said that “he knows” that one who listens, etc. with the qualities that are directly perceived by the Buddha, who has attained the knowledge and insight of the Tathāgata, is endowed with the qualities.

original: bzhi pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang nye bar gyur pa'i yon tan bstan pa ni thos nas kyang bzung ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bzhi pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang nye bar gyur pa'i yon tan bstan pa ni thos nas kyang bzung ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The qualities of approaching perfect enlightenment are taught in the fourth verse, which begins with “Having heard, he retains it.”

original: nye bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa dang nye bar gyur pa thob pas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang nye bar gyur pa'i yon tan 'byung ba'i phyir thag nye bar gnas par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: nye bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa dang nye bar gyur pa thob pas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang nye bar gyur pa'i yon tan 'byung ba'i phyir thag nye bar gnas par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “Approaches” means that he comes to be near, because the qualities of approaching perfect enlightenment arise through attaining the state of being near to the Tathāgata.

original: lnga pa don chen po nyid la sogs pa'i yon tan bstan pa ni /
analyzed: lnga pa don chen po nyid la sogs pa'i yon tan bstan pa ni /
translated: The qualities of great meaning, etc. are taught in the fifth verse.

original: sh'a ri'i bu gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “Śāriputra, those who” and so on.

original: gnas par mi 'gyur mod kyi zhes bya ba ni gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'i don gyis na de bzhin nyid dang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la sgrub pa dang bral bas de nyid kyi tshe gnas par mi 'gyur mod kyi'o //🔽de dag kyang zhes bya ba ni phan yon chen po thob pas don chen po la sogs pa'i yon tan 'byung ba'i phyir glegs bam du bris pa dang / 'chang ba dang klog par byed pa ni sangs rgyas dang mi 'bral ba nyid dang / bde 'gror gzhol ba nyid dang /
analyzed: gnas par mi 'gyur mod kyi zhes bya ba ni gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'i don gyis na de bzhin nyid dang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la sgrub pa dang bral bas de nyid kyi tshe gnas par mi 'gyur mod kyi'o // de dag kyang zhes bya ba ni phan yon chen po thob pas don chen po la sogs pa'i yon tan 'byung ba'i phyir glegs bam du bris pa dang / 'chang ba dang klog par byed pa ni sangs rgyas dang mi 'bral ba nyid dang / bde 'gror gzhol ba nyid dang /
translated: Although they do not abide, means that because they are not otherwise, they do not abide in suchness and unsurpassed perfect enlightenment at that time, due to being devoid of practice.🔽And those, means that because the qualities of great meaning, etc. arise due to obtaining the great benefit, those who write out the text, bear it in mind, and read it are not separated from the Buddha, are inclined towards good rebirth,

original: yang dag par rdzogs par sangs rgyas ba nyid dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'og tu yang gzhan gyi don la 'jug pa'i dbang du mdzad nas go rims bzhin du don che ba dang / phan yon che ba dang / 'bras bu che ba dang /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs par sangs rgyas ba nyid dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'og tu yang gzhan gyi don la 'jug pa'i dbang du mdzad nas go rims bzhin du don che ba dang / phan yon che ba dang / 'bras bu che ba dang /
translated: and are inclined towards perfect enlightenment, and even after nirvana, they engage in the welfare of others.

original: rnam par smin pa che ba zhes bya ba'i tshig bzhi gsungs pa yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa che ba zhes bya ba'i tshig bzhi gsungs pa yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: One should understand that these are the four lines that state “the great maturation.”

original: 'dir ni khyad par @190b can du smin pa rnam par smin pa yin par blta'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni khyad par @190b can du smin pa rnam par smin pa yin par blta'o //
translated: Here, maturation should be viewed as a special ripening.

original: de dag gi 'bad pa dang zhes bya ba ni bri ba la'o //
analyzed: de dag gi 'bad pa dang zhes bya ba ni bri ba la'o //
translated: “Their effort” refers to writing.

original: yongs su g-yo ba zhes bya ba ni 'dzin pa dang klog pa la'o //
analyzed: yongs su g-yo ba zhes bya ba ni 'dzin pa dang klog pa la'o //
translated: “Complete movement” refers to memorizing and reading.

original: theg pa chen po ji lta bar //
analyzed: theg pa chen po ji lta bar //
translated: As for the Great Vehicle,🔽the Dharma is designated,

original: chos rnams btags pa mdzad pa dang // byang chub sems dpa' rtag par yang //
analyzed: chos rnams btags pa mdzad pa dang // byang chub sems dpa' rtag par yang //
translated: and bodhisattvas always

original: shes rab gsum gyis yid byang la //
analyzed: shes rab gsum gyis yid byang la //
translated: have mental activity through the three wisdoms.🔽The elements are developed,

original: khams brtas byed dang 'jug byed dang // de ni don rnams 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: khams brtas byed dang 'jug byed dang // de ni don rnams 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: and that is the source of the benefits.

original: zhes bya bas theg pa chen po'i chos thams cad kyi phan yon yin pas na rgyal ba'i yum kho na'i phan yon ji ltar yin snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhen zhes bya bas bsu nas /
analyzed: zhes bya bas theg pa chen po'i chos thams cad kyi phan yon yin pas na rgyal ba'i yum kho na'i phan yon ji ltar yin snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhen zhes bya bas bsu nas /
translated: Since this is the benefit of all the dharmas of the Great Vehicle, one might wonder, “What is the benefit of the Mother of the Victors alone?”
